doc: forecasting smog-related health hazard based on social media and physical sensor .
smog disaster are becoming more and more frequent and may cause severe consequence on the environment and public health , especially in urban area .
social media as a real-time urban data source has become an increasingly effective channel to observe people׳s reaction on smog-related health hazard .
it can be used to capture possible smog-related public health disaster in its early stage .
we then propose a predictive analytic approach that utilizes both social media and physical sensor data to forecast the next day smog-related health hazard .
first , we model smog-related health hazard and smog severity through mining raw microblogging text and network information diffusion data .
second , we developed an artificial neural network ( ANN ) -based model to forecast smog-related health hazard with the current health hazard and smog severity observation .
we evaluate the performance of the approach with other alternative machine learning method .
to the best of our knowledge , we are the first to integrate social media and physical sensor data for smog-related health hazard forecasting .
the empirical finding can help researcher to better understand the non-linear relationship between the current smog observation and the next day health hazard .
in addition , this forecasting approach can provide decision support for smog-related health hazard management through function like early warning .
cyber Citie : Social Media as a Tool for Understanding Citie .
‘ Big ’ urban data are increasingly becoming accessible for scientific research and policy use .
they may enhance the intelligence that is needed for understanding and mapping out social connectivity phenomena ( in the sense of Jane Jacobs ) in modern smart city .
the present paper aims to highlight and demonstrate the rich potential of information based on digital technology in modern city .
as a case study example of the power of social media data as a support tool in smart city , we consider Twitter data in the municipality of Amsterdam .
we use machine learning technique to identify temporal pattern that we then relate back to their spatial dimension , effectively connecting the digital with physical aspect of city .
we also show that analysis of geo-referenced tweet can shed significant light on physical aspect of the city and on the spatial distribution of urban function .
using abstraction to solve opportunistic crime security game at scale .
in this paper , we aim to deter urban crime by recommending optimal police patrol strategy against opportunistic criminal in large scale urban problem .
while previous work has tried to learn criminal ' behavior from real world data and generate patrol strategy against opportunistic crime , it can not scale up to large-scale urban problem .
our first contribution is a game abstraction framework that can handle opportunistic crime in large-scale urban area .
in this game abstraction framework , we model the interaction between Officer and opportunistic criminal as a game with discrete target .
by merging similar target , we obtain an abstract game with fewer total target .
we use real world data to learn and plan against opportunistic criminal in this abstract game , and then propagate the result of this abstract game back to the original game .
our second contribution is the layer-generating algorithm used to merge target as described in the framework above .
this algorithm applies a mixed integer linear program ( MILP ) to merge similar and geographically neighboring target in the large scale problem .
as our third contribution , we propose a planning algorithm that recommends a mixed strategy against opportunistic criminal .
finally , our fourth contribution is a heuristic propagation model to handle the problem of limited data we occasionally encounter in large-scale problem .
as part of our collaboration with local police department , we apply our model in two large scale urban problem : a university campus and a city .
our approach provides high prediction accuracy in the real dataset ; furthermore , we project significant crime rate reduction using our planning strategy compared to current police strategy .
transparency in practice : Using visualization to enhance the interpretability of open data .
urban data is gradually being opened to the public .
tool for exploitation , analysis and discovery of new knowledge in large data set are the key to enable citizen to make sense of such large amount of data .
the purpose of this work is to analyze how data analysis associated with visualization technique in different level can lead to the improvement of the interpretability of open data .
with the support of machine learning technique , these visualization may improve pattern identification in urban data set .
to guide our discussion , a case study was conducted analyzing socioeconomic data released by the Chicago city government .
we discussed the use of different visualization in this scenario , tailored for univariate , bivariate and multivariate analysis .
we also performed an evaluation of the different form of visualization proposed in this work .
we could observe that allowing the user to explore open urban data using some specific visualization may lead to more effective data interpretation .
how should urban planner be trained to handle big data ?
historically urban planner have been educated and trained to work in a data poor environment .
urban planning student take course in statistic , survey research and projection and estimation that are designed to fill in the gap in this environment .
for decade they have learned how to use census data , which is comprehensive on several basic variable , but is only conducted once per decade so is almost always out of date .
more detailed population characteristic are based on a sample and are only available in aggregated form for larger geographic area .

but new data source , including distributed sensor , infrastructure monitoring , remote sensing , social media and cell phone tracking record , can provide much more detailed , individual , real time data at disaggregated level that can be used at a variety of scale .

we have entered a data rich environment , where we can have data on system and behavior for more frequent time increment and with a greater number of observation on a greater number of factor ( The Age of Big Data , The New York Times , 2012 ; Now you see it : simple visualization technique for quantitative analysis , Berkeley , 2009 ) .
planner are still being trained in method that are suitable for a data poor environment ( J Plan Educ Res 6:10–21 , 1986 ; Analytic over large-scale multidimensional data : the big data revolution !

in this paper we suggest that visualization , simulation , data mining and machine learning are the appropriate tool to use in this new environment and we discuss how planning education can adapt to this new data rich landscape .
we will discuss how these method can be integrated into the planning curriculum as well as planning practice .
predictive analytic can facilitate proactive property vacancy policy for city .
is it possible for a city to understand , analyze , predict , and therefore prevent vacant property ?

in this paper , we demonstrate the feasibility of using technique from machine learning and data mining to determine the future vacancy risk for individual property and for neighborhood using a variety of structural , demographic , socioeconomic , and city activity features with high accuracy .

within a larger systems-of-systems framework that we develop , these predictive analytic will allow a city to move from decision-making based on 'educated anecdote ' and reactive strategy aimed at the most urgent need , to policy development based on informed , holistic insight and proactive intervention that prevent and reverse decline .
a demonstration of the use of predictive analytic within the sociotechnical system is provided using data from Syracuse , New York .
using data mining technique to detect the personality of player in an educational game .
one of the goal of Educational Data Mining is to develop the method for student modeling based on educational data , such as ; chat conversation , class discussion , etc .
on the other hand , individual behavior and personality play a major role in Intelligent Tutoring Systems ( ITS ) and Educational Data Mining ( EDM ) .
thus , to develop a user adaptable system , the student 's behavior that occurring during interaction has huge impact EDM and ITS .

in this chapter , we introduce a novel data mining technique and natural language processing approach for automated detection student 's personality and behavior in an educational game ( Land Science ) where student act as intern in an urban planning firm and discuss in group their idea .
in order to apply this framework , input excerpt must be classified into one of six possible personality class .
we applied this personality classification method using machine learning algorithm , such as : Naive Bayes , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) and Decision Tree .
analyzing Objective and Subjective Data in Social Sciences : Implication for Smart Cities .
the ease of deployment of digital technology and the Internet of Things gives us the opportunity to carry out large-scale social study and to collect vast amount of data from our city .
in this paper , we investigate a novel way of analyzing data from social science study by employing machine learning and data science technique .
this enables us to maximize the insight gained from this type of study by fusing both objective ( sensor information ) and subjective data ( direct input from the user ) .
the pilot study is concerned with better understanding the interaction between citizen and urban green space .
a field experiment was carried out in Sheffield , U.K. , involving 1870 participant for two different time period ( 7 and 30 day ) .
with the help of a smartphone app , both objective and subjective data were collected .
location tracking was recorded as people entered any of the publicly accessible green space .
this was complemented by textual and photographic information that user could insert spontaneously or when prompted ( when entering a green space ) .
by employing data science and machine learning technique , we identify the main feature observed by the citizen through both text and image .
furthermore , we analyze the time spent by people in park as well as the top interaction area .

this paper allows us to gain an overview of certain pattern and the behavior of the citizen within their surrounding and it proves the capability of integrating technology into large-scale social study .
social media data analysis in urban e-planning .
computational social media data analysis ( SMDA ) is opening up new possibility for participatory urban planning .
the aim of this study is to analyse what kind of computational method can be used to analyse social media data to inform urban planning .

a descriptive literature review of recent case study article reveal that in this context SMDA has been applied mainly to location based social media data , such as geo-tagged Tweet , photographs and check-in data .
there were only a few study concerning the use of non-place-based data .
based on this review SMDA can provide planner with local knowledge about people 's opinion , experience , feeling , behaviour , and about the city structure .
however , integration of this knowledge in planning and decision-making has not been completely successful in any of the case .
by way of a conclusion , a planning-led categorization of the SMDA method 's tool and analysis result is suggested .
modelling urban-scale occupant behaviour , mobility , and energy in building : A survey .
the proliferation of urban sensing , IoT , and big data in city provides unprecedented opportunity for a deeper understanding of occupant behaviour and energy usage pattern at the urban scale .

this enables data-driven building and energy model to capture the urban dynamic , specifically the intrinsic occupant and energy use behavioural profile that are not usually considered in traditional model .
although there are related review , none investigated urban data for use in modelling occupant behaviour and energy use at multiple scale , from building to neighbourhood to city .
this survey paper aims to fill this gap by providing a critical summary and analysis of the work reported in the literature .

we present the different source of occupant-centric urban data that are useful for data-driven modelling and categorise the range of application and recent data-driven modelling technique for urban behaviour and energy modelling , along with the traditional stochastic and simulation-based approach .
finally , we present a set of recommendation for future direction in data-driven modelling of occupant behaviour and energy in building at the urban scale .
automated classification of social network message into Smart Cities dimension .
a Smart City can be defined as a high-tech city with several public and private service capable to strategically solve ( or mitigate ) problem normally generated by rapid urbanization .
different model of indicator have been developed to follow city ’ evolution to become a Smart City .
an example of such model is the standard 37120 from the International Organization for Standardization ( ISO ) that proposes a set of dimension and indicator ( e.g .
transportation , Recreation , Solid Waste ) for service and quality of life for sustainable city and community .

it has been common to find official social network profile of organization and governmental entity related to the service they provide or are responsible for ( water , waste , transportation , cultural event , etc . )
and that are used by citizen as a gateway to directly interact and communicate their complain and problem about those service .

the present paper proposes to apply machine learning algorithms over the urban data generated by social network in order to create classifier to automatically categorize citizen message according to the different city service dimension .
for that , two distinct text dataset in Portuguese were collected from two social network : Twitter ( 1,950 tweet ) and Colab.re ( 65,066 post ) .
the texts were mapped according to the different ISO 37120 category , preprocessed and mined through the use of 8 algorithm implemented in Scikit-Learn .

initial result pointed out the feasibility of the proposal with model achieving average F1-measure around 55 % for F1-macro and 78 % for F1-micro when using Linear Vector Classification , Logistic Regression , Decision Tree and Complement Naive Bayes .

however , as the dataset were highly unbalanced , the performance of the model vary significantly for each ISO category , with the best result occurring for Wastewater , Water & Sanitation , Energy and Transportation .

the classifier generated here can be integrated on a number of different city service and system such as : governmental support decision system , customer complain system , community dashboard , police office , transportation 's companie , cultural producer , environmental agency , and recycler ’ companie .
positive deviance , big data , and development : A systematic literature review .

positive deviance is a growing approach in international development that identifie those within a population who are outperforming their peer in some way , eg , children in low-income family who are well nourished when those around them are not .
analysing and then disseminating the behaviours and other factor underpinning positive deviance are demonstrably effective in delivering development result .
however , positive deviance faces a number of challenge that are restricting its diffusion .
in this paper , using a systematic literature review , we analyse the current state of positive deviance and the potential for big data to address the challenge facing positive deviance .

from this , we evaluate the promise of “ big data-based positive deviance ” : This would analyse typical source of big data in developing countries—mobile phone record , social media , remote sensing data , etc—to identify both positive deviant and the factor underpinning their superior performance .

while big data can not solve all the challenge facing positive deviance as a development tool , they could reduce time , cost , and effort ; identify positive deviant in new or better way ; and enable positive deviance to break out of its current preoccupation with public health into domain such as agriculture , education , and urban planning .
in turn , positive deviance could provide a new and systematic basis for extracting real-world development impact from big data .
gis-based emotional computing : A review of quantitative approach to measure the emotion layer of human–environment relationship .

in recent year , with the growing accessibility of abundant contextual emotion information , which is benefited by the numerous georeferenced user-generated content and the maturity of artificial intelligence ( AI ) -based emotional computing technic , the emotion layer of human–environment relationship is proposed for enriching traditional method of various related discipline such as urban planning .
this paper proposes the geographic information system ( GIS ) -based emotional computing concept , which is a novel framework for applying GIS method to collective human emotion .

the methodology presented in this paper consists of three key step : ( 1 ) collecting georeferenced data containing emotion and environment information such as social media and official site , ( 2 ) detecting emotion using AI-based emotional computing technic such as natural language processing ( NLP ) and computer vision ( CV ) , and ( 3 ) visualizing and analyzing the spatiotemporal pattern with GIS tool .
this methodology is a great synergy of multidisciplinary cutting-edge technique , such as GIScience , sociology , and computer science .
moreover , it can effectively and deeply explore the connection between people and their surrounding with the help of GIS method .

generally , the framework provides a standard workflow to calculate and analyze the new information layer for researcher , in which a measured human-centric perspective onto the environment is possible .
game-based crowdsourcing to support collaborative customization of the definition of sustainability .
successful adoption and management of sustainable urban system hinge on the community embracing these system .
capturing citizen ’ idea , view , and assessment of the built environment will be essential to this goal .
in collaborative city planning , these are qualified and valued form of partial knowledge that should be collectively used to shape the decision making process of urban planning .
among other tool , social media and online social network analytic can provide mean to capture element of such a distributed knowledge .

while a structured definition of sustainability ( normally dictated in a top-down fashion ) may not sufficiently respond well to the pluralist nature of such knowledge acquisition ; dealing with the unstructured community input , assessment and contribution on social media can be confusing .
we can detect fully relevant topics/idea in community discussion ; but they typically suffer from lack of coherence .
in this paper , we advocate the use of a semi-structured approach for capturing , analyzing , and interpreting citizen ’ input .
public official and professional can develop the main element ( topical aspect ) of sustainability , which can act as the skeleton of a taxonomy .

it is however , the community inputs/ideas ( in our case collected via social media and parsed ) , that can shape-up that skeleton and augment those topical aspect with adding the required semantic depth .
in more specific term , we collected tweet for four urban infrastructure mega-project in North America .
then we used a game-with-a-purpose to crowdsource the identification of topic for a training set of tweet .
this was then used to train machine learning algorithm to cluster the rest of collected tweet .
we studied the semantic ( finding the topic ) of tweet as well as their sentiment ( in term of being opposing or supportive of a project ) .
our classification tested different decision tree with different topic hierarchy .
we considered/extracted eight different linguistic feature in studying content of a tweet .
finally , we examined the accuracy of three algorithm in classifying tweet according to the sequence in the tree , and based on the extracted feature .
these are : K-nearest neighbor , Naïve Bayes classifier and Support Vector Machines ( SVM ) .
respective to our data set , SVM outperformed other algorithms .
semantic analysis was insensitive to the depth/number of linguistic feature considered .
in contrast , sentiment analysis was enhanced when part of speech ( PoS ) was tracked .

interestingly , our work shows that considering the topic ( semantic ) of a tweet helped enhance the accuracy of sentiment analysis : including topical class as a feature in conducting sentiment analysis result in higher accuracy .
this could be used as mean to detect the evolution of community opinion : that topic-based social network are evolving within the community tweeting about urban project .
it could also be used to identify the topic of top priority to the community or the one that have the widest spread of view .
in our case , these were mainly the impact of the design and engineering feature on social issue .
an urban data framework for assessing equity in city : Comparing accessibility to healthcare facility in Cascadia .
as city continue to grow worldwide , policymaker and urban planner face the dual task of meeting rising demand for essential service while ensuring that benefit accrue to their citizen equitably .
we propose a framework for assessing inclusivity and equity in city , which leverages open data and machine learning technique to inform urban infrastructure investment strategy .
the framework is applied at a regional scale to compare differential access to healthcare facility ( public hospital and clinic ) via public transit in Vancouver , Seattle and Portland .
we find important distributional impact on vulnerable population across the three city .
portland displays the highest inequity in hospital and clinic access , and Vancouver the least , owing to Vancouver 's relatively compact geographic area and high population density .
for senior , over 75 % are socially excluded from hospital and over 50 % from clinic in Portland , compared to 30 % and 3 % respectively in Vancouver .
in all three city , significantly more resident of low-income neighborhood are excluded from healthcare compared to their counterpart in high-income neighborhood .
this translates into proportionally higher transportation cost for low-income area resident compared with high-income area resident , regardless of whether they are socially excluded or not .
transportation cost are notably high for low-income senior in Seattle and Vancouver .

these finding pose a challenge for inclusive planning , since low-income and senior population may require specialized service and are more reliant on public transportation than the average population .

our evaluation framework provides a systematic approach for municipality to account for the distributional effect of transportation and service infrastructure planning , to integrate equity into their decision-making , and to learn from the success and pitfall of each other 's urban policy .
a framework to simplify pre-processing location-based social media big data for sustainable urban planning and management .
over the last decade , 90 % of Big Data has been generated by people living in urban area .
with the advent of Internet of Things ( IoT ) and the increased use of the internet , Social Media has become an integral part of people 's daily live .
million of unstructured data are being sent to the cloud every second , providing opinion practically on any discourse .

this makes microblog such as Twitter , Instagram , WeChat , and Facebook smart instrument for urban planner to harvest ‘ big data ’ on socioeconomic , urban dynamic , transportation , land use , resilience , etc .
this study proposed a framework for social media big data mining and data analytic using Twitter .

it demonstrated the functionality of the framework on a case study using Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning technique like Latent Dirichlet Allocation and VADER Sentiment Analysis to mine , clean , process , and validate the data .
the validated result from the case study showed high accuracy that Social Media Big Data can be used to study the spatiotemporal dynamism of community challenge .
a value of civic voice for smart city : A big data analysis of civic query posed by Seoul citizen .
since urban problem are increasingly becoming complex and multifaceted due to the rapid urbanization , interest in the development of smart city as an efficient solution to such problem is growing .

the significance of smart city lies in not having technology itself but using technology with a novel approach to solve urban problem , enhance the quality of life for urban resident , and optimize government performance .

such an approach includes scientifically processing civic query ( including complaint , suggestion , and inquiry ) data about a city and planning the city such that its policy reflect its resident ' voice to ensure “ throughput legitimacy.
” This study introduces a novel approach to analyze diverse informal civic query data for a city and plan the city in a way that its resident want .

by analyzing 160,000 civic query accumulated over 10 year from 2006 to 2017 from the “ Oasis of 10 Million Imagination , ” which is a civic participation platform of Seoul , this study aims to contribute to the sustainable development of Seoul so that it can plan a citizen-centric and smart city that satisfies the demand of its resident .
by applying Dynamic Topic Model , the author intend to specify civic demand and forecast the demand of citizen .
detecting player personality behavior with any effort of concealment .

we introduce a novel natural language processing component using machine learning technique for prediction of personality behavior of player in a serious game , Land Science , where player act as intern in an urban planning firm and discuss in group their idea about urban planning and environmental science in written natural language .
our model learns vector space representation for various feature extraction .
in order to apply this framework , input excerpt must be classified into one of six possible personality class .
we applied this personality classification task using several machine learning algorithm , such as : Naïve Bayes , Support Vector Machines , and Decision Tree .
training is performed on a relatively dataset of manually annotated excerpt .

by combining these feature space from psychology and computational linguistic , we perform and evaluate our approach to detecting personality , and eventually develop a classifier that is nearly 83 % accurate on our dataset .
based on the feature analysis of our model , we add several theoretical contribution , including revealing a relationship between different personality behavior in player ' writing .
automated detection of mentor and player in an educational game .
automatically identifying the various role ( e.g.
, mentor , player ) in multi-party collaborative chat is a challenging task .
to better understand the conversational demand of mentor and player , this paper investigates the dynamic and linguistic feature of multi-party chat in the context of an online educational game .

in this paper we introduce a novel computational linguistic method using a machine learning algorithm to automatically classify utterance of player and mentor in a serious game , where player act as intern in an urban planning firm and discuss their idea about urban planning and environmental science in written natural language .
our result are promising and our model can be extended to any multi-party environment that Leader ( Mentors ) are needed to be distinguished based on their conversation .
an AI Approach to Collecting and Analyzing Human Interactions with Urban Environment .

thank to advance in Internet of Things and crowd-sensing , it is possible to collect vast amount of urban data , to better understand how citizen interact with city and , in turn , improve human well-being in urban environment .
this is a scientifically challenging proposition , as it requires new method to fuse objective ( heterogeneous ) data ( e.g .
people location trail and sensor data ) with subjective ( perceptual ) data ( e.g .
the citizen ' quality of experience collected through feedback form ) .
when it comes to vast urban area , collecting statistically significant data is a daunting task ; thus new data-collection method are required too .

in this work , we turn to artificial intelligence ( AI ) to address these challenge , introducing a method whereby the objective , sensor data is analyzed in real-time to scope down the test matrix of the subjective questionnaire .
in turn , subjective response are parsed through AI model to extract further objective information .
the outcome is an interactive data analysis framework for urban environment , which we put to test in the context of a citizen ' well-being project .
in our pilot study , each new entry ( objective or subjective ) is parsed through the AI engine to determine which action maximizes the information gain .
this translates into a particular question being fired at a specific moment and place , to a specific person .
with our AI data collection method , we can reach statistical significance much faster , achieving ( in our city-wide pilot study ) a 41 % acceleration factor and a 75 % reduction in intrusiveness .
our study opens new Avenue in urban science , with potential application in urban planning , citizen 's well-being project , and sociology , to mention but a few case .
online urban-waterlogging monitoring based on a recurrent neural network for classification of microblogging text .
with the global climate change and rapid urbanization , urban flood disaster spread and become increasingly serious in China .
urban rainstorm and waterlogging have become an urgent challenge that needs to be monitored in real time and further predicted for the improvement of urbanization construction .

we trained a recurrent neural network ( RNN ) model to classify microblogging post related to urban waterlogging and establish an online monitoring system of urban waterlogging caused by flood disaster .
we manually curated more than 4400 waterlogging post to train the RNN model so that it can precisely identify waterlogging-related post of Sina Weibo to timely determine urban waterlogging .

the RNN model has been thoroughly evaluated , and our experimental result showed that it achieved higher accuracy than traditional machine learning method , such as the support vector machine ( SVM ) and gradient boosting decision tree ( GBDT ) .
furthermore , we build a nationwide map of urban waterlogging based on recent 2-year microblogging data .
applying machine learning and geolocation technique to social media data ( Twitter ) to develop a resource for urban planning .
with all the recent attention focused on big data , it is easy to overlook that basic vital statistic remain difficult to obtain in most of the world .

what makes this frustrating is that private companie hold potentially useful data , but it is not accessible by the people who can use it to track poverty , reduce disease , or build urban infrastructure .
this project set out to test whether we can transform an openly available dataset ( Twitter ) into a resource for urban planning and development .

we test our hypothesis by creating road traffic crash location data , which is scarce in most resource-poor environment but essential for addressing the number one cause of mortality for children over five and young adult .

the research project scraped 874,588 traffic related tweet in Nairobi , Kenya , applied a machine learning model to capture the occurrence of a crash , and developed an improved geoparsing algorithm to identify its location .
we geolocate 32,991 crash report in Twitter for 2012-2020 and cluster them into 22,872 unique crash during this period .
for a subset of crash reported on Twitter , a motorcycle delivery service was dispatched in real-time to verify the crash and its location ; the result show 92 % accuracy .
to our knowledge this is the first geolocated dataset of crash for the city and allowed us to produce the first crash map for Nairobi .
using a spatial clustering algorithm , we are able to locate portion of the road network ( < 1 % ) where 50 % of the crash identified occurred .

even with limitation in the representativeness of the data , the result can provide urban planner with useful information that can be used to target road safety improvement where resource are limited .
the work shows how twitter data might be used to create other type of essential data for urban planning in resource poor environment .
opportunity and challenge of geospatial analysis for promoting urban livability in the era of big data and machine learning .
urban system involve a multitude of closely intertwined component , which are more measurable than before due to new sensor , data collection , and spatio-temporal analysis method .

turning these data into knowledge to facilitate planning effort in addressing current challenge of urban complex system requires advanced interdisciplinary analysis method , such as urban informatic or urban data science .

yet , by applying a purely data-driven approach , it is too easy to get lost in the ‘ forest ’ of data , and to miss the ‘ tree ’ of successful , livable city that are the ultimate aim of urban planning .

this paper assesses how geospatial data , and urban analysis , using a mixed method approach , can help to better understand urban dynamic and human behavior , and how it can assist planning effort to improve livability .

based on reviewing state-of-the-art research the paper goes one step further and also addresses the potential as well as limitation of new data source in urban analytic to get a better overview of the whole ‘ forest ’ of these new data source and analysis method .

the main discussion revolves around the reliability of using big data from social media platform or sensor , and how information can be extracted from massive amount of data through novel analysis method , such as machine learning , for better-informed decision making aiming at urban livability improvement .
multiscale spatio-temporal data aggregation and mapping for urban data exploration .
map seem the most intuitive way to visualize massive urban data but they also raise some well-known graphical problem ( such as visual clutter , etc . )
this paper focuses on processing massive spatiotemporal data in order to ease multi-scale exploration .

to this end , we describe a preprocessing tool that enables the automatic creation of a multi-resolution grid from a high resolution grid of spatio-temporal data in a format compatible with webmapping application ( vector tile ) .
the use of this tool is exemplified through a prototype that offers the possibility to navigate into a massive itinerary request dataset collected in the Ile-de- France region .
dtex : A dynamic urban thermal exposure index based on human mobility pattern .
background : Extreme heat in light of climate change is increasingly threatening the health and comfort of urban resident .
understanding spatio-temporal pattern of heat exposure is a critical factor in directing mitigation measure .

current heat vulnerability indice provide insight into heat sensitivity within given community but do not account for the dynamic nature of the human movement as people travel for different activity .
here , we present a new Dynamic urban Thermal Exposure index ( DTEx ) that captures the varying heat exposure within urban environment .
method : We developed the DTEx to understand human heat exposure patterns in a mid-sized city .
this index incorporates the human movement pattern and the heat hazard pattern obtained via novel and advanced technique .
we generated the human movement pattern from large-scale , anonymized smartphone location data .
the heat hazard pattern were extrapolated via machine learning model from air temperature data measured through vehicle-mounted sensor .
the exposure index was then developed by combining the two parameter using their standard-deviation-classified indice .
result : Our exposure index varied between 2 and 12 , indicating low to high thermal exposure .
several high-temperature spot associated with a large volume of foot traffic are successfully identified through this DTEx .
we observed the hottest spot at shopping plazas but not specifically in the urban center .
during the selected football gameday , the exposure index surged across most Place near the football stadium but was reduced considerably further away .
discussion : The proposed DTEx is novel because it provides dynamic heat monitoring capability to facilitate heat mitigation strategy at vulnerable location in urban environment .
combining the mobility data and extensive sensor data generate rich detail on the most heat-exposed area due to human congregation .
such information will be critical for risk communication and urban planning for policymaker .
dtex could also help smart route planning in sustainable city to avoid heat hazard risk .
intelligent control system in urban planning conflict : Social media user ’ perception .
the relevance of this study is determined by the need to develop technology for effective urban system management and resolution of urban planning conflict .
the paper presents an algorithm for analyzing urban planning conflict .

the material for the study was data from social network , microblogging , blog , instant messaging , forum , review , video hosting service , thematic portal , online media , print media and TV related to the construction of the North-Eastern Chord ( NEC ) in Moscow ( RF ) .
to analyze the content of social media , a multimodal approach was used .

the paper presents the result of research on the development of method and approach for constructing mathematical and neural network model for analyzing the social media user ’ perception based on their digital footprint .
artificial neural network , differential equation , and mathematical statistic were involved in building the model .
differential equation of dynamic system were based on observation enabled by machine learning .
mathematical model were developed to quickly detect , prevent , and address conflict in urban planning in order to manage urban system efficiently .

in combination with mathematical and neural network model the developed approach , made it possible to draw a conclusion about the tense situation around the construction of the NEC , identify complaint of resident to constructor and city authority , and propose recommendation to resolve and prevent conflict .
research data could be of use in solving similar problem in sociology , ecology , and economic .

avi 2020 Workshop on Road Mapping Infrastructures for Artificial Intelligence Supporting Advanced Visual Big Data Analysis , AVI-BDA 2020 and 2nd Italian Workshop on Visualization and Visual Analytics , ITAVIS 2020 .
the proceeding contain 14 paper .
the special focus in this conference is on Road Mapping Infrastructures for Artificial Intelligence Supporting Advanced Visual Big Data Analysis .

the topic include : An Experience on Cooperative Development of Interactive Visualizations for the Analysis of Urban Data ; Explaining AI Through Critical Reflection Artifacts : On the Role of Communication Design Within XAI ; Information Visualization and Visual Analytics at IVU Lab ; visual Analytic for Financial Crime Detection at the University of Perugia ; a Visual Analytics Technique to Compare the Performance of Predictive Models ; affective Analytics and Visualization for Ensemble Event-Driven Stock Market Forecasting ; understanding the Role of ( Advanced ) Machine Learning in Metagenomic Workflows ; intelligent Advanced User Interfaces for Monitoring Mental Health Wellbeing ; Towards Explainable Artificial Intelligence and Explanation User Interfaces to Open the ‘ Black Box ’ of Automated ECG Interpretation ; recognition and Visualization of Facial Expression and Emotion in Healthcare ; machine Learning in Healthcare : Breast Cancer and Diabetes Cases ; AI2VIS4BigData : Qualitative Evaluation of an AI-Based Big Data Analysis and Visualization Reference Model .
predicting and mapping neighborhood-scale health outcome : A machine learning approach .
estimating health outcome at a neighborhood scale is important for promoting urban health , yet costly and time-consuming .
in this paper , we present a machine-learning-enabled approach to predicting the prevalence of six common non-communicable chronic disease at the census tract level .
we apply our approach to the City of Austin and show that our method can yield fairly accurate prediction .

in searching for the best predictive model , we experiment with eight different machine learning algorithms and 60 predictor variable that characterize the social environment , the physical environment , and the aspect and degree of neighborhood disorder .

our analysis suggests that ( a ) the sociodemographic and socioeconomic variable are the strongest predictor for tract-level health outcome and ( b ) the historical record of 311 service request can be a useful complementary data source as the information distilled from the 311 data often helps improve the model ' performance .

the machine learning model yielded from this study can help the public and city official evaluate future scenario and understand how change in the neighborhood condition can lead to change in the health outcome .

by analyzing where the most significant discrepancy between the predicted and the actual value are , we will also be ready to identify area of best practice and area in need of greater investment or policy intervention .
investigating Customer Satisfaction Patterns in a Community Livability Context : An Efficiency-Oriented Decision-Making Approach .

a comprehensive understanding of neighborhood facility distribution and function along with residential quality of life satisfaction is a key asset for relating livability management to transportation network .
due to the simultaneous involvement of varied factor with an individual 's perception of livability , this concept is difficult to measure .
therefore , a more objective mean of quantifying livability is needed .

the service industry has demonstrated the intersection of machine learning classifier and survey domain knowledge for evaluating user ' quality of experience ; however , this process of inquiry-based learning has never been considered for solving the communication difficulty between community stakeholder and transportation agency .

another area of overlap is that of urban computing , which integrates computing technology in the traditional context of urban area , connecting ubiquitous sensing technology , computational power , and data about the urban environment to promote quality of life for people living in a particular community .

to this aim , the focus of this study is on interpreting a linkage between society stated preference and quantitative measure of livability by extracting information from survey-based method and translating it to a quantitative framework using combined service industry and urban computing methodology .

this work focuses on four transportation planning-related research question in this blended framework : understanding existing livability pattern , predicting heterogeneous perception of quality of life , prioritizing public preference , and developing a multidimensional livability index ( MLI ) .
processing , mining and visualizing massive urban data .
the development of smart technology and the advent of new observation capability have increased the availability of massive urban dataset that can greatly benefit urban study .

for example , a large amount of urban data is collected by various sensor , such as smart meter , or provided by GSM , Wi-Fi or Bluetooth record , ticketing data , geo- tagged post on social network , etc .

analysis of such digital record can help to build decision-making tool ( for analytical , forecasting and display purpose ) with a view to better understanding the operating of urban system , to enable urban stakeholder to plan better when extending infrastructure and to provide better service to citizen in order to assist the development of the city and improve quality of life .
this paper will focus on three main domain of application : Transportation and mobility , water and energy .
european Conference on Machine Learning and Knowledge Discovery in Databases , ECML PKDD 2016 .
the proceeding contain 39 paper .
the special focus in this conference is on Demo Track Contributions , Industrial Track Contributions and Nectar Track Contributions .

the topic include : A tool for subjective and interactive visual data exploration ; a web-based visualization tool for biclustering of multivariate time series ; dynamic trafficmanagement using heterogeneous urban data ; coordinate transformation for characterization and cluster analysis of spatial configuration in football ; leveraging spatial abstraction in traffic analysis and forecasting with visual analytic ; the SPMF open-source data mining library version 2 ; dynamic attributed network with community structure generator ; real-time story tracking via social tag ; learning language model from image with ReGLL ; exploratory analysis of text collection through visualization and hybrid biclustering ; pattern-based mining of satellite image time series ; finding incident-related social media message for emergency awareness ; exploratory monitoring of twitter stream for the 2016 U.S. presidential election cycle ; using social media to promote STEM education ; a real time system for crowd flow prediction at metropolitan subway station ; finding dynamic co-evolving zone in spatial-temporal time series data ; ECG monitoring in wearable device by sparse model ; intelligent urban data monitoring for smart city ; automatic detection of non-biological artifact in ECGs acquired during cardiac computed tomography ; active learning with rationale for identifying operationally significant anomaly in aviation ; engine misfire detection with pervasive mobile audio ; a KDD process for discrimination discovery ; personality-based user modeling for music recommender system and resource-aware steel production through data mining .
2nd International Workshop on Mining Urban Data ( Preface ) .
this paper presents an overview of the second International Workshop on Mining Urban Data ( MUD2 ) .
the MUD2 workshop was held in conjunction with the 32nd International Conference on Machine Learning ( ICML 2015 ) in Lille , France , July 11 , 2015 .
measuring human perception of a large-scale urban region using machine learning .

measuring the human sense of place and quantifying the connection among the visual feature of the built environment that impact the human sense of place have long been of interest to a wide variety of Field .
previous study have relied on low-throughput survey and limited data source , which have difficulty in measuring the human perception of a large-scale urban region at flexible spatial resolution .
in this work , a data-driven machine learning approach is proposed to measure how people perceive a place in a large-scale urban region .
specifically , a deep learning model , which has been trained on million of human rating of street-level imagery , was used to predict human perception of a street view image .
the model achieved a high accuracy rate in predicting six human perceptual indicator , namely , safe , lively , beautiful , wealthy , depressing , and boring .
this model can help to map the distribution of the city-wide human perception for a new urban region .
furthermore , a series of statistical analysis was conducted to determine the visual element that may cause a place to be perceived as different perception .
from the 150 object category segmented from the street view image , various object were identified as being positively or negatively correlated with each of the six perceptual indicator .
the result take researcher and urban planner one step toward understanding the interaction of the place sentiment and semantic .
using image recognition to automate assessment of cultural ecosystem service from social media photographs .
quantifying and mapping cultural ecosystem service is complex because of their intangibility .
data from social media , such as geo-tagged photographs , have been proposed for mapping cultural use or appreciation of ecosystem .
however , manual content analysis and classification of large number of photographs is time consuming .
this study develops a novel method for automating content analysis of social media photographs for ecosystem service assessment .
the approach applies an online machine learning algorithm – Google Cloud Vision – to analyse over 20,000 photograph from Singapore , and uses hierarchical clustering to group these photograph .
the accuracy of the classification was assessed by comparison with manual classification .
over 20 % of photographs were taken of nature , being of animal or plant .
the distribution of nature photographs was concentrated around particular natural attraction , and nature photographs were more likely to occur in park and area of high vegetation cover .
the approach developed for clustering photographs was accurate and saved approximately 170 h of manual work .
the method provides an indicator of cultural ecosystem service that can be applied rapidly over large area .
automated assessment and mapping of cultural ecosystem service could be used to inform urban planning .
a machine learning-based method for the large-scale evaluation of the quality of the urban environment .
given the present size of modern city , it is beyond the perceptual capacity of most people to develop a good knowledge about the quality of the urban space at every street corner .

correspondingly , for planner , it is also difficult to accurately answer question such as ‘ where the quality of the physical environment is the most dilapidated in the city that regeneration should be given first consideration ’ and ‘ in fast urbanising city , how is the city appearance changing ’ .

to address this issue , in the present study , we present a computer vision method that contains three machine learning model for the large-scale and automatic evaluation on the quality of the urban environment by leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning technique and wide-coverage street view image .

from various physical quality that have been identified by previous research to be important for the urban visual experience , we choose two key quality , the construction and maintenance quality of building facade and the continuity of street wall , to be measured in this research .
to test the validity of the proposed method , we compare the machine scores with public rating score collected on-site from 752 passers-by at 56 location in the city .

we show that the machine learning model can produce a medium-to-good estimation of people 's real experience , and the modelling result can be applied in many way by researcher , planner and local resident .
a human-machine adversarial scoring framework for urban perception assessment using street-view image .

though global-coverage urban perception dataset have been recently created using machine learning , their efficacy in accurately assessing local urban perception for other countrie and region remains a problem .

here we describe a human-machine adversarial scoring framework using a methodology that incorporates deep learning and iterative feedback with recommendation score , which allows for the rapid and cost-effective assessment of the local urban perception for Chinese city .
using the state-of-the-art Fully Convolutional Network ( FCN ) and Random Forest ( RF ) algorithms , the proposed method provides perception estimation with error less than 10 % .
the driving factor analysis from both the visual and urban functional aspect demonstrated its feasibility in facilitating local urban perception derivation .

with high-throughput and high-accuracy scoring , the proposed human-machine adversarial framework offer an affordable and rapid solution for urban planner and researcher to conduct local urban perception assessment .
the visual quality of Street : A human-centred continuous measurement based on machine learning algorithms and street view image .
this study proposes a workable approach for quantitatively measuring the perceptual-based visual quality of Street , which has often relied on subjective impression or feeling .

with the help of recently emerged street view image and machine learning algorithms , an evaluation model has been trained to assess the perceived visual quality with accuracy similar to that of experienced urban designer , to provide full coverage and detailed result for a citywide area .
the town centre of Shanghai was selected for the site .

around 140,000 screenshot from Baidu Street View were processed and a machine learning algorithm , SegNet , was applied to intelligently extract the pixel representing key element affecting the visual quality of Street , including the building frontage , greenery , sky view , pedestrian space , motorisation , and diversity .
a Java-based program was then produced to automatically collect the preference of experienced urban designer on representative sample image .
another machine learning algorithm , i.e .
an artificial neural network , was used to train an evaluation model to achieve a citywide , high-resolution evaluation of the visual quality of the Street .
further validation through different approach shows this evaluation model obtains a satisfactory accuracy .
the result from the artificial neural network also help to explore the high or low effect of various key element on visual quality .
in short , this study contributes to the development of human-centred planning and design by providing continuous measurement of an ‘ unmeasurable ’ quality across large-scale area .
meanwhile , insight on the perceptual-based visual quality and detailed mapping of various key element in Street can assist in more efficient street renewal by providing accurate design guidance .
understanding city with machine eye : A review of deep computer vision in urban analytic .
modelling urban system has interested planner and modeller for decade .
different model have been achieved relying on mathematic , cellular automation , complexity , and scaling .

while most of these model tend to be a simplification of reality , today within the paradigm shift of artificial intelligence across the different Field of science , the application of computer vision show promising potential in understanding the realistic dynamic of city .
while city are complex by nature , computer vision shows progress in tackling a variety of complex physical and non-physical visual task .
in this article , we review the task and algorithms of computer vision and their application in understanding city .
we attempt to subdivide computer vision algorithms into task , and city into layer to show evidence of where computer vision is intensively applied and where further research is needed .

we focus on highlighting the potential role of computer vision in understanding urban system related to the built environment , natural environment , human interaction , transportation , and infrastructure .

after showing the diversity of computer vision algorithms and application , the challenge that remain in understanding the integration between these different layer of city and their interaction with one another relying on deep learning and computer vision .
we also show recommendation for practice and policy-making toward reaching AI-generated urban policy .
classification of sidewalk in street view image .
mapping sidewalk in urban environment is key in the creation of pedestrian-friendly , sustainable city .
currently , urban planner are hindered by a lack of information available in a format suitable for the large-scale analysis of sidewalk design .

to demonstrate the impact that information technology could have in this area , we leverage technique from machine learning and computer vision to gather information about the presence and quality of sidewalk in map image .

in particular , we identify sidewalk segment in street view image using a random forest classifier , utilizing a set of local and global feature that include geometric context , presence of Lane , pixel color , and location .
our result illustrate that this approach is effective in classifying sidewalk segment in a large set of street view image .
this algorithm can be easily extended to other dataset , and can be automated to gather complete , fine-grained detail about sidewalk for arbitrarily large urban environment .
visual gaze analysis of robotic pedestrian moving in urban space .

this study is founded on the idea that an analysis of the visual gaze dynamic of pedestrian can increase our understanding of how important architectural feature in urban environment are perceived by pedestrian .
the result of such an analysis can lead to improvement in urban design .
however , a technical challenge arise when trying to determine the gaze direction of pedestrian recorded on video .
high noise level and the subtlety of human gaze dynamic hamper precise calculation .

however , as robot can be programmed and analysed more efficiently than human , this study uses them for developing and training a gaze analysis system with the aim to later apply it to human video data using the machine learning technique of manifold alignment .
for this study , a laboratory was set up to become a model street scene in which autonomous humanoid robot of approximately 55cm in height simulate the behaviour of human pedestrian .
the experiment compare the input from several camera as the robot walks down the model street and changes its behaviour upon encountering visually attractive object .
overhead recording and the robot 's internal joint signal are analysed after filtering to provide true data against which the recorded data can be compared for accuracy testing .

a central component of the research is the calculation of a torus-like manifold that represents all the different three-dimensional ( 3D ) head direction of a robot head and allows the ordering of extracted 3D gaze vector obtained from video sequence .
we briefly describe how the obtained multidimensional trajectory data can be analysed by using a temporal behaviour analysis technique based on support vector machine that was developed separately .
classification of urban scene from georeferenced image in urban street-view context .
this paper addresses the challenging problem of scene classification in street-view georeferenced image of urban environment .
more precisely , the goal of this task is semantic image classification , consisting in predicting in a given image , the presence or absence of a pre-defined class ( e.g .
shop , vegetation , etc . )

the approach is based on the BOSSA representation , which enriches the Bag of Words ( BoW ) model , in conjunction with the Spatial Pyramid Matching scheme and kernel-based machine learning technique .

the proposed method handles problem that arise in large scale urban environment due to acquisition condition ( static and dynamic objects/pedestrian ) combined with the continuous acquisition of data along the vehicle direction , the varying light condition and strong occlusion ( due to the presence of tree , traffic sign , car , etc . )
giving rise to high intra-class variability .
experiment were conducted on a large dataset of high resolution image collected from two main Avenue from the 12th district in Paris and the approach shows promising result .
deep CNN-based method to evaluate neighborhood-scale urban valuation through street scene perception .
social data from city level provides unprecedented opportunity to identify urban attribute from various angle .
citizen are likely to evaluate the quality of the neighborhood and make important decision by their perception and the feedback from the environment .
in this paper , we studied the correlation between the neighborhood 's environment with their property value and land value .
it is profitable to train the algorithm by parallel deep convolutional neural network on the visual urban scene data associated with quantitative non-visual urban characteristic in the same view .
the result of our approach defines a scenarized profile from building-level detail to city-level trait .

the main contribution of this work is providing a unique and more accurate perspective to urban valuation estimation , by integrating the scattered source of piece of information and implanting into the available image .

this urban evaluation approach will be more human-centered , which can be extended to help urban planner and citizen to explore the significant impact on city decision optimization or spatial economics-related issue like decreasing the cost of property assessment .
machine Learning Assisted Urban Filling .
when drawing urban scale plan , designer should always define the position and the shape of each building .
this process usually costs much time in the early design stage when the condition of a city has not been finally determined .
thus the designer spend a lot of time working forward and backward drawing sketch for different characteristic of city .
meanwhile , machine learning , as a decision-making tool , has been widely used in many Field .
generative Adversarial Network ( GAN ) is a model frame in machine learning , specially designed to learn and generate image data .
therefore , this research aims to apply GAN in creating urban design plan , helping designer automatically generate the predicted detail of building configuration with a given condition of city .
through the machine learning of image pair , the result shows the relationship between the site condition ( Road , green land , and river ) and the configuration of building .
this automatic design tool can help release the heavy load of urban designer in the early design stage , quickly providing a preview of design solution for urban design task .
the analysis of different machine learning model trained by the data from different city inspires urban designer with design strategy and feature in distinct condition .
urban land use information retrieval based on scene classification of Google Street View image .
land use map are very important reference for the urban planning and management .
however , it is difficult and time-consuming to get high-resolution urban land use map .
in this study , we propose a new method to derive land use information at building block level based on machine learning and geo-tagged street-level imagery - Google Street View image .
several commonly used generic image feature ( GIST , HoG , and SIFT-Fisher ) are used to represent street-level image of different cityscape in a case study area of New York City .
machine learning is further used to categorize different image based on the calculated image feature of different street-level image .
accuracy assessment result show that the method developed in this study is a promising method for land use mapping at building block level in future .
using Random Forest on Real-World City Data for Urban Planning in a Visual Semantic Decision Support System .

the constantly increasing amount and availability of urban data derived from varying source leads to an assortment of challenge that include , among other , the consolidation , visualization , and maximal exploitation prospect of the aforementioned data .

a preeminent problem affecting urban planning is the appropriate choice of location to host a particular activity ( either commercial or common welfare service ) or the correct use of an existing building or empty space .
in this paper , we propose an approach to address these challenge availed with machine learning technique .

the proposed system combine , fuse , and merges various type of data from different source , encodes them using a novel semantic model that can capture and utilize both low-level geometric information and higher level semantic information and subsequently feeds them to the random forests classifier , as well as other supervised machine learning model for comparison .

our experimental evaluation on multiple real-world data set comparing the performance of several classifier ( including Feedforward Neural Networks , Support Vector Machines , Bag of Decision Trees , k-Nearest Neighbor and Naïve Bayes ) , indicated the superiority of Random Forests in term of the examined performance metric ( Accuracy , Specificity , Precision , Recall , F-measure and G-mean ) .
detecting advertising on building façade with computer vision .
outdoor advertising influences the visual environment of any modern city .
advertising and information sign on building façade are one of the type of outdoor advertising .
as a rule , there are law and design code in city that define permissible look of such sign .
at the same time , in metropolis , there is a problem of timely detection of advertising construction on façade that violate these rule .
city-scale monitoring of façade condition is beyond the capability of any city 's authority .
to address this issue , we propose a solution which combines street-view map and machine learning to automate the process of searching for law-breaking advertising object on building façade .
we develop a dataset for a machine learning model and a set of check for detected advertising object to check their legality .
the resulting approach can provide data for future research and help maintain coherent urban visual environment .
equitensor : Learning Fair Integrations of Heterogeneous Urban Data .
neural method are state-of-the-art for urban prediction problem such as transportation resource demand , accident risk , crowd mobility , and public safety .
model performance can be improved by integrating exogenous feature from open data repository ( e.g.
, weather , housing price , traffic , etc . )
, but these uncurated source are often too noisy , incomplete , and biased to use directly .
we propose to learn integrated representation , called EquiTensor , from heterogeneous dataset that can be reused across a variety of task .
we align dataset to a consistent spatio-temporal domain , then describe an unsupervised model based on convolutional denoising autoencoder to learn shared representation .
we extend this core integrative model with adaptive weighting to prevent certain dataset from dominating the signal .
to combat discriminatory bias , we use adversarial learning to remove correlation with a sensitive attribute ( e.g.
, race or income ) .
experiment with 23 input dataset and 4 real application show that EquiTensor could help mitigate the effect of the sensitive information embodied in the biased data .
meanwhile , application using EquiTensor outperform model that ignore exogenous feature and are competitive with `` oracle '' model that use hand-selected dataset .
predicting human perception of the urban environment in a spatiotemporal urban setting using locally acquired street view image and audio clip .
this study investigates people 's perception of visual and auditory landscape in a mixed-use urban environment .
a set of audio and visual data is collected at different interval during the day in local Street with the help of an audio recorder and camera setup .
the High and Low-level feature from the collected audio and visual dataset are captured with the help of custom Deep Learning ( DL ) model and other standard algorithms .
the collected data is used in the perception survey , which included human subject ( n = 73 ) .
the evaluation of the individual perception is done with the help of eight and six auditory and visual perceptual attribute , respectively .
the result from the survey are then studied in relation to the feature extracted from algorithms .
finally , a street of 10 km length is chosen within the study area where a spatiotemporal street-level visual and auditory data is collected .
statistical analysis and Machine Learning modeling are performed in the surveyed dataset to predict the human perception of audio and visual scene in the chosen street .
the result helped in understanding specific audio and visual feature that are related to individual perception .
further , these relationship are utilized to create prediction model , which helped in creating spatiotemporal visual and auditory perception map .
an investigation of the visual feature of urban street vitality using a convolutional neural network .

as a well-known urban landscape concept to describe urban space quality , urban street vitality is a subjective human perception of the urban environment but difficult to evaluate directly from the physical space .

the study utilized a modern machine learning computer vision algorithm in the urban build environment to simulate the process , which starts with the visual perception of the urban street landscape and ends with the human reaction to street vitality .
by analyzing the optimized trained model , we tried to identify urban street vitality ’ s visual feature and evaluate their importance .
a region around the Mochou Lake in Nanjing , China , was set as our study area .
seven investigator surveyed the area , recorded their evaluation score on each site ’ s vitality level with a corresponding picture taken on site .
a total of 370 picture and recorded score pair from 231 valid survey site were used to train a convolutional neural network .
after optimization , a deep neural network model with 43 layer , including 11 convolutional one , was created .
heat map were then used to identify the feature which lead to high vitality score output .
the spatial distribution of different type of feature entity were also analyzed to help identify the spatial effect .
the study found that visual feature , including human , construction site , shop front , and roadside/walking pavement , are vital one that correspond to the vitality of the urban street .
the consistency of these critical feature with traditional urban vitality feature indicates the model had learned useful knowledge from the training process .
applying the trained model in urban planning practice can help to improve the city environment for better attraction of resident ’ activity and communication .
