uncertainty of human perception in visual image interpretation in complex urban environment .
today satellite image are mostly exploited automatically due to advance in image classification method .
manual visual image interpretation ( MVII ) , however , still plays a significant role e.g.
, to generate training data for machine-learning algorithms or for validation purpose .
in certain urban environment , however , of e.g.

, highest density and structural complexity , textural and spectral complication in overlapping roof-structure still demand the human interpreter if one aims to capture individual building structure .
the cognitive perception and real-world experience are still inevitable .
against these background , this article aims at quantifying and interpreting the uncertainty of mapping rooftop footprint of such area .
we focus on the agreement among interpreter and which aspect of perception and element of image interpretation affect mapping .
ten test person digitized six complex built-up area .
hereby , we receive quantitative information about spatial variable of building to systematically check the consistency and congruence of result .
an additional questionnaire reveal qualitative information about obstacle .
generally , we find large difference among interpreter ' mapping result and a high consistency of result for the same interpreter .
we measure rising deviation correlate with a rising morphologic complexity .
high degree of individuality are expressed e.g.
, in time consumption , in-situ- or geographic information system ( GIS ) -precognition whereas data source mostly influences the mapping procedure .
by this study , we aim to fill a gap as prior research using MVII often does not implement an uncertainty analysis or quantify mapping aberration .
we conclude that remote sensing study should not only rely unquestioned on MVII for validation ; furthermore , data and method are needed to suspend uncertainty .
digital excavation of mediatized urban heritage : Automated recognition of building in image source .
digital technology provide novel way of visualizing city and building .
they also facilitate new method of analyzing the built environment , ranging from artificial intelligence ( AI ) to crowdsourced citizen participation .
digital representation of city have become so refined that they challenge our perception of the real .
however , computer have not yet become able to detect and analyze the visible feature of built structure depicted in photographs or other media .
recent scientific advance mean that it is possible for this new field of computer vision to serve as a critical aid to research .
neural network now meet the challenge of identifying and analyzing building element , building and urban landscape .
the development and refinement of these technology requires more attention , simultaneously , investigation is needed in regard to the use and meaning of these method for historical research .
for example , the use of AI raises question about the way in which computer-based image recognition reproduces biase of contemporary practice .
it also invites reflection on how mixed method , integrating quantitative and qualitative approach , can be established and used in research in the humanitie .
finally , it opens new perspective on the role of crowdsourcing in both knowledge dissemination and shared research .

attempt to analyze historical big data with the latest method of deep learning , to involve many people—laymen and experts—in research via crowdsourcing and to deal with partly unknown visual material have provided a better understanding of what is possible .
the article presents finding from the ongoing research project ArchiMediaL , which is at the forefront of the analysis of historical mediatization of the built environment .

it demonstrates how the combination of crowdsourcing , historical big data and deep learning simultaneously raises question and provides solution in the field of architectural and urban planning history .
development of generating system for architectural color icon using google map platform and tensorflow-segmentation .
in this research , the goal is to develop a generating system for architectural color icon using Google Map Platform and Tensorflow-Segmentation .
there has been no case of developing a system that allows user to visualize the color tendency of building as architectural color icon for each building element from image of various region .
it is considered meaningful to be able to create criterion for decision making in architecture and the urban design by developing a system to clarify the current state of the architectural color .
it will contribute a rise in the consciousness of landscape conservation and be essential for the design of architecture and public object .
this paper includes the explanation of development method , use experiment , and consideration of five problem among architectural color icon creation .
it is assumed that the accuracy of the present system will be better as the technology improves .
holistic visual data representation for built environment assessment .
with an increasing interest of big data and its analysis , urban planner and architect use manifold data from different source as an indicator of urban phenomenon .
to analyse them , machine learning model have been gotten fame to evaluate complex urban feature with correlation matrix and cross validation .
there are two major type of data such as top-down and bottom-up data .
interestingly , there is a third category of data that has not been widely deployed yet which we define as the 'Holistic visual data ' .
it is the general impression to your visual perception of urban environment when you at a specific spot that we believe can be captured by Google Street Views .
this paper aims to ask how do top-down , bottomup , and holistic visual data work individually or together to predict the built environment value in urban area .

admittedly , housing price is a highly spatial metric that involves multifarious interest including macroeconomic policy , the development of the area , the local people , and specific house ' feature .
to investigate the quality of built environment , machine learning technique are adopted for different group of dataset .

by comparing several regression and classification model for each group of data such as top-down , bottom-up and holistic visual data with housing price , the Random Forest model could be proposed as a best model .
the intricate urban matrix need to be organized such an order , but there are multiple factor affecting urban issue including land value and housing price .
by utilizing relevant machine learning model , it can be provided the practical guideline to architect and designer for improving the quality of built environment .
street view imagery in urban analytic and GIS : A review .
street view imagery has rapidly ascended as an important data source for geospatial data collection and urban analytic , deriving insight and supporting informed decision .
such surge has been mainly catalysed by the proliferation of large-scale imagery platform , advance in computer vision and machine learning , and availability of computing resource .

we screened more than 600 recent paper to provide a comprehensive systematic review of the state of the art of how street-level imagery is currently used in study pertaining to the built environment .

the main finding are that : ( i ) street view imagery is now clearly an entrenched component of urban analytic and GIScience ; ( ii ) most of the research relies on data from Google Street View ; and ( iii ) it is used across myriad of domain with numerous application – ranging from analysing vegetation and transportation to health and socio-economic study .

a notable trend is crowdsourced street view imagery , facilitated by service such as Mapillary and KartaView , in some case furthering geographical coverage and temporal granularity , at a permissive licence .
street design for hedonistic sustainability through ai and human co-operative evaluation .
recently , there has been an increasing emphasis on community development centered on the well-being and quality of life of citizen , while pursuing sustainability .

this study proposes an AI and human co-operative evaluation ( AIHCE ) framework that facilitates communication design between designer and stakeholder based on human emotion and value and is an evaluation method for street space .

aihce is an evaluation method based on image recognition technology that performs deep learning of the facial expression of both people and the city ; namely , it consists of a facial expression recognition model ( FERM ) and a street image evaluation model ( SIEM ) .
the former evaluates the street space based on the emotion and value of the pedestrian ’ s facial expression , and the latter evaluates the target street space from the prepared street space image .

aihce is an integrated framework for these two model , enabling continuous and objective evaluation of space with simultaneous subjective emotional evaluation , showing the possibility of reflecting it in the design .

it is expected to contribute to fostering people ’ s awareness that Street are public good reflecting the basic function of public space and the value and regional characteristic of resident , contributing to the improvement of the sustainability of the entire city .
subjectively measured streetscape perception to inform urban design strategy for Shanghai .

recently , many new study applying computer vision ( CV ) to street view imagery ( SVI ) datasets to objectively extract the view indice of various streetscape feature such as tree to proxy urban scene quality have emerged .
however , human perception ( e.g.
, imageability ) have a subtle relationship to visual element that can not be fully captured using view indice .
conversely , subjective measure using survey and interview data explain human behavior more .
however , the effectiveness of integrating subjective measure with SVI dataset has been less discussed .
to address this , we integrated crowdsourcing , CV , and machine learning ( ML ) to subjectively measure four important perception suggested by classical urban design theory .
we first collected rating from expert on sample SVIs regarding these four quality , which became the training label .
cv segmentation was applied to SVI sample extracting streetscape view indice as the explanatory variable .
we then trained ML model and achieved high accuracy in predicting score .
we found a strong correlation between the predicted complexity score and the density of urban amenity and service point of interest ( POI ) , which validates the effectiveness of subjective measure .

in addition , to test the generalizability of the proposed framework as well as to inform urban renewal strategy , we compared the measured quality in Pudong to other five urban core that are renowned worldwide .

rather than predicting perceptual score directly from generic image feature using a convolution neural network , our approach follows what urban design theory has suggested and confirmed as various streetscape feature affecting multi-dimensional human perception .
therefore , the result provide more interpretable and actionable implication for policymaker and city planner .
panoramic street-level imagery in data-driven urban research : A comprehensive global review of application , technique , and practical consideration .

the release of Google Street View in 2007 inspired several new panoramic street-level imagery platform including Apple Look Around , Bing StreetSide , Baidu Total View , Tencent Street View , Naver Street View , and Yandex Panorama .
the ever-increasing global capture of city in 360◦ provides considerable new opportunity for data-driven urban research .

this paper provides the first comprehensive , state-of-the-art review on the use of street-level imagery for urban analysis in five research area : built environment and land use ; health and wellbeing ; natural environment ; urban modelling and demographic surveillance ; and area quality and reputation .

panoramic street-level imagery provides advantage in comparison to remotely sensed imagery and conventional urban data source , whether manual , automated , or machine learning data extraction technique are applied .

key advantage include low-cost , rapid , high-resolution , and wide-scale data capture , enhanced safety through remote presence , and a unique pedestrian/vehicle point of view for analyzing city at the scale and perspective in which they are experienced .

however , several limitation are evident , including limited ability to capture attribute information , unreliability for temporal analysis , limited use for depth and distance analysis , and the role of corporation as image-data gatekeeper .
finding provide detailed insight for those interested in using panoramic street-level imagery for urban research .
urban morphological feature extraction and multi-dimensional similarity analysis based on deep learning approach .
the study of urban morphology contribute to the evolution of city and sustainable development .

urban morphological feature extraction and similarity analysis represents a practical framework in many study to interpret and introduce the current built environment to aid in proposing novel design .
in conventional method , morphological feature are represented based on qualitative description , symbolical interpretation , or manually selected indicator .
however , these method could cause subjective bias and limit the generalizability .

this study proposes a hybrid data-driven approach to support quantitative morphological description and multi-dimensional similarity analysis for urban design decision-making and to further morphology-related study using information abundance via a deep-learning approach .
we constructed a dataset of 3817 residential plot with geometrical and related infrastructure information .
a deep convolutional neural network , GoogLeNet , was implemented with the plot ’ figure–ground image , by quantifying the morphological feature into 2048-dimensional feature vector .
we conducted a similarity analysis of the plot by calculating the Euclidean distance between the high-dimensional feature vector .
then , a comparison study was performed by retrieving case based on the plot shape and plot with building separately .
the proposed method considers the overall characteristic of the urban morphology and social infrastructure situation for similarity analysis .
this method is flexible and effective .

the proposed framework indicates the feasibility and potential of integrating task-oriented information to introduce custom and adequate reference via deep learning method , which could support decision making and association study on morphology with urban consequence .
this work could serve as a basis for further typo-morphology study and other morphology-related ecological , social , and economic study for sustainable built environment .
4d building reconstruction with machine learning and historical map .
the increasing importance of three-dimensional ( 3D ) city modelling is linked to these data ’ s different application and advantage in many domain .
image and Light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) data availability are now an evident and unavoidable prerequisite , not always verified for past scenario .
indeed , historical map are often the only source of information when dealing with historical scenario or multi-temporal ( 4D ) digital representation .
the paper presents a methodology to derive 4D building model in the level of detail 1 ( LoD1 ) , inferring missing height information through machine learning technique .
the aim is to realise 4D LoD1 building for geospatial analysis and visualisation , valorising historical data , and urban study .
several machine learning regression technique are analysed and employed for deriving missing height data from digitised multi-temporal map .
the implemented method relie on geometric , neighbour , and categorical attribute for height prediction .
derived elevation data are then used for 4D building reconstruction , offering multitemporal version of the considered urban scenario .
various evaluation metric are also presented for tackling the common issue of lack of ground-truth information within historical data .
a deep learning approach to urban street functionality prediction based on centrality measure and stacked denoising autoencoder .
in urban planning and transportation management , the centrality characteristic of urban Street are vital measure to consider .
centrality can help in understanding the structural property of dense traffic network that affect both human life and activity in city .
many city classify urban Street to provide stakeholder with a group of street guideline for possible new rehabilitation such as sidewalk , curb , and setback .
transportation research always considers street network as a connection between different urban area .
the street functionality classification defines the role of each element of the urban street network ( USN ) .
some potential factor such as land use mix , accessible service , design goal , and administrator ' policy can affect the movement pattern of urban traveler .
in this study , nine centrality measure are used to classify the urban Road in four city evaluating the structural importance of street segment .
in our work , a Stacked Denoising Autoencoder ( SDAE ) predicts a street 's functionality , then logistic regression is used as a classifier .

our proposed classifier can differentiate between four different class adopted from the U.S. Department of Transportation ( USDT ) : principal arterial road , minor arterial road , collector road , and local road .

the SDAE-based model showed that regular grid configuration with repeated pattern are more influential in forming the functionality of road network compared to those with less regularity in their spatial structure .
this article is an open access article distributed under the term and condition of the Creative Commons Attribution ( CC BY ) license ( http : //creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ ) .
construction of landscape architecture art design based on streaming media data processing .
in urban planning , the design of garden landscape is not a difficult thing , it needs to adopt effective design method .

different way of landscape design can add natural landscape to the urban ecosystem , and will not destroy the ecological environment , but will gradually improve the quality of the ecological environment .
however , the design method of landscape in urban planning in China are not perfect enough , there are many problem , and it is difficult to improve the ecological environment of the city .

therefore , in the process of urban planning , the relevant personnel should fully understand the design method of landscape , and constantly innovate to create a quality living environment for people .
in this paper , we propose the landscape architecture system based on mobile edge streaming media data processing .
in the system , video surveillance system is mainly used to collect data , and the edge computing is the further processing of the inner connection .
especially , the stram data is analysed based on the machine learning model and the connection with the design is analysed .
the experimental result prove robustness of the methodology .
urban street context classification using convolutional neural network and Street imagery .
the classification of Street on road network has been focused on the vehicular transportational feature of Street .
example of street label include arterial , major Road , minor Road and so forth based on their transportational use .
city authority on the other hand have been shifting to more wholistic planning of Street .
the modern approach toward designing and planning Street is more inclusive of the street context , meaning the side use of a street combined with the transportational feature of a street .
several city authority are developing new classification scheme for street context that extends traditional classification method to include the use of land on the side of a street .
in those classification scheme , Street are labeled for example as commercial throughway , residential neighborhood , park etc .
this modern approach to urban planning have been adopted by major city such as the city of San Francisco , the state of Florida and Pennsylvania among many other .
currently , the process of labeling Street according to their contexts is manual and hence is tedious and time consuming .
it will require manual labor to regularly relabel Street as the city develops .
in this paper , we propose an approach to deploy advancement in computer vision toward modern urban planning .
we propose a framework for automatic classification of street context .
using labeled street imagery we train deep convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to perform the classification of street context .
we show that CNN model can perform well achieving accuracy in the 81 % to 87 % range .
we test various CNN architecture and report on their performance .
variational beauty of space : Machine intuition and non-linear neural aggregation .

spatial network have long been known for their internal spatial order or beauty ( Hillier , 2007 ) and in the field spatial computation and analytic we employ a number of graph based methodology in order to understand or extract intrinsic attribute of the urban fabric around us .
in this research we take a complete different approach by looking at urban structure through the use of deep convolutional variational autoencoder with interesting result .
autoencoder are an unsupervised learning technique in which we employ neural network for the task of representation learning .
specifically , a neural network architecture imposes a bottleneck in the network which forces a compressed and generalization of the knowledge representation of the structure of space .
this non-linear compression and subsequent reconstruction creates a unique set of feature that are inherent of urban space .

our network is multiple layer deep in order to be able to encode basic spatial complexity and is build based on a convolutional network architecture which is inspired by biological process similar to the connectivity pattern between neuron that resembles the organization of the animal visual cortex .
artificial neuron respond to real urban network of London in a restricted region of the visual field , which partially overlap such that they cover the entire convolutional visual field .
convolutional layer apply a convolution operation to the input , passing the result to the next layer .
each convolutional neuron processes data only for its receptive field but the cascading nature of our network build a knowledge of more complex spatial relation as data move deeper .
while convolutional neural network are extensively used in supervised image classification the work presented in this paper is completely unsupervised .

in this paper we present the complete architecture of the deep convolutional network that was trained for month using data from the city of London , concluding with two significant outcome extracted from the variational encoding and decoding process .
a non-linear clustering , or neural aggregation , of urban space based on the learned feature and a generative urban network output based on the variational synthesis we call machine intuition .
simulating land-use dynamic under planning policy by integrating artificial immune system with cellular automata .
cellular automata ( CA ) have been increasingly used in simulating urban expansion and land-use dynamic .
however , most urban CA model rely on empirical data for deriving transition rule , assuming that the historical trend will continue into the future .
such inertia CA model do not take into account possible external intervention , particularly planning policy , and thus have rarely been used in urban and land-use planning .
this paper proposes to use artificial immune system ( AIS ) as a technique for incorporating external intervention and generating alternative in urban simulation .
inspired by biological immune system , the primary process of AIS is the evolution of a set of 'antibodie ' that are capable of learning through interaction with a set of sample 'antigen ' .
these 'antibodie ' finally get 'matured ' and can be used to identify/classify other 'antigen ' .
an AIS-based CA model incorporates planning policy by altering the evolution mechanism of the 'antibodie ' .

such a model is capable of generating different scenario of urban development under different land-use policy , with which the planner will be able to answer 'what if ' question and to evaluate different option .
we applied an AIS-based CA model to the simulation of urban agglomeration development in the Pearl River Delta in southern China .
our experiment demonstrate that the proposed model can be very useful in exploring various planning scenario of urban development .
integrating the multi-label land-use concept and cellular automata with the artificial neural network-based Land Transformation Model : an integrated ML-CA-LTM modeling framework .
cellular automata ( CA ) and artificial neural network ( ANNs ) have been used by researcher over the last three decade to simulate land-use change ( LUC ) .
while conventional CA and ANN model assign a cell to only one land-use class , in reality , a cell may belong to several land-use class simultaneously .
the recently developed multi-label ( ML ) concept overcomes this limitation in land change science .
although the ML concept is a new paradigm with nonexclusive class and has shown considerable merit in several application , few study in land change science have applied it .
in addition , determining transition rule in conventional CA is difficult when the number of driver is large .

since CA has been shown as a potential model to consider neighborhood effect and ANN has been shown effective in determining CA transition rule , we integrated both CA with an ANN model to overcome limitation of each tool .
in this study , we specifically extended the ANN-based Land Transformation Model ( LTM ) with both a CA-based model and the ML concept to create an integrated ML-CA-LTM modeling framework .
we also compared , using standard evaluation measure , difference between the proposed integrated model with a conventional CA-based LTM model ( called the ml-CA-LTM ) .
parameterization was made using a learning and testing procedure common in machine learning .
result showed that the modified LUC model , ML-CA-LTM , produced consistently better goodness of fit calibration value compared to the ml-CA-LTM .
the outcome of this modified model can be used by manager and decision maker for improved urban planning .
urban water resource management for sustainable environment planning using artificial intelligence technique .
in the current era , water is a significant resource for socio-economic growth and the protection of healthy environment .
properly controlled water resource are considered a vital part of development , which reduces poverty and equity .
conventional Water system Management maximizes the existing water flows available to satisfy all competing demand , including on-site water and groundwater .
therefore , Climatic change would intensify the specific challenge in water resource management by contributing to uncertainty .
sustainable water resource management is an essential process for ensuring the earth 's life and the future .
nonlinear effect , stochastic dynamic , and hydraulic constraint are challenging in ecological planning for sustainable water development .
in this paper , Adaptive Intelligent Dynamic Water Resource Planning ( AIDWRP ) has been proposed to sustain the urban area ' water environment .
here , an adaptive intelligent approach is a subset of the Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technique in which environmental planning for sustainable water development has been modeled effectively .

artificial intelligence modeling improve water efficiency by transforming information into a leaner process , improving decision-making based on data-driven by combining numeric AI tool and human intellectual skill .

in AIDWRP , Markov Decision Process ( MDP ) discusses the dynamic water resource management issue with annual use and released locational constraint that develop sensitivity-driven method to optimize several efficient environmental planning and management policy .

consequently , there is a specific relief from the engagement of supply and demand for water resource , and substantial improvement in local economic efficiency have been simulated with numerical outcome .
mining transition rule of cellular automata for simulating urban expansion by using the deep learning technique .

along with the gradually accelerated urbanization process , simulating and predicting the future pattern of the city is of great importance to the prediction and prevention of some environmental , economic and urban issue .
previous study have generally integrated traditional machine learning with cellular automaton ( CA ) model to simulate urban development .

nevertheless , difficulty still exist in the process of obtaining more accurate result with CA model ; such difficulty are mainly due to the insufficient consideration of neighborhood effect during urban transition rule mining .
in this paper , we used an effective deep learning method , named convolution neural network for united mining ( UMCNN ) , to solve the problem .
umcnn has substantial potential to get neighborhood information from its receptive field .
thus , a novel CA model coupled with UMCNN and Markov chain was designed to improve the performance of simulating urban expansion process .

choosing the Pearl River Delta of China as the study area , we excavate the driving factor and the transformational relation revealed by the urban land-use pattern in 2000 , 2005 and 2010 and further simulate the urban expansion status in 2020 and 2030 .
additionally , three traditional machine-learning-based CA model ( LR , ANN and RFA ) are built to attest the practicality of the proposed model .
in the comparison , the proposed method reaches the highest simulation accuracy and landscape index similarity .
the predicted urban expansion result reveal that the economy will continue to be the primary factor in the study area from 2010 to 2030 .
the proposed model can serve as guidance in urban planning and government decision-making .
upscaling urban data science for global climate solution .
non-technical summary Manhattan , Berlin and New Delhi all need to take action to adapt to climate change and to reduce greenhouse gas emission .
while case study on these city provide valuable insight , comparability and scalability remain sidelined .

it is therefore timely to review the state-of-the-art in data infrastructure , including earth observation , social media data , and how they could be better integrated to advance climate change science in city and urban area .

we present three route for expanding knowledge on global urban area : mainstreaming data collection , amplifying the use of big data and taking further advantage of computational method to analyse qualitative data to gain new insight .
these data-based approach have the potential to upscale urban climate solution and effect change at the global scale .
technical summary Citie have an increasingly integral role in addressing climate change .

to gain a common understanding of solution , we require adequate and representative data of urban area , including data on related greenhouse gas emission , climate threat and of socio-economic contexts .

here , we review the current state of urban data science in the context of climate change , investigating the contribution of urban metabolism study , remote sensing , big data approach , urban economic , urban climate and weather study .

we outline three route for upscaling urban data science for global climate solution : 1 ) Mainstreaming and harmonizing data collection in city worldwide ; 2 ) Exploiting big data and machine learning to scale solution while maintaining privacy ; 3 ) Applying computational technique and data science method to analyse published qualitative information for the systematization and understanding of first-order climate effect and solution .
collaborative effort towards a joint data platform and integrated urban service would provide the quantitative foundation of the emerging global urban sustainability science .
simulation of urban expansion via integrating artificial neural network with Markov chain–cellular automata .
accurate simulation and prediction of urban expansion are critical to manage urbanization and explicitly address the spatiotemporal trend and distribution of urban expansion .
cellular Automata integrated Markov Chain ( CA-MC ) is one of the most frequently used model for this purpose .

however , the urban suitability index ( USI ) map produced from the conventional CA-MC is either affected by human bias or can not accurately reflect the possible nonlinear relation between driving factor and urban expansion .

to overcome these limitation , a machine learning model ( Artificial Neural Network , ANN ) was integrated with CA-MC instead of the commonly used Analytical Hierarchy Process ( AHP ) and Logistic Regression ( LR ) CA-MC model .
the ANN was optimized to create the USI map and then integrated with CA-MC to spatially allocate urban expansion cell .
the validated result of kappa and fuzzy kappa simulation indicate that ANN-CA-MC outperformed other variously coupled CA-MC modelling approach .
based on the ANN-CA-MC model , the urban area in South Auckland is predicted to expand to 1340.55 ha in 2026 at the expense of non-urban area , mostly grassland and open-bare land .
most of the future expansion will take place within the planned new urban growth zone .
simulating urban land use change by integrating a convolutional neural network with vector-based cellular automata .
vector-based cellular automata ( VCA ) model have been applied in land use change simulation at fine scale .
however , the neighborhood effect of the driving factor are rarely considered in the exploration of the transition suitability of cell , leading to lower simulation accuracy .

this study proposes a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) -VCA model that adopts the CNN to extract the high-level feature of the driving factor within a neighborhood of an irregularly shaped cell and discover the relationship between multiple land use change and driving factor at the neighborhood level .
the proposed model was applied to simulate urban land use change in Shenzhen , China .
compared with several VCA model using other machine learning method , the proposed CNN-VCA model obtained the highest simulation accuracy ( figure-of-merit = 0.361 ) .

the result indicated that the CNN-VCA model can effectively uncover the neighborhood effect of multiple driving factor on the developmental potential of land parcel and obtain more detail on the morphological characteristic of land parcel .
moreover , the land use pattern of 2020 and 2025 under an ecological control strategy were simulated to provide decision support for urban planning .
an agent-based learning-embedded model ( ABM-learning ) for urban land use planning : A case study of residential land growth simulation in Shenzhen , China .

a forward-looking urban land use plan is crucial to a city 's sustainability , which requires a deep understanding of human-environment interaction between different domain , and modelling them soundly .
one of the key challenge of modelling these interaction is to understand and model how human individual make and develop their location decision by learning that then shape urban land-use pattern .
to investigate this issue , we have constructed an extended experience-weighted attraction learning model to represent the human agent ’ learning when they make location decision .

consequently , we propose and have developed an agent-based learning-embedded model ( ABM-learning ) for residential land growth simulation that incorporates a learning model , a decision-making model , a land use conversion model and the constraint of urban land use master plan .
the proposed model was used for a simulation of the residential land growth in Shenzhen city , China .
by validating the model against empirical data , the result showed that the site-specific accuracy of the model has been improved when embedding learning model .
the analysis on the simulation accuracy has proved the argument that modelling individual-level learning matter in the agent 's decision model and the agent-based model .
we also applied the model to predict residential land growth in Shenzhen from 2015 to 2035 , and the result can be a reference for land-use allocation in detailed planning of Shenzhen .

the ABM-learning is applicable to studying the past urban growth trajectory , aiding in the formulation of detailed residential land and public service facility planning and assessing the land use planning effectiveness .
machine learning for geographically differentiated climate change mitigation in urban area .
artificial intelligence and machine learning are transforming scientific discipline , but their full potential for climate change mitigation remains elusive .

here , we conduct a systematic review of applied machine learning study that are of relevance for climate change mitigation , focusing specifically on the Field of remote sensing , urban transportation , and building .
the relevant body of literature span twenty year and is growing exponentially .

we show that the emergence of big data and machine learning method enables climate solution research to overcome generic recommendation and provide policy solution at urban , street , building and household scale , adapted to specific contexts , but scalable to global mitigation potential .
we suggest a meta-algorithmic architecture and framework for using machine learning to optimize urban planning for accelerating , improving and transforming urban infrastructure provision .
coupling cellular automata with area partitioning and spatiotemporal convolution for dynamic land use change simulation .
urbanization process have accelerated over recent decade , prompting effort to model land use change ( LUC ) patterns for decision support and urban planning .
cellular automata ( CA ) are extensively employed given their simplicity , flexibility , and intuitiveness when simulating dynamic LUC .

previous research , however , has ignored the spatial heterogeneity among sub-region , instead applying the same transition rule across entire region ; moreover , most existing method extract neighborhood effect with only one data time slice , which is inconsistent with the nature of neighborhood interaction as a long-term process exhibiting obvious spatiotemporal dependency .
accordingly , we propose a hybrid cellular automata model coupling area partitioning and spatiotemporal neighborhood feature learning , named PST-CA .

we use a machine-learning-based partitioning strategy , self-organizing map ( SOM ) , to divide entire region into several homogeneous sub-region , and further apply a spatiotemporal three-dimensional convolutional neural network ( 3D CNN ) to extract the spatiotemporal neighborhood feature .
an artificial neural network ( ANN ) is then built to create a conversion probability map for each sub-region using both spatiotemporal neighborhood feature and factor that drive the LUC .
finally , the dynamic simulation result of entire study area are generated by fusing these probability map , constraint and stochastic factor .
land use data collected from 2000 to 2015 in Shanghai were selected to verify our proposed method .
four traditional model were implemented for comparison , including logistic regression ( LR ) -CA , support vector machine ( SVM ) -CA , random forest ( RF ) -CA and conventional ANN-CA .
result illustrate that the proposed PST-CA outperformed four traditional model , with overall accuracy increased by 4.66 % ~6.41 % .

moreover , three distinctly different “ coverage rate-growth rate ” composite pattern of built-up area are shown in the SOM partitioning result , which verifies SOM 's ability to address spatial heterogeneity ; while the optimal time step in 3D CNN generally maintained a positive correlation with the growth rate of built-up area , which implies longer temporal dependency should be captured for rapidly developing area .
multivariate relationship between campus design parameter and energy performance using reinforcement learning and parametric modeling .
for the past two decade , extensive research has been conducted to evaluate the performance of urban form scenario such as sky view factor , solar radiation , or energy performance .
the relationship between urban design parameter and multiple performance should be stipulated to evaluate scenario for supporting timely and reliable design decision .

however , there are three major challenge : ( 1 ) only a few design alternative are devised , ( 2 ) the multiple performance has not been provided synthetically , and ( 3 ) the relationship between design parameter and performance are difficult to be determined because they are multivariate relationship .

this research proposes a new methodology applying a generative design approach using a reinforcement learning algorithm , a parametric performance modeling , and a multivariate adaptive regression spline approach to identify relationship between design parameter and urban performance .
this research aims to support decision-making of urban design to achieve an energy efficient and visually qualified urban environment .

a data-driven urban design approach is proposed to generate possible design alternative using reinforcement learning , and a design-driven analysis is conducted to evaluate multiple performance of urban building using parametric modeling .
the multivariate analysis presented relationship between urban geometric form and performance criterion by using 30 sample .
the finding show that to maintain optimal solar potential , the building coverage ratio is recommended to be bigger than 0.17 .
to maintain the optimal energy balance , the threshold for sky view factor is recommended as 54.17 % .
these relationship contribute to deriving design strategy and guideline for designing a sustainable campus .
generative design and performance modeling for relationship between urban built form , sky opening , solar radiation and energy .
for the past two decade , extensive research has been conducted to evaluate the performance of urban form scenario such as sky view factor , solar radiation , or energy performance .
simulation-based performance analysis has been applied for optimizing urban design using multiple performance criterion of energy demand , daylighting , or radiance .

two major limitation exist in the performance evaluation method of urban design : 1 ) the number of urban design alternative or scenario has been limited , and 2 ) various performance criterion and metric have not been assessed synthetically .
in this respect , we aim to generate all possible alternative under constraint such as a city policy or development requirement .
this paper addresses the integration of generative design and multi-criteria performance analysis for urban design decision making .
the relationship between geometric urban form and multiple performance criterion are identified .

the proposed methodology incorporates the reinforcement learning algorithm , an advanced machine learning technique , along with parametric modeling technique , to enhance urban design decision based on various performance criterion .
this methodology was tested on the design of an international campus of the Georgia Institute of Technology , located in Shenzhen , China .
an algorithm generates numerous geometrical alternative of campus design under site constraint and development requirement of the campus .
those alternative are then evaluated based on performance criterion of sky opening , solar radiation , or energy consumption synthetically .
the method enables an integrated performance analysis for all possible design under constraint .
the paper proposes a data driven urban design approach that connect generative design and multi-criteria performance analysis .
the relationship between urban geometric form and performance criterion function derive guideline for a sustainable and green campus .
in future conduct multivariate analysis to examine the relationship between geometric element and performance measurement metric .

improving land-use change modeling by integrating ANN with Cellular Automata-Markov Chain model .
urban growth and land-use change are a few of many puzzling factor affecting our future city .
creating a precise simulation for future land change is a challenging process that requires temporal and spatial modeling .
many recent study developed and trained model to predict urban expansion pattern using Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) .
this study aims to enhance the simulation capability of Cellular Automata Markov Chain ( CA-MC ) model in predicting change in land-use .
this study integrates the Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) into CA-MC to incorporate several driving force that highly impact land-use change .

the research utilizes different socio-economic , spatial , and environmental variable ( slope , distance to road , distance to urban center , distance to commercial , density , elevation , and land fertility ) to generate potential transition map using ANN Data-driven model .
the generated map are fed to CA-MC as additional input .
we calibrated the original CA-MC and our model for 2015 cross-comparing simulated map and actual map obtained for Irbid city , Jordan in 2015 .
validation of our model was assessed and compared to the CA-MC model using Kappa indice including the agreement in term of quantity and location .
the result elucidated that our model with an accuracy of 90.04 % substantially outperforms CA-MC ( 86.29 % ) model .
the improvement we obtained from integrating ANN with CA-MC suggested that the influence imposed by the driving force was necessary to be taken into account for more accurate prediction .

in addition to the improved model prediction , the predicted map of Irbid for the year 2021 and 2027 will guide local authority in the development of management strategy that balance urban expansion and protect agricultural region .
this will play a vital role in sustaining Jordan 's food security .
machine learning-assisted evaluation of land use policy and plan in a rapidly urbanizing district in Chongqing , China .
analysis of annual land use change is crucial to timely assessment of the impact of land use policy , especially in rapidly urbanizing area such as the Liangjiang New District of Chongqing , China .
this research aims to assess the impact of multi-level land use policy and plan and their effectiveness in protecting farmland , and to recommend policy to remedy defective one .
markov Chain–Cellular Automata modelling was integrated with machine learning to predict future urbanization .
the result show that prior to the establishment of the District in late 2010 , the urban area grew at 13 % annually because local policy promoted profit-motivated development .
this rate declined drastically to 4 % during 2011–2012 in direct response to the changed local land use policy and strict enforcement of national policy .
these policy stabilized the urbanization rate at 7 % over the subsequent year .

the safeguard of previous farmland was possible only when the national policy were aligned closely with the local policy in their aim , provided both were rigorously enforced through a land management agency .
urban land in 2020 is predicted to growth by at least 464 km2 with some difference between two scenario .
in the baseline scenario ( no change in policy ) , almost 70 % of new growth will take place inside three industry zone and the duty-free port .
however , in the national overall plan scenario , a significant amount of marginal farmland will be changed into greenfield within the planned urban zone .
it is recommended that a hierarchical farmland protection policy be implemented .
it should incorporate the national policy that must be adapted to the local setting to achieve sustainable urbanization and to minimize farmland loss .
investigation of the likelihood of green infrastructure ( GI ) enhancement along linear waterway or on derelict site ( DS ) using machine learning .

study evaluating the potential for green infrastructure ( GI ) development using traditional Boolean logic-based multi-criteria analysis method are not capable of predicting future GI development in dynamic urbanscape .

this study evaluated both artificial neural network ( ANN ) and adaptive , network-based fuzzy inference system ( ANFIS ) algorithms in conjunction with statistical modelling to predict green or grey transformation likelihood for derelict site ( DS ) and vacant site along waterway corridor ( WWC ) in Manchester based on ecological , environmental , and social criterion .
the soft-computing algorithms had better predictive capacity at 72 % accuracy versus the 65 % of logistic model .
site size , population coverage , and air pollution were identified as the main influencer in the potential for site transformation .
in Manchester , the likelihood of GI transformation was higher for WWC than derelict site at 80 % versus 60 % likelihood , respectively .
furthermore , DS were more likely to transform into grey development based on current trend and urban planning practice .
deep neural network analysis of water quality time series associated with water sensitive urban design ( WSUD ) feature .

the ability of Long short-term memory ( LSTM ) , Gated recurrent unit ( GRU ) , Adaptive-network-based fuzzy inference system ( ANFIS ) , Artificial neural network ( ANN ) , and Group method of data handling ( GMDH ) in predicting water quality time series associated with a cleansing biotope were evaluated .
we examined continuous monitoring time series of chlorophyll-a , turbidity , and specific conductivity using YSI EXO datasondes at the Inlet and Outlet .

based on Root Mean Square Errors , Mean Absolute Percentage Errors , Mean Absolute Errors , Correlation Coefficients , and Theil ’ s U , the GRU generally was the most efficient model in predicting the Outlet water quality .
ai model should find increasing implementation the area of ‘ smart environment ’ .

way forward for enhancing AI model performance were suggested to better consider data periodicity and explore a transfer function approach in which the water quality timeserie of one parameter is forecast based on an ensemble of other parameter .
comparison of ANN Classifier to the Neuro-Fuzzy System for Collusion Detection in the Tender Procedures of Road Construction Sector .

as the contract in the road construction sector in Poland are usually of extremely high value and financed from the state budget , the tender procedure should not allow for the non-concurrent behaviours of tender participant .
otherwise , the client ' loss will be of high value too .
a database comprising hundred of bidding procedure in the road construction industry in Poland has been developed .
it includes the tender 's participant , the location of the Road section , bid ' value , the winner , and the type of Road .
every procedure has been evaluated and assigned to the set with a given level of collusion occurrence probability .
the evaluation has required the analysis and the transformation of-described in the literature-collusive type of behaviours to the parameter of procedure that can be shown as number or rank .
four criterion of a collusion threatened contract have been chosen and applied for evaluation .
then , two method of machine learning were applied .
the first method was to train an artificial neural network ( ANN ) to classify the procedure to the aforementioned set .
the other method was to utilize artificial neural network predictive capability enriched by the fuzzy set theory .
the multiple output from ANN was defined as membership function value .
the use of the fuzzy set theory-the process of defuzzification-helps to classify the tender procedure to the set of different level of risk ( of collusion appearance ) .
the result achieved in these two separate process are compared and discussed .
the created tool can be applied for the future tender procedure as a pre-test of a collusion appearance .
selecting artificial intelligence urban model using wave of complexity .
urban land use change is a complex and dynamic process .
it is therefore important to understand the complexity involved with system dynamic and choose appropriate modelling approach .
for this purpose , this paper firstly reviews how artificial intelligence ( AI ) approaches provide solution to aid urban land dynamic modelling .
the three dimension that are considered pivotal for the understanding of urban dynamic process - urban land dynamic , planning support and AI infrastructure - are defined .

once these three dimension are clarified , it is possible to propose the different solution space provided by AI approach using a graphic representation of a cube and its associated mathematical formulation .
it is therefore possible to understand and define the best data model to represent the complexity of different phenomenon in urban system .
gis-enabled digital twin system for sustainable evaluation of carbon emission : A case study of Jeonju city , south Korea .
despite the growing interest in digital twin ( DTs ) in geospatial technology , the scientific literature is still at the early stage , and concept of DTs vary .
in common perspective , the primary goal of DTs are to reduce the uncertainty of the physical system in real-world project to reduce cost .

thus , this study is aimed at developing a structural schematic of a geographic information system ( GIS ) -enabled DT system and exploring geospatial technology that can aid in deploying a DT system for a real-world project—in particular , for the sustainable evaluation of carbon emission .
the schematic includes three major phase : ( 1 ) data collection and visualization , ( 2 ) analytic , and ( 3 ) deployment .
three step are designed to propose an optimal strategy to reduce carbon emission in an urban area .
in the analytic phase , mapping , machine learning algorithms , and spatial statistic are applied , mapping an ideal counterpart to physical asset .
furthermore , not only are GIS map able to analyze geographic data that represent the counterpart of physical asset but can also display and analyze spatial relationship between physical asset .

in the first step of the analytic phase , a GIS map spatially represented the most vulnerable area based on the value of carbon emission computed according to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change ( IPCC ) guideline .
next , the radial basis function ( RBF ) kernel algorithm , a machine learning technique , was used to forecast spatial trend of carbon emission .

a backpropagation neural network ( BPNN ) was used to quantitatively determine which factor was the most influential among the four data source : electricity , city gas , household waste , and vehicle .
then , a hot spot analysis was used to assess where high value of carbon emission clustered in the study area .
this study on the development of DTs contributes the following .
first , with DTs , sustainable urban management system will be improved and new insight developed more publicly .
ultimately , such improvement can reduce the failure of project associated with urban planning and management .
second , the structural schematic proposed here is a data-driven approach ; consequently , its output are more reliable and feasible .
ultimately , innovative approach become available and service are transformed .
consequently , urban planner or policy maker can apply the system to scenario-based approach .
systematizing and upscaling urban climate change mitigation .
the question of what city can contribute to mitigation and adapting to climate change is gaining traction among researcher and policy maker alike .
however , while the field is rich with case study , method that provide rich data across municipality and potentially at global scale remain underdeveloped , and comparative insight remain scarce .
here we summarize contribution to the focus issue on 'Systematizing and Upscaling Urban Climate Solutions ' , also drawing from presentation given at an accompanying conference in 2018 .
we highlight four core area for systematizing and upscaling urban climate mitigation solution .
first , with more and better ( big ) data and associated machine learning method , there is increasing potential to compare type of city and leverage collective understanding .

second , while urban climate assessment have mostly emphasized urban planning , demand-side action as related to both behavioral change and modified social practice relevant to urban space deserve more academic attention and integration across a diverse set of social science .

third , climate mitigation would be intangible as a single objective at the urban scale , and measure and solution that coordinate mitigation coherently with adaptation and broader sustainable development goal require explicit conceptualization and systematization .
forth , all insight should come together to develop governance framework that translate scientific exercise into concrete , realistic and organized action plan on the ground , for all city .
published by IOP Publishing Ltd .
balkanisation of urban planning .
the Maharashtra government does not seem to be serious about urban planning .
the development plan is a meaningless exercise in accordance with a law that is 50 year out of date .

the current situation is a balkanisation of urban planning with a host of different agency looking at land use and transportation planning along with policy intervention by department of the state and central government .
there is an urgent need for a central coordinator of urban plan even i f t he det ai led work is done by different agency .
design of machine learning model for Urban planning and management improvement .
with the aid of artificial intelligence , this paper builds a machine learning model with the KNN algorithm to optimize the traditional method of urban planning and management ( UPM ) .
the optimization is realized through two step .
first , the relevant theory of the updated UPM of livelihood oriented UPM ( LOUPM ) are explored for the later machine learning architecture design .
people 's livelihood has a great influence on UPM .
livelihood orientation makes the complex UPM even more complicated due to diverse living need of citizen .

this paper analyzes the deeper relationship between the people 's livelihood and UPM , systematically study the function and connotation of the people 's livelihood behavior , and profoundly discusses current contradiction and restraining factor .
second , based on a better understanding of LOUPM , this paper further proposes an artificial intelligence approach to select most related factor to optimize UPM from database .
in the first paper of this series , in the analysis of the relevant UPM theory , three scope of LOUPM are concluded to be the evaluation of data set : authority , time , and space .
then , this paper continues to design a software model with the KNN algorithm to evaluate the urban plan and generates optimization advice for the user .
based on this research , it is possible to explore LOUPM .

in order to make every effort to seek way and method to meet the challenge of the LOUPM in the new period , and by introducing a creative computing approach of government management and social governance , this article can contribute to the growing demand of China 's urbanization process .
comparative review of method supporting decision-making in urban development and land management .
this paper discusses how and where technology supporting decision-making can play , or are already playing , a role in both urban development and land management .

the review analyzes and compares three type of technology : cellular automata ( CA ) , artificial intelligence ( AI ) , and operational research ( OR ) , and evaluates to which extent they can be useful when dealing with various land planning objective and phase .

ca is one of the most useful model for simulating urban growth , AI displays great potential as a solution to capture the dynamic of land change , and OR is useful in decision-making , for example to conduct locational analysis .
the evaluation relie on a collection of relevant article , selected on the basis of both content and actuality .
the paper offers new perspective toward innovative method in urban planning and land management and highlight where and when which type of tool can be considered useful and valid .
the existing gap , i.e.
, phases or area in spatial planning or land management where the method have not been applied , are also discussed .
ai Technologies in Green Architecture Field : Statistical Comparative Analysis .

the technique , theory and implementation of the green building issue are the standout amongst the most difficult in architectural design , where these technique are a piece of the design process in architecture , landscape , and urban planning .
there are various parameter which might be interrelated , negating , dubious and of subjective nature are widen to utilize .

this paper presents a comprehensive critical state of art survey of current practice taking into account Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technique ( such as Fuzzy , ( AHP ) Analytical Hierarchy Process , ( GA ) Genetic Algorithms ) and their blend .
also , a comparative analysis of the strength and weakness of existing knowledge engineering AI tool based on different technique applied to the architecture problem are statistically discussed .

in addition , the paper exhibits how green architecture can be improved using the technology that been used for analysis to look for ideal green solution strategy to assist in making the best possible decision .
shanghai ’ s regenerated industrial waterfront : Urban lab for sustainability transition ?
in China , Shanghai often serves as a place to introduce and try out new idea .
this is certainly the case with experimental urban planning and design solution and sustainability transition .
this article identifie and evaluates the role of pilot project and demonstration zone along the Huangpu River .
these cluster and zone are supposed to guide the urban regeneration of the former industrial waterfront and to accelerate innovative development in Shanghai and the wider Yangtze Delta Region .

the Huangpu River as a whole is considered an urban lab and a showcase of ecological civilisation policy , with a strong ‘ people oriented ’ focus on improving the overall quality and attractiveness of urban life .
following three decade of rapid urban expansion , Shanghai ’ s urban development model is shifting toward one that emphasizes den-sification and the reuse of existing element .
the motto of Shanghai ’ s latest master plan is “ Striving for an Excellent Global City.
” One of the pathway to realize this expectation is the creation of thematic cluster for creative industry , financial institutes , AI , and technology , media and telecommunication industry .
these cluster are high‐density investment project meant to support and accelerate the transformation of Shanghai into a service economy .
there are important sim-ilaritie between these project in Shanghai and the role of urban lab in theory of sustainability transition .

drawing on these theory and those of ecological civilization , this article examines how these so‐called ‘ experimental ’ urban megapro-ject along the river contribute to Shanghai ’ s effort to take the lead in developing sustainable urban transition .
accelerated exploration for long-term urban water infrastructure planning through machine learning .

in this study , the neural network method ( Multi-Layer Perceptron , MLP ) was integrated with an explorative model , to study the feasibility of using machine learning to reduce the exploration time but providing the same support in long-term water system adaptation planning .
the specific network structure and training pattern were determined through a comprehensive statistical trial-and-error ( considering the distribution of error ) .
the network was applied to the case study in Scotchman 's Creek , Melbourne .
the network was trained with the first 10 % of the exploration data , validated with the following 5 % and tested on the rest .

the overall root-mean-square-error between the entire observed data and the predicted data is 10.5722 , slightly higher than the validation result ( 9.7961 ) , suggesting that the proposed trial-and-error method is reliable .
the designed MLP showed good performance dealing with spatial randomness from decentralized strategy .
the adoption of MLP-supported planning may overestimate the performance of candidate urban water system .

by adopting the safety coefficient , a multiplicator or exponent calculated by observed data and predicted data in the validation process , the overestimation problem can be controlled in an acceptable range and have few impact on final decision making .
improving intelligent decision making in urban planning : Using machine learning algorithm .
generally , decision making in urban planning has progressively become difficult due to the uncertain , convoluted , and multi-criteria nature of urban issue .
even though there has been a growing interest to this domain , traditional decision support system are no longer able to effectively support the decision process .
this paper aims to elaborate an intelligent decision support system ( IDSS ) that provides relevant assistance to urban planner in urban project .
this research addresses the use of new technique that contribute to intelligent decision making : machine learning classifier , naïve Bayes classifier , and agglomerative clustering .
finally , a prototype is being developed to concretize the proposition .
