optimization of a novel urban growth simulation model integrating an artificial fish swarm algorithm and cellular automata for a smart city .
as one of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals , it is sensible to analysis historical urban land use characteristic and project the potential of urban sustainable development for a smart city .
the cellular automaton ( CA ) model is the widely applied in simulating urban growth , but the optimum parameter of variable driving urban growth in the model remains to be continued to improve .

we propose a novel model integrating an artificial fish swarm algorithm ( AFSA ) and CA for optimizing parameter of variable in the urban growth model and make a comparison between AFSA-CA and other five model , which is used to study a 40-year urban land growth of Wuhan .

we found that the urban growth type from 1995 to 2015 appeared relatively consistent , mainly including infilling , edge-expansion and distant-leap type in Wuhan , which a certain range of urban land growth on the periphery of the central area .

additionally , although the genetic algorithms ( GA ) -CA model and the AFSA-CA model among the six model due to the distance variable , the parameter value of the GA-CA model is −15.5409 according to the fact that the population ( POP ) variable should be positively .
as a result , the AFSA-CA model regardless of the initial parameter setting is superior to the GA-CA model and the GA-CA model is superior to all the other model .

finally , it is projected that the potential of urban growth in Wuhan for 2025 and 2035 under three scenario ( natural urban land growth without any restriction ( NULG ) , sustainable urban land growth with cropland protection and ecological security ( SULG ) , and economic urban land growth with sustainable development and economic development in the core area ( EULG ) ) focus mainly on existing urban land and some new town center based on AFSA-CA urban growth simulation model .
an increasingly precise simulation can determine the potential increase area and quantity of urban land , providing a basis to judge the layout of urban land use for urban planner .
planning Support Systems for Long-Term Climate Resilience : A Critical Review .
as climate change is becoming a reality , there is an increasing demand to improve urban resilience .
planning Support Systems ( PSS ) enable climate-informed planning .
however , previous research confirms difficulty in the uptake of PSS due to their resource-intensive nature and lack of awareness of their usefulness .
this chapter aims to make a headway in understanding research priority and gap that need to be addressed for PSS to address climate resilience in the long run .

to this end , we review the emerging body of knowledge in academia and practice , by conducting a text-mining analysis of academic ( n = 36,405 ) and non-academic ( practice ) ( n = 86 ) literature on urban planning and climate resilience .
we extract trend on climate pressure , infrastructure driver , and planning response .
a key finding from academic literature is that long-term planning continues to be limited to a few fixed scenario and places a strong focus on single sector strategy .
practice document continue to be designed to inform high-level policy , but not spatial plan that require integrated thinking .

our analysis concludes with a research agenda for improving PSS to ( 1 ) identify and integrate the full range of variable in the long-term ; ( 2 ) support selection of appropriate planning response across multiple infrastructure system ; and ( 3 ) improve flexibility in planning by a deeper understanding of temporal aspect such as planning timeframe .
modeling Urban Future : Data-Driven Scenario of Climate Change and Vulnerability in Cities .
city are complex system where social , ecological , and technological process are deeply coupled .
this coupling complicate urban planning and land use development , as changing one facet of the urban fabric will likely impact the other .
as city grapple with climate change , there is a growing need to envision urban future that not only address more frequent and intense severe weather event but also improve day-to-day livability .
here we examine climate risk as function of the local land use with numerical model .
these model leverage a wide array of data source , from satellite imagery to tax assessment and land cover .
we then present a machine-learning cellular automata approach to combine historical land use change with local coproduced urban future scenario .

the cellular automata model uses historical and ancillary data like existing road system and natural feature to develop a set of probabilistic land use change rule , which are then modified according to stakeholder priority .
the resulting land use scenario are evaluated against historical flood hazard , showcasing how they perform against stakeholder expectation .

our work shows that coproduced scenario , when grounded with historical and emerging data , can provide path that increase resilience to weather hazard as well as enhancing ecosystem service provided to citizen .
a Machine Learning-Based Method for Predicting Urban Land Use .
land use is one of the most basic element of urban management .
in urban planning and design , land use is often determined by experience and case study .
however , the development of urbanization has led to a combinatory trend for land use , and the land use of a plot is always impacted by the surrounding environment .
in such a complex situation , it is difficult to find hidden relationship among type of land use by human alone .
within artificial intelligence , machine learning can help find correlation among data .
this paper presents a new method for learning the rule relating the known land use data and predicting the land use of a target plot by constructing an artificial neural network .
we take Nanjing as a specific case and study the logic of its land use .
the result not only demonstrate association between the surrounding and the target but also show the feasibility of a combinatory land use index in urban planning and design .
ai application on LID stormwater management and urban planning in Guam , USA , and Southern China , PRC .
over the last decade , there has been a tremendous increase in the usage of AI technology for hydrological and hydraulic modelling on the application of water resource management .
in early model stage , AI method were used primarily for prediction and forecasting , utilizing quantitative data .

with SCADA and sensor application with internet of thing ( IOT ) , AI technology have increasingly been used for the incorporation of qualitative and subjective information into real time monitoring .

with rapid calculation of model result and decision support system ( the AI process ) , the drainage system can control hydrological device such as pump , valve , or gate to adjust or control the flow rate of a drainage system as well as urban drainage ability to model complex hydrological system in an integrated fashion .
there are three part to the AI application on blockchain water platform ( BWP ) .
from the upstream of BWP , sensor and meter will be able to collect hydrological data such as rain gauge , flowrate , pressure in pipe , and key indicator of water quality .
this information will input into hydrological and hydraulic modelling , many engineering modelling software have been used for predicting flow with the scenario analysis .
the engineer will be able to run the model 24/7 to collect data from the studying watershed .
with continuous updated result , they will be able to obtain real time monitoring .

finally , through the result from the modelling system , operation procedure , drainage analysis , and the decision support system ( DSS ) , control device such as pump , valve , and gate will have the ability to be controlled wirelessly .
the AI process will allow the urban stormwater drainage to optimize their operation and produce the most efficient result for urban drainage .
with this approach , AI will link the sensor data by internet of thing ( IOT ) into the model with model analysis .
the overall benefit of using AI storm water management include an increase of energy efficiency , a decrease in flood risk , and a decrease in cost .
the system is operating in both Guam , U.S. , and southern China , since spring 2018 .
mining and Analysis of Air Quality Data to Aid Climate Change .
the data science and AI community has gathered around the world to support tackling the climate change problem in different domain .
this research aims to work on the air quality through emission and pollutant concentration data along with vegetation information .
authority especially in urban city like London have been very vigilant in monitoring these different aspect of air quality and reliable source of big data are available in this domain .

this study aims to mine and collate this information spread all over the place in different format into usable knowledge base on which further data analysis and powerful Machine Learning approach can be built to extract strong evidence useful in building better policy around climate change .
using particle swarm optimization method to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation in Beijing , China .
agricultural afforestation is an important way to mitigate climate change and improve the environmental quality of city system .
the major restriction of planning agricultural afforestation program and optimize the carbon sequestration potential of these program is the decrease of food productivity .
the spatial heterogeneity of both the food productivity and carbon sequestration potential further complicate this problem .
in this article , we demonstrate how the particle swarm optimization ( PSO ) method can be formulated and applied to address this problem .

based on the spatial estimation of food productivity and carbon sequestration potential , we formulated a PSO model to generate the optimal zoning of agricultural afforestation area and optimize the carbon sequestration potential with different scenario of food productivity decrease ratio in Beijing , China .
result show that our method can be used to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation under the restriction of decrease in food productivity .
with the application of our method , a significantly higher carbon sequestration potential can be achieved with a small loss of the current food productivity , e.g .
8.80-12.47 Tg C ( 14.82 - 20.93 % of the maximum carbon sequestration potential ) can be sequestrated with 5 % loss of current food productivity .
this research highlights the application of machine learning at the high level of smart city management to improve the efficacy and intelligence of urban planning .
multi-scale modeling of territorial dynamic of geospatial anthropogenic energy consumption .
objective : The development of any region or territory stems from its own dynamic nature .
distribution and consumption of energy resource are varied territorially which in turn is ruled by the number of anthropogenic activity in association with geospatial localization .
such territorial dynamic necessitate considerable modification of the energy infrastructure .

thus , the development of a computational multi-scale unified energy consumption model with the usage of geographic information helps in automating data analysis processes for sustainable urban planning , allocation of energy-saving infrastructure , and strategic deployment of the renewable energy resource to finely regulate the utilization of energy resource for sustainable energy consumption .
method : The integration of city-wide energy system model and geographic information system ( GIS ) is still in its infancy .
the research work is divided into five interrelated work package .
the Modelling problem is achieved with the help of analytical hierarchical process .

thus , we propose a computational infrastructure for modelling city-wide geospatial energy consumption and automating the data analysis process to provide the sustainable environmental policy , which requires artificial intelligence-based geospatial aware comprehensive planning , regarding the modification of the energy supply , consumption , activity , and infrastructure in city .

result and Discussion : Thus , end result of the presented research work is fine-grained energy demand estimation from data source , decentralized storage facility , and automated sustainable planning ; investigation of GIS-based anthropogenic activity or mobility pattern influencing the wastage of energy resource , the transition from purely structural to operational planning , and , finally , the development of a new dynamic-based power market design .
10th International Conference on Modeling and Applied Simulation , MAS 2011 , Held at the International Mediterranean and Latin American Modeling Multiconference , I3M 2011 .
the proceeding contain 72 paper and 1 PowerPoint presentation .

the topic discussed include : planning highway resurfacing using computer simulation ; 3 year of funding initiative for computational mathematic in Austria ; dynamic phenomenon and quality defect in laser cutting ; analysis of a warehouse management system by mean of simulation experiment ; CoMModO - complex material modeling operation , a comprehensive approach to the modeling of complex material with machine learning model within finite element simulation ; multi-objective optimization in urban design ; additive fault tolerant control for delayed system ; centralized and decentralized adaptive fault-tolerant control applied to interconnected and networked control system ; genetic algorithm approach to modeling fractal manufacturing layout ; mechanical damage to navy bean as affected by moisture content , impact velocity and seed orientation ; how important is price leadership in the UK fresh fruit and vegetable market ?
; and PLC code processing for automatic simulation model generation .
research on application of intelligent computation - Based LUCC model in urbanization process .
global change study is an interdisciplinary and comprehensive research activity with international cooperation , arising in 1980s , with the largest scope .

the interaction between land use and cover change , as a research field with the crossing of natural science and social science , has become one of core subject of global change study as well as the front edge and hot point of it .

it is necessary to develop research on land use and cover change in urbanization process and build an analog model of urbanization to carry out description , simulation and analysis on dynamic behavior in urban development change as well as to understand basic characteristic and rule of urbanization process .
this has positive practical and theoretical significance for formulating urban and regional sustainable development strategy .

the effect of urbanization on land use and cover change is mainly embodied in the change of quantity structure and space structure of urban space , and LUCC model in urbanization process has been an important research subject of urban geography and urban planning .

in this paper , based upon previous research achievement , the writer systematically analyzes the research on land use/cover change in urbanization process with the theory of complexity science research and intelligent computation ; builds a model for simulating and forecasting dynamic evolution of urban land use and cover change , on the basis of cellular automation model of complexity science research method and multi-agent theory ; expands Markov model , traditional CA model and Agent model , introduce complexity science research theory and intelligent computation theory into LUCC research model to build intelligent computation-based LUCC model for analog research on land use and cover change in urbanization research , and perform case research .
the concrete content are as follows : 1 .
complexity of LUCC research in urbanization process .

analyze urbanization process in combination with the content of complexity science research and the conception of complexity feature to reveal the complexity feature of LUCC research in urbanization process .

urban space system is a complex economic and cultural phenomenon as well as a social process , is the comprehensive characterization of urban society , economy and culture , and is a complex space system formed by society , economy and nature .
it has dissipative structure characteristic , such as opening , dynamic , self-organization , non-balance etc .
traditional model can not simulate these social , economic and natural driving force of LUCC including main feedback relation from LUCC to driving force .
establishment of Markov extended model of LUCC analog research in urbanization process .

firstly , use traditional LUCC research model to compute change speed of regional land use through calculating dynamic degree , exploitation degree and consumption degree of land use ; use the theory of fuzzy set to rewrite the traditional Markov model , establish structure transfer matrix of land use , forecast and analyze dynamic change and development trend of land use , and present noticeable problem and corresponding measure in urbanization process according to research result .
application of intelligent computation research and complexity science research method in LUCC analog model in urbanization process .

on the basis of detailed elaboration of the theory and the model of LUCC research in urbanization process , analyze the problem of existing model used in LUCC research ( namely , difficult to resolve many complexity phenomenon in complex urban space system ) , discuss possible structure realization form of LUCC analog research in combination with the theory of intelligent computation and complexity science research .

perform application analysis on BP artificial neural network and genetic algorithms of intelligent computation and CA model and MAS technology of complexity science research , discuss their theoretical origin and their own characteristic in detail , elaborate the feasibility of them in LUCC analog research , and bring forward improvement method and measure on existing problem of this kind of model .
establishment of LUCC analog model in urbanization process based on theory of intelligent computation and complexity science .

based on the research on abovementioned BP artificial neural network , genetic algorithms , CA model and multi-agent technology , put forward improvement method and application assumption towards their expansion on geography , build LUCC analog model in urbanization process based on CA model and Agent model , realize the combination of learning mechanism of BP artificial neural network and fuzzy logic reasoning , express the regulation with explicit formula , and amend the initial regulation through self study ; optimize network structure of LUCC analog model and method and procedure of model parameter with genetic algorithm .
in this paper , I introduce research theory and method of complexify science into LUCC analog research and present LUCC analog model based upon CA model and MAS theory .

meanwhile , I carry out corresponding expansion on traditional Markov model and introduce the theory of fuzzy set into data screening and parameter amendment of improved model to improve the accuracy and feasibility of Markov model in the research on land use/cover change .
developing methodology of knowledge discovery and data mining to investigate metropolitan land use evolution .
in the urban/territorial planning process , the quality of the evaluation procedure is crucial .

it is necessary to select and implement innovative tool able to handle the huge amount of available data concerning territorial system in order to extract useful information from them to enhance the quality of evaluation procedure for urban/territorial planning .

this paper selects some tool derived from Artificial Intelligence , and incorporated GIS through the elaboration of various type of available data , to extract and build knowledge directly from experimental data and also to represent the extracted knowledge very effectively and communicatively , in the form of set of spatial transformation rule .

it describes the structure of the data mining tool which are most suitable for application in the field of urban planning , aimed at discovering the transformation rule driving the evolution of city in special of metropolitan in analysis .
achieving high irrigation efficiency in public garden : A case study from the RBG Melbourne , Melbourne , Australia .
the development of a centrally controlled Automatic Irrigation System ( AIS ) from the case study the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne ( RBG Melbourne ) is discussed .
the RBG Melbourne covers about 35 hectare and is characterized by mature tree , broad expanse of lawn and detailed garden bed .
ais supply water to about 15 ha and 11 ha of garden-a total of 26 ha .
the interception of the sprinkler stream by foliage , branch , and trunk of plant has a pernicious effect on irrigation uniformity .
citywide Traffic Volume Estimation Using Trajectory Data .
traffic volume estimation at the city scale is an important problem useful to many transportation operation and urban application .
this paper proposes a hybrid framework that integrates both state-of-art machine learning technique and well-established traffic flow theory to estimate citywide traffic volume .

in addition to typical urban context feature extracted from multiple source , we extract a special set of feature from GPS trajectory based on the implication of traffic flow theory , which provide extra information on the speed-flow relationship .
using the network-wide speed information estimated from a travel speed estimation model , a volume related high level feature is first learned using an unsupervised graphical model .
a volume re-interpretation model is then introduced to map the volume related high level feature to the predicted volume using a small amount of ground truth data for training .
the framework is evaluated using a GPS trajectory dataset from 33,000 Beijing taxis and volume ground truth data obtained from 4,980 video clip .
the result demonstrate effectiveness and potential of the proposed framework in citywide traffic volume estimation .
nested logit model and artificial neural network for predicting household automobile choice : Comparison of performance .
over the past few year , machine-learning technique have expanded enormously .
these approach are increasingly being applied to traffic and transportation problem formerly reserved for formal statistical approach such as discrete choice model .

part of the reason for this has to do with research trend , but there are some potential advantage associated with such technique , including the ability to model nonlinear system ; the ease with which symbolic , nominal , or categorical variable can be included ; and the ability of these method to deal with noisy data .

the use of two modeling technique , the nested logit model and the multilayer perceptron artificial neural network , was investigated in term of their applicability to the household vehicle choice problem .
both method generated strong result , although the multilayer perceptron artificial neural network yielded better predictive potential .
pso-elm : A Hybrid Learning Model for Short-Term Traffic Flow Forecasting .

accurate and reliable traffic flow forecasting is of importance for urban planning and mitigation of traffic congestion , and it is also the basis for the deployment of intelligent traffic management system .
however , constructing a reasonable and robust forecasting model is a challenging task due to the uncertainty and nonlinear characteristic of traffic flow .

aiming at the nonlinear relationship affecting traffic flow forecasting effect , a PSO-ELM model based on particle swarm optimization is proposed for short-term traffic flow forecasting , which takes the advantage of particle swarm optimization to search global optimal solution and extreme learning machine to fast deal with the nonlinear relationship .
the proposed model improves the accuracy of traffic flow forecasting .
the traffic flow data from highway A1 , A2 , A4 , A8 connecting to Amsterdam 's ring road are employed for the case study .
the RMSEs of PSO-ELM model are respectively 252.61 , 173.75 , 200.24 , 146.05 , while the MAPEs of PSO-ELM model are respectively 11.86 % , 10.10 % , 10.74 % , 11.60 % .
the experimental result show that the performance of the proposal is significantly better than the performance of state-of-the-art model .
hierarchical multi-agent control of traffic light based on collective learning .
increasing traffic congestion poses significant challenge for urban planning and management in metropolitan area around the world .
one way to tackle the problem is to resort to the emerging technology in artificial intelligence .
traffic light control is one of the most traditional and important instrument for urban traffic management .
the present study proposes a traffic light control system enabled by a hierarchical multi-agent modeling framework in a decentralized manner .
in the framework , a traffic network is decomposed into region represented by region agent .
each region consists of intersection , modeled by intersection agent who coordinate with neighboring intersection agent through communication .
for each intersection , a collection of turning movement agent operate individually and implement optimal action according to local control policy .

by employing a reinforcement learning algorithm for each turning movement agent , the intersection controller are enabled with the capability to make their timing decision in a complex and dynamic environment .
in addition , the traffic light control operates with an advanced phase composition process dynamically combining compatible turning movement .
moreover , the collective operation performed by the agent in a road network are further coordinated by varying priority setting for relevant turning movement .
a case study was carried out by simulation to evaluate the performance of the proposed control system while comparing it with an optimized vehicle-actuated control system .

the result show that the proposed traffic light system , after a collective machine learning process , not only improves the local signal operation at individual intersection but also enhances the traffic performance at the regional level through coordination of specific turning movement .
identification of low-carbon travel block based on GIS hotspot analysis using spatial distribution learning algorithm .
in the future , big data will become an efficient and useful mean for improving urban planning , and machine learning can take city as a simplified and efficient system .
we take full advantage of the benefit of new technology , but also clarify that city is not a machine , also can not fully mechanically control the urban development .
this study presents a methodology for identifying low-carbon travel block , which can be used to identify the built environment conducive to resident ’ low-carbon travel .
we chose the four element of traffic survey—travel mode , travel time , travel purpose and travel frequency—as the framework to evaluate travel carbon emission .

using the index data collected from “ WeChat , ” a popular social-media platform in China and questionnaire survey , we conducted hotspot analysis of the spatial distribution of travel carbon emission in GIS .
we obtained a comprehensive carbon emission and its spatial distribution through the superposition of hotspot density surface of different indexe .
the result show that E block within the research area has the lowest travel carbon emission .

these result suggest some planning implication from three aspects—land use mode , road network and public service facility : In the old urban district of Pucheng , the ratio of residential building area and other type ’ building area should be “ 4:1–3:1 ” ; and we should develop the travel model of bicycle , and the interval of bicycle Lane should be 350–450 m ; The ratio of walking road to total road area should be 15–20 % , and the width of road should be restricted .

coverage of transit site buffered for the radius of 150 m is 40–50 % , coverage of shopping service buffered for the radius of 50 m is 45–60 % , and coverage of recreational facility buffered for the radius of 100 m is 50–70 % .
the result confirm that “ functional mixing ” and “ dense road network ” are beneficial to resident ’ low-carbon travel proposed by the predecessor .
at the same time , we found that not the higher volume rate is , the more favorable for low-carbon travel .
small city have limited number of population and scattered distribution of professional post , which are not suitable for the traditional mode of improving the volume ratio and the bus system .

it is not that the higher the bus station coverage is , the better for resident to travel as low-carbon , and the high popularity of public transportation in small city will increase the carbon emission of resident .
the study provides a new way to evaluate the carbon emission assessment of block and provides a basis for block planning with low-carbon concept .
urban traffic flow analysis based on deep learning car detection from cctv image series .
traffic flow analysis is fundamental for urban planning and management of road traffic infrastructure .
automatic number plate recognition ( ANPR ) system are conventional method for vehicle detection and travel time estimation .
however , such system are specifically focused on car plate , providing a limited extent of road user .

the advance of open-source deep learning convolutional neural network ( CNN ) in combination with freely-available closed-circuit television ( CCTV ) dataset have offered the opportunity for detection and classification of various road user .

the research , presented here , aims to analyse traffic flow pattern through fine-tuning pre-trained CNN model on domain-specific low quality imagery , as captured in various weather condition and season of the year 2018 .
such imagery is collected from the North East Combined Authority ( NECA ) Travel and Transport Data , Newcastle upon Tyne , UK .

result show that the fine-tuned MobileNet model with 98.2 % precision , 58.5 % recall and 73.4 % harmonic mean could potentially be used for a real time traffic monitoring application with big data , due to its fast performance .

compared to MobileNet , the fine-tuned Faster region proposal R-CNN model , providing a better harmonic mean ( 80.4 % ) , recall ( 68.8 % ) and more accurate estimation of car unit , could be used for traffic analysis application that demand higher accuracy than speed .
this research ultimately exploits machine learning alogrithms for a wider understanding of traffic congestion and disruption under social event and extreme weather condition .
inferring Pedestrian Motion at Urban Crosswalks .
robust prediction of pedestrian behavior is one of the most challenging problem for autonomous driving .
particularly , predicting pedestrian crossing at crosswalk is of considerable importance for avoiding accident on the one hand and not unnecessarily slowing down traffic on the other hand .
traditional model-based motion tracking and prediction approach have difficulty in capturing abrupt change in motion , as human can perform them .
in this paper , an approach for predicting pedestrian motion that combine established motion tracking algorithm with data-driven method is presented .
the approach is built upon a hierarchical structure , where first , the intent of each pedestrian is classified .
then , the approach computes several qualitative metric , such as time-to-cross , for the pedestrian classified as crossing .
the approach is evaluated on a challenging urban data set collected for different type of crosswalk such as roundabout and straight Road .
the evaluation also provides a thorough analysis of the generalization performance of the proposed approach .
safe reinforcement learning with scene decomposition for navigating complex urban environment .
navigating urban environment represents a complex task for automated vehicle .
they must reach their goal safely and efficiently while considering a multitude of traffic participant .
we propose a modular decision making algorithm to autonomously navigate intersection , addressing challenge of existing rule-based and reinforcement learning ( RL ) approach .
we first present a safe RL algorithm relying on a model-checker to ensure safety guarantee .
to make the decision strategy robust to perception error and occlusion , we introduce a belief update technique using a learning based approach .
finally , we use a scene decomposition approach to scale our algorithm to environment with multiple traffic participant .
we empirically demonstrate that our algorithm outperform rule-based method and reinforcement learning technique on a complex intersection scenario .
smart mobile crowdsensing with urban vehicle : A deep reinforcement learning perspective .
mobile crowdsensing ( MCS ) is a promising sensing paradigm based on the mobile node which provides the solution with cost-effectiveness to perform urban data collection .
to monitor the urban environment and facilitate the municipal administration , more and more application adopt vehicle as participant to carry out MCS task .
the performance of the application highly depends on the sensing data which is influenced by the recruiting strategy on vehicle .
in this paper , we propose a novel vehicle selection algorithm to maximize the sensing range with limited cost while the vehicle selection problem was proved to be NP-complete .

specifically , we modeled the interaction between MCS server and candidate vehicle as a Markov decision process and formulated the maximum spatial temporal coverage ( STC ) optimization as a deep reinforcement learning process .
the performance of our deep reinforcement learning-based vehicle selection ( i.e.
, DRLVS ) algorithm is evaluated with real trajectory dataset .
the numerical result indicates that the proposed algorithm achieves an optimal solution and maximizes the STC .
a comparison of machine learning method for the prediction of traffic speed in Urban Place .

rising interest in the field of Intelligent Transportation Systems combined with the increased availability of collected data allows the study of different method for prevention of traffic congestion in city .
a common need in all of these method is the use of traffic prediction for supporting planning and operation of the traffic light and traffic management scheme .

this paper focuses on comparing the forecasting effectiveness of three machine learning model , namely Random Forest , Support Vector Regression , and Multilayer Perceptron-in addition to Multiple Linear Regression-using probe data collected from the road network of Thessaloniki , Greece .
the comparison was conducted with multiple test clustered in three type of scenario .
the first scenario tests the algorithms on specific randomly selected date on different randomly selected Road .
the second scenario tests the algorithms on randomly selected Road over eight consecutive 15 min interval ; the third scenario tests the algorithms on random Road for the duration of a whole day .

the experimental result show that while the Support Vector Regression model perform best at stable condition with minor variation , the Multilayer Perceptron model adapt better to circumstance with greater variation , in addition to having the most near-zero error .
joint prediction of road-Traffic and parking occupancy over a city with representation learning .

as journey planning service begins to include real time traffic forecast feature in order to compute more accurate routing along the journey , adaptive traffic control system can also benefit from this prediction so as to minimize traffic congestion .

but these two system dedicated to end user and road traffic management authority could also benefit from other information , and particularly from parking availability prediction since cruising for parking spot represents a significant part of urban traffic : When looking for a parking , driver must guess where to go , and if they are wrong , may face long distance to find the next location , resulting in considerable time loss and a worsening of traffic congestion .
we focus on the simultaneous prediction of traffic and parking availability .

our approach relay on machine learning technique and more precisely on representation learning method : Each road and car-park is represented by a vector in a common large dimensional space which captures both structural and dynamical information about the observed phenomenon .
such a model is thus able to jointly capture the spatio-Temporal correlation between parking and traffic resulting in a high performance prediction system .
the result of our experiment on the Grand Lyon ( France ) urban area show the effectiveness of our approach compared to state of the art method .
trajectory clustering of road traffic in urban environment using incremental machine learning in combination with hyperdimensional computing .
road traffic congestion in urban environment poses an increasingly complex challenge of detection , profiling and prediction .

although public policy promote transport alternative and new infrastructure , traffic congestion is highly prevalent and continues to be the lead cause for numerous social , economic and environmental issue .
although a significant volume of research has been reported on road traffic prediction , profiling of traffic has received much less attention .

in this paper we address two key problem in traffic profiling by proposing a novel unsupervised incremental learning approach for road traffic congestion detection and profiling , dynamically over time .

this approach uses ( a ) hyperdimensional computing to enable capture variable-length trajectory of commuter trip represented as vehicular movement across intersection , and ( b ) transforms these into feature vector that can be incrementally learned over time by the Incremental Knowledge Acquiring Self-Learning ( IKASL ) algorithm .

the proposed approach was tested and evaluated on a dataset consisting of approximately 190 million vehicular movement record obtained from 1,400 Bluetooth identifier placed at the intersection of the arterial road network in the State of Victoria , Australia .
toward Transportation Mode Recognition Using Deep Convolutional and Long Short-Term Memory Recurrent Neural Networks .
with the rapid development of mobile Internet technique , using the sensor-rich smartphone to sense various contexts attract much attention , such as transportation mode recognition .
the transportation mode information can help to improve urban planning , traffic management and journey planning .

though much work has been done on the transportation mode recognition using classic machine learning algorithms , the performance of these method is not reasonable and heavily relie on the effectiveness of handcrafted feature .

in this paper , we leverage the strong representation ability of deep learning method and present a deep-learning-based algorithm for transportation mode recognition , namely CL-TRANSMODE , which is capable of accurately detecting multiple transportation mode .
the algorithm first uses a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to learn appropriate and robust feature representation for transportation mode recognition .
then , an LSTM network performs a further learning of the temporal dependency characteristic on the feature vector of CNN output .
to further enhance the accuracy of transportation mode recognition , several artificial segment and peak feature are extracted from the raw sensor measurement .
these feature characterize the transportation modes over a much long period of time ( minute or hour ) .
by combining the CNN-extracted feature and handcrafted feature , our proposed CL-TRANSMODE transportation mode recognition algorithm can accurately differentiate eight transportation mode , i.e.
, walking , running , bicycling , driving a car , riding a bus , taking a metro , taking a train , or being stationary .

extensive experiment on both the SHL and HTC dataset demonstrate that use our proposed CL-TRANSMODE transportation mode recognition algorithm which outperforms the state-of-the-art comparative algorithms .
on the SHL dataset , which contain barometric data , the accuracy using the CL-TRANSMODE algorithm can reaches 98.1 % .
attention based stack resnet for citywide traffic accident prediction .
the fine-grained citywide traffic accident prediction is of great significance for urban traffic management .
existing approach mainly apply classic machine learning method based on historical accident record .
thus they failed to involve the cross-domain data , which contains spatial and temporal dependency .

recently , with more cross-domain urban data available , leveraging the cross-domain data by deep learning algorithms to predict fine-grained accident becomes possible , we propose an attention based ResNet framework to model the sophisticated correlation between urban data .
deep neural network dynamic traffic routing system for vehicle .

traffic grid have always suffered from a lack of dynamic routing and path planning algorithms and relied only on static characteristic of the Road like the number of Lane , distance and speed limit to avoid and resolve traffic congestion , by routing traffic to a lighter traffic path .

however , with the increased number of vehicle in urban area these algorithm may have reached their limitation due to the huge increase in the state space in a limited computing power and memory environment .

in this research we will introduce a dynamic routing system for traffic in intersection based on real-time traffic condition such as individual vehicle speed , destination and traffic light status to provide the fasted path between a source and a target point .
this system will exploit the recent advancement in the field of machine learning by leveraging the power of deep learning especially deep convolutional neural network .
simulation shows that the proposed model result in a path that are generally fast and avoid frequent red light stop .
intelligent driver assist system for urban driving .
driving in an urban environment is hectic and often adventurous .

getting accurate routing instruction , finding parking spot , receiving customized information that helps individual driver reach their destination will significantly reduce the stress of driving , save fuel and reduce unnecessary delay and pollution level .

in this paper we present a system that combines smart navigation with intelligent parking assist and driver diagnostic to considerably improve driving comfort , safety and mobility in an urban environment .
the smart navigation employs an on line traffic simulator which provides traffic prediction and improves the accuracy of existing navigation system which rely on limited traffic data .
the intelligent parking assist system predicts the availability of parking at the start of the journey and these prediction get updated as the destination is approached .
the system uses machine learning to understand the habit and preference of the individual driver so that the preferred parking availability information is presented to the driver .
the driver diagnostic part learns the driving characteristic of the driver i.e .
whether aggressive , semi aggressive or passive , reaction time , following distance etc .
and provides this information to the smart navigation and parking assist system for better estimation of travel time .
in addition , it can be used to support collision warning and other driver assist device .
the proposed system has been successfully demonstrated using an AUDI vehicle in the area of Los Angeles and San Francisco .
dynamic spatial-temporal feature optimization with ERI big data for Short-term traffic flow prediction .
accurate short-term traffic flow prediction is an important basis of intelligent transportation system ( ITS ) such as transportation operation and urban planning application .

however , due to the lack of complete directly measured data on urban traffic flow , existing study can not adequately mine the dynamic spatial-temporal correlation characterizing traffic flow in urban road network .
electronic registration identification ( ERI ) , which is an emerging technology for uniquely identifying a vehicle , can help collect the travel record of all vehicle .
this inspires us to employ ERI big data for traffic flow prediction .

in this paper , we propose a dynamic spatial-temporal feature optimization method with ERI big data for short-term traffic flow prediction based on a gradient–boosted regression tree , called DSTO-GBRT .
firstly , the framework of DSTO-GBRT is built .
secondly , we analyze the dynamic spatial-temporal correlation among the current prediction point and upstream correlative point using the Pearson correlation coefficient ( PCC ) .
thirdly , to eliminate the linear correlation among feature , we exploit principal component analysis ( PCA ) to optimize the original training data and obtain optimized training data .
in the experiment , real-world ERI big data from Chongqing are employed for the proposed DSTO-GBRT method .
compared with ST-GBRT , ARIMA , DSTO-BPNN and DSTO-SVM , the result demonstrate that DSTO-GBRT can provide timely and adaptive prediction even in rush hour , when traffic condition change rapidly .
furthermore , compared with DSO-GBRT and DTO-GBRT , the result show that the proposed DSTO-GBRT method is more accurate .
knowledge-based learning for solving vehicle routing problem .

in this study , we have developed a method that applies machine learning in combination with an optimization heuristic algorithm such as a genetic algorithm ( GA ) for solving the vehicle routing problem ( VRP ) .
further , we developed a knowledge-based algorithm for a knowledge learning system .
the algorithm learns to classify coordinate ( unlabeled ) into region .

consequently , dividing routing calculation into region ( cluster ) provides many benefit over traditional method , and can result in an improvement in routing cost over the traditional company method by up to 25.68 % and over the classical GA by up to 8.10 % .
it is also shown that our proposed method can reduce traveling distance compared to previous method .
finally , the prediction of future customer region has an accuracy of up to 0.72 for the predicted unlabeled customer coordinate .
this study can contribute toward creation of more efficient and environmentally friendly urban freight transportation system .
inference of vehicular traffic in smart city using machine learning with the internet of thing .

a rapidly increasing world population is not only directly related with increased urban mobility but also traffic delay , loss in fuel , air and noise pollution as well as physiological and psychological problem in the population .
traffic control has been shown to be a means of maintaining road serviceability with a key input being traffic inference .
the harvesting of sufficiently large data set for traffic inference has thus far been a challenge examined by the scientific community .

a modelling , interactive design approach to the harvesting and preprocessing of vehicular data can be used to bridge the gap for traffic control to be autonomously implementable in an urban context .

with this consideration , this paper explores the implementation of an internet of thing multiagent system , in a network and equipped with sensor , distributed along the roadway to collect and share this vehicular data among its node and then process the data using a machine learning algorithm for learning and subsequent inference of vehicular type .

an interactive design approach is used in the creation of a reduced model of knowledge from each node ’ s bulk harvested data , which is then easily stored or deployed and which also facilitates post-processing of data .

considering the smart city as a product , the interactive approach to product engineering permits the implementation of these mathematical model as part of an interactive traffic control system , to ensure the city ’ s adaptability to the ever-changing need of its inhabitant .
in this paper , we present the analysis of the trivial case of the detection of presence and absence of a class A type vehicle .
in the introductory section , we examine the problem of transportation in urban expansion .
in section two , we examine the solution provided by the Smart Cities with respect to transport service .
further problem which appear within these transport service and their respective solution in machine learning and the internet of thing are discussed in this section on these disruptive technology .
section three examines the bibliography for success achieved with similar research and also demonstrates the basis for classification by support vector machine .

section four to six explain how the experiment is set up to test the hypothesis that over 99 % accuracy in vehicular detection can be achieved with the proposed system when cross-referenced with the actual acoustic , magnetic and video presence and absence of a test vehicle .
people counting with image retrieval using compressed sensing .
the estimation of the number of people present in an image has many application such as intelligent transportation , urban planning and crowd surveillance .
rather than conventional counting by detection or regression/machine-learning method , we propose an image retrieval approach , which uses an image descriptor to estimate the people count .
we review the performance of several image descriptor .
in addition , we propose a straightforward global image descriptor for image retrieval based on compressed sensing theory .

extensive evaluation on existing crowd analysis benchmark dataset demonstrate the effectiveness of our image retrieval-based approach compared to state-of-the-art regression-based people counting method .
utilizing Big Data for Enhancing Passenger Safety in Railway Stations .
in light of the increasing demand and capacity in the railway industry , it is imperative to maintain safety in relation to the complexity of the substantial railway station .
thus , it is important to take note of the time where investment in new technology directed at the safety of the railway enable safety and protection in this area .
novel technological technique such as big data analysis ( BDA ) , data mining or machine learning ( ML ) have been developed and applied in many area such as sale , banking and healthcare .

the development of such method has important benefit within the context of railway safety , however , these new method need to be implemented and developed with consideration of whether these operational model can help to solve the various difficulty that currently exist in the risk analysis of railway station .
moreover , as the adoption of the Internet of thing ( IoT ) grows , it is expected that analytical need for handling data will also increase .

it has been shown that the progression towards automation and applying such innovative new technology such as BDA may be a powerful tool for integration in the future of transportation in general and the railway industry in particular , whereby analytical prediction can aid in the development of safer railway station which have greater potential for ensuring the safety of passenger .
in this paper a Bow Tie ( BT ) framework model has been created to combine BDA into the risk assessment process .
the BDA can be beneficial to the risk assessment , support the decision maker in real time , and reduce human error .
this method can be fully integrated into passenger data and the business model for the railway station .
employing the existing safety record utilizing BDA is expected to mitigate risk , predict hazard , raise safety and security efficiency and reduce the cost .
enhanced urban clustering in VANETs using online machine learning .
clustering in Vehicular Ad-Hoc Networks ( VANETs ) is essential to mitigate different challenge and meet the required quality of communication .
however , most of the available clustering protocol were designed for highway , and thus become unstable in realistic urban environment with many intersection .
in this paper , a Clustering Adaptation Near Intersection ( CANI ) approach is proposed to ensure clustering stability at intersection .
this approach exploits Online Sequential Extreme Learning Machine ( OS-ELM ) to predict the behavior of the vehicle near an intersection and adapt the cluster accordingly .
the main advantage of the developed OS-ELM prediction model is its ability to continuously learn and update in real time .
after being validated , the proposed adaptation approach is included in a highway clustering scheme .
the resultant clustering protocol is compared to other scheme in a realistic urban environment , and shows significant stability and efficiency performance improvement .
optimization and evaluation of the human fall detection system .
fall are the most critical health problem for elderly people , which are often , cause significant injury .

to tackle a serious risk that made by the fall , we develop an automatic wearable fall detection system utilizing two device ( mobile phone and wireless sensor ) based on three axe accelerometer signal .
the goal of this study is to find an effective machine learning method that distinguish fall from activity of daily living ( ADL ) using only a single triaxial accelerometer .

in addition , comparing the performance result for wearable sensor and mobile device data.The proposed model detects the fall by using seven different classifier and the significant performance is demonstrated using accuracy , recall , precision and F-measure .
our model obtained accuracy over 99 % on wearable device data and over 97 % on mobile phone data .
automated planning for urban traffic control : Strategic vehicle routing to respect air quality limitation .
the global growth in urbanisation increases the demand for service including road transport infrastructure , presenting challenge in term of mobility .
these trend are occurring in the context of concern around environmental issue of poor air quality and transport related carbon dioxide emission .
one out of several way to help meet these challenge is in the intelligent routing of road traffic through congested urban area .
our goal is to show the feasibility of using automated planning to perform this routing , taking into account a knowledge of vehicle type , vehicle emission , route map , air quality zone , etc .

specifically focusing on air quality concern , in this paper we investigate the problem where the goal are to minimise overall vehicle delay while utilising network capacity fully , and respecting air quality limit .
we introduce an automated planning approach for the routing of traffic to address these area .
the approach has been evaluated on micro-simulation model that use real-world data supplied by our industrial partner .
result show the feasibility of using AI planning technology to deliver efficient route for vehicle that avoid the breaking of air quality limit , and that balance traffic flow through the network .
traffic Clustering Algorithm of Urban Data Brain Based on a Hybrid-Augmented Architecture of Quantum Annealing and Brain-Inspired Cognitive Computing .
in recent year , the urbanization process has brought modernity while also causing key issue , such as traffic congestion and parking conflict .
therefore , city need a more intelligent `` brain '' to form more intelligent and efficient transportation system .
at present , as a type of machine learning , the traditional clustering algorithm still has limitation .
k-mean algorithm is widely used to solve traffic clustering problem , but it has limitation , such as sensitivity to initial point and poor robustness .

therefore , based on the hybrid architecture of Quantum Annealing ( QA ) and brain-inspired cognitive computing , this study proposes QA and Brain-Inspired Clustering Algorithm ( QABICA ) to solve the problem of urban taxi-stand location .
based on the traffic trajectory data of Xi'an and Chengdu provided by Didi Chuxing , the clustering result of our algorithm and K-mean algorithm are compared .

we find that the average taxi-stand location bias of the final result based on QABICA is smaller than that based on K-means , and the bias of our algorithm can effectively reduce the tradition K-means bias by approximately 42 % , up to approximately 83 % , with higher robustness .
qa algorithm is able to jump out of the local suboptimal solution and approach the global optimum , and brain-inspired cognitive computing provides search feedback and direction .
thus , we will further consider applying our algorithm to analyze urban traffic flow , and solve traffic congestion and other key problem in intelligent transportation .
spatiotemporal Variation of Taxi Demand .
the growth of urban area has made taxi service become increasingly more popular due to its ubiquity and flexibility when compared with , more rigid , public transportation mode .
however , in big city taxi service is still unbalanced , resulting in inefficiency such as long waiting time and excessive vacant trip .
this paper presents an exploratory taxi fleet service analysis and compares two forecast model aimed at predicting the spatiotemporal variation of short-term taxi demand .
for this paper , we used a large sample with more than 1 million trip between 2014 and 2017 , representing roughly 10 % of Lisbon 's fleet .
we analysed the spatiotemporal variation between pick-up and drop-off location and how they are affected by weather condition and point of interest .
more , based on historic data , we built two model to predict the demand , ARIMA and Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) , and evaluated and compared the performance of both model .

this study not only allows the direct comparison of a linear statistical model with a machine learning one , but also leads to a better comprehension of complex interaction surrounding different urban data source using the taxi service as a probe to better understand urban mobility-on-demand and its need .
published by Elsevier B.V .
secure blockchain-based traffic load balancing using edge computing and reinforcement learning .
congestion represents one of the major problem in constantly growing city , and the expansion and modernization of the traffic system are a major priority to all government infrastructure .
in effect , more efficient traffic represents a more efficient economy .

solving the issue of congestion by increasing the number of Road is not always the most cost-effective solution as it represents massive change in city infrastructure that have been present for decade .
urban planning shapes the environment around us but fails to address specifically the future traffic clogging .

our research tackles the problem of traffic congestion by proposing a system for vehicle detection , identification , and count , allied with reinforcement learning for traffic congestion anticipation and prediction .
the need for a real-time and efficient system led us to push the research and development onto an Edge Computing platform using IoT and secure transaction using Hyperledger Fabric blockchain .
blockchain intervene as a security protocol in the proposed system .
the native form of Internet of Things does not include security protocol which are important to a large scale implementation .
ensuring the security of transaction and permanent access control is the main reason why blockchain is rooted in our system architecture .

our project aims to reduce the traffic load on Road experiencing significant congestion , and improve overall city traffic system without costly investment into new communication infrastructure and city planning .
admsv2 : A modern architecture for transportation data management and analysis .
this paper presents ADMSv2 , an end-to-end data-driven system that enables real-time and historical data analytic and machine learning task over big , streaming , spatiotemporal data .

admsv2 employs a unified multi-layered architecture that integrates several open-source framework to collect , store , manage , and analyze a variety of data source , including massive traffic sensor data , bus trajectory data , transportation network data , and traffic incident data .
admsv2 enables numerous application in intelligent transportation , urban planning , public policy , and emergency response , all of which are critical for city resilience .

here , we demonstrate three application scenario running on top of ADMSv2 to showcase the efficiency of its capability of query processing on real-world streaming and historical data as well as real-time data analysis using deep learning for traffic forecasting .
data-driven next destination prediction and ETA improvement for urban delivery fleet .

in an urban logistic system , prediction of the next destination and estimated time of arrival ( ETA ) are of paramount importance for efficient resource planning of delivery fleet and for providing a satisfactory client experience .
the quality of prediction is limited by the information accessible to individual logistic business entity , and further complicated by the complex urban road system .
data collection under the auspice of smart city initiative worldwide provides exciting new opportunity to overcome these limitation .

in this study , the author identify two area of improvement through data-driven approach , including a next destination predictor , based on the delivery fleet 's historical global positioning system trajectory data using a non-linear autoregressive neural network , and a road incident detector for real-time ETA improvement .
by comparing a range of machine learning classification algorithms for incident detection , XGBoost has been found to be the most practical choice , due to its performance and efficiency .

the proposed framework can be utilised by government authority who possess such data for better urban planning and providing advanced infrastructure , so as to improve the operational efficiency of the logistic industry .
a Survey of Recent Advances in Crowd Density Estimation using Image Processing .
crowd analysis is an essential topic of research in artificial intelligence .
there are several application on crowd analysis , such as , environmental management , urban planning and public safety .
this paper presents review of different methodology those have been implemented for estimating crowd .
this paper covers several method of crowd density estimation , such as , image processing technique , machine learning and deep learning based technique , and smartphone based technique .
a user monitoring road traffic information collection using sumo and scheme for road surveillance with deep mind analytic and human behavior tracking .
road congestion and huge traffic on roads has become a big problem in many urban area .
investment on planning and processing of traffic information should help to minimize congestion and pollution .
so here we propose a way to design our own road network as required to reduce traffic using a tool called Sumo .
inorder to find the efficiency of that network , a WSN based framework is designed for the same and various routing scheme are applied on it .
a fuzzy logic-based traffic light control system and QOS parameter handling system is designed by extracting data available by routing scheme applied .
inorder to make the Road safer artificial intelligence-based security camera hoping to achieve automated recognition of people and event is planned .
digital brain map the eye to analyze live video and helping responder to more easily find crime and accident on Road .
machine learning is employed to get considerable gain in its ability to identify object , the skill of analyzing scene , activity , and movement .
simulation have shown good performance for the proposed routing scheme and fuzzy controller designed show good result to the urban traffic network .
optimization and simulation of regional traffic control in mixed traffic condition .

this paper analyzes feature of mixed traffic flow based on the traffic condition of China first , then it applies artificial intelligence ( AI ) and knowledge project in traffic light control to optimize the regional traffic control system and realize traffic control intelligence .
it breaks the limitation of considering only motor vehicle , and take into account pedestrian , bicycle as well .
this paper conducts simulation with VISSIM to evaluate the effect of traffic control system .
then a systematic PI can be constructed to reflect the integrative performance of the whole traffic control system .
research on the big data of traditional taxi and online car-hailing : A systematic review .

the purpose of this paper is to provide a summary of a quick overview of the latest development and unprecedented opportunity for scholar who want to set foot in the field of traditional taxi and online car-hailing ( TTOC ) .
from the perspective of people ( e.g.

, passenger , driver , and policymaker ) , vehicle , road , and environment , this paper describes the current research status of TTOC 's big data in six hot topic , including the ridership factor , spatio-temporal distribution and travel behavior , cruising strategy and passenger service market partition , route planning , transportation emission and new-energy , and TTOC 's data extensional application .

these topic were included in five mainstream as follows : ( 1 ) abundant study often focus only on determinant analysis on given transportation ( taxi , transit , online car-hailing ) ; the exploration of ridership pattern for a multi-modal transportation mode is rare ; furthermore , multiple aspect of factor were not considered synchronously in a wide time span ; ( 2 ) travel behavior research mainly concentrates on the commuting trip and distribution pattern of various travel indice ( e.g.

, distance , displacement , time ) ; ( 3 ) the taxi driver-searching strategy can be divided into autopsychic cruising and system dispatching ; ( 4 ) the spatio-temporal distribution character of TTOC 's fuel consumption ( FC ) and greenhouse gas ( GHG ) emissions has become a hotspot recently , and there has been a recommendation for electric taxi ( ET ) in urban city to decrease transportation congestion is proposed ; and ( 5 ) based on TTOC and point of interest ( POI ) multi-source data , many machine learning algorithm were used to predict travel condition indice , land use , and travel behavior .
then , the main bottleneck and research direction that can be explored in the future are discussed .
we hope this result can provide an overview of current fundamental aspect of TTOC 's utilization in the urban area .
development of people mass movement simulation framework based on reinforcement learning .
understanding individual and crowd dynamic in urban environment is critical for numerous application , such as urban planning , traffic forecasting , and location-based service .
however , researcher have developed travel demand model to accomplish this task with survey data that are expensive and acquired at low frequency .

in contrast , emerging data collection method have enabled researcher to leverage machine learning technique with a tremendous amount of mobility data for analyzing and forecasting people 's behavior .
in this study , we developed a reinforcement learning-based approach for modeling and simulation of people mass movement using the global positioning system ( GPS ) data .

unlike traditional travel demand modeling approach , our method focuses on the problem of inferring the spatio-temporal preference of individual from the observed trajectory , and is based on inverse reinforcement learning ( IRL ) technique .

we applied the model to the data collected from a smartphone application and attempted to replicate a large amount of the population 's daily movement by incorporating with agent-based multi-modal traffic simulation technology .
the simulation result indicate that agent can successfully learn and generate human-like travel activity .
furthermore , the proposed model performance significantly outperforms the existing method in synthetic urban dynamic .
taxi Demand Prediction using an LSTM-Based Deep Sequence Model and Point of Interest .
nowaday , urban mobility plays an important role in modern city for city planning , navigation , and other mobility service .
taxicab are vital public service in large city that are taken by passenger thousand of time every day .

reducing the number of vacant vehicle on the Street will help service provider to raise driver ' income , reduce energy consumption , optimize traffic efficiency , and control air pollution problem in large city .
since driver do not have enough information about the location of passenger and other taxis , most of them might drive to the same area .
due to the lack of passenger information , they often end up without picking up any passenger while there are highly demanded area in their neighborhood .

to address these issue , machine learning technique can be applied to analyze mobility data acquired from the IoT sensor and help companie to organize the taxi fleet or minimize the wait-time for both passenger and driver in the city .
in this paper , an LSTM-based deep sequence learning model is applied to forecast taxi-demand in a particular urban area in a smart city .
for this purpose , point of interest ( POIs ) in the city are extracted from Google Maps and integrated with the mobility data source .

given a real-world dataset and two evaluation metric , we observed that taxi-demand in each urban area can be influenced by external factor such as neighborhood location and the POIs located in that area .

the result show that the proposed method outperforms the vanilla LSTM model and has less average error than baseline method in term of the Mean Squared Error ( MSE ) and Symmetric Mean Absolute Percentage Error ( SMAPE ) .
robust anomaly detection in urban environment using sensor and information fusion and a camera network .
the paper presents a method for detection of abnormal behavior related to violent event in urban environment .
we have further developed a person detection method and introduced a person tracker as an intermediate stage between person detection and anomaly detection .
the method is presented together with result from evaluation based on real sensor data that have been recorded in a realistic urban environment .
several scenario have been recorded such as normal situation , a person loitering , a person shooting and people escaping from sudden smoke development .
the method uses sensor data from a static video surveillance system , consisting of two visual and two thermal infrared camera .
the person detection method combine foreground segmentation with a trained machine learning algorithm which is based on boosting .
the tracker associates incoming detection to object ( i.e .
people ) , and generates track of world coordinate and velocity of object .
the anomaly detection method , which is based on the hidden Markov model ( HMM ) , fuses information that is derived from the tracker .
the information contains a number of person , their position and velocity .

the result indicate that the person detection method in combination with the tracker can produce robust and accurate observation to the HMM , which in turn provide good condition for accurate anomaly detection .
road traffic safety management strategy for the Western Cape Province .
in 2004 , the Western Cape Department of Community Safety decided to revise the existing traffic safety strategy for the Western Cape Province .

existing strategy and practice within the traditional road traffic safety portfolio were identified , and recommendation for improvement were made in order to maximise the impact of these practice on road traffic safety .

there was also a need to draw in role player outside the traditional safety sphere to commit time and fund towards the improvement of road traffic safety in the Province The methodology followed to develop the strategy consisted of a review of relevant documentation , an assessment of information system and collection of data , interview and discussion with role player on provincial , metropolitan and local level within all related discipline .

the development of a Road Traffic Safety Management Strategy required a comprehensive analysis of the current road traffic safety situation in the Western Cape , as well as an assessment of the current approach to provincial management .

the vision of the Western Cape Traffic Safety Management Strategy `` A Safer Road Environment for AI '' embraces the provincial vision for `` A Home for AII '' , and the vision adopted by the Department of Community Safety , which is `` A Safer Home For AII '' .
the Strategy furthermore embraces the concept of Holistic Governance , with its pillar of Integrated , Co-operative and Responsive Governance .
specific thematic issue emanating from the analysis are addressed in the Strategy .
they are : law enforcement ; education and communication ; engineering and land development ; public transport ; and health and emergency service .
operational objective at regional level are defined .
the role of Regional Centres and the Partnership Manager to be appointed at each Regional Centre are defined .
a Performance Management system with clearly defined Key Result Areas for each official is recommended .
