smart Urban Mobility : When Mobility Systems Meet Smart Data .
city around the world are expanding dramatically , with urban population growth reaching nearly 2.5 billion people in urban area and road traffic growth exceeding 1.2 billion car by 2050 .
the economic contribution of the transport sector represents 5 & # x0025 ; of the GDP in Europe and costs an average of US & # x0024 ; 482.05 billion in the United States .
these figure indicate the rapid rise of industrial city and the urgent need to move from traditional city to smart city .

this article provides a survey of different approach and technology such as intelligent transportation system ( ITS ) that leverage communication technology to help maintain road user safe while driving , as well as support autonomous mobility through the optimization of control system .
the role of ITS is strengthened when combined with accurate artificial intelligence model that are built to optimize urban planning , analyze crowd behavior and predict traffic condition .
ai-driven ITS is becoming possible thank to the existence of a large volume of mobility data generated by billion of user through their use of new technology and online social media .
the optimization of urban planning enhance vehicle routing capability and solve traffic congestion problem , as discussed in this paper .
from an ecological perspective , we discuss the measure and incentive provided to foster the use of mobility system .

we also underline the role of the political will in promoting open data in the transport sector , considered as an essential ingredient for developing technological solution necessary for city to become healthier and more sustainable .
ieee
deepcrowd : A Deep Model for Large-Scale Citywide Crowd Density and Flow Prediction .
predicting the density and flow of the crowd or traffic at a citywide level become possible by using the big data and cutting-edge AI technology .
it has been a very significant research topic with high social impact , which can be widely applied to emergency management , traffic regulation , and urban planning .

in particular , by meshing a large urban area to a number of fine-grained mesh-grid , citywide crowd and traffic information in a continuous time period can be represented with 4D tensor ( Timestep , Height , Width , Channel ) .
based on this idea , a series of method have been proposed to address grid-based prediction for citywide crowd and traffic .
in this study , we revisit the density and in-out flow prediction problem and publish a new aggregated human mobility dataset generated from a real-world smartphone application .
comparing with the existing one , our dataset holds several advantage including large mesh-grid number , fine-grained mesh size , and high user sample .

toward this large-scale crowd dataset , we propose a novel deep learning model called DeepCrowd by designing pyramid architecture and high-dimensional attention mechanism based on Convolutional LSTM .
lastly , thorough and comprehensive performance evaluation are conducted to demonstrate the superiority of the proposed DeepCrowd comparing to multiple state-of-the-art method .
ieee
evaluating the Performance of Reinforcement Learning Signalling Strategies for Sustainable Urban Road Networks .
smart Cities promise to their resident , quick journeys in a clean and sustainable environment .
despite , the benefit accrued by the introduction of traffic management solution ( e.g .
improved travel time , maximisation of throughput , etc . )
, these solution usually fall short on ensuring the environmental sustainability around the implementation area .
this is because the environmental dimension ( e.g .
vehicle emission ) is usually absent from the optimisation methodology adopted for traffic management strategy .
nonetheless , since environmental performance correspond as a primary goal of contemporary mobility planning , solution that can guarantee air quality are significant .
this study presents an advanced Artificial Intelligence-based ( AI ) signal control framework , able to incorporate environmental consideration into the core of signal optimisation process .

more specifically , a highly flexible Reinforcement Learning ( RL ) algorithm has been developed in order to identify efficient but -more importantly- environmentally friendly signal control strategy .
the methodology is deployed on a large-scale micro-simulation environment able to realistically represent urban traffic condition .
alternative signal control strategy are designed , applied , and evaluated against their achieved traffic efficiency and environmental footprint .

based on the result obtained from the application of the methodology on a core part of the road urban network of Nicosia , Cyprus the best strategy achieved a 4.8 % increase of the network throughput , 17.7 % decrease of the average queue length and a remarkable 34.2 % decrease of delay while considerably reduced the CO emission by 8.1 % .
the encouraging result showcase ability of RL-based traffic signal controlling to ensure improved air-quality condition for the resident of dense urban area .
an AI-based approach for arterial signal control in heterogeneous traffic .
one of the fundamental way of designing transport infrastructure is to use arterial Road for substantial traffic stream intersected with orthogonal branch .

however , even with state-of-The-Art urban design methodology used in developed countrie , transportation infrastructure in developing countrie often does not keep up with the rapid development of travel demand .
unlike developed countrie , traffic in the developing countrie is heterogeneous , in which different type of vehicle can travel on all Lane .
this paper addresses how to regulate the heterogeneous traffic flow by a light control mechanism without changing the urban road network .
a novel proposed approach uses reinforcement learning for arterial road control .
experimental result show that the proposed control outperforms existing control in all three common network structure of urban design despite only using realtime data available in real-world system .
bistro : Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization .
the current trend toward urbanization and adoption of flexible and innovative mobility technology will have complex and difficult-to-predict effect on urban transportation system .
comprehensive methodological framework that account for the increasingly uncertain future state of the urban mobility landscape do not yet exist .
furthermore , few approach have enabled the massive ingestion of urban data in planning tool capable of offering the flexibility of scenario-based design .

this article introduces Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization ( BISTRO ) , a new open source transportation planning decision support system that uses an agent-based simulation and optimization approach to anticipate and develop adaptive plan for possible technological disruption and growth scenario .
the new framework was evaluated in the context of a machine learning competition hosted within Uber Technologies , Inc. , in which over 400 engineer and data scientist participated .
for the purpose of this competition , a benchmark model , based on the city of Sioux Falls , South Dakota , was adapted to the BISTRO framework .

an important finding of this study was that in spite of rigorous analysis and testing done prior to the competition , the two top-scoring team discovered an unbounded region of the search space , rendering the solution largely uninterpretable for the purpose of decision-support .
on the other hand , a follow-on study aimed to fix the objective function .

it served to demonstrate BISTRO 's utility as a human-in-the-loop cyberphysical system : one that uses scenario-based optimization algorithms as a feedback mechanism to assist urban planner with iteratively refining objective function and constraint specification on intervention strategy .
the portfolio of transportation intervention strategy alternative eventually chosen achieves high-level regional planning goal developed through participatory stakeholder engagement practice .
pedestrian Walking on Reachable Set and Manifolds .
it is a challenge to find safe trajectory for automated vehicle .
especially in urban environment with pedestrian there exist many different situation .
the prediction of future movement with absolute certainty is impossible if the intention of the pedestrian is unknown .
this paper is intended to offer a new concept of decision-making for motion planning with vulnerable road-user in urban environment .
reachability analysis is used to define spatial area based on physical constraint , where the pedestrian might go .
the approach is physically inspired and it can be proven for all kind of pedestrian .
a new approach to cluster spatial area is introduced to store specific environmental information about the pedestrian .
the maximum value for jerk , acceleration and velocity of the pedestrian are necessary to find reachable area .
object Counting on Low Quality Images : A Case Study of Near Real-Time Traffic Monitoring .
the installation and management of traffic monitoring device can be costly from both a financial and human resource point of view .
it is therefore important to take advantage of available infrastructure to maximize the information extraction for each technology .
here we show how low-quality urban road traffic image from camera , already installed in many city such as Montreal , Vancouver and Toronto can be used as a non-intrusive traffic monitoring .
to this end , we use a pre-trained object detection neural network to count vehicle within image .
we then compare the result with human annotation gathered through crowdsourcing campaign .
we use this comparison to assess performance and calibrate the neural network annotation .
the performance of our system allows us to consider application which can monitor the traffic condition in near real-time , making the counting usable for traffic-related service .

furthermore , the resulting annotation pave the way for building a historical vehicle counting dataset to be used for analysing the impact of road traffic on many city-related issue such as urban planning , security , and pollution .
highway traffic volume prediction via stacking KNN , SVR , MLP , RNN .
highway traffic volume prediction is critical for urban planning and relieving traffic stress .
in recent year , many research have been focusing on it by using machine learning algorithm .
however , different prediction methodology are required for different evaluation metric and the prediction performance of single machine learning model is limited .
in this paper , we present our model which are respectively inspired from KNN , SVR , MLP and RNN , to predict highway traffic volume , aiming at different evaluation metric .
based on the revised model , model stacking is used which can boost predictive accuracy by combining the prediction of multiple machine learning model .
the experiment show that , when the metric are specified , the revised model outperform the traditional one .
moreover , one single model is not always superior to the other and each of them can have encouraging result in certain condition .
by stacking these model , significant improvement can be achieved .

the design of urban geographical information system for transportation .
with the fast development of national economy and society , urban transportation has not been suitable for the current situation .
the traffic jam , traffic accident and environmental pollution are becoming more and more serious .
due to its complexity , the transportation problem can not be solved only through considering the vehicle or road .

therefore , to establish modern intelligent transportation system ( ITS ) by integrating vehicle , road and user with various high-tech such as AI , computer network , information processing , telecommunication , is the important solution .

this paper adopts special information technology to set up Geographical Information System for Transportation , which provide advanced and effective condition and measure for the real-time collection , integration storing , deep knowledge mining , analyze and application of transportation information .
then it can resolve the problem of urban transportation effectively , earthquake etc can be predicted and prevented in some extent .
location , design , and operation of accident investigation site in urban freeway corridor .
in this paper , current recommendation for locating , designing , and operating Accident Investigation Sites ( AISs ) in urban freeway corridor are summarized .
the recommendation are based on ( a ) interview with freeway corridor traffic management team in Texas and ( b ) experience of the author .
the guideline can be summarized as follows : The AIS location must be easily accessible from the freeway .
the most desirable location is within one block of the freeway exit ramp terminal .
local police should be involved in locating and esigning AISs .
an AIS should be paved , illuminated , have a minimum of 1,000 ft2 , and be equipped with some form of telephone communication system .
it is better to install AISs as part of a citywide freeway incident management program involving traffic engineer and law enforcement personnel .
beyond Word2vec : An approach for urban functional region extraction and identification by combining Place2vec and POIs .
the actual function of a region may not reflect the intent of the original zoning scheme from planner .
to identify the actual urban functional region , numerous method have been proposed with computational advancement .
specifically , remote sensing by image recognition , geodemographic classification , social sensing with big data and geo-text mining technique have been widely applied .
points-of-interest ( POIs ) are one of the most common open-access data type used to extract information pertaining to functional zone .
however , previous work have either lost sight or did not make full use of the spatial interaction that can be extracted from POIs due to model limitation in the context of geographical space .

in this research , we introduced an approach that detects functional region at the scale of a neighborhood area ( NA ) by combining POI data and a simplified Place2vec model , which is theorized from the first law of geography .
first , the POI-based spatial context is constructed by using the nearest neighbor approach .
then , we can increase the number of training tuple ( tcenter , tcontext ) based on the weight derived from the distance between the POI tcenter and POI tcontext .
next , high-dimensional characteristic vector of the POIs are extracted by using the skip-gram training framework .
by summarizing the POI vector at the NA level , we employ a K-means clustering model to cluster the functional region .

compared with other probabilistic topic model ( PTMs ) and Word2vec , the Place2vec-based approach obtained the highest mean reciprocal rank value ( MRR-SWP=0.356 , MRR-SLC=0.401 , MRR-SJC=0.433 , and MRR-SLin=0.421 ) in term of similarity capturing performance and functional region identification accuracy ( OA=0.7424 ) .
the research has important implication to urban planning and governance .
predicting neighborhood ' socioeconomic attribute using restaurant data .

accessing high-resolution timely socioeconomic data such as data on population employment and enterprise activity at the neighborhood level is critical for social scientist and policy maker to design and implement location-based policy .
however in many developing countrie or city reliable local-scale socioeconomic data remain scarce .
here we show an easily accessible and timely updated location attribute-restaurant-can be used to accurately predict a range of socioeconomic attribute of urban neighborhood .
we merge restaurant data from an online platform with 3 microdataset for 9 Chinese city .
using feature extracted from restaurant we train machine-learning model to estimate daytime and nighttime population number of firm and consumption level at various spatial resolution .
the trained model can explain 90 to 95 % of the variation of those attribute across neighborhood in the test dataset .

we analyze the tradeoff between accuracy spatial resolution and number of training sample as well as the heterogeneity of the predicted result across different spatial location demographic and firm industry .
finally we demonstrate the cross-city generality of this method by training the model in one city and then applying it directly to other city .
the transferability of this restaurant model can help bridge data gap between city allowing all city to enjoy big data and algorithm dividend .
quantifying place : Analyzing the driver of pedestrian activity in dense urban environment .
understanding pedestrian behavior is critical for many aspect of city planning , design , and management , including transportation , public health , emergency response , and economic development .

this study bridges in-situ observation of pedestrian activity and urban computing by integrating high-resolution , large-scale , and heterogeneous urban dataset and analyzing both fixed attribute of the urban landscape ( e.g .
physical and transit infrastructure ) with dynamic environmental and socio-psychological factor , such as weather , air quality , and perceived crime risk .

we use local pedestrian count data collected by the New York City ( NYC ) Department of Transportation ( DOT ) and an extensive array of open dataset from NYC to test how pedestrian volume relate to land use , building density , streetscape quality , transportation infrastructure , and other factor typically associated with urban walkability .
we quantify , classify , and analyze place dynamic , including contextual and situational factor that influence pedestrian activity at high spatial–temporal resolution .
the quantification process measures the urban context by extracting rich , yet initially fragmented and siloed , urban data for individual geolocation .

based on these feature , we then construct contextual indicator by selecting and combining feature relevant to pedestrian activity , and develop a typology of place to support the generalizability of our analysis .

finally , we use multivariate regression model with panel-corrected standard error to estimate how specific contextual feature and time-varying situational indicator impact pedestrian activity across time of day , day of the week , season , and year .

the result provide insight into the key driver of local pedestrian activity and highlight the importance accounting for the immediate urban environment and socio-spatial dynamic in pedestrian behavior modeling .
structure of 311 service request as a signature of urban location .
while urban system demonstrate high spatial heterogeneity , many urban planning , economic and political decision heavily rely on a deep understanding of local neighborhood contexts .

we show that the structure of 311 Service Requests enables one possible way of building a unique signature of the local urban context , thus being able to serve as a low-cost decision support tool for urban stakeholder .

considering example of New York City , Boston and Chicago , we demonstrate how 311 Service Request recorded and categorized by type in each neighborhood can be utilized to generate a meaningful classification of location across the city , based on distinctive socioeconomic profile .
moreover , the 311-based classification of urban neighborhood can present sufficient information to model various socioeconomic feature .
finally , we show that these characteristic are capable of predicting future trend in comparative local real estate price .
we demonstrate 311 Service Requests data can be used to monitor and predict socioeconomic performance of urban neighborhood , allowing urban stakeholder to quantify the impact of their intervention .

where to go and what to do : Extracting leisure activity potential from Web data on urban space .
web data is the most prominent source of information for deciding where to go and what to do .
exploiting this source for geographic analysis , however , does not come without difficulty .
first , in recent year , the amount and diversity of available Web information about urban space have exploded , and it is therefore increasingly difficult to overview and exploit .
second , the bulk of information is in an unstructured form which is difficult to process and interpret by computer .

third , semi-structured source , such as Web ranking , geolocated tag , check-in , or mobile sensor data , do not fully reflect the more subtle quality of a place , including the particular function that make it attractive .
in this article , we explore a method to capture leisure activity potential from Web data on urban space using semantic topic model .
we test three supervised multi-label machine learning strategy exploiting geolocated webtexts and place tag to estimate whether a given type of leisure activity is afforded or not .

we train and validate these model on a manually curated dataset labeled with leisure ontology class for the city of Zwolle , and discuss their potential for urban leisure and tourism research and related city policy and planning .
we found that multi-label affordance estimation is not straightforward but can be made to work using both official webtexts and user-generated content on a medium semantic level .
this opens up new opportunity for data-driven approach to urban leisure and tourism study .
a deep learning architecture for semantic address matching .
address matching is a crucial step in geocoding , which plays an important role in urban planning and management .
to date , the unprecedented development of location-based service has generated a large amount of unstructured address data .
traditional address matching method mainly focus on the literal similarity of address record and are therefore not applicable to the unstructured address data .
in this study , we introduce an address matching method based on deep learning to identify the semantic similarity between address record .
first , we train the word2vec model to transform the address record into their corresponding vector representation .
next , we apply the enhanced sequential inference model ( ESIM ) , a deep text-matching model , to make local and global inference to determine if two address match .

to evaluate the accuracy of the proposed method , we fine-tune the model with real-world address data from the Shenzhen Address Database and compare the output with those of several popular address matching method .
the result indicate that the proposed method achieves a higher matching accuracy for unstructured address record , with its precision , recall , and F1 score ( i.e.
, the harmonic mean of precision and recall ) reaching 0.97 on the test set .
reversed urbanism : Inferring urban performance through behavioral pattern in temporal telecom data .
a fundamental aspect of well performing city is successful public space .
for century , understanding these Place has been limited to sporadic observation and laborious data collection .
this study proposes a novel methodology to analyze citywide , discrete urban space using highly accurate anonymized telecom data and machine learning algorithms .
through superposition of human dynamic and urban feature , this work aims to expose clear correlation between the design of the city and the behavioral pattern of its user .

geolocated telecom data , obtained for the state of Andorra , were initially analyzed to identify “ stay-point ” —event in which cellular device remain within a certain roaming distance for a given length of time .
these stay-point were then further analyzed to find cluster of activity characterized in term of their size , persistence , and diversity .

multivariate linear regression model were used to identify association between the formation of these cluster and various urban feature such as urban morphology or land-use within a 25–50 meter resolution .

some of the urban feature that were found to be highly related to the creation of large , diverse and long-lasting cluster were the presence of service and entertainment amenity , natural water feature , and the betweenness centrality of the road network ; other , such as educational and park amenity were shown to have a negative impact .

ultimately , this study suggests a “ reversed urbanism ” methodology : an evidence-based approach to urban design , planning , and decision making , in which human behavioral pattern are instilled as a foundational design tool for inferring the success rate of highly performative urban Place .
a business zone recommender system based on facebook and urban planning data .
we present ZoneRec-a zone recommendation system for physical business in an urban city , which uses both public business data from Facebook and urban planning data .
the system consists of machine learning algorithms that take in a business ’ metadata and outputs a list of recommended zone to establish the business in .
we evaluate our system using data of food business in Singapore and assess the contribution of different feature group to the recommendation quality .
why do people move ?
enhancing human mobility prediction using local function based on public record and SNS data .
the quality of life for people in urban region can be improved by predicting urban human mobility and adjusting urban planning accordingly .

in this study , we compared several possible variable to verify whether a gravity model ( a human mobility prediction model borrowed from Newtonian mechanic ) worked as well in inner-city region as it did in intra-city region .
we reviewed the resident population , the number of employee , and the number of SNS post as variable for generating mass value for an urban traffic gravity model .
we also compared the straight-line distance , travel distance , and the impact of time as possible distance value .
we defined the function of urban region on the basis of public record and SNS data to reflect the diverse social factor in urban region .
in this process , we conducted a dimension reduction method for the public record data and used a machine learning-based clustering algorithm for the SNS data .
in doing so , we found that functional distance could be defined as the Euclidean distance between social function vector in urban region .
finally , we examined whether the functional distance was a variable that had a significant impact on urban human mobility .

automatic identification of the social function of area of interest ( AOIS ) using the standard hour-day-spectrum approach .

the social function of area of interest ( AOIs ) is crucial to the identification of urban functional zoning and land use classification , which has been a hot topic in various Field such as urban planning and smart city Field .

most existing study on urban functional zoning and land use classification either largely rely on low-frequency remote sensing image , which are constrained to the block level due to their spatial scale limitation , or suffer from low accuracy and high uncertainty when using dynamic data , such as social media and traffic data .

this paper proposes an hour-day-spectrum ( HDS ) approach for generating six type of distribution waveform of taxi pick-up and drop-off point which serve as interpretation indicator of the social function of AOIs .
to achieve this goal , we first performed fine-grained cleaning of the drop-off point to eliminate the spatial error caused by taxi driver .
next , buffer and spatial clustering were integrated to explore the association between travel behavior and AOIs .
third , the identification of AOI type was made by using the standard HDS method combined with the k-nearest neighbor ( KNN ) algorithm .
finally , some matching test were carried out by similarity indexe of a standard HDS and sample HDS , i.e.
, the Gaussian kernel function and Pearson coefficient , to ensure matching accuracy .
the experiment was conducted in the Chongchuan and Gangzha Districts , Nantong , Jiangsu Province , China .
by training 50 AOI sample , six type of standard HDS of residential district , school , hospital , and shopping mall were obtained .
then , 108 AOI sample were tested , and the overall accuracy was found to be 90.74 % .
this approach generates value-added service of the taxi trajectory and provides a continuous update and fine-grained supplementary method for the identification of land use type .
in addition , the approach is object-oriented and based on AOIs , and can be combined with image interpretation and other method to improve the identification effect .
the big picture of city : Analysing Flickr photos of 222 city worldwide .
the purpose of the current research is to introduce a new method involving machine learning that can identify and analyse the city image dimension ( CIDs ) of city worldwide .

unlike traditional method , this new method can rapidly identify city image dimension from large set of user-generated photo in an efficient and scalable manner , which could help city manager more effectively plan city branding strategy and city development policy .

label detection with Google Cloud Vision and dimension identification ( or topic extraction ) with latent Dirichlet allocation ( LDA ) modelling were used to analyse 222,000 photo of 222 city worldwide from Flickr.com .
theoretically , this study reinforces the existing literature using Big Data , present alternative way to identify CIDs , and illustrates diversity within the image dimension .
topic modeling to discover the thematic structure and spatial-temporal pattern of building renovation and adaptive reuse in city .
building alteration and redevelopment play a central role in the revitalization of developed city , where the scarcity of available land limits the construction of new building .
the adaptive reuse of existing space reflects the underlying socioeconomic dynamic of the city and can be a leading indicator of economic growth and diversification .
however , the collective understanding of building alteration pattern is constrained by significant barrier to data accessibility and analysis .
we present a data mining and knowledge discovery process for extracting , analyzing , and integrating building permit data for more than 2,500,000 alteration project from seven major U.S. city .

we utilize natural language processing and topic modeling to discover the thematic structure of construction activity from permit description and merge with other urban data to explore the dynamic of urban change .

the knowledge discovery process proceed in three step : ( 1 ) text mining to identify popular word , popularity change , and their co-appearance likelihood ; ( 2 ) topic modeling using latent Dirichlet allocation ( LDA ) ; and ( 3 ) integrating the topic modeling output with building information and ancillary data to discover the spatial , temporal , and thematic pattern of urban redevelopment and regeneration .

the result demonstrate a generalizable approach that can be used to analyze unstructured text data extracted from permit record across varying database structure , permit typology , and local contexts .

our machine learning methodology can assist city to better monitor building alteration activity , analyze spatiotemporal pattern of redevelopment , and more fully understand the economic , social , and environmental implication of change to the urban built environment .
identifying the Structure of Citie by Clustering Using a New Similarity Measure Based on Smart Card Data .
identifying the structure of city has long been studied in urban planning and traffic modeling .
this study presents a reliable method that reveals the structure of city mainly based on clustering analysis using a new similarity measure .

several previous study have used well-known clustering algorithms in machine learning Field , such as k-mean clustering based on temporal mobility pattern of region , whereas other study have applied community detection algorithms on network that depict traffic flows .
however , the former does not reflect spatial interaction among Place or area , and the latter group ' Place or area with different land uses into the same cluster .
to address these issue in existing approach , this study proposes a new similarity method that considers not only temporal mobility pattern of area but also spatial interaction with other area .

moreover , the study combines spectral clustering repeated several time with hierarchical clustering to obtain a reliable structure that keeps the contiguity of cluster and determine the hierarchy of different areal unit .
the application of the proposed method to the data for Seoul , South Korea , reveals that the proposed clustering process divides a city into relatively homogeneous area in term of land use .
the flow map based on the clustering result also revealed the spatial interaction between different area and identify the polycentric structure of Seoul .
geosilhouette : Geographical measure of cluster fit .
regionalization , under various guise and description , is a longstanding and pervasive interest of urban study .

with an increasingly large number of study on urban place detection in language , behavior , pricing , and demography , recent critique of longstanding regional science perspective on place detection have focused on the arbitrariness and non-geographical nature of measure of best fit .
in this paper , we develop new explicitly geographical measure of cluster fit .
these hybrid spatial–social measure , called geosilhouette , are demonstrated to capture the “ core ” of geographical cluster in racial data on census block in Brooklyn neighborhood .
these new geosilhouette are also useful in a variety of boundary analysis and outlier detection problem .
in this paper , the thinking behind geosilhouette is presented , their mathematical form is defined , they are demonstrated , and new direction of research are discussed .
gcn2cdd : A Commercial District Discovery Framework via Embedding Space Clustering on Graph Convolution Networks .
modern enterprises attach much attention to the selection of commercial location .
with the rapid development of urban data and machine learning , we can discover the pattern of human mobility with these data and technology to guide commercial district discovery .

in this paper , we propose an unsupervised commercial district discovery framework via embedding space clustering on graph convolution network ( GCN2CDD ) to solve the problem of commercial district discovery .
specifically , the proposed framework aggregates human mobility feature according to geographic similarity by graph convolution network .
based on the graph convolution network embedding space , we apply hierarchical clustering to mine the latent functional region hidden in different human pattern .
then with the kernel density estimation , we can obtain the semantic label for the clustering result to discover commercial district .
finally , we analyze the multi-source data of the Xiaoshan District and Chengdu City and experiment verify the effectiveness of our framework .
ieee
predicting safe parking space : A machine learning approach to geospatial urban and crime data .
this research aims to identify spatial and time pattern of theft in Manhattan , NY , to reveal urban factor that contribute to theft from motor vehicle and to build a prediction model for theft .

method include time series and hot spot analysis , linear regression , elastic-net , Support vector machine SVM with radial and linear kernel , decision tree , bagged CART , random forest , and stochastic gradient boosting .

machine learning method reveal that linear model perform better on our data ( linear regression , elastic-net ) , specifying that a higher number of subway entrance , graffiti , and restaurant on Street contribute to higher theft rate from motor vehicle .

although the prediction model for theft meet almost all assumption ( five of six ) , its accuracy is 77 % , suggesting that there are other undiscovered factor making a contribution to the generation of theft .
as an output demonstrating final result , the application prototype for searching safer parking in Manhattan , NY based on the prediction model , has been developed .
safe city in the new urban world : A comparative cluster dynamic analysis through machine learning .
city in the ‘ New Urban World ’ display an enormous diversity in appearance , growth and performance .
the awareness is growing that the urban development potential ( ‘ magnetism ’ ) of city is closely related to safety and security condition in these city .

this paper develops a new analytical framework based on a wealth of empirical data on both safety/security and socio-economic magnetism achievement of many world city , by combining two comprehensive relevant global urban data base .

the aim of the study is to offer a comparative analysis of the combined safety/security data and socio-economic performance data of 30 global city , through the use of an advanced sequential cluster dynamic analysis that is ( partly ) inspired by a novel machine learning approach ( using Python software ) .
in this way , city can be categorized according to their quantitative characteristic feature represented by the relevant cluster .
it appears that city safety/security feature are an important predictor of the variability in overall urban performance regarding magnetism .
this study allows also for drawing relevant policy lesson .
delineation of an Urban Community Life Circle Based on a Machine-Learning Estimation of Spatiotemporal Behavioral Demand .
delineating life circle is an essential prerequisite for urban community life circle planning .
recent study combined the environmental contexts with resident ’ global positioning system ( GPS ) data to delineate the life circle .
this method , however , is constrained by GPS data , and it can only be applied in the GPS surveyed community .
to address this limitation , this study developed a generalizable delineation method without the constraint of behavioral data .
according to previous research , the community life circle consists of the walking-accessible range and internal structure .

the core task to develop the generalizable method was to estimate the spatiotemporal behavioral demand for each plot of land to acquire the internal structure of the life circle , as the range can be delineated primarily based on environmental data .
therefore , behavioral demand estimation model were established through logistic regression and machine learning technique , including decision tree and ensemble learning .
the model with the lowest error rate was chosen as the final estimation model for each type of land .
finally , we used a community without GPS data as an example to demonstrate the effectiveness of the estimation model and delineation method .

this article extends the existing literature by introducing spatiotemporal behavioral demand estimation model , which learn the relationship between environmental contexts , population composition and the existing delineated result based on GPS data to delineate the internal structure of the community life circle without employing behavioral data .

furthermore , the proposed method and delineation result also contributes to facility adjustment and location selection in life circle planning , people-oriented transformation in urban planning , and activity space estimation of the population in evaluating and improving the urban policy .
combining design pattern and topic modeling to discover region that support particular functionality .

the problem of discovering region that support particular functionality in an urban setting has been approached in literature using two general methodology : top-down , encoding expert knowledge on urban planning and design and discovering region that conform to that knowledge ; and bottom-up , using data to train machine learning model , which can discover similar region .

both methodology face limitation , with knowledge-based approach being criticized for scalability and transferability issue and data-driven approach for lacking interpretability and depending heavily on data quality .

to mitigate these disadvantage , we propose a novel framework that fuses a knowledge-based approach using design pattern and a data-driven approach using latent Dirichlet allocation ( LDA ) topic modeling in three different way : Functional region discovered using either approach are evaluated against each other to identify case of significant agreement or disagreement ; knowledge from pattern is used to adjust topic probability in the learning model ; and topic probability are used to adjust pattern-based result .
the proposed methodology are demonstrated through the use case of identifying shopping-related region in the Los Angeles metropolitan area .

result show that the combination of pattern-based discovery and topic modeling extraction helps uncover discrepancy between the two approach and smooth inaccuracy caused by the limitation of each approach .
crowdsensed Data Learning-Driven Prediction of Local Businesses Attractiveness in Smart Cities .
urban planning typically relies on experience-based solution and traditional methodology to face urbanization issue and investigate the complex dynamic of city .
recently , novel data-driven approach in urban computing have emerged for researcher and companie .
they aim to address historical urbanization issue by exploiting sensing data gathered by mobile device under the so-called mobile crowdsensing ( MCS ) paradigm .
this work shows how to exploit sensing data to improve traditionally experience-based approach for urban decision .
in particular , we apply widely known Machine Learning ( ML ) technique to achieve highly accurate result in predicting category of local business ( LBs ) ( e.g.
, bar , restaurant ) , and their attractiveness in term of class of temporal demand ( e.g.
, nightlife , business hour ) .
the performance evaluation is conducted in Luxembourg city and the city of Munich with publicly available crowdsensed dataset .
the result highlight that our approach does not only achieve high accuracy , but it also unveils important hidden feature of the interaction of citizen and LBs .
uncovering the relationship between point-of-interests-related human mobility and socioeconomic status .
in a city or region , understanding the relationship between human mobility and socioeconomic status is critical to public policy formulation , urban design and marketing strategy development .
based on the available massive geo-located human data , existing study focused almost exclusively on the position attributes ( i.e .
coordinate ) of the location visited by people to explore the relationship , however , they ignored the category attributes ( e.g .
restaurant or supermarket ) of these location which imply the purpose ( e.g .
eating or shopping ) behind human movement .
a location with coordinate and category information is usually referred to as a point-of-interest ( POI ) .
in this paper , we study the relationship between POIs-related human mobility and socioeconomic status at city level .
starting from the location-based social network ( i.e .
foursquare ) dataset , we find that the check-in number of location category are correlated with socioeconomic indicator , either positively or negatively .
to further validate these correlation , we develop and test a multi-task prediction framework based on POIs-related human mobility for forecasting socioeconomic indicator .
extensive experiment on the Foursquare dataset show that the socioeconomic indicator can be well predicted by our proposed framework .
our finding and method are helpful for modeling human mobility and assessing socioeconomic status .
mining heterogeneous urban data for retail store placement .
retail store placement problem has been extensively studied in both academic and industry as it decides the retail success of a business .
existing method exploited either consumer study ( e.g.
, consultant-based solution ) or geographic feature ( e.g.
, point of interest ) to settle it .
however , due to the limitation of data source ( i.e.
, costly in time and labor ) , none of these method could provide an accurate and timely solution .
in this paper , we rethink retail store placement problem by mining heterogeneous urban data .
in particular , unlike existing work which only used geographic feature or consumer study solely , we extract three category of feature ( i.e.

, human movement feature , commercial area feature and geographic feature ) from heterogeneous urban data , and integrate them into various machine learning model to predict the popularity of a prospective retail store in the candidate area .
we conduct a case study with real data in Shenzhen to demonstrate the predictive power of our proposal .
learning task-specific city region partition .
the proliferation of publicly accessible urban data provide new insight on various urban task .
a frequently used approach is to treat each region as a data sample and build a model over all the region to observe the correlation between urban feature ( e.g.
, demographic ) and the target variable ( e.g.
, crime count ) .
to define region , most existing study use fixed grid or pre-defined administrative boundary ( e.g.
, census tract or community area ) .
in reality , however , definition of region should be different depending on task ( e.g.
, regional crime count prediction vs. real estate price estimation ) .
in this paper , we propose a new problem of task-specific city region partitioning , aiming to find the best partition in a city w.r.t .
a given task .
we prove this is an NP-hard search problem with no trivial solution .
to learn the partition , we first study two variant of Markov Chain Monte Carlo ( MCMC ) .
we further propose a reinforcement learning scheme for effective sampling the search space .
we conduct experiment on two real dataset in Chicago ( i.e.
, crime count and real estate price ) to demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method .
toward a deep learning powered query engine for urban planning .
urban planning is crucial to sustainable growth .
in order for the planner to make informed decision , data from multiple source have to be retrieved and cross-referenced efficiently .

we discuss the implementation of a query engine which accepts natural language as input , using machine learning and NLP technique namely word embedding , CNN , rule-based system and NER to produce accurate output enriched with geographical insight to facilitate the planning process .
the query engine classifies the query into one of the planning domain , as well as determine the category , location and the size of buffer .
processed result are presented on the ePlanner , which is a map service on the GIS implemented by the Urban Redevelopment Authority ( URA ) of Singapore .
revealing functional region via joint matrix factorization based model .
various function in the region are emerging with the process of urbanization , such as the residential , entertainment or hospital district , which can be indicated during the urban planning .
recently , researcher try to discover the region function with the human mobility data based on machine learning and statistical model .
however , previous work always employs the single domain data like mobility information or district attribute to measure the function .
in this paper , we will address the problem by integrating multi-domain data , like human trajectory , base station information and Points-of-Interest attribute .

for that , we propose a joint nonnegative matrix factorization model to combine the multi-source data and extract the function distribution of each urban region , then the dominated function among the region can be uncovered based on the clustering process over the extracted distribution .
we also evaluate the performance of our method on the real-world dataset to demonstrate the advantage of our proposed model over the baseline method .
street context of various demographic group in their daily mobility .

we present an urban science framework to characterize phone user ’ exposure to different street context type based on network science , geographical information system ( GIS ) , daily individual trajectory , and street imagery .
we consider street context as the inferred usage of the street , based on its building and construction , categorized in nine possible label .
the label define whether the street is residential , commercial or downtown , throughway or not , and other special category .
we apply the analysis to the City of Boston , considering daily trajectory synthetically generated with a model based on call detail record ( CDR ) and image from Google Street View .
image are categorized both manually and using artificial intelligence ( AI ) .

we focus on the city ’ s four main racial/ethnic demographic group ( White , Black , Hispanic and Asian ) , aiming to characterize the difference in what these group of people see during their daily activity .
based on daily trajectory , we reconstruct most common path over the street network .
we use street demand ( number of time a street is included in a trajectory ) to detect each group ’ s most relevant Street and region .
based on their street demand , we measure the street context distribution for each group .
the inclusion of image allows us to quantitatively measure the prevalence of each context and point to qualitative difference on where that context takes place .
other AI methodology can further exploit these difference .
this approach presents the building block to further study that relate mobile device ’ dynamic record with the difference in urban exposure by demographic group .

the addition of AI-based image analysis to street demand can power up the capability of urban planning methodology , compare multiple city under a unified framework , and reduce the crudeness of GIS-only mobility analysis .

shortening the gap between big data-driven analysis and traditional human classification analysis can help build smarter and more equal city while reducing the effort necessary to study a city ’ s characteristic .
learning with self-attention for rental market spatial dynamic in the Atlanta metropolitan area .
the rental housing market plays a critical role in the United States real estate market .
prior study have used various approach to model housing rent , such as interpolation , hedonic modeling , and machine learning .
however , only a few study have modeled rental price based on textual data , which provides rich and contextual information about rental property .
in addition , many model , especially deep learning model , use an end-to-end black box for prediction , which hides the decision process .
such model are difficult to interpret and explain the driving factor .
this study builds on our previous work , aiming to develop and evaluate rental market spatial dynamic model combining Long Short-Term Memory ( LSTM ) network and self-attention mechanism .
we compare the performance of the proposed model with our previous model on predicting rental price in Atlanta , Georgia , USA .
we also use technique from saliency map to explain the generated model .
result show that the self-attention-based model outperforms our previous model .
the saliency map technique reveal how the model attends to a different part of the textual information .
the predicted result reflect the spatial variation of textual information .
such a model offers practical pricing reference for homeowner and renter , and spatial pattern for urban planner and stakeholder .
chain store placement recommendation with multi-source urban data .
with the rapid development of chain store , how to recommend the placement of new store becomes a challenge .
existing work mainly focus on using feature-based model to recommend Place for store .
different from existing work , we focus on the scale-based store placement problem , which can not recommend Place for a store , but also suggest the right scale for the store .
firstly , we extract geospatial feature , business feature and scale-relevant feature to characterize the urban region .
secondly , we present regression and classification method for dealing with two situation : recommending Place with a given scale , and recommending scale given the place .
experiment over real world dataset prove the effectiveness of our method .
identifying spatio-temporal hotspot of human activity that are popular non-work destination .

the improved temporal and spatial granularity of data now available from current information technology offers an opportunity to study previously unexplored dimension of the relationship between built environment and social outcome .

within the field of urban study , an old question worth revisiting with these new technology is how to best trace the spatial boundary that circumscribe a place or location to explore non-work activity .
in this study , we explore a data-driven definition of Place as unit of analysis that can be used to explore non-work activity in Singapore .
such a definition of place characterizes an urban space in term of its concentration of activity and the topology of the built environment–features that are especially important to urban planner .
we utilize available smartphone data to develop a systematic framework to identify location with a concentrated human presence .

using a cylinder moving over a grid representing Singapore , we scan aggregated smartphone locational request ( by time and cell ) , identifying area with atypical high concentration at a given time .
our tool identified 93 Place with a concentrated human presence .

direct observation of six of these Place at the selected time in conjunction with additional transportation and population data indicated that the topology of commercial establishment provided a strong approximation of non-work activity at a given time and place .

having established the relevance of commercial establishment in approximating non-work activity , then points-of-interest data within the 93 derived Place are used to propose a typology of commercial patch , based on their spatial configuration .
nine metric of the geometry and topology of patch of establishment , such as compacity and their dependence on proximity to shopping mall , were developed .
these combined variable revealed more temporal and spatial variety within location than had previously been recognized .
the most popular Place for non-work activity were densely configured with various commercial sub-space or patch appealing to different lifestyle and income group .

this study suggests that a location/place can be best defined as a highly detailed , multi-faceted , and always evolving area of activity rather than as a fixed location with temporal and unmovable boundary .
suggesting a dynamic redefinition of location/place that builds on other recent work , this work offers potential contribution to locational model for non-work activity .
an Intelligent Tree Planning Approach Using Location-Based Social Networks Data .
how do we make sure that all citizen in a city have access to enough green space ?
an increasing part of the world ’ s population live in urban area , where contact with nature is largely reduced to street tree and park .
as optional tree planting site and financial resource are limited , determining the best planting site can be formulated as an optimization problem with constraint .
can we locate these site based on the popularity of nearby venue ?
how can we ensure that we include group of people who tend to spend time in tree deprived area ?
currently , tree location site are chosen based on criterion from spatial-visual , physical and biological , and functional category .

as these criterion do not give any insight into which citizen are benefiting from the tree placement , we propose new data-driven tree planting policy that take socio-cultural aspect as represented by the citizen ’ behavior into account .
we combine a Location Based Social Network ( LBSN ) mobility data set with tree location data set , both of New York City and Paris , as a case study .
the effect of four different policy is evaluated on simulated movement data and assessed on the average , overall exposure to tree as well as on how much inequality in tree exposure is mitigated .
from PIace2Vec to Multi-Scale Built-Environment Representation : A General-Purpose Distributional Embedding for Urban Data Analysis .
built environment like city , Road , community are rich source of urban data .

many downstream application require comprehensive analysis like geographic information retrieval , recommender system , geographic knowledge graphs , and in general , understanding urban space [ 28 ] .

point of Interest ( POI ) , as one of the most researched aspect of urban data , has been successfully modeled using concept borrowed from Machine Learning ( ML ) and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) .
in the work of Place2Vec [ 28 ] , a Word2Vec-like statistical model is proposed to represent spatial adjacency with a continuous embedding space .
this method successfully model the functional semantic of POIs with regard to several human-assessment based evaluation .

however , though the Place2Vec model addresses the distributional heterogeneity within a given spatial context with ITDL augmentation , it does not address the spatial heterogeneity among different region .
to solve this problem , we propose to introduce a hierarchical , density-based , self-adjusting clustering mechanism .
the boundary of relatedness and unrelatedness is learned from the given context , where denser area have tighter bound while sparser area have looser one .
we train our model on both the baseline Yelp hierarchical dataset [ 28 ] and our OpenStreetMap dataset .

we demonstrate that 1 ) our model significantly improves the performance on 2 of the 3 baseline task and the stability of training , and 2 ) our model generalizes excellently across 112 city of radically different scale ( minimum 1725 POIs , maximum 2694070 POIs ) , region ( North America , Europe , Asia , Africa ) and type ( commercial , touristy , industrial , etc . )
without the need of adjusting or tuning any hyperparameter .

we also demonstrate that our model can be used to discover interesting fact about city like inter-city semantic analogy and intra-city connectivity , which can be very useful in urban planning , social computing and public policy making .
region2vec : An Approach for Urban Land Use Detection by Fusing multiple Feature .
with the advancement of urbanization , urban land use detection has become a research hotspot .
numerous method have been proposed to identify urban land use , in which point of interest ( POI ) data is widely used , and sometimes other data source like GPS trajectory is incorporated .

however , previous work have hardly fully utilized the global spatial information contained in the POI data , or ignored correlation between feature when integrating multiple data source , so resulting in information loss .
in this study , we propose an integrated framework titled Region2vec to detect urban land use type by combining POI and mobile phone data .
first , POI-based region embedding are generated by applying Glove model and LDA model to mine the global spatial information and land use topic distribution respectively .
the mobile phone data is utilized to generate human activity pattern-based embedding .
then a similarity matrix is constructed according to POI-based and activity pattern-based embedding .
finally , the similarity measure are regarded as clustering feature to extract the urban land use result .
experiment are implemented and compared with other urban land use algorithm based on data in Sanya , China .
the result demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework .
this research can provide effective information support for urban planning .
ballparking the Urban placeness : A case study of analyzing starbuck post on instagram .
placeness or the “ sense of a place ” plays a vital role in urban design and planning .
research on placeness in the past has been conducted via conventional method like survey to reveal essential insight for urban planner and architect .

for taking a glimpse into placeness by analyzing common factor across geography , we choose Instagram post from Starbucks as a case study , owing to its the-next-door coffee shop psychological construct .
we conduct our research by first adopting a flexible ontological framework to organize the concept governing placeness .
next , we curate a dataset of community generated Instagram post from Starbucks in three major metropolitan city of the world : New York , Seoul , and Tokyo .
the curated dataset is then automatically enriched with contextual attribute such as activity , visitor demographic , and time via machine learning technique .
we finally analyze and validate the quantitative variation in contextual information with finding from well-accepted cross-cultural case study .
our result show that placeness mined from Starbucks , a prominent urban third-place , can be reliably utilized to discover surrounding urban placeness .
localization Decision of Entrepreneur : The Role of Path Dependency and Market Forces .
the purpose of this research is to determine the role of path dependency and market force in the localization decision of entrepreneur from different industry .
we hypothesize that most industry develop new entity based on the number of companie from the same industry that already exist in a region .
we also hypothesize that entrepreneur create new entity based on related industry operating within the same knowledge pool .
to test these hypothesis , we used the machine learning decision tree method .
the input variable are the number of companie from 86 industry located in 2,531 community in Poland in 2009 .
the target value are the number of new companie from these industry created in the year 2009-2015 .
the principal result show that localization decision are mostly based on demand and supply industry , in which manufacturing industry play crucial role .
path dependency appears in less than half of the industry ' model and thus is not the main factor influencing decision regarding the creation of new companie .
the highest share of path-dependent industry is in manufacturing sector , but the degree of the dependence is lower than in the service sector .
the service sector seems to be the least path-dependent , as service usually serve other industry .
competition in industry is a rare factor in new company creation ; however , if it appears , it usually shrinks the industry .
sta : A spatio-temporal thematic analytic framework for urban ground sensing .
urban planning has always involved getting feedback from various stakeholder and member of public , to inform plan and evaluation of proposal .
a lot of rich information comes in textual form , which traditionally have to be read manually .
with advancement in machine learning capability , there is potential to tap on it to aid planner in synthesizing insight from large amount of textual feedback data more efficiently .
in this paper , we developed a more general urban-centric feedback analysis framework , which encompasses the spatio-temporal thematic of ground sensing .
three essential method : geotagging , topic modeling , and trend analysis are proposed and a prototype has been implemented .

the result of experiment indicate that the proposed framework could not only accurately extract precise geospatial information , but also efficiently analyze the semantic theme based on a probabilistic topic modeling with Latent Dirichlet Allocation .

importantly , the spatial and temporal trend of detected topic indicate the effectiveness of our proposed algorithm and then benefit domain expert in their routine work and reveal many interesting insight on ground sensing matter .
the syntactic signature of starbuck ' location Towards a machine-learning approach to location decision-making .

the space syntax Theory of Natural Movement postulates that everything else being equal , land use selects their location based on the asymmetry of accessibility created by the configuration of the street network .
in this article , I test the hypothesis whether configurational ( syntactic ) property of an urban street network are relevant for the location of land use .
if syntactic feature are relevant , then land use type may have a 'syntactic signature ' .
to identify this blueprint , I apply machine-learning technique to dataset of syntactic measure , for ten business type .
the result are ten model , each with the syntactic blueprint of a type of business .
the model are used to predict the existence , or not , of such business in segment of the map of London .
the performance of the model varie , with fifty per cent reaching statistical significance , including one with 'good ' prediction ability .
the model for Starbucks coffee shop and solicitor 's office have the strongest prediction ability .

the exploratory exercise demonstrates the potential of the machine-learning method Random Forests , when supervised and individually applied to a business activity , to identify the syntactic signature of business type .
such model can be used during planning and design and on location study .
the result strengthen the candidacy of syntactic measurement to location-decision-making .
moreover , they reinforce the theory of Natural Movement .
mining urban land-use pattern from volunteered geographic information by mean of genetic algorithm and artificial neural network .
in the context of OpenStreetMap ( OSM ) , spatial data quality , in particular completeness , is an essential aspect of its fitness for use in specific application , such as planning task .

to mitigate the effect of completeness error in OSM , this study proposes a methodological framework for predicting by mean of OSM urban area in Europe that are currently not mapped or only partially mapped .
for this purpose , a machine learning approach consisting of artificial neural network and genetic algorithms is applied .
under the premise of existing OSM data , the model estimates missing urban area with an overall squared correlation coefficient ( R 2 ) of 0.589 .
interregional comparison of European region confirm spatial heterogeneity in the model performance , whereas the R 2 range from 0.129 up to 0.789 .
these result show that the delineation of urban area by mean of the presented methodology depends strongly on location .
land-use-change modeling using unbalanced support-vector machine .
modeling land-use change is a prerequisite to understanding the complexity of land-use-change pattern .
this paper presents a novel method to model urban land-use change using support-vector machine ( SVMs ) , a new generation of machine learning algorithm used in classification and regression domain .
an SVM modeling framework has been developed to analyze land-use change in relation to various factor such as population , distance to Road and facility , and surrounding land use .

as land-use data are generally unbalanced , in the sense that the unchanged data overwhelm the changed data , traditional method are incapable of classifying relatively minor land-use change with high accuracy .
to circumvent this problem , an unbalanced SVM has been adopted by enhancing the standard SVMs .
a case study of Calgary land-use change demonstrates that the unbalanced SVMs can achieve high and reliable performance for land-use-change modeling .
driving force analysis of urban expansion based on boosted regression tree and Logistic regression .
the rapid relentless urban area expansion has led to a series of problem in China .
many research focused on this issue in recent year .
driving force are the core topic in urban expansion , as well as the basic component of modeling and predicting .

it is very useful and meaningful to analyze the driving force of urban expansion , which may provide us with a scientific basis to rationally utilize land resource , determining the law of urban development , researching the evolution process , predicting the urban expansion trend , and also providing guidance for the development of rational control policy .
the Shenyang city was chosen as study area .
eight category of land use type were extracted from remote sensing image ( 1997 and 2010 ) with ArcGIS software .
ten driving force were chosen , including three natural factor , three distance factor , four social and economic factor .
which were calculated based on the land use map , DEM , topographic map , zoning map and the statistical yearbook .
the dependent variable was the change of built-up area of Shenyang from 1997 to 2010 .

boosted regression tree ( BRT ) is an ensemble method and is a combination of technique between statistical and machine learning tradition that has shown to be effective to identify relationship between result and influencing factor .
logistic regression is a method to discover the empirical relationship between a binary dependent and several independent categorical and continuous variable .
boosted Regression Trees and Logistic regression were used to analyze the main driving force of urban expansion synthetically .

the result illustrated the relative influence of driving factor was followed by distance from urban area of 1997 , distance from river , DEM , distance from highway and railway , land use type , development plan , GDP , population density , aspect , and slope based on BRT analysis .

according to Logistic regression analysis , the relative influence of important factor was followed by development zone , distance from urban land of 1997 , DEM , distance from highway and railway , population density , distance from river , rural residential area and slope .
the most important driving force affecting the expansion of Shenyang are distance from urban area of 1997 , DEM , distance from highway and railway .
meanwhile , they were all located in the top four of the main factor .
the result revealed that the distance factor were the most important factor , and the total contribution rate of relative influence was up to 61.4 % .
it is demonstrated distance factor are the main driving force of urban expansion .
natural factorswere less important , but the relative influence of DEM was important , and the contribution rate was 12.5 % .
development zone and rural settlement are the only two factor have much influence in the socio-economic factor .
on the whole , location factor , which refer to the distance from urban land in this study , were the leading factor of urban expansion .
natural factor , such as DEM , river and so on , are the basis of urban development , determining the overall urban spatial form .
the construction of infrastructure , such as Road and railway , are the frame of the city .
the social and economic factor decided the speed of urban expansion .
urban planning and development zone construction provided the direction of urban expansion .
performance analysis of radial basis function network and multi-layer perceptron network in modeling urban change : a case study .
the majority of city are rapidly growing .
this makes the monitoring and modeling of urban change ’ s spatial pattern critical to urban planner , decision maker , and environment protection activist .

although a wide range of method exist for modeling and simulating urban growth , machine learning ( ML ) technique have received less attention despite their potential for producing highly accurate prediction of future urban extent .
the aim of this study is to investigate two ML technique , namely radial basis function network ( RBFN ) and multi-layer perceptron ( MLP ) network , for modeling urban change .

by predicting urban change for 2010 , the model ’ performance is evaluated by comparing result with a reference map and by using a set of pertinent statistical measure , such as average spatial distance deviation and figure of merit .
the application of these technique employs the case study area of Mumbai , India .
the result show that both model , which were tested using the same explanatory variable , produced promising result in term of predicting the size and extent of future urban area .
although a close match between RBFN and MLP is observed , RBFN demonstrates higher spatial accuracy of prediction .
accordingly , RBFN was utilized to simulate urban change for 2020 and 2030 .
overall , the study provides evidence that RBFN is a robust and efficient ML technique and can therefore be recommended for land use change modeling .
predicting multiple land use transition under rapid urbanization and implication for land management and urban planning : The case of Zhanggong District in central China .
numerous machine learning-based land change model have been presented by researcher over the last two decade .
to date , however , far less have simulated multiple land use class and specific land use subclasses at the same time .
in some area of the world , it is important to simulate both of these dynamic to understand fully the driver and consequence of land change .
one important example is the process of urbanization in China , as urban policy have been developed that guide urban expansion , rural protection , and urban subclass development .

this paper presents a new model integrating geographic information system ( GIS ) with artificial neural network ( ANNs ) to predict multiple transition among land use type and urban subclass in the Zhanggong District of Ganzhou city in China .
we show that the model produces satisfactory goodness of fit values-based on location , quantity and spatial configuration-between simulated and observed land use map for 2015 .

our simulated future map produced by the model for 2020 and 2025 demonstrate that transition from farmland and forest to urban will remain the main pathway of urbanization although we predict that the rate will slow after 2025 .
the goal of urban planning should be aligned with land use planning according to “ Combining multiple law and regulation ” in China .
taking into account the current and future land use transition will enhance the accuracy and timeliness of land use policy making and urban land planning .

for the sustainable land use in Zhanggong District , we argue for a strengthened regulation of the land market by government and believe that planning official should guide the spatial distribution of land supply actively .
furthermore , improving the production , living and ecological function of land resource are the key point to optimize urban land use function and the allocation of land resource .
we discuss how our model can be adapted to other area to benefit land use management and urban planning in China .
analyzing the spatial factor related to the distribution of building height in urban area : A comparative case study in Guangzhou and Shenzhen .
rapid urbanization has become an increasingly serious issue worldwide .
while most previous study focused on two-dimensional urban development , the spatial characteristic of building height are rarely explored .
such information could provide valuable implication for smart urban planning and management .
however , previous attempt did not systematically investigate the spatial factor that influence building height and their association with urban development .
therefore , this study developed a machine learning-based method to compare the distribution of building height in Guangzhou and Shenzhen , two city with different development pattern .
first , we collected detailed information on the building , such as the location and land value .
second , the height of each building was simulated based on the above information using the well-known random forest , k-nearest neighbor algorithm , and artificial neural network .
the random forests algorithm outperformed the other two in both city .
we also found that the commercial land value is the most important factor associated with building height .

moreover , the building height in Guangzhou are more sensitive to the distance to administrative center , while the distance to transportation network exert stronger influence on the building height in Shenzhen .
overall , these finding could support urban planning and management .
more importantly , the proposed method can be used to predict the height of new building and investigate the distribution of building height in other region .
comparison of approach for urban functional zone classification based on multi-source geospatial data : A case study in Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .

accurate and timely classification and monitoring of urban functional zone prove to be significant in rapidly developing city , to better understand the real and varying urban function of city to support urban planning and management .
many effort have been undertaken to identify urban functional zone using various classification approach and multi-source geospatial dataset .

the complexity of this category of classification pose tremendous challenge to these study especially in term of classification accuracy , but on the opposite , the rapid development of machine learning technology provides us with new opportunity .

in this study , a set of commonly used urban functional zone classification approach , including Multinomial Logistic Regression , K-Nearest Neighbors , Decision Tree , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) , and Random Forest , are examined and compared with the newly developed eXtreme Gradient Boosting ( XGBoost ) model , using the case study of Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .
the investigation is based on multi-variate geospatial data , including night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , point of interest ( POI ) from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map .
this study is the first endeavor of implementing the XGBoost model in the field of urban functional zone classification .
the result suggest that the XGBoost classification model performed the best and was able to achieve an accuracy of 88.05 % , which is significantly higher than the other commonly used approach .

in addition , the integration of night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , POI from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map has also demonstrated their value for the classification of urban functional zone in this case study .
mapping long-term dynamic of population and dwelling based on a multi-temporal analysis of urban morphology .

information on the distribution and dynamic of dwelling and their inhabitant is essential to support decision-making in various Field such as energy provision , land use planning , risk assessment and disaster management .

however , as various different of approach to estimate the current distribution of population and dwelling exist , further evidence on past dynamic is needed for a better understanding of urban process .

this article therefore addresses the question of whether and how accurately historical distribution of dwelling and inhabitant can be reconstructed with commonly available geodata from national mapping and cadastral agency .
