for this purpose , an approach for the automatic derivation of such information is presented .
the data basis is constituted by a current digital landscape model and a 3D building model combined with historical land use information automatically extracted from historical topographic map .
for this purpose , method of image processing , machine learning , change detection and dasymetric mapping are applied .

the result for a study area in Germany show that it is possible to automatically derive decadal historical pattern of population and dwelling from 1950 to 2011 at the level of a 100 m grid with slight underestimation and acceptable standard deviation .
by a differentiated analysis we were able to quantify the error for different urban structure type .
a machine learning-based classification system for urban built-up area using multiple classifier and data source .
information about urban built-up area is important for urban planning and management .
however , obtaining accurate information about urban built-up area is a challenge .
this study developed a general-purpose built-up area intelligent classification ( BAIC ) system that supports various type of data and classifier .
all of the step in the BAIC were implemented using Python module including Numpy , Pandas , matplotlib , and scikit-learn .

we used the BAIC to conduct a classification experiment that involved seven type of input data ; namely , Point of Interest ( POI ) , Road Network ( RN ) , nighttime light ( NTL ) , a combination of POI and RN data ( POI_RN ) , a combination of POI and NTL data ( POI_NTL ) , a combination of RN and NTL data ( RN_NTL ) , and a combination of POI , RN , and NTL data ( POI_RN_NTL ) , and five classifier , namely , Logistic Regression ( LR ) , Decision Tree ( DT ) , Random Forests ( RF ) , Gradient Boosted Decision Trees ( GBDT ) , and AdaBoost .

the result show the following : ( 1 ) among the 35 combination of the five classifier and seven type of input data , the overall accuracy ( OA ) ranged from 76 to 89 % , F1 value ranged from 0.73 to 0.86 , and the area under the receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve ( AUC ) ranged from 0.83 to 0.95 .

the largest F1 value and OA were obtained using the POI_RN_NTL data and AdaBoost , while the largest AUC was obtained using POI_RN_NTL and POI_NTL data against AdaBoost , LR , and RF ; and ( 2 ) the advantage of the BAIC include its support for multi-source input data , its objective accuracy assessment , and its robust classifier .

the BAIC can quickly and efficiently realize the automatic classification of urban built-up area at a reasonably low cost and can be readily applied to other urban area in the world where any kind of POI , RN , or NTL data coverage is available .

the result of this study are expected to provide timely and effective reference information for urban planning and urban management department , and could also potentially be used to develop large-scale map of urban built-up area in the future .
comparing machine learning classification scheme - A GIS approach .
this project examines the effectiveness of two classification schema : Support Vector Machines ( SVM ) , and Artificial Neural Networks ( NN ) when applied to geographic ( i.e .
spatial ) data .
the context for this study is to examine pattern of urbanization in Mahoning County , OH in relation to several independent driving variable of urban development .
these independent variable were constructed using Geographic Information Systems ( CIS ) and were compared to the dependent variable of the spatial location of urban area in Mahoning County .
the classification technique were used in conjunction with the GIS-created variable to predict the location of urban area within Mahoning County .
a comparison of the accuracy of the technique is presented and conclusion drawn concerning which of the variable are the most influential on urban pattern in the region .
lastly , a spatial analysis of the prediction error is performed for each method .
disentangling the comparative role of multilevel built environment on body mass index : Evidence from China .
one common goal of urban planning is to promote health , where the built environment ( BE ) is believed to play an essential role .
this study provides new evidence for the link between body mass index ( BMI ) and the BE at different geographic scale in a unified framework .

based on a sample of 10,962 individual across 95 city in China , this study explores the collective effect of the BE attributes at neighborhood and city level on BMI using a gradient boosting decision tree ( GBDT ) approach .
moreover , whether the relationship between the city-level BE attribute and BMI vary across social group is revealed .
the result indicate that the city-level BE attribute have larger collective effect on BMI than the neighborhood-level BE attributes .
specifically , population size is the greatest contributor to predicting BMI , with a relative importance of 13.92 % among all influential factor .
moreover , it is found that the effect of city-level BE attributes vary across different social group .

these finding suggest it is of vital importance for urban planner to coordinate both neighborhood- and city-level BE planning to deter the risk of obesity , and urban planning can be more effective if it is implemented considering local socio-demographic characteristic .
spatiotemporal modeling of urban growth using machine learning .
this paper presents a general framework for modeling the growth of three important variable for city : population distribution , binary urban footprint , and urban footprint in color .

the framework model the population distribution as a spatiotemporal regression problem using machine learning , and it obtains the binary urban footprint from the population distribution through a binary classifier plus a temporal correction for existing urban region .
the framework estimates the urban footprint in color from its previous value , as well as from past and current value of the binary urban footprint using a semantic inpainting algorithm .
by combining this framework with free data from the Landsat archive and the Global Human Settlement Layer framework , interested user can get approximate growth prediction of any city in the world .
these prediction can be improved with the inclusion in the framework of additional spatially distributed input variable over time subject to availability .
unlike widely used growth model based on cellular automata , there are two main advantage of using the proposed machine learning-based framework .
firstly , it does not require to define rule a priori because the model learns the dynamic of growth directly from the historical data .
secondly , it is very easy to train new machine learning model using different explanatory input variable to assess their impact .

as a proof of concept , we tested the framework in Valledupar and Rionegro , two Latin American city located in Colombia with different geomorphological characteristic , and found that the model prediction were in close agreement with the ground-truth based on performance metric , such as the root-mean-square error , zero-mean normalized cross-correlation , Pearson 's correlation coefficient for continuous variable , and a few other for discrete variable such as the intersection over union , accuracy , and the f1 metric .

in summary , our framework for modeling urban growth is flexible , allows sensitivity analysis , and can help policymaker worldwide to assess different what-if scenario during the planning cycle of sustainable and resilient city .
estimating quality of life dimension from urban spatial pattern metric .
the spatial structure of urban area plays a major role in the daily life of dweller .
the current policy framework to ensure the quality of life of inhabitant leaving no one behind , leads decision-maker to seek better-informed choice for the sustainable planning of urban area .
thus , a better understanding between the spatial structure of city and their socio-economic level is of crucial relevance .
accordingly , the purpose of this paper is to quantify this two-way relationship .
therefore , we measured spatial pattern of 31 city in North Rhine-Westphalia , Germany .
we rely on spatial pattern metric derived from a Local Climate Zone classification obtained by fusing remote sensing and open GIS data with a machine learning approach .

based upon the data , we quantified the relationship between spatial pattern metric and socio-economic variable related to ‘ education ’ , ‘ health ’ , ‘ living condition ’ , ‘ labor ’ , and ‘ transport ’ by mean of multiple linear regression model , explaining the variability of the socio-economic variable from 43 % up to 82 % .

additionally , we grouped city according to their level of ‘ quality of life ’ using the socio-economic variable , and found that the spatial pattern of low-dense built-up type was different among socio-economic group .
the proposed methodology described in this paper is transferable to other dataset , level , and region .
this is of great potential , due to the growing availability of open statistical and satellite data and derived product .
moreover , we discuss the limitation and needed consideration when conducting such study .
population spatialization in Beijing city based on machine learning and multisource remote sensing data .
remote sensing data have been widely used in research on population spatialization .

previous study have generally divided study area into several sub-area with similar feature by artificial or clustering algorithm and then developed model for these sub-areas separately using statistical method .
these approach have drawback due to their subjectivity and uncertainty .
in this paper , we present a study of population spatialization in Beijing City , China based on multisource remote sensing data and town-level population census data .

six predictive algorithm were compared for estimating population using the spatial variable derived from The National Polar-Orbiting Partnership/ Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite ( NPP/VIIRS ) night-time light and other remote sensing data .
random forest achieved the highest accuracy and therefore was employed for population spatialization .
feature selection was performed to determine the optimal variable combination for population modeling by random forest .
cross-validation result indicated that the developed model achieved a mean absolute error ( MAE ) of 2129.52 people/km2 and a R2 of 0.63 .
the gridded population density in Beijing at a spatial resolution of 500 m produced by the random forest model was also adjusted to be consistent with the census population at the town scale .
by comparison with Google Earth high-resolution image , the remotely-sensed population was qualitatively validated at the intra-town scale .
validation result indicated that remotely sensed result can effectively depict the spatial distribution of population within town-level district .
this study provides a valuable reference for urban planning , public health and disaster prevention in Beijing , and a reference for population mapping in other city .
predicting stream water quality under different urban development pattern scenario with an interpretable machine learning approach .
urban development pattern significantly impacts stream water quality by influencing pollutant generation , build-up , and wash-off process .
it is thus necessary to understand and predict stream water quality in accordance with different urban development pattern to effectively advise urban growth planning and policy .
to do so , we collected pollutant concentration data on nitrate ( NO3−-N ) , total phosphate ( TP ) , and Escherichia coli ( E. coli ) from 1047 sampling station in the Texas Gulf Region .
we utilized a Random Forest ( RF ) machine learning model to predict stream water quality under four planning scenario with different urban density and configuration .
shapley Additive exPlanation ( SHAP ) was used to prove the importance of urban development pattern in influencing stream water quality .
the spatial variation of the impact of these pattern were explored with Geographically Weighted Regression ( GWR ) .

shap result indicated that Largest Patch Index ( LPI ) , Patch Cohesion Index ( COHESION ) , Splitting Index ( SPLIT ) , and Landscape Division Index ( DIVISION ) were the most important urban development pattern metric affecting stream water quality .
the spatial variation of such pattern were shown to impact stream water quality depending on pollutant , seasonality , climate , and urbanization level .

rf prediction result suggested that high density aggregated development was more effective in reducing TP and NO3−-N concentration than the current sprawl development , but had the potential risk of increasing E. coli pollution in the wet season .
the result of this study provide empirical evidence and a potential mechanistic explanation that stream water quality degradation is a consequence of urban sprawl .
lastly , machine learning is a powerful tool for scenario prediction in land use planning to forecast environmental impact under different urban development pattern scenario .
learning from urban form to predict building height .
understanding city as complex system , sustainable urban planning depend on reliable high-resolution data , for example of the building stock to upscale region-wide retrofit policy .
for some city and region , these data exist in detailed 3D model based on real-world measurement .
however , they are still expensive to build and maintain , a significant challenge , especially for small and medium-sized city that are home to the majority of the European population .
new method are needed to estimate relevant building stock characteristic reliably and cost-effectively .
here , we present a machine learning based method for predicting building height , which is based only on open-access geospatial data on urban form , such as building footprint and street network .
the method allows to predict building height for region where no dedicated 3D model exist currently .

we train our model using building data from four European countrie ( France , Italy , the Netherlands , and Germany ) and find that the morphology of the urban fabric surrounding a given building is highly predictive of the height of the building .

a test on the German state of Brandenburg shows that our model predicts building height with an average error well below the typical floor height ( about 2.5 m ) , without having access to training data from Germany .
furthermore , we show that even a small amount of local height data obtained by citizen substantially improves the prediction accuracy .

our result illustrate the possibility of predicting missing data on urban infrastructure ; they also underline the value of open government data and volunteered geographic information for scientific application , such as contextual but scalable strategy to mitigate climate change .

this is an open access article distributed under the term of the Creative Commons Attribution License , which permits unrestricted use , distribution , and reproduction in any medium , provided the original author and source are credited .
sensing Mixed Urban Land-Use Patterns Using Municipal Water Consumption Time Series .
the biased population coverage and short temporal length of newly emerged data set ( e.g.
, data set of social media , mobile phone , and smart card ) obstruct the effective analysis of long-term dynamic of landuse pattern , particularly in small and developing city .
this study proposed a framework to delineate and analyze mixed land-use pattern and their evolution using municipal water consumption data .
a two-step classification strategy was designed based on the rotation forest scheme to differentiate the socioeconomic type of customer ( e.g.
, residence , commerce , public facility , manufacturing , and recreation ) using multiple feature extracted from the various form of water consumption time series .
the spatial distribution of the socioeconomic function were then derived , and the mixed land use was measured using a diversity index based on information entropy .
such an approach was applied to Changshu , a typical developing county-level city in China , for the period 2004 to 2013 .
the result showed that the urbanization of Changshu experienced both spatial expansion and intensification , with a slightly declining rate of growth in recent year .
apart from the city center , two subcenter have emerged for industrial development .
the degree of land-use mixture has increased with urban growth , indicating a maturing of urbanization .

this study explored the approach of identifying individual socioeconomic function by the consumption pattern of municipal service and demonstrated that municipal service data set can reveal land-use pattern and dynamic at a fine spatial resolution to evaluate urban planning and management , with the advantage of large population coverage and long-term temporal length .
investigating adoption pattern of residential low impact development ( LID ) using classification tree .
local government are under pressure to improve storm water management and often time must comply with consent decree with the Federal Government .

decentralizing a portion of the storm water management by integrating private landowner into localized retention and infiltration effort , that is , low impact development ( LID ) or green infrastructure project , is becoming increasingly popular .
some wastewater system have considered incentivizing private land owner to make improvement aimed at retaining storm water or slowing the conveyance to grey infrastructure .
this study examines potential opportunity for incentivizing private residential land owner in Washington DC to install LID project .
this study maps LID configuration to a set of adoption strategy and category .
the C4.5 algorithm is then applied to identify a high performance decision tree for classifying parcel by adoption strategy or adoption category based on property-level attribute .
modeling fine-scale residential land price distribution : An experimental study using open data and machine learning .

modeling the fine-scale spatiotemporal distribution of residential land price ( RLPs ) is the basis for scientifically allocating land resource , managing the residential market and improving urban planning .
the accurate mapping of the RLP dynamic require reliable land price prediction model and data with fine spatial and temporal resolution .

with the aid of point of interest ( POI ) data and nighttime light ( NTL ) images , this paper attempts to explore the ability of machine learning algorithms ( MLAs ) to model grid-level RLPs using the case of Wuhan in China .
several land price prediction model were built using five MLAs and various geographic variable .

the experimental result show that the extra-trees regression algorithm and the radial basis function-based support vector regression algorithm perform best in Period Ⅰ ( 2010–2014 ) and Period Ⅱ ( 2015–2019 ) , respectively ; therefore , they were selected to estimate the RLPs of the grid without observation in the corresponding period .

based on the estimated result , we found that the spatial pattern of the RLP in Wuhan transitioned from monocentric to polycentric between the two period , and RLPs grew rapidly near newly formed urban subcenter and waterscape .

the relative importance of the predictor variables shows that commercial and educational facility are important determinant of the RLP distribution in Wuhan ; moreover , the relative importance of natural amenity and education facility increased over time , while that of commercial facility and public transportation decreased slightly .
the case of Wuhan confirms the feasibility of MLAs and openly accessible urban data in modeling fine-scale RLP distribution .

our proposed framework provides a new approach to monitor the urban land price dynamic accurately and closely , which is beneficial for improving the infrastructure layout and achieve smart city growth .
do land policy make a difference ?
a data-driven approach to trace effect on urban form in France and Germany .
against the backdrop of rapidly expanding urban structure , land policy in many countrie have been adapted to contain and redirect growth to existing urban structure .
however , obstacle remain to measure the effect of policy .
in the meantime , geoinformation technology have given rise to a wide range of approach to measure and describe urban form .
nevertheless , its application for the assessment of land policy has a high , but not yet fully exploited , potential .
it is thus the aim of this research to address and investigate the option of spatial analysis and machine learning in particular to analyse urban form from a land policy perspective .
to do so , we develop urban metric informed by urban planning and land readjustment policy of two countrie describing urban form on different spatial level .
we therefore formulate hypothesis on causal relation between policy and form .
based on the metric , we apply the random forest algorithm to classify the building stock of the region .
we then extract the residential area , those with single-family house , as this is where the effect of the policy are considered most visible .
in a next step , we use random forest to predict the nationality of a building .
through variable importance measure , we identify and discuss urban morphological difference between the two countrie and test the hypothesis on effect of land policy .
we develop and test the approach for the French-German city-region of Strasbourg using OpenStreetMap data .
we identify significant difference in the building coverage ratio , which tend to be higher in Germany .
this can be linked to difference in planning regulation .
furthermore , German residential area appear to be more diverse in urban form .
difference in land readjustment policy have proven to be plausible here , as French policy favour strong actor that develop residential area more uniformly .
in Germany , policy favour fragmented ownership-oriented development of residential area .
the metric and the applied algorithm for building classification have proven to be robust in term of data heterogeneity and have shown high level of accuracy .
they could also be successfully used for tracing causal relation .
analysis of relationship between road traffic noise and urban form indicator through machine learning method .
as the urban area overcrowded , volume of urban road traffic is increasing .
it could affect adverse effect on the urban resident 's life quality and health .
however , road traffic noise is being managed after it has affected urban resident , because it could not managed at urban planning stage .
therefore , reactive-management of road traffic noise , such as noise barrier is chosen as noise control plan , but it is costly than proactive-management .
when road traffic noise could be considered as urban planning factor , the cost will be reduced .
machine learning method , such as regression analysis , decision tree and artificial neural network , could be used to analyze the relationship between variable .
this method was used to analyze relationship between road traffic noise and urban form indicator .
predicted noise level of road traffic noise at building facade was used as output variable , and urban form indicator are used as input variable .
applicable urban form indicator could be divided into population-related , building-related , traffic-related and land-use-related .
building-related indicator include building coverage ratio , floor area ratio , and traffic-related indicator include traffic volume , speed and percentage of heavy vehicle .
explanation power of the prediction model derived through machine learning method could verified through correlation , coefficient of determination and k-fold cross validation .
systematic data mining into land consumption in Germany .
this paper presents a systematic approach for discovering comprehensible , valid , potentially innovative and useful structure in multivariate municipality data .
technique from statistic , machine learning and data mining are applied in logical consecutive step .
this allows the validation after each step and the generation of important result during the investigation .
in particular , the approach does not end with a clustering of the data .
if a structure has been identified , then the question is posed : what does the cluster mean ?
symbolic machine learning method are used to produce an understandable description of the cluster in form of classification rule .
the approach is demonstrated on a data set of nine variable concerning land consumption of all municipality in Germany .
selected result demonstrate the capacity of the method .
identifying different type of urban land use dynamic using Point-of-interest ( POI ) and Random Forest algorithm : The case of Huizhou , China .
the significant economic development witnessed in China in recent decade has been accompanied by the increasing expansion of urban area .

although a growing literature has analyzed the characteristic and driving force of urban land expansion , less attention has been paid to examining the different expansion determinant driving fine-scale urban land use ( residential land , administration and public service land , commercial land , and industrial land ) change .
this paper aims to identify the difference of multi-mechanisms driving fine-scale urban land use expansion based on big data and machine learning , in the Huizhou downtown area in 2000–2015 .
the Random Forest ( RF ) algorithm is used to identify the natural , transportation , location , social , and POI factor driving land expansion by considering different urban land-use category .

our RF estimation showed that enormous difference existed between various urban land-use type in term of the role they played in this expansion and their relation to potential determinant , during the different urban development stage studied .
transportation , location , and the distribution of actual land use were found to exert a greater influence on urban land expansion than other factor .
all the finding above provide detailed spatiotemporal knowledge and targeted information that can aid in understanding fine-scale urban land use dynamic .
in this way , sound planning strategy for different fine-scale land use can be formulated more scientifically .

the strength of association between these factor and urban land expansion differed greatly depending on the different land-use type involved as well as the urban development stage that it occurred within .
these result cast a new light on the importance of investigating the potential driving force in the expansion of different urban land-use type .
sustainable development scale of housing estate : An economic assessment using machine learning approach .
economic sustainability is often addressed from the perspective of economic growth and at the national level .
in contrast , this research attempts to examine the question of economic sustainability of human settlement at a local project level .
urban planner need to strike a balance between dispersal and over-concentration of population in city .
the existing theory suggest that either excessively low or extremely high level of household concentration is undesirable to a neighborhood .

in this study , an economic assessment using machine learning ( ML ) technique is used to identify the threshold scale of a housing estate , which comprises many privately owned residential unit ( like condos ) with shared amenity .
using two decade of property transaction data in Hong Kong as our evidence , this study has found that a tipping point exists in the development scale of these housing estate .
housing value initially rise with the number of residential unit in a housing estate but gradually fall when it increases beyond a critical limit .

this nonlinear economic relationship is attributed to the per household share of common facility , which does not increase sufficiently to match with the growing population density of the housing estate .

the policy implication is that , to optimize housing supply , urban planning should not just focus on increasing the development bulk of housing but should also pay attention to the possible bottleneck in the provision of shared amenity in the neighborhood .
regional population forecast and analysis based on machine learning strategy .

regional population forecast and analysis is of essence to urban and regional planning , and a well-designed plan can effectively construct a sound national infrastructure and stabilize positive population growth .
traditionally , either urban or regional planning relie on the opinion of demographer in term of how the population of a city or a region will grow .
multi-regional population forecast is currently possible , carried out mainly on the basis of the Interregional Cohort-Component model .
while this model has its unique advantage , several demographic rate are determined based on the decision made by primary planner .

hence , the only drawback for cohort-component type population forecasting is allowing the analyst to specify the demographic rate of the future , and it goes without saying that this tends to introduce a biased result in forecasting accuracy .
to effectively avoid this problem , this work proposes a machine learning-based method to forecast multi-regional population growth objectively .
thus , this work , drawing upon the newly developed machine learning technology , attempt to analyze and forecast the population growth of major city in Taiwan .

by effectively using the advantage of the XGBoost algorithm , the evaluation of feature importance and the forecast of multi-regional population growth between the present and the near future can be observed objectively , and it can further provide an objective reference to the urban planning of regional population .
predictive model using “ cheap and easy ” field measurement : Can they fill a gap in planning , monitoring , and implementing fecal sludge management solution ?
the characteristic of fecal sludge delivered to treatment plant are highly variable .
adapting treatment process operation accordingly is challenging due to a lack of analytical capacity for characterization and monitoring at many treatment plant .
cost-efficient and simple field measurement such as photographs and probe reading could be proxy for process control parameter that normally require laboratory analysis .
to investigate this , we evaluated questionnaire data , expert assessment , and simple analytical measurement for fecal sludge collected from 421 onsite containment .
this data served as input to model of varying complexity .

random forest and linear regression model were able to predict physical-chemical characteristic including total solid ( TS ) and ammonium ( NH4+-N ) concentration , and solid-liquid separation performance including settling efficiency and filtration time ( R2 from 0.51-0.66 ) based on image analysis of photographs ( sludge color , supernatant color , and texture ) and probe reading ( conductivity ( EC ) and pH ) .
supernatant color was the best predictor of settling efficiency and filtration time , EC was the best predictor of NH4+-N , and texture was the best predictor of TS .
predictive model have the potential to be applied for real-time monitoring and process control if a database of measurement is developed and model are validated in other city .
simple decision tree model based on the single classifier of containment type can also be used to make prediction about citywide planning , where a lower degree of accuracy is required .
review of machine learning technique for mosquito control in urban environment .
machine learning ( ML ) techniques excel at forecasting , clustering , and classification task , making them valuable for various aspect of mosquito control .
in this literature review , we selected 120 paper relevant to the current state of ML for mosquito control in urban setting .
the reviewed work covers several different methodology , objective , and evaluation criterion from various environmental contexts .
we first divided the existing paper into geospatial , visual , or audio category .
for each category , we analyzed the machine learning pipeline , from dataset creation to model performance .
we conclude with a discussion of the challenge and opportunity for further research .

while the reviewed ML method in mosquito control are promising , we recommend a ) increased use of crowdsourced and citizen science data , b ) a standardized and open ML pipeline for reproducible result , and c ) research that incorporates advance in ML .
with these suggestion , ML technique could lead to effective mosquito control in urban environment .
a glimpse into the future of exposure and vulnerability in city ?
modelling of residential location choice of urban population with random forest .
the most common approach to assessing natural hazard risk is investigating the willingness to pay in the presence or absence of such risk .
in this work , we propose a new , machine-learning-based , indirect approach to the problem , i.e .
through residential-choice modelling .

especially in urban environment , exposure and vulnerability are highly dynamic risk component , both being shaped by a complex and continuous reorganization and redistribution of asset within the urban space , including the ( re- ) location of urban dweller .
by modelling residential-choice behaviour in the city of Leipzig , Germany , we seek to examine how exposure and vulnerability are shaped by the residential-location-choice process .
the proposed approach reveal hot spot and cold spot of residential choice for distinct socioeconomic group exhibiting heterogeneous preference .

we discuss the relationship between observed pattern and disaster risk through the len of exposure and vulnerability , as well as link to urban planning , and explore how the proposed methodology may contribute to predicting future trend in exposure , vulnerability , and risk through this analytical focus .
Avenue for future research include the operational strengthening of these linkage for more effective disaster risk management .
machine Learning Predictors for Sustainable Urban Planning .
while essential for economic reason , rapid urbanization has had many negative impact on the environment and the social wellbeing of humanity .
heavy traffic , unexpected geohazard are some of the effect of uncontrollable development .

this situation points its fingerto urban planning and design ; there are numerous automation tool to help urban planner assess and forecast , yet unplanned development still occurs , impeding sustainability .
automation tool use machine learning classification model to analyze spatial data and various trend view before planning a new urban development .

although there are many sophisticated tool and massive dataset , big city with colossal migration still witness traffic jam , pollution , and environmental degradation affecting urban dweller ’ quality .
this study will analyze the current predictor in urban planning machine learning model and identify the suitable predictor to support sustainable urban planning .
a correct set of predictor could improve the efficiency of the urban development classification model and help urban planner to enhance the quality of life in big city .
analysis of built-up area of small polish city with the use of deep learning and geographically weighted regression .
small city are an important part of the settlement system , a link between rural area and large city .

although they perform important function , research focuses on large city and metropolis while marginalizing small city , the study of which is of great importance to progress in social science , geography , and urban planning .
the main goal of this paper was to verify the impact of selected socio-economic factor on the share of built-up area in 665 small Polish city in 2019 .
data from the Database of Topographic Objects ( BDOT ) , Sentinel-2 satellite imagery from 2015 and 2019 , and Local Data Bank by Statistics Poland form 2019 were used in the research .
a machine learning segmentation procedure was used to obtain the data on the occurrence of built-up area .

hot Spot ( Getis-Ord Gi * ) analysis and geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) was applied to explain spatially varying impact of factor related to population , spatial and economic development , and living standard on the share of built-up area in the area of small city .
significant association was found between the population density and the share of built-up area in the area of the city studied .
the influence of the other socio-economic factor examined , related to the spatial and economic development of the city and the quality of life of the inhabitant , showed great regional variation .

the result also indicated that the share of built-up area in the area of the city under study is a result of the condition under which they were established and developed throughout their existence , and not only of the socio-economic factor affecting them at present .
analyzing the spatiotemporal uncertainty in urbanization prediction .

with the availability of computational resource , geographical information system , and remote sensing data , urban growth modeling has become a viable tool for predicting urbanization of city and Town , region , and nation around the world .

this information allows policy maker , urban planner , environmental and civil organization to make investment , design infrastructure , extend public utility network , plan housing solution , and mitigate adverse environmental impact .
despite its importance , urban growth model often discard the spatiotemporal uncertainty in their prediction estimate .

in this paper , we analyzed the uncertainty in the urban land prediction by comparing the outcome of two different growth model , one based on a widely applied cellular automata model known as the SLEUTH CA and the other one based on a previously published machine learning framework .

we selected these two model because they are complementary , the first is based on human knowledge and pre-defined and understandable policy while the second is more data-driven and might be less influenced by any a priori knowledge or bias .

to test our methodology , we chose the city of Jiaxing and Lishui in China because they are representative of new town planning policy and have different characteristic in term of land extension , geographical condition , growth rate , and economic driver .

we focused on the spatiotemporal uncertainty , understood as the inherent doubt in the prediction of where and when will a piece of land become urban , using the concept of certainty area in space and certainty area in time .
the proposed analysis in this paper aim to contribute to better urban planning exercise , and they can be extended to other city worldwide .
urban population distribution mapping with multisource geospatial data based on zonal strategy .
mapping population distribution at fine resolution with high accuracy is crucial to urban planning and management .

this paper takes Guangzhou city as the study area , illustrates the gridded population distribution map by using machine learning method based on zoning strategy with multisource geospatial data such as night light remote sensing data , point of interest data , land use data , and so on .

the street-level accuracy evaluation result show that the proposed approach achieved good overall accuracy , with determinant coefficient ( R2 ) being 0.713 and root mean square error ( RMSE ) being 5512.9 .
meanwhile , the goodness of fit for single linear regression ( LR ) model and random forest ( RF ) regression model are 0.0039 and 0.605 , respectively .

for dense area , the accuracy of the random forest model is better than the linear regression model , while for sparse area , the accuracy of the linear regression model is better than the random forest model .
the result indicated that the proposed method has great potential in fine-scale population mapping .
therefore , it is advised that the zonal modeling strategy should be the primary choice for solving regional difference in the population distribution mapping research .
exploring different combination of data and method for urban land use analysis : A survey .

modern planning and management of urban space is an essential topic for smart city and depends on up-to-date and reliable information on land use and functional role of the Place that integrate urban area .
in the last year , driven by increased availability of geo-referenced data from social or embedded sensor and remote sensing ( RS ) image , various method become popular for land use analysis .
this paper addresses the various method employed in this context , as well as needed data and respective categorization , best application of each method , and their comparison .
we focus on approach based on data from RS image , open map and various category of crowdsourced data .
we identify and discuss the way these approach use Data Mining ( DM ) and Machine Learning ( ML ) .
from our initial study we concluded that even using the same method and the same kind of data , result depend on spatial configuration of the data , accordingly to the specificity of each region .

the work described in this paper is intended to provide relevant contribution to method selection for knowledge discovery for city planning and management , taking into consideration available data and the pro and con of each technique .
urban sprawl modeling of Lahore , Pakistan using machine learning technique .

population is the fundamental concentration because population is related with all resource and urban sprawl , an effect of socioeconomic improvement in specific condition , has progressively turned into a noteworthy issue confronting numerous metropolitan zone .
this is very essential to understand the significant factor affecting the population .
this research analyzed the spatial and temporal characteristic of metropolitan city Lahore , Pakistan .
supervised classification method is applied to examine the urban expansion and to evaluate signature of Lahore city into four category ( urban , vegetation , bare land and water bodie ) .

for the land cover change analysis and to predict the urban sprawl in future different technique and method can be used and out of numerous , geospatial technique like ( MOLUSCE ) QGIS plug-in , GIS along with remote sensing is used .
in this study , Landsat V and VIII satellite image of 1998 , 2008 and 2017 were used to classify the urban expansion .
the precision appraisal was completed for characterized map .
distinctive image Transition probability matrix and region change were acquired by utilizing plug-in created in QGIS and future year 2036 urban expansion was obtained .
in this study , an attempt was made to develop a relationship between urban sprawl and population of Lahore .
in light of accessible informational index , from 2017 to 2036 the change in urban area is 40 % while a 367.02 sq.km loss in vegetation is chronicled .
the majority of the urban sprawl occurred along primary roadway .
the outcome demonstrates that urban region is relied upon to develop substantially higher in the year 2036 when contrasted with 2017 .
this analysis gives awareness of urban development and support in macro and micro level urban planning , policy making in metropolitan city .
urban inefficient industrial land recognition system based on augmented learning model .
from a salient point of view , urban planning has a significant impact on the expansion of the residential , industrial and commercial land .

land planning has a positive impact on the development of residential land but negatively affects the expansion of industrial , commercial and mining land , that is to say , the plot planned for construction land has a lower probability of transforming into construction land , which is not in line with common sense , indicating that the compilation of the land planning is far from the expansion of actual construction land .
therefore , this paper presents the urban inefficient industrial land recognition system based on augmented learning model .

we adopt endogenous optimization method to determine the weight of each input factor , do not need to estimate parameter in advance , no correlation requirement to input and output variable , avoiding the input-output relationship of the expression and the index weight to determine the specific functional form of subjectivity .
with this model , the urban planning model is then optimized to satisfy the general requirement .
feature selection and knowledge extraction from buppu 2000 and 2010 census using artificial intelligence .
the census of population and dwelling undertaken by national state institution world over at regular time interval , is a fantastic source of information .
however , there are major challenge to overcome when transforming the census data that usually consists of a vast number of attribute , into useful knowledge .
in this paper , an artificial intelligent approach is investigated to select appropriate attribute feature that indicate interesting pattern in Beppu census ward in 2000 and 2010 .

the result of the SOM ( unsupervised artificial neural network ) based clustering , GIS visualisation and machine learning ( J48 and JRip function of WEKA ) , provide relevant discerning feature , new pattern and new knowledge that can be of use in many application domain , such as urban planning , resource management and transport planning .
spectral-spatial Residual Network for Hyperspectral Image Classification : A 3-D Deep Learning Framework .
in this paper , we designed an end-to-end spectral-spatial residual network ( SSRN ) that takes raw 3-D cube as input data without feature engineering for hyperspectral image classification .
in this network , the spectral and spatial residual block consecutively learn discriminative feature from abundant spectral signature and spatial contexts in hyperspectral imagery ( HSI ) .
the proposed SSRN is a supervised deep learning framework that alleviates the declining-accuracy phenomenon of other deep learning model .
specifically , the residual block connect every other 3-D convolutional layer through identity mapping , which facilitates the backpropagation of gradient .
furthermore , we impose batch normalization on every convolutional layer to regularize the learning process and improve the classification performance of trained model .

quantitative and qualitative result demonstrate that the SSRN achieved the state-of-the-art HSI classification accuracy in agricultural , rural-urban , and urban data set : Indian Pines , Kennedy Space Center , and University of Pavia .
building detection in very high resolution multispectral data with deep learning feature .

the automated man-made object detection and building extraction from single satellite image is , still , one of the most challenging task for various urban planning and monitoring engineering application .
to this end , in this paper we propose an automated building detection framework from very high resolution remote sensing data based on deep convolutional neural network .
the core of the developed method is based on a supervised classification procedure employing a very large training dataset .
an MRF model is then responsible for obtaining the optimal label regarding the detection of scene building .
the experimental result and the performed quantitative validation indicate the quite promising potential of the developed approach .
using convolutional network and satellite imagery to identify pattern in urban environment at a large scale .
urban planning application ( energy audit , investment , etc . )
require an understanding of built infrastructure and its environment , i.e.
, both low-level , physical feature ( amount of vegetation , building area and geometry etc . )
, as well as higher-level concept such as land use class ( which encode expert understanding of socioeconomic end uses ) .
this kind of data is expensive and labor-intensive to obtain , which limits its availability ( particularly in developing countrie ) .

we analyze pattern in land use in urban neighborhood using large-scale satellite imagery data ( which is available worldwide from third-party provider ) and state-of-the-art computer vision technique based on deep convolutional neural network .

for supervision , given the limited availability of standard benchmark for remote-sensing data , we obtain ground truth land use class label carefully sampled from open-source survey , in particular the Urban Atlas land classification dataset of 20 land use classes across 300 European city .

we use this data to train and compare deep architecture which have recently shown good performance on standard computer vision task ( image classification and segmentation ) , including on geospatial data .
furthermore , we show that the deep representation extracted from satellite imagery of urban environment can be used to compare neighborhood across several city .
we make our dataset available for other machine learning researcher to use for remote-sensing application .
building type classification using spatial and landscape attribute derived from LiDAR remote sensing data .
building information is one of the key element for a range of urban planning and management practice .

in this study , an investigation was performed to classify building delineated from light detection and ranging ( LiDAR ) remote sensing data into three type : single-family house , multiple-family house , and non-residential building .
four kind of spatial attribute describing the shape , location , and surrounding environment of building were calculated and subsequently employed in the classification .
experiment were performed in suburban and downtown site in Denver , CO , USA , considering different building component and neighborhood environment .
building type classification result yielded overall accuracy > 70 % and Kappa > 0.5 for both site , demonstrating the feasibility of obtaining building type information from LiDAR data .
the shape attributes , such as width , footprint area , and perimeter , were most useful for identifying building type .
environmental landscape attributes surrounding building , such as the number of road and parking lot pixel , also contributed to obtaining building type information .
combining shape and environmental landscape attribute was necessary to obtain accurate and consistent classification result .
urban land use and land cover classification using remotely sensed sar data through deep belief network .
land use and land cover ( LULC ) mapping in urban area is one of the core application in remote sensing , and it plays an important role in modern urban planning and management .
deep learning is springing up in the field of machine learning recently .
by mimicking the hierarchical structure of the human brain , deep learning can gradually extract feature from lower level to higher level .
the Deep Belief Networks ( DBN ) model is a widely investigated and deployed deep learning architecture .
it combines the advantage of unsupervised and supervised learning and can archive good classification performance .
this study proposes a classification approach based on the DBN model for detailed urban mapping using polarimetric synthetic aperture radar ( PolSAR ) data .
through the DBN model , effective contextual mapping feature can be automatically extracted from the PolSAR data to improve the classification performance .
two-date high-resolution RADARSAT-2 PolSAR data over the Great Toronto Area were used for evaluation .

comparison with the support vector machine ( SVM ) , conventional neural network ( NN ) , and stochastic Expectation-Maximization ( SEM ) were conducted to assess the potential of the DBN-based classification approach .
experimental result show that the DBN-based method outperform three other approach and produces homogenous mapping result with preserved shape detail .
improving Spatial Feature Representation from Aerial Scenes by Using Convolutional Networks .
the performance of image classification is highly dependent on the quality of extracted feature .
concerning high resolution remote image image , encoding the spatial feature in an efficient and robust fashion is the key to generating discriminatory model to classify them .

even though many visual descriptor have been proposed or successfully used to encode spatial feature of remote sensing image , some application , using this sort of image , demand more specific description technique .

deep Learning , an emergent machine learning approach based on neural network , is capable of learning specific feature and classifier at the same time and adjust at each step , in real time , to better fit the need of each problem .

for several task , such image classification , it has achieved very good result , mainly boosted by the feature learning performed which allows the method to extract specific and adaptable visual feature depending on the data .
in this paper , we propose a novel network capable of learning specific spatial feature from remote sensing image , with any pre-processing step or descriptor evaluation , and classify them .
specifically , automatic feature learning task aim at discovering hierarchical structure from the raw data , leading to a more representative information .

this task not only poses interesting challenge for existing vision and recognition algorithms , but also brings huge opportunity for urban planning , crop and forest management and climate modelling .
the propose convolutional neural network has six layer : three convolutional , two fully-connected and one classifier layer .
so , the five first layer are responsible to extract visual feature while the last one is responsible to classify the image .

we conducted a systematic evaluation of the proposed method using two dataset : ( i ) the popular aerial image dataset UCMerced Land-use and , ( ii ) a multispectral high-resolution scene of the Brazilian Coffee Scenes .
the experiment show that the proposed method outperforms state-of-the-art algorithm in term of overall accuracy .
building block level urban land-use information retrieval based on Google Street View image .
land-use map are important reference for urban planning and urban study .
given the heterogeneity of urban land-use type , it is difficult to differentiate different land-use type based on overhead remotely sensed data .

google Street View ( GSV ) image , which capture the façade of building block along Street , could be better used to judge the land-use type of different building block based on their façade appearance .

recently developed scene classification algorithms in computer vision community make it possible to categorize different photo semantically based on various image feature descriptor and machine-learning algorithms .
therefore , in this study , we proposed a method to derive detailed land-use information at building block level based on scene classification algorithms and GSV image .
three image feature descriptor ( i.e.
, scale-invariant feature transform-Fisher , histogram of oriented gradient , GIST ) were used to represent GSV image of different building .
existing land-use map were used to create training dataset to train support vector machine ( SVM ) classifier for categorizing GSV image .
the trained SVM classifier were then applied to case study area in New York City , Boston , and Houston , to predict the land-use information at building block level .
accuracy assessment result show that the proposed method is suitable for differentiating residential building and nonresidential building with an accuracy of 85 % or so .
since the GSV image are publicly accessible , this proposed method would provide a new way for building block level land-use mapping in future .
building detection from orthophotos using a machine learning approach : An empirical study on image segmentation and descriptor .
building detection from aerial image has many application in Field like urban planning , real-estate management , and disaster relief .
in the last two decade , a large variety of method on automatic building detection have been proposed in the remote sensing literature .
many of these approach make use of local feature to classify each pixel or segment to an object label , therefore involving an extra step to fuse pixelwise decision .

this paper presents a generic framework that exploits recent advance in image segmentation and region descriptor extraction for the automatic and accurate detection of building on aerial orthophotos .
the proposed solution is supervised in the sense that appearance of building are learnt from example .
for the first time in the context of building detection , we use the matrix covariance descriptor , which proves to be very informative and compact .
moreover , we introduce a principled evaluation that allows selecting the best pair segmentation algorithm-region descriptor for the task of building detection .
finally , we provide a performance evaluation at pixel level using different classifier .
this evaluation is conducted over 200 building using different segmentation algorithms and descriptor .
the performance analysis quantifies the quality of both the image segmentation and the descriptor used .
the proposed approach presents several advantage in term of scalability , suitability and simplicity with respect to the existing method .

furthermore , the proposed scheme ( detection chain and evaluation ) can be deployed for detecting multiple object category that are present in image and can be used by intelligent system requiring scene perception and parsing such as intelligent unmanned aerial vehicle navigation and automatic 3D city modeling .
a supervoxel-based spectro-spatial approach for 3D urban point cloud labelling .
abstract : Three-dimensional ( 3D ) point cloud labelling of airborne lidar ( light detection and ranging ) data has promising application in urban city modelling .
automatic and efficient method for semantic labelling of airborne urban point cloud data with multiple class still remains a challenge .
we propose a novel 3D object-based classification framework for labelling urban lidar point cloud using a computer vision technique , supervoxel .
the supervoxel approach is promising for representing dense lidar point cloud in a compact manner for 3D segmentation and for improving the computational efficiency .
initially , supervoxel are generated by over-segmenting the coloured point cloud using the voxel-based cloud connectivity algorithm in the geometric space .
the local connectivity established between supervoxel has been used to produce meaningful and realistic object ( segment ) .
the segment are classified by different machine learning technique based on several spectral and geometric feature extracted from the segment .
all the point within a labelled segment are assigned the same segment label .
furthermore , the effect of different feature vector and varying point density on the classification accuracy has been studied .
result indicate an accurate labelling of point in realistic 3D space conforming to the boundary of object .
an overall classification accuracy of 90 % is achieved by the proposed method .
the labelled 3D point can be used directly for the reconstruction of building and other man-made object .
conditional random field for 3D point cloud with adaptive data reduction .
we proposed using Conditional Random Fields with adaptive data reduction for the classification of 3D point cloud acquired from a Riegl Terrestrial laser scanner .
the training and inference of the acquired large outdoor urban data can be time consuming .
we approach the problem by computing an adaptive support region for each data point using 3D scale theory .

for training and inference of the discriminative Conditional Random Fields , smaller set of data sample that contains relevant information within the support region is selected instead of using all point cloud data .
we tested the algorithm on synthetically generated data and urban point cloud data acquired from the laser scanner .
the computed support region is also used in feature extraction for urban point cloud data .
the result showed improvement in the training and inference rate while maintaining comparable classification accuracy .
change detection based on artificial intelligence : State-of-the-art and challenge .

change detection based on remote sensing ( RS ) data is an important method of detecting change on the Earth 's surface and has a wide range of application in urban planning , environmental monitoring , agriculture investigation , disaster assessment , and map revision .
in recent year , integrated artificial intelligence ( AI ) technology has become a research focus in developing new change detection method .

although some researcher claim that AI-based change detection approach outperform traditional change detection approach , it is not immediately obvious how and to what extent AI can improve the performance of change detection .
this review focuses on the state-of-the-art method , application , and challenge of AI for change detection .
specifically , the implementation process of AI-based change detection is first introduced .

then , the data from different sensor used for change detection , including optical RS data , synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) data , street view image , and combined heterogeneous data , are presented , and the available open dataset are also listed .
the general framework of AI-based change detection method are reviewed and analyzed systematically , and the unsupervised scheme used in AI-based change detection are further analyzed .
subsequently , the commonly used network in AI for change detection are described .
from a practical point of view , the application domain of AI-based change detection method are classified based on their applicability .

finally , the major challenge and prospect of AI for change detection are discussed and delineated , including ( a ) heterogeneous big data processing , ( b ) unsupervised AI , and ( c ) the reliability of AI .
this review will be beneficial for researcher in understanding this field .
building extraction from LiDAR data applying deep convolutional neural network .

deep learning paradigm has been shown to be a very efficient classification framework for many application scenario , including the analysis of Light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) data for building detection .
in fact , deep learning act as a set of mathematical transformation , encoding the raw input data into appropriate form of representation that maximize the classification performance .

however , it is clear that mathematical computation alone , even highly nonlinear , are not adequate to model the physical property of a problem , distinguishing , for example , the building structure from vegetation .
in this letter , we address this difficulty by augmenting the raw LiDAR data with feature coming from a physical interpretation of the information .
then , we exploit a deep learning paradigm based on a convolutional neural network model to find out the best input representation suitable for the classification .
as test site , three complex urban study area with various kind of building structure through the LiDAR data set of Vaihingen , Germany were selected .
our method has been evaluated in the context of 'ISPRS Test Project on Urban Classification and 3-D Building Reconstruction . '

comparison with traditional method , such as artificial neural network and support vector machine-based classifier , indicate the outperformance of the proposed approach in term of robustness and efficiency .
local climate zone mapping as remote sensing scene classification using deep learning : A case study of metropolitan China .
china , with the world 's largest population , has gone through rapid development in the last forty year and now has over 800 million urban citizen .
although urbanization lead to great social and economic progress , they may be confronted with other issue , including extra heat and air pollution .
local climate zone ( LCZ ) , a new concept developed for urban heat island research , provides a standard classification system for the urban environment .
lcz are defined by the context of the urban environment ; the minimum diameter of an LCZ is expected to be 400–1,000 m so that it can have a valid effect on the urban climate .
however , most existing method ( e.g.
, the WUDAPT method ) regard this task as pixel-based classification , neglecting the spatial information .
in this study , we argue that LCZ mapping should be considered as a scene classification task to fully exploit the environmental context .
fifteen city covering 138 million population in three economic region of China are selected as the study area .
sentinel-2 multispectral data with a 10 m spatial resolution are used to classify LCZs .
a deep convolutional neural network composed of residual learning and the Squeeze-and-Excitation block , namely the LCZNet , is proposed .

we obtained an overall accuracy of 88.61 % by using a large image ( 48×48 corresponding to 480×480 m2 ) as the representation of an LCZ , 7.5 % higher than that using a small image representation ( 10×10 ) and nearly 20 % higher than that obtained by the standard WUDAPT method .
image size from 32×32 to 64×64 were found suitable for LCZ mapping , while a deeper network achieved better classification with larger input .
compared with natural class , urban class benefited more from a large input size , as it can exploit the environment context of urban area .
the combined use of the training data from all three region led to the best classification , but the transfer of LCZ model can not achieve satisfactory result due to the domain shift .
more advanced domain adaptation method should be applied in this application .
multiscale road centerline extraction from high-resolution aerial imagery .
accurate road extraction from high-resolution aerial imagery has many application such as urban planning and vehicle navigation system .
the common road extraction method are based on classification algorithm , which needs to design robust handcrafted feature for road .
however , designing such feature is difficult .
for the road centerlines extraction problem , the existing algorithms have some limitation , such as spur , time consuming .

to address the above issue to some extent , we introduce the feature learning based on deep learning to extract robust feature automatically , and present a method to extract road centerline based on multiscale Gabor filter and multiple directional non-maximum suppression .
the proposed algorithm consists of the following four step .
firstly , the aerial imagery is classified by a pixel-wise classifier based on convolutional neural network ( CNN ) .
specifically , CNN is used to learn feature from raw data automatically , especially the structural feature .
then , edge-preserving filtering is conducted on the resulting classification map , with the original imagery serving as the guidance image .
it is exploited to preserve the edge and the detail of the road .
after that , we do some post-processing based on shape feature to extract more reliable Road .
finally , multiscale Gabor filter and multiple directional non-maximum suppression are integrated to get a complete and accurate road network .
experimental result show that the proposed method can achieve comparable or higher quantitative result , as well as more satisfactory visual performance .
progressively Expanded Neural Network ( PEN Net ) for hyperspectral image classification : A new neural network paradigm for remote sensing image analysis .
hyperspectral image ( HSI ) has been used for a wide range of application including forestry , urban planning , and precision agriculture .
in recent year , machine learning based algorithms , such as support vector machine , decision tree , ensemble learning , and their variation have shown promising result in HSI analysis .
such methodology , nevertheless , can lead to insufficient information abstraction in interpreting hyperspectral pixel .

in this paper , we propose a novel neural network based classification algorithm , named Progressively Expanded Neural Network ( PEN Net ) , that can effectively interpret hyperspectral pixel in nonlinear feature space and then determine their category .
furthermore , a spectral-spatial HSI classification framework is also introduced to test the generality and robustness of the PEN Net .

experimental result on four standard hyperspectral dataset illustrate that : ( 1 ) PEN Net classifier yield better accuracy and competitive processing speed in HSI classification task compared to the state-of-the-art method ; ( 2 ) Multi-hidden layer based PEN Net generally provides better performance than single hidden layer one ; ( 3 ) Combination of spectral and spatial feature in the PEN Net classifier can significantly improve the classification accuracy by 6–15 % compared to the spectral only based HSI classification .
this study implies that the proposed neural network architecture opens a new window for future research and the potential for remote sensing image analysis .
road centerline extraction from very-high-resolution aerial image and LiDAR data based on road connectivity .
the road network provide key information for a broad range of application such as urban planning , urban management , and navigation .
the fast-developing technology of remote sensing that acquires high-resolution observational data of the land surface offers opportunity for automatic extraction of road network .
however , the road network extracted from remote sensing image are likely affected by Shadow and tree , making the road map irregular and inaccurate .
this research aims to improve the extraction of road centerline using both very-high-resolution ( VHR ) aerial image and light detection and ranging ( LiDAR ) by accounting for road connectivity .

the proposed method first applies the fractal net evolution approach ( FNEA ) to segment remote sensing image into image object and then classifie image objects using the machine learning classifier , random forest .
a post-processing approach based on the minimum area bounding rectangle ( MABR ) is proposed and a structure feature index is adopted to obtain the complete road network .

finally , a multistep approach , that is , morphology thinning , Harris corner detection , and least square fitting ( MHL ) approach , is designed to accurately extract the road centerline from the complex road network .

the proposed method is applied to three dataset , including the New York dataset obtained from the object identification dataset , the Vaihingen dataset obtained from the International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing ( ISPRS ) 2D semantic labelling benchmark and Guangzhou dataset .
compared with two state-of-the-art method , the proposed method can obtain the highest completeness , correctness , and quality for the three dataset .
the experiment result show that the proposed method is an efficient solution for extracting road centerline in complex scene from VHR aerial image and light detection and ranging ( LiDAR ) data .
object-based detection of vehicle using combined optical and elevation data .
the detection of vehicle is an important and challenging topic that is relevant for many application .
in this work , we present a workflow that utilizes optical and elevation data to detect vehicle in remotely sensed urban data .
this workflow consists of three consecutive stage : candidate identification , classification , and single vehicle extraction .
unlike in most previous approach , fusion of both data source is strongly pursued at all stage .
while the first stage utilizes the fact that most man-made object are rectangular in shape , the second and third stage employ machine learning technique combined with specific feature .
the stage are designed to handle multiple sensor input , which result in a significant improvement .

a detailed evaluation shows the benefit of our workflow , which includes hand-tailored feature ; even in comparison with classification approach based on Convolutional Neural Networks , which are state of the art in computer vision , we could obtain a comparable or superior performance ( F1 score of 0.96–0.94 ) .
ensemble method for binary classification of airborne LIDAR data .

this paper presents a framework that is aimed at improving the performance of two existing ensemble method ( namely , AdaBoost and Bagging ) for airborne light detection and ranging ( LIDAR ) classification .
lidar is one of the fastest growing technology to support a multitude of civil engineering application , such as transportation , urban planning , flood control , and city 3D reconstruction .
for the above application , LIDAR data need to be classified into binary class ( i.e.
, terrain and nonterrain ) or multiple class ( e.g.
, ground , vegetation , and building ) .
the proposed framework is designed to enhance the generalization performance of binary classification approach by minimizing type II error .
the author developed and tested the framework on different LIDAR data set representing geographic site in Germany and the United States .
the result showed that the proposed ensemble framework performed better compared to the existing method .
in addition , the AdaBoost method outperformed the Bagging method on all the terrain type .
however , the framework has some limitation in term of dealing with rough terrain and discontinuous surface .
aerial point cloud classification with deep learning and machine learning algorithms .
with recent advance in technology , 3D point cloud are getting more and more frequently requested and used , not only for visualization need but also e.g .
by public administration for urban planning and management .

3d point cloud are also a very frequent source for generating 3D city model which became recently more available for many application , such as urban development plan , energy evaluation , navigation , visibility analysis and numerous other GIS study .
while the main data source remained the same ( namely aerial photogrammetry and LiDAR ) , the way these city model are generated have been evolving toward automation with different approach .
as most of these approach are based on point cloud with proper semantic class , our aim is to classify aerial point cloud into meaningful semantic class , e.g .
ground level object ( GLO , including Road and pavement ) , vegetation , building ' facade and building ' roofs .
in this study we tested and evaluated various machine learning algorithms for classification , including three deep learning algorithms and one machine learning algorithm .
in the experiment , several hand-crafted geometric feature depending on the dataset are used and , unconventionally , these geometric feature are used also for deep learning .
self-supervised feature learning for semantic segmentation of overhead imagery .
overhead imagerie play a crucial role in many application such as urban planning , crop yield forecasting , mapping , and policy making .
semantic segmentation could enable automatic , efficient , and large-scale understanding of overhead imagerie for these application .

however , semantic segmentation of overhead imagerie is a challenging task , primarily due to the large domain gap from existing research in ground imagerie , unavailability of large-scale dataset with pixel-level annotation , and inherent complexity in the task .

readily available vast amount of unlabeled overhead imagerie share more common structure and pattern compared to the ground imagerie , therefore , its large-scale analysis could benefit from unsupervised feature learning technique .
in this work , we study various self-supervised feature learning technique for semantic segmentation of overhead imagerie .
we choose image semantic inpainting as a self-supervised task [ 36 ] for our experiment due to its proximity to the semantic segmentation task .

we ( i ) show that existing approach are inefficient for semantic segmentation , ( ii ) propose architectural change towards self-supervised learning for semantic segmentation , ( iii ) propose an adversarial training scheme for self-supervised learning by increasing the pretext task 's difficulty gradually and show that it leads to learning better feature , and ( iv ) propose a unified approach for overhead scene parsing , road network extraction , and land cover estimation .
our approach improves over training from scratch by more than 10 % and ImageNet pre-trained network by more than 5 % mIOU .
a locally-constrained YOLO framework for detecting small and densely-distributed building footprint .
building footprint are among the most predominant feature in urban area , and provide valuable information for urban planning , solar energy suitability analysis , etc .
we aim to automatically and rapidly identify building footprint by leveraging deep learning technique and the increased availability of remote sensing dataset at high spatial resolution .
the task is computationally challenging due to the use of large training dataset and large number of parameter .
in related work , You-Only-Look-Once ( YOLO ) is a state-of-the-art deep learning framework for object detection .
however , YOLO is limited in its capacity to identify small object that appear in group , which is the case for building footprint .
we propose a LOcally-COnstrained ( LOCO ) You-Only-Look-Once framework to detect small and densely-distributed building footprint .
loco is a variant of YOLO .
its layer architecture is determined by the spatial characteristic of building footprint and it uses a constrained regression modeling to improve the robustness of building size prediction .
we also present an invariant augmentation based voting scheme to further improve the precision in the prediction phase .
experiment show that LOCO can greatly improve the solution quality of building detection compared to related work .
a robust segmentation framework for closely packed building from airborne LiDAR point cloud .
urban village ( UVs ) are commonly found in many Asian city .
these village contain many closely packed building constructed decade ago without proper urban planning .
there is a need for those building to be identified and put into statistic .

in this paper , we present a segmentation framework that invokes multiple machine learning technique and point cloud/image processing algorithm to segment individual closely packed building from large urban scene .
the presented framework consists of two major segmentation process .
the framework first filters out the non-ground object from the point cloud , then it classified them by using the Random Forest classifier to isolate building from the entire scene .
