after that , the building point clouds will be segmented based on several building attribute analysis method .

this is followed by using the Random Sample Consensus ( RANSAC ) plane filtering method to expand the space between two closely packed building , so that the Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise ( DBSCAN ) clustering technique can be used to more accurately segment each individual building from the closely packed building area .
two airborne Light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) dataset collected in two different city with some typical closely packed building were used to verify the proposed framework .
the result show that the framework can effectively identify the closely packed building with unified structure from large airborne LiDAR dataset .
the overall segmentation accuracy reaches 84 % for the two dataset .
the proposed framework can serve as a basis for analysis and segmentation of closely packed building with a more complicated structure .
deep highway unit network for land cover type classification with GF-3 SAR imagery .

the fully polarized synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) is an advanced earth observation system with day and night imaging capability , which can obtain rich information of terrain and has a wide range of application in environmental protection , urban planning and resource investigation .
as the first selfdeveloped C-band multi-polarized SAR image , the acquisition of massive data and operational operation of Chinese SAR remote sensing has entered the era of big data .
under the era of remote sensing large data , however , SAR image interpretation is a great challenge for scientific application .
at present , big data-based intelligent method such as computer vision technology have achieved great success .
deep learning such as deep highway unit network has revolutionized the computer vision area .

however , due to the characteristic of SAR microwave band imaging and phase coherence processing , SAR image are very different from ordinary optical image in term of band , projection direction , data composition and so on .
therefore , deep learning can not be directly used for quad-pol SAR image classification .
in this paper , deep learning is applied to land cover type classification with GF-3 quad-pol SAR imagery .
a deep highway unit network is employed to automatically extract a hierarchic feature representation from the data , based on which the land cover type classification can be conducted .

our classification model is trained on limited training data from forest resource inventory and planning data , and tested on a Radarsat-2 quad-pol image , which is the image of the same area acquired at different time .
we also employ the machine learning such as SVM , Random Forest on the same sample for comparison .
the deep highway unit network trained by the GF-3 image , which can reduce speckle , fully excavate the regularity of SAR image in time and space .
mapping Urban Trees Within Cadastral Parcels Using an Object-Based Convolutional Neural Network .
urban tree offer significant benefit for improving the sustainability and liveability of city , but its monitoring is a major challenge for urban planner .
remote-sensing based technology can effectively detect , monitor and quantify urban tree coverage as an alternative to field-based measurement .
automatic extraction of urban land cover features with high accuracy is a challenging task and it demands artificial intelligence workflow for efficiency and thematic quality .

in this context , the objective of this research is to map urban tree coverage per cadastral parcel of Sandy Bay , Hobart from very high-resolution aerial orthophoto and LiDAR data using an Object Based Convolution Neural Network ( CNN ) approach .
instead of manual preparation of a large number of required training sample , automatically classified Object based image analysis ( OBIA ) output is used as an input sample to train CNN method .
also , CNN output is further refined and segmented using OBIA to assess the accuracy .
the result shows 93.2 % overall accuracy for refined CNN classification .
similarly , the overlay of improved CNN output with cadastral parcel layer shows that 21.5 % of the study area is covered by tree .
this research demonstrates that the accuracy of image classification can be improved by using a combination of OBIA and CNN method .
such a combined method can be used where manual preparation of training sample for CNN is not preferred .

also , our result indicate that the technique can be implemented to calculate parcel level statistic for urban tree coverage that provides meaningful metric to guide urban planning and land management practice .
3d shape descriptor for object recognition .
3d point cloud classification is an important task in application for many area such as robotic , urban planning and augmented reality .
3d sensor measure a high amount of point in the 3D scene object ' surface at a high collect rate , so robust technique are needed to process all input data and also deal with some imprecision .
a common solution for these task is the use of robust feature extraction technique to gather representative scene information at the lowest computational cost possible .
this paper presents a new approach for object recognition in 3D scene , using a novel 3D shape descriptor which is used as input for a supervised machine learning method .
proposed robust 3D feature is invariant to translation and scale and provides a very simplified object representation for pattern recognition input .

experiment were performed using an Artificial Neural Network to recognize six different object shape , and obtained result showed that the proposed method is a promising approach for object recognition in 3D scene .
attention-gate-based Encoder-Decoder Network for Automatical Building Extraction .
rapidly developing remote sensing technology provides massive data for urban planning , mapping , and disaster management .
as a carrier of human productive activity , building are essential to both urban dynamic monitoring and suburban construction inspection .
fully-convolutional-network-based method have provided a paradigm for automatically extracting building from high-resolution imagery .
however , high intraclass variance and complexity are two problem in building extraction .
it is hard to identify different scale of building by using a single receptive field .

for this purpose , in this article , we use the stable encoder- decoder architecture , combined with a grid-based attention gate and atrous spatial pyramid pooling module , to capture and restore feature progressively and effectively .
a modified ResNet50 encoder is also applied to extract feature .
the proposed method could learn gated feature and distinguish building from complex surrounding such as tree .
we evaluate our model on two building dataset , WHU aerial building dataset and our DB UAV rural building dataset .
experiment show that our model outperforms other five most recent model .
the result also exhibit great potential for extracting building with different scale and validate the effectiveness of deep learning in practical scenario .
satellite image spoofing : Creating remote sensing dataset with generative adversarial network .
the rise of Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) has brought up both opportunity and challenge for today 's evolving GIScience .
its ability in image classification , object detection and feature extraction has been frequently praised .
however , it may also apply for falsifying geospatial data .

to demonstrate the thrilling power of AI , this research explored the potential of deep learning algorithms in capturing geographic feature and creating fake satellite image according to the learned 'sense ' .

specifically , Generative Adversarial Networks ( GANs ) is used to capture geographic feature of a certain place from a group of web map and satellite image , and transfer the feature to another place .
corvallis is selected as the study area , and fake dataset with 'learned ' style from three big city ( i.e .
new York City , Seattle and Beijing ) are generated through CycleGAN .
the empirical result show that GANs can 'remember ' a certain 'sense of place ' and further apply that 'sense ' to another place .

with this paper , we would like to raise both public and GIScientists ' awareness in the potential occurrence of fake satellite image , and its impact on various geospatial application , such as environmental monitoring , urban planning , and land use development .
context-based Filtering of Noisy Labels for Automatic Basemap Updating from UAV Data .
unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) have the potential to obtain high-resolution aerial imagery at frequent interval , making them a valuable tool for urban planner who require up-to-date basemap .
supervised classification method can be exploited to translate the UAV data into such basemap .
however , these method require labeled training sample , the collection of which may be complex and time consuming .

existing spatial dataset can be exploited to provide the training label , but these often contain error due to difference in the date or resolution of the dataset from which these outdated label were obtained .

in this paper , we propose an approach for updating basemap using global and local contextual cue to automatically remove unreliable sample from the training set , and thereby , improve the classification accuracy .

using UAV dataset over Kigali , Rwanda , and Dar es Salaam , Tanzania , we demonstrate how the amount of mislabeled training sample can be reduced by 44.1 % and 35.5 % , respectively , leading to a classification accuracy of 92.1 % in Kigali and 91.3 % in Dar es Salaam .
to achieve the same accuracy in Dar es Salaam , between 50000 and 60000 manually labeled image segment would be needed .

this demonstrates that the proposed approach of using outdated spatial data to provide label and iteratively removing unreliable sample is a viable method for obtaining high classification accuracy while reducing the costly step of acquiring labeled training sample .
urban area extraction from multi sensor data based on machine learning and data fusion .
accurate urban area information is important for a variety of application , especially city planning and natural disaster prediction and management .
in recent year , extraction of urban structure from remotely sensed image has been extensively explored .
the key advantage of this imaging modality are reduction of surveying expense and time .
it also elevates restriction on ground survey .

thus far , much research typically extracts these structure from very high resolution satellite imagery , which are unfortunately of relatively poor spectral resolution , resulting in good precision yet moderate accuracy .

therefore , this paper investigates extraction of building from middle and high resolution satellite image by using spectral indice ( Normalized Difference Building Index : NDBI , Normalized Difference Vegetation Index : NDVI , Soil Adjustment Vegetation Index : SAVI , Modified Normalized Difference Index : MNDWI , and Global Environment Monitoring Index : GEMI ) by mean of various Machine Learning method ( Artificial Neural Network : ANN , K-Nearest Neighbor : KNN , and Support Vector Machine : SVM ) and Data Fusion ( i.e.
, Majority Voting ) .
herein empirical result suggested that suitable learning method for urban area extraction are in preferring order Data Fusion , SVM , KNN , and ANN .
their accuracy were 85.46 , 84.86 , 84.66 , and 84.91 % , respectively .
deep learning-based multi-feature semantic segmentation in building extraction from image of UAV photogrammetry .
building information is an essential part of geographic information system ( GIS ) application in urban planning and management .
however , it changes rapidly with economic growth .
unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) -based photogrammetry work well in this situation with its advantage of quick and high-resolution data updating .

in this paper , in order to improve building extraction accuracy in complex area where building are characterized by various pattern , complex structure , and unique style , we present a framework which applies deep learning ( DL ) semantic segmentation to UAV image with digital surface model ( DSM ) and visible-band difference vegetation index ( VDVI ) .
the result show that extraction accuracy improves .
the combination of red , green , blue ( RGB ) and VDVI band ( RGBVI ) can effectively distinguish the building area and vegetation .
the application of RGB with DSM band ( RGBD ) helps separate building from ground object .
the combination of RGB , DSM , and VDVI band ( RGBDVI ) can identify small building which are usually not high and covered partly by tree branch .
the proposed method is further applied to an open standard dataset to evaluate its robustness and result indicate an increased overall accuracy from RGB only ( 93 % ) to RGBD ( 97 % ) .
a generalized multi-task learning approach to stereo DSM filtering in urban area .
city model and height map of urban area serve as a valuable data source for numerous application , such as disaster management or city planning .
while this information is not globally available , it can be substituted by digital surface model ( DSMs ) , automatically produced from inexpensive satellite imagery .
however , stereo DSMs often suffer from noise and blur .
furthermore , they are heavily distorted by vegetation , which is of lesser relevance for most application .
such basic model can be filtered by convolutional neural network ( CNNs ) , trained on label derived from digital elevation model ( DEMs ) and 3D city model , in order to obtain a refined DSM .
we propose a modular multi-task learning concept that consolidates existing approach into a generalized framework .

our encoder-decoder model with shared encoder and multiple task-specific decoder leverage roof type classification as a secondary task and multiple objective including a conditional adversarial term .
the contributing single-objective loss are automatically weighted in the final multi-task loss function based on learned uncertainty estimate .
we evaluated the performance of specific instance of this family of network architecture .
our method consistently outperforms the state of the art on common data , both quantitatively and qualitatively , and generalizes well to a new dataset of an independent study area .
precise object detection using adversarially augmented local/global feature fusion .

object detection , which aims at recognizing or locating the object of interest in remote sensing imagery with high spatial resolution ( HSR ) , plays a significant role in many real-world scenario , e.g.
, environment monitoring , urban planning , civil infrastructure construction , disaster rescuing , and geographic image retrieval .
as a long-lasting challenging problem in both machine learning and geoinformatic community , many approach have been proposed to tackle it .
however , previous method always overlook the abundant information embedded in the HSR remote sensing image .
the effectiveness of these method , e.g.
, accuracy of detection , is therefore limited to some extent .
to overcome the mentioned challenge , in this paper , we propose a novel two-phase deep framework , dubbed GLGOD-Net , to effectively detect meaningful object in HSR image .
glgod-net firstly attempts to learn the enhanced deep representation from super-resolution image data .
fully utilizing the augmented image representation , GLGOD-Net then learns the fused representation into which both local and global latent feature are implanted .
such fused representation learned by GLGOD-Net can be used to precisely detect different object in remote sensing image .
the proposed framework has been extensively tested on a real-world HSR image dataset for object detection and has been compared with several strong baseline .
the remarkable experimental result validate the effectiveness of GLGOD-Net .
the success of GLGOD-Net not only advances the cutting-edge of image data analytic , but also promotes the corresponding applicability of deep learning in remote sensing imagery .
integration of Texture and Spectral Response with AI Techniques for Buildings Footprint Identification Using High-Resolution Satellite Images .

the rapid growth and advancement in the application of remote sensing ( RS ) and geographic information system ( GIS ) in several application domain helped many researcher to analyze a wide range of information from satellite imagery .
settlement information that includes building foot print is a very essential parameter for different application such as urban planning , environmental planning and disaster management .
vgg-16 ( Visual Geometry Group ) conventional neural network ( CNN ) model is a popular model used to detect and classify the input image .
in this study , a new approach was proposed by integration of VGG-16-CNN model with spectral and textural information of satellite image for identification of building foot print .
the model was trained and implemented to identify the building footprint using Worldview-3 high-resolution satellite image over part of Mumbai city of Maharashtra state , India .
classification accuracy in the proposed approach is observed to be nearly 94 % as compared to 82 % in case of single-shot detector ( SSD ) algorithm alone .
metric parameter such as F1 score of 0.957 , intersection over union ( IoU ) of 94.86 % and total error rate of 8.133 % also indicated better performance of the proposed approach .
particularly , the approach is highly beneficial for urban development authority as they need to monitor the large number of vacant land spread across urban area .
a Self-Supervised Learning Framework for Road Centerline Extraction from High-Resolution Remote Sensing Images .
road extraction from the high-resolution remote sensing image is significant for the land planning , vehicle navigation , etc .
the existing road extraction method normally need many preprocessing and subsequent optimization step .
therefore , an automatic road centerline extraction method based on the self-supervised learning framework for high-resolution remote sensing image is proposed .
this proposed method does not need to manually select training sample and other optimization step , such as the nonroad area removing .
first , the positive sample selection method combining the spectral and shape feature is proposed to extract the road sample .
then , the one-class classifier framework is introduced and the random forest positive unlabeled learning classifier is constructed to get the posterior probability of the pixel belonging to road .
the shape feature and the posterior probability are combined to form the final road network in the object-oriented way .
finally , the road centerline is obtained through the tensor voting algorithm .
in order to verify the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm , high-resolution remote sensing image and benchmark dataset are used to do experiment .
the indexe of the completeness ratio , the correctness ratio , and the detection quality are used for the quantitative accuracy evaluation .
compared with the supervised , the unsupervised , and the one-class classification road extraction algorithms , this proposed algorithm achieves high accuracy and efficiency .
for the deep learning method comparison , the deep learning method perform well in most case especially in the complex urban area .
however , the deep learning method needs a large number of sample and a long training time , and our self-supervised learning framework does not need the training sample .
application of satellite image segmentation for urban planning optimization .
this article presents research result of a convolution neural network for building detection on high-resolution aerial image of Planet database .
jaccard index was used for analysis of the quality of machine learning algorithm .
this index of similarity compares result of algorithms with real mask .
the mask were sliced on smaller part together with image before training of developed model .
the convolution neural network was launched on NVIDIA DGX-1 supercomputer , which was provided by AI-center of P.G Demidov Yaroslavl State University .
the problem of building detection on satellite image can be put into practice for urban planning , building control , search of the best location for outlet etc .
a big remote sensing data analysis using deep learning framework .
spaceborne and airborne sensor deliver a huge number of Earth Observation Data every day .
in this context , we can easily observe the whole earth from its different side .

therefore , this big data is important in remote sensing and could be exploited in several domain requiring image classification , natural hazard monitoring , global climate change , agriculture , urban planning .
over the last five year , Convolutional Neural Networks ( CNN ) emerged as the most successful technique for the image classification task , as well as a number of other computer vision task .
however , to train million of parameter in CNN one requires a huge amount of annotated data .
this requirement leads to a significant challenge if the available training data is limited for a target task at hand .

to address this challenge , in the recent literature , researcher proposed various way to apply a technique called Transfer Learning to transfer the knowledge gained by training CNNs parameter on some large annotated dataset to the target task with limited availability of training data .
most of our work in this paper was dedicated to proposing a hybrid classification of remote sensing image .

this architecture combines Spark RDD image coding to consider image 's local region , pre-trained VGGNET-16 and UNET for image segmentation and SVM ( Support Vector Machines ) from spark Machine Learning to achieve labeling task .
building detection from orthophotos using binary feature classification .
building detection in orthophotos is crucial for various application , such as urban planning and real-estate management .
in order to realize accurate and fast building detection , a non-interactive approach based on binary feature classification is brought forward in this paper .
the proposed approach includes two major stage , i.e.
, building area detection and building contour extraction .

in the first stage , a sequence of intersection is obtained by superpixel segmentation in the subsampled orthophoto , and then building area is reserved roughly according to the classification of intersection .

in the second stage , the sequence of intersection is updated by superpixel segmentation in the building area from original orthophoto , and then building contours is extracted in accordance with the classification of intersection likewise .
the local feature of the intersection is descripted employing our extremely compact binary descriptor , and is classified using binary bag-of-feature .
experiment show that benefiting from binary description and making full use of texture detail and color channel , the proposed descriptor is not only computationally frugal , but also accurate .
experiment are also conducted on orthophoto with different roof color , texture , shape , size and orientation , and demonstrate that the proposed approach are capable of achieving desirable result .
understanding Historical Cityscape from Aerial Imagery Through Machine Learning .
understanding cityscape using remote sensing data has been an active research field for more than two decade .
meanwhile , machine learning provides generalization capability compared to hierarchical and rule-based method .
this paper evaluates several machine learning algorithm in order to fuse shadow detection and shadow compensation method for building detection using high resolution aerial imagery .
three complex and real-life urban study area were used as test dataset with various : ( i ) kind of building structure of special architecture , ( ii ) pixel resolution and , ( iii ) type of data .
objective evaluation metric have been used for assessing the compared algorithm such recall , precision and F1-score as well as rate of completeness , correctness and quality .
for both approach , i.e.
, shadow detection and building detection , the computational complexity of each machine learning algorithm was examined .
the result indicate that deep learning scheme , such a Convolutional Neural Network ( CNN ) , provides the best classification performance in term of shadow detection and building detection .
comparison of different machine learning classifier for building extraction in LiDAR-derived dataset .
building extraction in remotely sensed imagery is an important problem that needs solving .
it can be used to aid in urban planning , hazard assessment and disaster risk management among other .
light Detection and Ranging or LiDAR , is one of the most powerful remote sensing technology nowaday .
many study have used the fusion of LiDAR data and multispectral image in detecting building .
this study seeks to maximize the power of LiDAR imagery to be able to classify building without the aid of multispectral imagery .
this work follows the Object Based Image Analysis ( OBIA ) approach .
instead of the traditional pixel-based classification method , pixel are segmented into logical group called object .
from these object , feature for building extraction are calculated .
these feature are : the number of return , difference of return , and the mean and standard deviation of positive surface openness .
these object are then classified using different machine learning classifier such as Support Vector Machines , K-Nearest Neighbors , Naïve Bayes Classifier , Decision Trees , and Random Forests .
a comparative assessment was done on the performance of these different machine learning classifier .
the classifier performed similarly with the Random Forest Classifier slightly outperforming the other .
automated classification of building structure for urban built environment identification using machine learning .

the urban environment , especially building with different structure type , is difficult to identify automatically due to variation in urban function and form and to building ’ relatively tacit structural attribute .
to enable automated classification of building structure in complex urban environment , this study developed a machine learning ( ML ) -based method .
twenty-nine ML feature were defined , and twelve popular ML algorithms were tested .
the method was tested by classifying over 3700 building in Beijing , China into five common structure .
of the 12 ML algorithms , the Gradient Boosted Decision Tree delivered the highest overall performance , and its classification was verified as effective , i.e.
, achieving approximately 91.7 % , 90.6 % , and 91.1 % of average recall , precision and F1 , respectively , on testing data .

this study 's classification method helps establish a nexus among urban form , building structure , and material and resource requirement , thus contributing to the advance of sustainable urban study , such as urban metabolism and ecological planning .
comparing three machine learning technique for building extraction from a digital surface model .
automatic building extraction from high-resolution remotely sensed data is a major area of interest for an extensive range of Field ( e.g.
, urban planning , environmental risk management ) but challenging due to urban morphology complexity .
among the different method proposed , the approach based on supervised machine learning ( ML ) achieve the best result .

this paper aims to investigate building footprint extraction using only high-resolution raster digital surface model ( DSM ) data by comparing the performance of three different popular supervised ML model on a benchmark dataset .

the first two method rely on a histogram of oriented gradient ( HOG ) feature descriptor and a classical ML ( support vector machine ( SVM ) ) or a shallow neural network ( extreme learning machine ( ELM ) ) classifier , and the third model is a fully convolutional network ( FCN ) based on deep learning with transfer learning .
used data were obtained from the International Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing ( ISPRS ) and cover the urban area of Vaihingen an der Enz , Potsdam , and Toronto .

the result indicated that performance of model based on shallow ML ( feature extraction and classifier training ) are affected by the urban context investigated ( F1 scores from 0.49 to 0.81 ) , whereas the FCN-based model proved to be the most robust and best-performing method for building extraction from a high-resolution raster DSM ( F1 scores from 0.80 to 0.86 ) .
building Roof Superstructures Classification from Imbalanced and Low Density Airborne LiDAR Point Cloud .
light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) , an active remote sensing technology , is becoming an essential tool for geoinformation extraction and urban planning .

airborne Laser Scanning ( ALS ) point clouds segmentation and accurate classification are challenging and crucial to produce different geo-information product like three-dimensional ( 3D ) city design .

this paper introduces an effective data-driven approach to build roof superstructure classification for airborne LiDAR point cloud with very low density and imbalanced class , covering an urban area .
notably , it focuses on building roof superstructure ( especially dormer and chimney ) and mitigating nonplanar object ' problem .
also , the imbalanced class problem of LiDAR data , to the best of our knowledge , is not yet addressed in the literature ; it is considered in this study .
the major advantage of the proposed approach is using only raw data without assumption on the distribution underlying data .
the main methodological novelty of this work are summarized in the following key element .
( i ) At first , an adapted connected component analysis for 3D point cloud is proposed .
( ii ) Twelve geometry-based feature are extracted for each component .
( iii ) A Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) -driven procedure is applied to classify the 3D component .
( iv ) Furthermore , a new component size-based sampling ( CSBS ) method is proposed to treat the imbalanced data problem and has been compared with several existing resampling strategy .
in this study , component are classified into five class : shed and gable dormer , chimney , ground , and other .
the result of this investigation show the satisfying classification performance of the proposed approach .
result also showed that the proposed approach outperformed machine learning method , including SVM , Random Forest , Decision Tree , and Adaboost .
assessment of deep learning technique for land use land cover classification in southern new caledonia .
land use ( LU ) and land cover ( LC ) are two complementary piece of cartographic information used for urban planning and environmental monitoring .

in the context of New Caledonia , a biodiversity hotspot , the availability of up-to-date LULC maps is essential to monitor the impact of extreme event such as cyclone and human activity on the environment .
with the democratization of satellite data and the development of high-performance deep learning technique , it is possible to create these data automatically .

this work aims at determining the best current deep learning configuration ( pixel-wise vs. semantic labelling architecture , data augmentation , image prepos-sessing , … ) , to perform LULC mapping in a complex , subtropical environment .

for this purpose , a specific data set based on SPOT6 satellite data was created and made available for the scientific community as an LULC benchmark in a tropical , complex environment using five representative area of New Caledonia labelled by a human operator : four used as training set , and the fifth as a test set .
several architecture were trained and the resulting classification was compared with a state-of-the-art machine learning technique : XGboost .
we also assessed the relevance of popular neo-channel derived from the raw observation in the context of deep learning .
the deep learning approach showed comparable result to XGboost for LC detection and over-performed it on the LU detection task ( 61.45 % vs. 51.56 % of overall accuracy ) .

finally , adding LC classification output of the dedicated deep learning architecture to the raw channel input significantly improved the overall accuracy of the deep learning LU classification task ( 63.61 % of overall accuracy ) .
all the data used in this study are available on line for the remote sensing community and for assessing other LULC detection technique .
machine learning approach to extract building footprint from high-resolution image : The case study of Makkah , Saudi Arabia .
extracting and identifying building boundary from high-resolution image have been a hot topic in the field of remote sensing for year .
various method including geometric , radiometric , object based and edge detection were previously deliberated and implemented in different study in the context of building extraction .
nevertheless , the reliability of extraction process is mainly subject to user intervention .
the current study proposes a new automatic morphology-based approach for extracting building using high-resolution satellite image of Al-Hudaybiyah region in the city of Makkah as a case study .
the proposed technique integrates the support vector machine for extracting building that have bright and dark roofs .
the appropriateness of this method has been examined by mean of various indicator for example completeness , correctness and quality .
preliminary finding will illustrate the precision and accuracy of the used machine learning algorithm .

research result can provide a generic indicator to assist the planning authority in achieving better urban planning processes taking into account all potential environmental , social and urban demand and requirement .
published by Oxford University Press .
a refined method of high-resolution remote sensing change detection based on machine learning for newly constructed building area .
automatic detection of newly constructed building area ( NCBAs ) plays an important role in addressing issue of ecological environment monitoring , urban management , and urban planning .
compared with low-and-middle resolution remote sensing image , high-resolution remote sensing image are superior in spatial resolution and display of refined spatial detail .
yet its problem of spectral heterogeneity and complexity have impeded research of change detection for high-resolution remote sensing image .

as generalized machine learning ( including deep learning ) technology proceed , the efficiency and accuracy of recognition for ground-object in remote sensing have been substantially improved , providing a new solution for change detection of high-resolution remote sensing image .

to this end , this study proposes a refined NCBAs detection method consisting of four part based on generalized machine learning : ( 1 ) pre-processing ; ( 2 ) candidate NCBAs are obtained by mean of bi-temporal building mask acquired by deep learning semantic segmentation , and then registered one by one ; ( 3 ) rule and support vector machine ( SVM ) are jointly adopted for classification of NCBAs with high , medium and low confidence ; and ( 4 ) the final vector of NCBAs are obtained by post-processing .
in addition , area-based and pixel-based method are adopted for accuracy assessment .

firstly , the proposed method is applied to three group of GF1 image covering the urban fringe area of Jinan , whose experimental result are divided into three category : high , high-medium , and high-medium-low confidence .
the result show that NCBAs of high confidence share the highest F1 score and the best overall effect .
therefore , only NCBAs of high confidence are considered to be the final detection result by this method .

specifically , in NCBAs detection for three group GF1 image in Jinan , the mean Recall of area-based and pixel-based assessment method reach around 77 % and 91 % , respectively , the mean Pixel Accuracy ( PA ) 88 % and 92 % , and the mean F1 82 % and 91 % , confirming the effectiveness of this method on GF1 .
similarly , the proposed method is applied to two group of ZY302 image in Xi ’ an and Kunming .
the score of F1 for two group of ZY302 image are also above 90 % respectively , confirming the effectiveness of this method on ZY302 .

it can be concluded that adoption of area registration improves registration efficiency , and the joint use of prior rule and SVM classifier with probability feature could avoid over and missing detection for NCBAs .
in practical application , this method is contributive to automatic NCBAs detection from high-resolution remote sensing image .
machine Learning Methods for Road Edge Detection on Fused Airborne Hyperspectral and LIDAR Data .
in the last decade , remote sensing sensor , such as hyperspectral system or LiDAR scanner , have been used for urban mapping .
however , an analysis in the urban environment is very complex in application , e.g.
, road detection , city management , and urban planning .
one of the important urban feature is the detection of the road edges .

in this study , an approach on multisensory hyperspectral and LiDAR data fusion ( HL-Fusion ) is introduced for road edge detection using different machine learning algorithms , such as Support Vector Machines , Random Forests , and Convolutional Neural Networks .
the first result show that the Random Forest algorithm outperformed in the experiment on the study area at Oslo 's surrounding in Norway .
this study opens a window for further investigation on machine learning algorithms and a better understanding of HL-Fusion capability .
a study on vehicle detection through aerial image : Various challenge , issue and application .
nowaday vehicle detection and counting at the border of countrie , as well as states/citie , has become popular through aerial image because of security concern .
it will play a vital role to reduce the various crime i.e .
( children kidnapping , drug/alcohol smuggling , traffic misconduct , weapon smuggling , sexual misconduct and mission of country-related crime , etc . )
at the border of the city as well as countrie .

vehicle detection and counting have various other application like traffic management , parking allotment , tracking the rescue vehicle in hill area , digital watermarking , vehicle tracking at the toll plaza and urban planning , etc .

however , vehicle detection and counting task are very challenging and difficult because of the complex background , the small size of the vehicle , other similar visual appearance object , distance , etc .
till now , traditional methodology introduced several robust algorithms which has limitation while extracting the feature from aerial image .
recently , deep learning-based algorithms introduced and the outcome of these algorithm are robust for such kind of application in the area of computer vision .

but accuracy of these algorithm is not optimized in aerial image because the deep learning algorithm required a huge amount of data to train the machine and the size of the object in aerial image is also too small .
all these factor affecting the efficiency of the real-time device .
this paper provides a brief description of traditional algorithms as well as machine learning and deep learning concept to identifying the object through aerial image .

the study has shown the comprehensive analysis of benchmark dataset and their parameter and corresponding challenge used by researcher and scientist in the area of object detection/tracking through aerial image .
fusion of airborne lidar point cloud and aerial image for heterogeneous land-use urban mapping .
the World Health Organization has reported that the number of worldwide urban resident is expected to reach 70 % of the total world population by 2050 .

in the face of challenge brought about by the demographic transition , there is an urgent need to improve the accuracy of urban land-use mapping to more efficiently inform about urban planning process .
decision-maker rely on accurate urban mapping to properly assess current plan and to develop new one .

this study investigates the effect of including conventional spectral signature acquired by different sensor on the classification of airborne LiDAR ( Light Detection and Ranging ) point cloud using multiple feature space .

the proposed method applied three machine learning algorithms—ML ( Maximum Likelihood ) , SVM ( Support Vector Machines ) , and MLP ( Multilayer Perceptron Neural Network ) —to classify LiDAR point clouds of a residential urban area after being geo-registered to aerial photo .
the overall classification accuracy passed 97 % , with height as the only geometric feature in the classifying space .
misclassification occurred among different class due to independent acquisition of aerial and LiDAR data as well as shadow and orthorectification problem from aerial image .

nevertheless , the outcome are promising as they surpassed those achieved with large geometric feature space and are encouraging since the approach is computationally reasonable and integrates radiometric property from affordable sensor .
use of deep learning model in street-level image to classify one-story unreinforced masonry building based on roof diaphragms .

in this paper , we explore the potential of convolutional neural network to classify street-level imagery of one-story unreinforced masonry building ( MURs ) according to the flexibility of the roof diaphragm ( rigid or flexible ) .
this information is critical for vulnerability study , disaster risk assessment , disaster management strategy , etc.
, and is of great relevance in city where unreinforced masonry is the most common building typology or where the majority of the population resides in such building .
our contribution could be useful for local government of city in developing countrie seeking to significantly reduce the number of death caused by disaster .
our research result indicate that VGG19 is the convolutional neural network architecture with the best performance , with an accuracy of 0.80 , a precision of 0.88 , and a recall of 0.84 .
the result are encouraging and could be used to reduce the amount of resource ( both human and economic ) for the development of detailed exposure model for unreinforced masonry building .
using 3D Convolution and Multimodal Architecture For Earthquake Damage Detection Based on Satellite Imagery and Digital Urban Data .
when a large earthquake occur , it is quite important to quickly figure out the damage distribution of housing structure for disaster prevention measure .
currently , the information is confirmed manually by local public organization , which takes a lot of time .
therefore , a method is required for gathering the information more swiftly and objectively .
in this work , a novel method for detecting damage to single building from a set of multi-temporal satellite image is developed by applying a recent machine learning approach .
the damage detection system is designed as a deep learning model that uses multimodal data , consisting of optical satellite image and structural attribute .

the proposed method achieved over 90 % detection accuracy on damaged housing in the affected area of 2016 Kumamoto earthquake , Japan from satellite image taken by Pleiades as well as digital urban data .
ccby
satellite derived bathymetry using deep learning .
coastal development and urban planning are facing different issue including natural disaster and extreme storm event .

the ability to track and forecast the evolution of the physical characteristic of coastal area over time is an important factor in coastal development , risk mitigation and overall coastal zone management .
traditional bathymetry measurement are obtained using echo-sounding technique which are considered expensive and not always possible due to various complexity .
remote sensing tool such as satellite imagery can be used to estimate bathymetry using incident wave signature and inversion model such as physical model of wave .

in this work , we present two novel approach to bathymetry estimation using deep learning and we compare the two proposed method in term of accuracy , computational cost , and applicability to real data .

we show that deep learning is capable of accurately estimating ocean depth in a variety of simulated case which offers a new approach for bathymetry estimation and a novel application for deep learning .
uvid-net : Enhanced Semantic Segmentation of UAV Aerial Videos by Embedding Temporal Information .
semantic segmentation of aerial videos has been extensively used for decision making in monitoring environmental change , urban planning , and disaster management .
the reliability of these decision support system is dependent on the accuracy of the video semantic segmentation algorithms .

the existing CNN-based video semantic segmentation method have enhanced the image semantic segmentation method by incorporating an additional module such as LSTM or optical flow for computing temporal dynamic of the video which is a computational overhead .
the proposed research work modifies the CNN architecture by incorporating temporal information to improve the efficiency of video semantic segmentation .
in this work , an enhanced encoder-decoder based CNN architecture ( UVid-Net ) is proposed for unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) video semantic segmentation .
the encoder of the proposed architecture embeds temporal information for temporally consistent labeling .
the decoder is enhanced by introducing the feature-refiner module , which aids in accurate localization of the class label .
the proposed UVid-Net architecture for UAV video semantic segmentation is quantitatively evaluated on extended ManipalUAVid dataset .
the performance metric mean Intersection over Union of 0.79 has been observed which is significantly greater than the other state-of-the-art algorithms .
further , the proposed work produced promising result even for the pretrained model of UVid-Net on urban street scene by fine tuning the final layer on UAV aerial videos .
a NOVEL SELF-TAUGHT LEARNING FRAMEWORK USING SPATIAL PYRAMID MATCHING for SCENE CLASSIFICATION .
remote sensing earth observation image have a wide range of application in area like urban planning , agriculture , environment monitoring , etc .
while the industrial world benefit from availability of high resolution earth observation image since recent year , interpreting such image has become more challenging than ever .

among many machine learning based method that have worked out successfully in remote sensing scene classification , spatial pyramid matching using sparse coding ( ScSPM ) is a classical model that has achieved promising classification accuracy on many benchmark data set .
scspm is a three-stage algorithm , composed of dictionary learning , sparse representation and classification .
it is generally believed that in the dictionary learning stage , although unsupervised , one should use the same data set as classification stage to get good result .
however , recent study in transfer learning suggest that it might be a better strategy to train the dictionary on a larger data set different from the one to classify .

in our work , we propose an algorithm that combines ScSPM with self-taught learning , a transfer learning framework that trains a dictionary on an unlabeled data set and uses it for multiple classification task .
in the experiment , we learn the dictionary on Caltech-101 data set , and classify two remote sensing scene image data set : UC Merced LandUse data set and Changping data set .
experimental result show that the classification accuracy of proposed method is compatible to that of ScSPM .
our work thus provides a new way to reduce resource cost in learning a remote sensing scene image classifier .
object detection of aerial image using mask-region convolutional neural network ( mask R-CNN ) .
the most fundamental task in remote sensing data processing and analysis is object detection .
it plays an important role in classification and very useful for various application such as forestry , urban planning , agriculture , land use and land cover mapping , etc .
however , it has many challenge to find an appropriate method due to many variation in the appearance of the object in image .
the object may have occlusion , illumination , viewpoint variation , shadow , etc .
many object detection method has been researched and developed .
recently , the development of various machine learning-based method for object detection has been increasing .
among of them are method based on artificial neural network , deep learning and its derivative .
in this research , object detection method of aerial image by using mask-region convolutional neural network ( mask-R CNN ) is developed .
the result shows that this method gives a significant accuracy by increasing the image training and epoch time .
a big bang-big crunch type-2 fuzzy logic system for explainable semantic segmentation of tree in satellite image using HSV color space .
in recent year , new sensor technology have increased the accessibility of high-resolution satellite image .
the information in these image can help to improve activity like urban planning and growth analysis of city .
additionally , information extracted from these image can be used for taking decision related to infrastructure planning , e.g .
identifying object that might interfere with network asset like underground cable .
to be able to justify the cost of network planning decision a high degree of interpretability is required .
convolutional Neural Networks ( CNNs ) are the state of the art for segmenting these image , but like any black box model they do not offer any explanation for their output .
in this paper , we present an approach on how to use a Fuzzy Logic System ( FLS ) for performing explainable semantic segmentation of tree in satellite image .
the FLS uses the HSV ( hue , saturation , value ) of the pixel as input and was optimized by using an evolutionary algorithm called Big Bang Big Crunch .

the best configuration for the Interval Type-2 FLS has an Intersection over Union metric measure of 60.6 % , which is close to the result obtained from neural network , however the proposed FLS provides interpretable output which is highly needed for the real-world operation especially in the telecommunication domain .
urban Intelligent Navigator for Drone Using Convolutional Neural Network ( CNN ) .
it is still a difficult and challenging task for a drone to maneuver autonomously at low altitude in the urban environment .
this is due to the complexity of the urban environment and its unpredictability .

many research have been carried out in the past decade until recent time , to find a way to solve this problem using powerful sensor such as laser rangefinder sensor , RGB-D camera , stereo vision system , LIDAR and computer vision method .
this paper is aimed to present an urban intelligent navigator for drone using CNN ( convolutional neural network ) .
the application of computer vision ( object detection ) is cheap and has low power consumption compared to other kind of vision system .
the machine learning allows a drone to detect and recognize all the object and obstacle on the Road , which can block drone 's way .
one thousand image were captured of six different street object ( tree , lamp , bump sign , free-smoking sign , no-horn sign , and roof-wall ) .
those image were used as a dataset to create a machine learning using Faster R-CNN ( region convolutional neural network ) method .
three machine-learning model were created using different parameter for each model .
the controlled parameter are the initial learning rate and the batch-size .
only the third model could successfully detect and recognize all the object at a specified location showing 98 % accuracy .
the POTENTIAL of BUILDING DETECTION from SAR and LIDAR USING DEEP LEARNING .

the introduction of airborne Synthetic Aperture Radar ( SAR ) approach has successfully addressed several challenge for mapping and surveying application Unlike other conventional sensor , airborne SAR mapping approach offers practicality and significant cost saving for the nation minimizing the need for ground control point on the ground in addition to providing high-resolution , day-and-night , cloud coverage and weather independent image , which in turn provides faster turnaround time for creation of large area geospatial data .

up-to-date building map is necessary to guide the decision making in many Field to understand the urban dynamic such as in disaster management , population estimation , planning and many other application .

whilst mapping and surveying work using airborne SAR have started to capture many interest among surveyor , professional and practitioner abroad , Malaysia however is still lacking behind in term of the knowledge and the usage of this technology together with Deep Learning , Machine Learning approach especially in building extraction for topographic mapping and urban planning and development .
deep learning is a subset of the machine learning algorithm .
recently , Deep Learning has been proposed to solve traditional artificial intelligent problem .

in order to develop a sustainable national geospatial infrastructure for year to come , the integration between airborne SAR and other sensor as such LIDAR is therefore essential in Malaysia and in high demand for urban planning and management .
thus , this paper reviews current technique and future trend of multi-source Remote Sensing for building extraction .
automatic semantic segmentation for change detection in remote sensing image .

change detection ( CD ) mainly focuses on the extraction of change information from multispectral remote sensing image of the same geographical location for environmental monitoring , natural disaster evaluation , urban study , and deforestation monitoring .
while capturing the Landsat imagery , there may occur data missing issue such as occlusion of cloud , camera sensor , and aperture artifact .
the existing machine learning approach do not provide significant result .
this paper proposes a DeepLab Dilated convolutional neural network ( DL-DCNN ) for semantic segmentation with the goal to occur the change map for earth observation application .

experimental result reveal that the accuracy of the proposed change detection result provides improved result as compared with the existing algorithms and maps the semantic object within the predefined class as change or no change .
a support vector machine approach on object based image analysis for feature extraction from high resolution image .
satellite image are the most important available data source for generation and updating of available map .
they have highly improved in term of spatial , spectral and temporal resolution and by the sheer volume of collected image , the necessity of simplification of automation in feature extraction .
road data play a key role in urban planning , traffic management , military application , and vehicle navigation as well as for decision making in numerous application .
the faster updation of road infrastructure is a need because the technology has brought map in the hand of people in the form of mobile phone and tablet .
road detection is one of the major issue of the road infrastructure extraction .
its accuracy depends on the type of methodology used .
an attempt is made here to analyse the first order , the co-occurrence texture feature and image transform useful for discriminating Road from other feature specially the building .

the identified dataset form high dimension feature space and the Support Vector Machine is a theoretically superior machine learning methodology with great result in classification of high dimensional dataset .
in the past , SVMs have been tested and evaluated only as pixel-based image classifier .
moving from pixel-based technique towards object-based representation , the dimension of remote sensing imagery feature space increases significantly .
an SVM approach for classification was followed , based on primitive image object produces by a multi-resolution segmentation algorithm .
the SVM procedure produced the final object classification result which were compared to the Nearest Neighbor classifier result and were found to give better result in OBIA domain .
monitoring land cover change in urban and peri-urban area using dense time stack of Landsat satellite data and a data mining approach .

given the pace and scale of urban expansion in many part of the globe , urban environment are playing an increasingly important role in daily quality-of-life issue , ecological process , climate , material flow , and land transformation .
remote sensing has emerged as a powerful tool to monitor rate and pattern of urban expansion , but many early challenge - such as distinguishing new urban land from bare ground - remain unsolved .

to deal with the high temporal and spatial variability as well as complex , multi-signature class within settlement , this paper presents a new approach that exploits multi-seasonal information in dense time stack of Landsat imagery using a multi-date composite change detection technique .

the central premise of the approach is that land within/near urban area have distinct temporal trajectory both before and after change occurs , and that these lead to characteristic temporal signature in several spectral region .

the method relies on a supervised classification that exploits training data of stable/changed area interpreted from Google Earth image , and a 'brute force ' approach of providing all available Landsat data as input , including scene with data gap due to the Scan Line Corrector ( SLC ) problem .

three classification algorithms ( maximum likelihood , boosted decision tree , and support vector machine ) were tested for their ability to monitor expansion across five time period ( 1988-1995 , 1996-2000 , 2001-2003 , 2004-2006 , 2007-2009 ) in three study area that differ in size , eco-climatic condition , and rates/pattern of development .

both the decision tree and support vector machine outperformed the maximum likelihood classifier ( overall accuracy of 90-93 % , compared to 65 % ) , but the decision tree were superior at handling missing data .

adding transformed feature such as band metric to the Landsat data stack increased accuracy 1-4 % , while experiment with a reduced number of feature ( designed to mimic noisy or missing data ) led to a drop in accuracy of 1-9 % .
the methodology also proved particularly effective for monitoring peri-urbanization outside the urban core , capturing > 98 % of village settlement .
exploring the optimal integration level between SAR and optical data for better urban land cover mapping in the Pearl River Delta .
integrating synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) and optical data to improve urban land cover classification has been identified as a promising approach .
however , which integration level is the most suitable remain unclear but important to many researcher and engineer .
this study aimed to compare different integration level for providing a scientific reference for a wide range of study using optical and SAR data .

sar data from TerraSAR-X and ENVISAT ASAR in both WSM and IMP mode were used to be combined with optical data at pixel level , feature level and decision level using four typical machine learning method .

the experimental result indicated that : 1 ) feature level that used both the original image and extracted feature achieved a significant improvement of up to 10 % compared to that using optical data alone ; 2 ) different level of fusion required different suitable method depending on the data distribution and data resolution .
for instance , support vector machine was the most stable at both the feature and decision level , while random forest was suitable at the pixel level but not suitable at the decision level .
3 ) By examining the distribution of SAR feature , some feature ( e.g.
, homogeneity ) exhibited a close-to-normal distribution , explaining the improvement from the maximum likelihood method at the feature and decision level .
this indicated the benefit of using texture feature from SAR data when being combined with optical data for land cover classification .

additionally , the research also shown that combining optical and SAR data does not guarantee improvement compared with using single data source for urban land cover classification , depending on the selection of appropriate fusion level and fusion method .
combining Pixel-and Object-Based Machine Learning for Identification of Water-Body Types from Urban High-Resolution Remote-Sensing Imagery .
water is one of the vital component for the ecological environment , which plays an important role in human survival and socioeconomic development .
water resource in urban area are gradually decreasing due to the rapid urbanization , especially in developing countrie .
therefore , the precise extraction and automatic identification of water bodie are of great significance and urgently required for urban planning .
it should be noted that although some study have been reported regarding the water-area extraction , to our knowledge , few paper concern the identification of urban water type ( e.g.
, river , lake , canal , and pond ) .
in this paper , a novel two-level machine-learning framework is proposed for identifying the water type from urban high-resolution remote-sensing image .

the framework consists of two interpretation level : 1 ) water bodie are extracted at the pixel level , where the water/shadow/vegetation indexe are considered and 2 ) water type are further identified at the object level , where a set of geometrical and textural feature are used .
both level employ machine learning for the image interpretation .
the proposed framework is validated using the GeoEye-1 and WorldView-2 image , over two mega city in China , i.e.
, Wuhan and Shenzhen , respectively .

the experimental result show that the proposed method achieved satisfactory accuracy for both water extraction [ 95.4 % ( Shenzhen ) , 96.2 % ( Wuhan ) ] , and water type classification [ 94.1 % ( Shenzhen ) , 95.9 % ( Wuhan ) ] in complex urban area .
from land cover-graphs to urban structure type .
urban structure type ( UST ) are an initial interest and basic instrument for monitoring , controlling and modeling task of urban planner and decision maker during ongoing urbanization process .
this study focuses on a method to classify UST from land cover ( LC ) object , which were derived from high resolution satellite image .
the topology of urban LC object is analyzed by implementing neighborhood LC-graphs .
various graph measure are examined by their potential to distinguish between different UST , using the machine learning classifier random forest .
additionally the influence of different parameter setting of the random forest model , the reduction of training sample , and the graph measure importance is analyzed .
an independent test set is classified and validated , achieving an overall accuracy of 87 % .
it was found that the height of the building with the highest node degree has a strong impact on the classification result .
land-cover classification and analysis of change using machine-learning classifier and multi-temporal remote sensing imagery .
frequent human activity and rapid urbanization have led to an assortment of environmental issue .
monitoring land-cover change is critical to efficient environmental management and urban planning .
the current study had two objective .

the first was to compare pixel-based random forest ( RF ) and decision tree ( DT ) classifier method and a support vector machine ( SVM ) algorithm both in pixel-based and object-based approach for classification of land-cover in a heterogeneous landscape for 2010 .
the second was to examine spatio-temporal land-cover change over the last two decade ( 1990–2010 ) using Landsat data .
this study found that the object-based SVM classifier is the most accurate with an overall classification accuracy of 93.54 % and a kappa value of 0.88 .
a post-classification change detection algorithm was used to determine the trend of change between land-cover class .
the most significant change from 1990 to 2010 was caused by the expansion of built-up area .
in addition to the net change , the rate of annual change for each phenomenon was calculated to obtain a better understanding of the process of change .
between 1990 and 2010 , an average of 4.53 % of land turned to the built-up annually and there was an annual decrease of about 0.81 % in natural land .
if the current trend of change continues , regardless of the action of sustainable development , drastic decline in natural area will ensue .
the result of this study can be a valuable baseline for land-cover manager in the region to better understand the current situation and adopt appropriate strategy for management of land-cover .
an adaptive and iterative method of urban area extraction from SAR image .

this letter presents a new method for unsupervised urban area extraction from synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) image based on the ffmax algorithm proposed by C. Gouinaud specially for acquiring urban area in SPOT imagery .
according to the statistical characteristic of urban area , an adaptive and iterative method based on the low-level extraction given by the ffmax algorithm using a large window is proposed .

experimental result on real SAR images show that the proposed automatic method work quickly and can preserve the border of urban area as well as avoid the disturbance of other class and the extraction of urban area are reliable and precise .
support Vector Machine accuracy assessment for extracting green urban area in Town .
the most commonly used model for analyzing satellite imagery is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) .

since there are a large number of possible variable for use in SVM , this paper will provide a combination of parameter that fit best for extracting green urban area from Copernicus mission satellite image .
this paper aims to provide a combination of parameter to extract green urban area with the highest degree of accuracy , in order to speed up urban planning and ultimately improve town environment .

two different Town in Croatia were investigated , and the result provide an optimal combination of parameter for green urban area extraction with an overall kappa index of 0.87 and 0.89 , which demonstrates a very high classification accuracy .
land Classification Using Remotely Sensed Data : Going Multilabel .
obtaining an up-to-date high-resolution description of land cover is a challenging task due to the high cost and labor-intensive process of human annotation through field study .

this work introduces a radically novel approach for achieving this goal by exploiting the proliferation of remote sensing satellite imagery , allowing for the up-to-date generation of global-scale land cover map .

we propose the application of multilabel classification , a powerful framework in machine learning , for inferring the complex relationship between the acquired satellite image and the spectral profile of different type of surface material .

introducing a drastically different approach compared to unsupervised spectral unmixing , we employ contemporary ground-collected data from the European Environment Agency to generate the label set and multispectral image from the MODIS sensor to generate the spectral feature , under a supervised classification framework .

to validate the merit of our approach , we present result using several state-of-the-art multilabel learning classifier and evaluate their predictive performance with respect to the number of annotated training example , as well as their capability to exploit example from neighboring region or different time instance .
we also demonstrate the application of our method on hyperspectral data from the Hyperion sensor for the urban land cover estimation of New York City .

experimental result suggest that the proposed framework can achieve excellent prediction accuracy , even from a limited number of diverse training example , surpassing state-of-the-art spectral unmixing method .
google Earth Engine Cloud Computing Platform for Remote Sensing Big Data Application : A Comprehensive Review .

remote sensing ( RS ) system have been collecting massive volume of dataset for decade , managing and analyzing of which are not practical using common software package and desktop computing resource .
in this regard , Google has developed a cloud computing platform , called Google Earth Engine ( GEE ) , to effectively address the challenge of big data analysis .
in particular , this platform facilitates processing big geo data over large area and monitoring the environment for long period of time .
although this platform was launched in 2010 and has proved its high potential for different application , it has not been fully investigated and utilized for RS application until recent year .
therefore , this study aims to comprehensively explore different aspect of the GEE platform , including its dataset , function , advantages/limitation , and various application .
for this purpose , 450 journal article published in 150 journal between January 2010 and May 2020 were studied .
it was observed that Landsat and Sentinel dataset were extensively utilized by GEE user .
moreover , supervised machine learning algorithms , such as Random Forest , were more widely applied to image classification task .
gee has also been employed in a broad range of application , such as Land Cover/land Use classification , hydrology , urban planning , natural disaster , climate analysis , and image processing .

it was generally observed that the number of GEE publication have significantly increased during the past few year , and it is expected that GEE will be utilized by more user from different Field to resolve their big data processing challenge .
a Random Forests classification method for urban land-use mapping integrating spatial metric and texture analysis .
rapid urban growth in developing countrie is causing a great number of urban planning problem .
to control and analyse this growth , new and better method for urban land use mapping are needed .
this article proposes a new method for urban land-use mapping , which integrates spatial metric and texture analysis in an object-based image analysis classification .
a high-resolution satellite image was used to generate spatial and texture metric from the machine learning algorithm of Random Forests landcover classification .
the most meaningful spatial indice were selected by visual inspection and then combined with the image and texture value to generate the classification .
the proposed method for land-use mapping was tested using a 10-fold crossvalidation scheme , achieving an overall accuracy of 92.3 % and a kappa coefficient of 0.896 .

these step produced an accurate model of urban land use , without the use of any census or ancillary data , and suggest that the combined use of spatial metric and texture is promising for urban land-use mapping in developing countrie .
the map produced can provide the landuse data needed by urban planner for effective planning in developing countrie .
urban land cover and land use classification of an informal settlement area using the open-source knowledge-based system InterIMAGE .

this study uses the InterIMAGE system and imagery from the Quick Bird sensor for land cover and land use classification at two test site with informal settlement in the metropolis of São Paulo , Brazil .
interimage is an open source and free access system for knowledge-based image classification .
within InterIMAGE human knowledge is represented as a semantic net and by user-defined rule based on the paradigms of object-oriented image analysis .
in the land cover classification step , a genetic algorithm was used for determining appropriate segmentation parameter .
for the description of the land cover classes in term of feature and threshold , a strategy combining machine learning algorithm and a semantic net was elaborated .
based on the land cover classification , the land use classification were carried out considering the urban block of the test sites as the analysis unit .
customized feature related to the composition and geometrical structure of the land cover object within these block were used for the description of the land use class .
the proposed methodology has been shown to be efficient for the automatic mapping of the land cover and land use in complex urban area .
the land cover classification achieved overall accuracy above 70 percent and Kappa indexe above 0.65 .
referring to the land use classification , overall accuracy above 87 percent and Kappa indexe above 0.71 were obtained .
this study has explored the main functionality of the InterIMAGE system , presenting its potential for object-based and knowledge-based image classification .
automatic classification of high resolution land cover using a new data weighting procedure : The combination of k-mean clustering algorithm and central tendency measure ( KMC-CTM ) .

information on a well-scale urban land cover is important for a number of urban planning practice involving tree shade mapping , green space analysis , urban hydrologic modeling and urban land use mapping .
in this study , an urban land cover dataset received from the database of UCI ( University of California at Irvine ) machine learning was used as the urban land cover data .
this dataset is the urban area located in Deerfield Beach , FL , USA .
separately , this dataset is a high definition atmospheric image consisting of 9 different urban land cover .
the characteristic of a multi-scale spectral , magnitude and formal tectology were used to sort out and classify these different image .
the dataset comprises a total of 147 feature and land cover of 9 different area involving tree , grass , soil , concrete , asphalt , building , car , pool and Shadow .
a new data weighting method was recommended to classify these 9 different pattern automatically .

this recommended data weighting method is based on the combination of the measure of central tendency composed of mean value , harmonic value , mode and median along with the k-mean clustering method .

in the data weighting method , the data set belonging to each class within the dataset are first calculated by using k-mean clustering method , after which the measure of central tendency belonging to each class are calculated , as well .

the measure of central tendency belonging to each class is divided by the set central value belonging to the class in question , as the result of which the data weight coefficient of that class has already been calculated .

this calculation process is performed separately for 9 different land cover , and afterward , these data weighting coefficient found are multiplied by the dataset , and thus , the dataset has been weighted .

in the second stage , on the other hand , 3 different classification algorithms containing k-NN ( k-nearest neighbor ) , extreme learning machine ( ELM ) and support vector machine ( SVM ) were used to classify 9 different urban land cover after the data weighting method .
in determining the educational and test data set , the 10-fold cross validation was used .

when classification through raw data was performed along with k-NN ( for k = 1 ) , ELM and SVM classification algorithms , the overall classification accuracy obtained was 77.15 % , 84.70 % and 84.79 % , respectively .

when classification through data weighting method ( the combination of k-mean clustering and mode measure ) along with k-NN ( for k = 1 ) , ELM and SVM classification algorithms was made , the overall classification accuracy obtained proved to be 98.58 % , 98.62 % and 98.77 % , respectively .
the obtained result suggest that the urban land cover in an atmospheric image via the recommended data weighting method was classified as 9 different area with a high classification success rate .
comparative assessment of machine learning method for urban vegetation mapping using multitemporal Sentinel-1 imagery .
mapping of green vegetation in urban area using remote sensing technique can be used as a tool for integrated spatial planning to deal with urban challenge .
in this context , multitemporal ( MT ) synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) data have not been equally investigated , as compared to optical satellite data .
this research compared various machine learning method using single-date and MT Sentinel-1 ( S1 ) imagery .
the research was focused on vegetation mapping in urban area across Europe .
urban vegetation was classified using six classifiers-random forest ( RF ) , support vector machine ( SVM ) , extreme gradient boosting ( XGB ) , multi-layer perceptron ( MLP ) , AdaBoost .
m1 ( AB ) , and extreme learning machine ( ELM ) .
wherea , SVM showed the best performance in the single-date image analysis , the MLP classifier yielded the highest overall accuracy in the MT classification scenario .
mean overall accuracy ( OA ) value for all machine learning method increased from 57 % to 77 % with speckle filtering .
using MT SAR data , i.e.
, three and five S1 imagery , an additional increase in the OA of 8.59 % and 13.66 % occurred , respectively .
additionally , using three and five S1 imagery for classification , the F1 measure for forest and low vegetation land-cover class exceeded 90 % .
this research allowed us to confirm the possibility of MT C-band SAR imagery for urban vegetation mapping .
deprivation pocket through the len of convolutional neural network .
machine learning technique have been frequently applied to map urban deprivation ( commonly referred to as slum ) in very high-resolution satellite image .
among these , Deep Convolutional Neural Networks have shown exceptional efficiency in automated deprivation mapping at the local scale .
yet these network have never been used to map very small heterogeneous deprivation area ( pocket ) at large scale .
this study proposes and evaluates a U-Net-Compound model to map deprivation pocket in Bangalore , India .
the model only relies on RGB satellite image with a resolution of 2 m as these are more commonly accessible to local urban planning department .
the experiment assumes a practical situation where only limited reference data is available for the model to learn the spatial morphology of deprivation pocket .
it tests whether an updated map of deprivation pocket can be obtained with limited information .
the model performance to map a large number of deprivation pocket is examined by incrementally changing the model architecture and the amount of training data .
result show that the proposed model is sensitive to the amount of spatial information contained in the training data .
