once sufficient spatial information is learnt through a few sample , the city scale mapping accuracy outperform existing model in mapping small deprivation pocket , achieving a Jaccard Index of 54 % .

this study demonstrated that a well-designed convolutional neural network can map the existence , extent , as well as distribution pattern of deprivation pocket at the city scale with limited training data , which is essential for upscaling research output to provide important information for the formulation of pro-poor policy .
regional mapping of essential urban land use category in China : A segmentation-based approach .
understanding distribution of urban land use is of great importance for urban planning , decision support , and resource allocation .
the first mapping result of essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) in China for 2018 have been recently released .
however , such kind of national map may not sufficiently meet the growing demand for regional analysis .
to address this shortcoming , here we proposed a segmentation-based framework named EULUC-seg to improve the mapping result of EULUC at the city scale .
an object-based segmentation approach was first applied to generate the basic mapping unit within urban parcel .
multiple feature derived from high-resolution remotely sensed and social sensing data were updated and then recalculated within each unit .
random forest was adopted as the machine learning algorithm for classifying urban land use into five Level I class and twelve Level II class .
finally , an accuracy assessment was carried out based on a collection of manually interpreted sample .
result showed that our derived map achieved an overall accuracy of 87.58 % for Level I , and 73.53 % for Level II .
the accurate and refined map of EULUC-seg is expected to better support various application in the future .
evaluation and comparison of eight machine learning model in land use/land cover mapping using Landsat 8 OLI : a case study of the northern region of Iran .

land use land cover change mapping has been used for monitoring environmental change as an essential factor to study on the earth ’ s surface land cover in the field of climate change phenomenon such as flood and drought .
remote sensing image have been suggested to present inexpensive and fine-scale data offering multi-temporal coverage .
this tool is useful in the field of environmental monitoring , land-cover mapping , and urban planning .
this study aims to evaluate eight machine learning algorithms for image classification implemented in WEKA and R programming language .

firstly , Landsat 8 OLI/TIRS Level-2 image based on eight machine learning technique including Random Forest , Decision Table , DTNB , J48 , Lazy IBK , Multilayer Perceptron , Non-Nested Generalized Exemplars ( NN ge ) , and Simple Logistic are classified .
then , obtained result are compared in term of Overall Accuracy ( OA ) , Mean Absolute Error ( MAE ) , and Root Mean Squared Error ( RMSE ) for land use land cover mapping .

among the eight machine learning algorithm used for image classification based on the training and test dataset , NN ge classifier is ranked first with value of 100 , 0 , and 0 for Overall Accuracy , Mean Absolute Error and Root Mean Squared Error respectively .
all machine learning algorithms had an Overall Accuracy of more than 99 % for the training dataset .
on the other hand , for the test dataset , J48 and DTNB algorithms had the worst performance with value of 88.1188 and 76.9802 respectively for the Overall Accuracy .
geographic object based image analysis of world view-3 imagery for urban hydrologic modelling at the catchment scale .
china 's Sponge City initiative will involve widespread installation of new stormwater infrastructure including green roofs , permeable pavement and rain garden in at least 30 city .

hydrologic modelling can support the planning of Sponge Cities at the catchment scale , however , highly detailed spatial data for model input can be challenging to compile from the various authority , or , if available , may not be sufficiently detailed or updated .
remote sensing method show great promise for mitigating this challenge due to their ability to efficiently classify satellite image into category relevant to a specific application .
in this study Geographic Object Based Image Analysis ( GEOBIA ) was applied to WorldView-3 satellite imagery ( 2017 ) to create a detailed land cover map of an urban catchment area in Beijing .

while land cover classification result based on a Bayesian machine learning classifier alone provided an overall land cover classification accuracy of 63 % , the subsequent inclusion of a series of refining rule in combination with supplementary data ( including elevation and parcel delineation ) , yielded the significantly improved overall accuracy of 76 % .

result of the land cover classification highlight the limitation of automated classification based on satellite imagery alone and the value of supplementary data and additional rule to refine classification result .

catchment scale hydrologic modelling based on the generated land cover result indicated that 61 to 82 % of rainfall volume could be captured for a range of 24 h design storm under varying degree of Sponge City implementation .
ultra-light aircraft-based hyperspectral and colour-infrared imaging to identify deciduous tree specie in an urban environment .
one may consider the application of remote sensing as a trade-off between the imaging platform , sensor , and data gathering and processing technique .

this study addresses the potential of hyperspectral imaging using ultra-light aircraft for vegetation specie mapping in an urban environment , exploring both the engineering and scientific aspect related to imaging platform design and image classification method .

an imaging system based on simultaneous use of Rikola frame format hyperspectral and Nikon D800E adopted colour infrared camera installed onboard a Bekas X32 manned ultra-light aircraft is introduced .
two test imaging flight mission were conducted in July of 2015 and September of 2016 over a 4000 ha area in Kaunas City , Lithuania .
sixteen and 64 spectral band in 2015 and 2016 , respectively , in a spectral range of 500-900 nm were recorded with colour infrared image .

three research question were explored assessing the identification of six deciduous tree specie : ( 1 ) Pre-treatment of spectral feature for classification , ( 2 ) testing five conventional machine learning classifier , and ( 3 ) fusion of hyperspectral and colour infrared image .
classification performance was assessed by applying leave-one-out cross-validation at the individual crown level and using as a reference at least 100 field inventoried tree for each specie .
the best-performing classification algorithm-multilayer perceptron , using all spectral property extracted from the hyperspectral images-resulted in a moderate classification accuracy .
the overall classification accuracy was 63 % , Cohen 's Kappa was 0.54 , and the species-specific classification accuracy were in the range of 51-72 % .

hyperspectral image resulted in significantly better tree specie classification ability than the colour infrared image and simultaneous use of spectral property extracted from hyperspectral and colour infrared image improved slightly the accuracy over the 2015 image .
even though classification using hyperspectral data cube of 64 band resulted in relatively larger accuracy than with 16 band , classification error matrice were not statistically different .

alternative imaging platform ( like an unmanned aerial vehicle and a Cessna 172 aircraft ) and setting of the Flight were discussed using simulated imaging project assuming the same study area and field of application .

ultra-light aircraft-based hyperspectral and colour-infrared imaging was considered to be a technically and economically sound solution for urban green space inventory to facilitate tree mapping , characterization , and monitoring .
understanding the spatial distribution of urban forest in China using Sentinel-2 image with Google Earth Engine .
urban forest are vitally important for sustainable urban development and the well-being of urban resident .
however , there is , as yet , no country-level urban forest spatial dataset of sufficient quality for the scientific management of , and correlative study on , urban forest in China .
at present , China attaches great importance to the construction of urban forest , and it is necessary to map a high-resolution and high-accuracy dataset of urban forest in China .
the open-access Sentinel image and the Google Earth Engine platform provide a significant opportunity for the realization of this work .

this study used eight band ( B2-B8 , B11 ) and three indice of Sentinel-2 in 2016 to map the urban forest of China using the Random Forest machine learning algorithms at the pixel scale with the support of Google Earth Engine ( GEE ) .
the 7317 sample point for training and testing were collected from field visit and very high resolution image from Google Earth .

the overall accuracy , producer 's accuracy of urban forest , and user 's accuracy of urban forest assessed by independent validation sample in this study were 92.30 % , 92.27 % , and 92.18 % , respectively .
in 2016 , the percentage of urban forest cover was 19.2 % .
nearly half of the city had an urban forest cover between 10 % and 20 % , and the average percentage of large city whose urban population were over 5 million was 24.8 % .
city with less than half of the average were mainly distributed in northern and western part of China , which should be focused on in urban greening planning .
using GIS and machine learning to classify residential status of urban building in low and middle income setting .
utilising satellite image for planning and development is becoming a common practice as computational power and machine learning capability expand .
in this paper , we explore the use of satellite image derived building footprint data to classify the residential status of urban building in low and middle income countrie .
a recently developed ensemble machine learning building classification model is applied for the first time to the Democratic Republic of the Congo , and to Nigeria .
the model is informed by building footprint and label data of greater completeness and attribute consistency than have previously been available for these countrie .
a GIS workflow is described that semiautomates the preparation of data for input to the model .
the workflow is designed to be particularly useful to those who apply the model to additional countrie and use input data from diverse source .
result show that the ensemble model correctly classifies between 85 % and 93 % of structure as residential and nonresidential across both countrie .

the classification output are likely to be valuable in the modelling of human population distribution , as well as in a range of related application such as urban planning , resource allocation , and service delivery .
accuracy comparison of land cover mapping using the object-oriented image classification with machine learning algorithm .
land cover mapping provides basic information for advanced science such as ecological management , biodiversity conservation , forest planning and so on .
in remote sensing research , the process of creating an accurate land cover map is an important subject .
recently , there has been growing research interest in the object-oriented image classification technique .
the object-oriented image classification consists of multidimensional feature including object feature and thus requires multi-dimensional image classification approach .
for example , a linear model such as the maximum likelihood method of pixel-based classification can not characterize the pattern or relation of multi-dimensional data .
in multi-dimensional image classification , data mining and ensemble learning have been shown to increase accuracy and flexibility .
this study examined the use of the object-oriented image classification by the multiple machine learning algorithms for land cover mapping .
we applied four classifier : Classification and regression tree ( CART ) , Decision tree with Boosting , Decision tree with Bagging , and Random Forest .
the study area was Sado Island in Niigata Prefecture , Japan .

pan-sharpened SPOT/HRG imagery ( June 2007 ) was used and classified into the following eight class : broad-leaved deciduous forest , Japanese cedar , Japanese red pine , bamboo forest , paddy field , urban area , road , and bare land .
we prepared four data set with the object based feature including textural information .
the number of feature is increased from data set I through IV .
as the result , CART was unsuitable for multi-dimensional classification .
random Forest and Decision tree with Boosting showed high classification accuracy .
furthermore , in the data set with the limited feature , Decision tree with Boosting was the accurate classifier .
finally , we propose two machine learning algorithm to every dataset .
random Forest is effective in the case of the multi-dimensional image classification such as data set II , III , and IV .
decision tree with Boosting is effective in the case of the image classification with the limited feature such as data set I .
remote measurement of building usable floor area – Algorithms fusion .
rapid change that are taking place in the urban environment have significant impact on urban growth .
most city and urban region all over the world compete to increase resident and visitor satisfaction .
the growing requirement and rapidity of introducing new technology to all aspect of resident ’ lives force city and urban region to implement “ smart city ” concept in their activity .

real estate is one of the principal anthropogenic component of urban environment thus become a subject of thorough multidisciplinary analysis in the field of data requiring spatial information system .

recent advance in information technology , combined with the increased availability of high-resolution imagery from Earth observation , create an opportunity to use new source of data that enable to identify , monitor , and solved many of urban environmental problem .
the aim of the paper is to elaborate precise , complete and detailed property information with the use of remote sensing observation in a suitable numerical algorithm .
the author concentrate on providing one of the most important , and probably the most lacking , feature describing property – building usable floor area ( BUFA ) .

the solution is elaborated in the form of an automatic algorithm based on machine learning and computer vision technology related to LiDAR ( big data ) , close range image with respect to spatial information system requirement .

the obtained result related to BUFA estimation in comparison to the state-of-the-art result are satisfactory and may increase the reliability of decision-making in investment , fiscal , registration and planning aspect .
mapping poverty and slum using multiple methodology in Accra , Ghana .

providing housing to slum dweller , protecting them from natural disaster and disease , and connecting them to job and service through improved infrastructure are urgent policy issue in many Sub-Saharan African city .
identifying the location and living condition of slum is a critical step toward designing effective urban policy .

by combining household survey data and census data with high spatial resolution satellite imagery and other geospatial data using multiple methodology , including machine learning , we attempt to define slum quantitatively within the city of Accra .
within these defined slum area , the pattern of monetary poverty are assessed .
poverty rate are estimated at the neighborhood level and indicate that living in slum is strongly correlated with higher monetary poverty .
poverty is more prevalent in community in area of lower elevation , which in Accra are generally flood-prone area .
however , the result also suggest that not all people living in slum are living in monetary poverty .
these result have important policy implication and are crucial to how economic opportunity are generated in slum so that effective urban policy can be designed .
rapid and automated urban modeling technique for UAS application .
urban model for testing UAV path-planning algorithms commonly apply simple representation using cuboid or cylinderical shape which may not capture the characteristic of a urban environment .
to address this limitation of existing urban model , this paper presents two urban modeling technique for an unmanned aircraft flight simulation in an urban environment .

the first proposed urban modeling technique is an airborne LiDAR source-based approach that incorporates machine learning algorithm to identify the number of building and characterize them from the LiDAR information .

the second proposed urban modeling technique is an artificial urban modeling technique without any airborne LiDAR resource that applies an adaptive spacing method , an iterative algorithm to define an artificial urban environment .

unlike the LiDAR source-based approach that creates an approximated urban model , the adaptive spacing-based urban modeling algorithm generates an artificial urban environment that is visually different from a reference city , but has similar the characteristic to it .
to demonstrate the two proposed urban modeling technique , numerical simulation are conducted using open-source dataset to construct several realistic urban model .
multi-scale correlation-based feature selection and random forest classification for LULC mapping from the integration of SAR and optical Sentinel image .

reliable and accurate land use/land cover ( LULC ) map is a crucial data source for the understanding of coupled human-environment system , monitoring change , timely low-cost planning , and management of natural resource .

improvement in sensor technology and machine learning capability have shifted the attention of remote sensing community to data complementarity through fusion of multi-sensor data for accurate feature extraction and mapping .

amalgamation of optical and synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) images has shown promising advantage in enhancing the accuracy of extracting LULC as such method allows exploitation of information in sensor .

this study investigated the potential of using freely available multisource Sentinel images to extract LULC map in semi-arid environment through multi-scale geographic object-based image analysis ( GEOBIA ) .

a multi-scale classification framework that integrates GEOBIA , correlation-based feature selection ( CFS ) , and random forest ( RF ) -supervised classification was adopted to extract LULC from assimilation of Sentinel multi-sensor product .
first , Sentinel-1 and-2 image were pre-processed .
second , optimum multi-scale segmentation level were selected using F-score segmentation quality measure .

third , 70 feature of various spectral indice and derivative and geometrical feature from optical data and multiple ratio and textural feature from dual-polarization SAR image were computed , and a CFS based on wrapper approach was used to select the most significant feature at multi-scale level .
finally , a single and multi-scale RF classifier was used to extract LULC class using the most relevant feature extracted from Sentinel SAR and optical image .
result of multi-scale image segmentation optimization showed that scale parameter ( SP ) value of 40 , 60 , and 150 were optimal for extraction of LULC class .
result of feature selection showed that 22 , 24 , and 27 feature were selected at scale SP value of 40 , 60 , and 150 , respectively .
half of the feature were common among the three scale .
single RF classification yielded overall accuracy ( OA ) value of 92.10 % , 93 % , and 91 % and kappa coefficient of 0.901 , 0.912 , and 0.89 at scale value of 150 , 60 , and 40 , respectively .
multiscale RF classification from scale value of 150 and 60 produced better LULC classification with OA 96.06 % and kappa coefficient of 0.95 compared with other scale SP value .
the integrated approach demonstrated an effective and promising method for high-quality LULC extraction from coupling optical and SAR image .

overall , multi-sensor Sentinel image along with the adopted approach feature a remarkable potential for improving LULC extraction and can effectively be used to update geographic information system layer for various application .
mapping essential urban land use category with open big data : Result for five metropolitan area in the United States of America .

urban land-use map outlining the distribution , pattern , and composition of various land use type are critically important for urban planning , environmental management , disaster control , health protection , and biodiversity conservation .

recent advance in remote sensing and social sensing data and method have shown great potential in mapping urban land use category , but they are still constrained by mixed land use , limited predictor , non-localized model , and often relatively low accuracy .
to inform these issue , we proposed a robust and cost-effective framework for mapping urban land use category using openly available multi-source geospatial “ big data ” .

with street block generated from OpenStreetMap ( OSM ) data as the minimum classification unit , we integrated an expansive set of multi-scale spatially explicit information on land surface , vertical height , socio-economic attribute , social media , demography , and topography .
we further proposed to apply the automatic ensemble learning that leverages a bunch of machine learning algorithm in deriving optimal urban land use classification map .

result of block-level urban land use classification in five metropolitan area of the United States found the overall accuracy of major-class ( Level-I ) and minor-class ( Level-II ) classification could be high as 91 % and 86 % , respectively .

a multi-model comparison revealed that for urban land use classification with high-dimensional feature , the multi-layer stacking ensemble model achieved better performance than base model such as random forest , extremely randomized tree , LightGBM , CatBoost , and neural network .

we found without very-high-resolution National Agriculture Imagery Program imagery , the classification result derived from Sentinel-1 , Sentinel-2 , and other open big data based feature could achieve plausible overall accuracy of Level-I and Level-II classification at 88 % and 81 % , respectively .
we also found that model transferability depended highly on the heterogeneity in characteristic of different region .

the method and finding in this study systematically elucidate the role of data source , classification method , and feature transferability in block-level land use classification , which have important implication for mapping multi-scale essential urban land use category .
classification of Urban Functional Areas from Remote Sensing Images and Time-Series User Behavior Data .
urbanization is accelerating at a rapid rate , which has introduced many challenge , especially in the field of urban planning .
under the backdrop of global urbanization , some city are particularly vulnerable to climate change and natural disaster that are influenced by unplanned urban expansion .
rational planning of urban functional area needs to be strengthened to improve the scientific approach of urban planning and urbanization .
in this study , the classification of urban functional area based on dual-modal data ( i.e.
, remote sensing image and user behavior data ) was implemented using machine learning ( ML ) algorithms .
after the set test , the classification accuracy of urban functional area reached 82.45 % .
through analysis , it could be concluded that the use of data of two modality achieved a higher classification accuracy than that achieved by using data of a single modality .
the data of the two modality complement each other , and the use of ML algorithms to train such data can yield good result .
land cover classification based on machine learning using UAV multi-spectral image .
land cover classification using UAV multi-spectral image is of great significance in precision agriculture , urban planning , land use and other Field .
however , traditional remote sensing image classification method can not meet the classification accuracy requirement of UAV multi-spectral image .
this paper aims to propose an object-based machine learning classification method to improve the land over classification accuracy of UAV multi-spectral image .
the experimental area is a standard test field located in the Jilin Province of China .
the experimental data was captured by a UAV equipped with a multi-spectral camera which includes four band from 550 nm to 790 nm .
first , the original image were preprocessed and the spectral curve of land cover were analyzed , thus four kind of land cover with large difference were selected as category .
then pixel-based , boosting-based and object-based machine learning method were used for classification .

the object-based classification method could make full use of the spatial and spectral information , and eliminate the noise problem caused by the high resolution of the UAV image to a certain extent .
finally , accuracy analysis using the verification image showed that the RF-O method achieved the highest classification accuracy of 92.2419 % , and the kappa coefficient was 0.8904 .

all result indicate that the object-based machine learning classification method proposed in this paper is more suitable for the research of land cover classification , comparing with the traditional remote sensing image classification method , and perform well on the land cover classification of UAV multi-spectral image .
application of machine learning in urban greenery land cover extraction .
urban greenery is a critical part of the modern city and the greenery coverage information is essential for land resource management , environmental monitoring and urban planning .
it is a challenging work to extract the urban greenery information from remote sensing image as the tree and grassland are mixed with city built-up .
in this paper , we propose a new automatic pixel-based greenery extraction method using multispectral remote sensing image .
the method includes three main step .
first , a small part of the image is manually interpreted to provide prior knowledge .
secondly , a five-layer neural network is trained and optimised with the manual extraction result , which are divided to serve as training sample , verification sample and testing sample .
lastly , the well-trained neural network will be applied to the unlabelled data to perform the greenery extraction .
the GF-2 and GJ-1 high resolution multispectral remote sensing image were used to extract greenery coverage information in the built-up area of city X .
it shows a favourable performance in the 619 square kilometer area .
also , when comparing with the traditional NDVI method , the proposed method gives a more accurate delineation of the greenery region .
due to the advantage of low computational load and high accuracy , it has a great potential for large area greenery auto extraction , which saves a lot of manpower and resource .

demystifying uncertainty in PM10 susceptibility mapping using variable drop-off in extreme-gradient boosting ( XGB ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .

this study investigates uncertainty in machine learning that can occur when there is significant variance in the prediction importance level of the independent variable , especially when the ROC fails to reflect the unbalanced effect of prediction variable .
a variable drop-off loop function , based on the concept of early termination for reduction of model capacity , regularization , and generalization control , was tested .

a susceptibility index for airborne particulate matter of less than 10 μm diameter ( PM10 ) was modeled using monthly maximum value and spectral band and indice from Landsat 8 imagery , and Open Street Maps were used to prepare a range of independent variable .
probability and classification index map were prepared using extreme-gradient boosting ( XGBOOST ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .

these were assessed against utility criterion such as a confusion matrix of overall accuracy , quantity of variable , processing delay , degree of overfitting , importance distribution , and area under the receiver operating characteristic curve ( ROC ) .

identifying urban poverty using high-resolution satellite imagery and machine learning approach : Implication for housing inequality .

enriching Asian perspective on the rapid identification of urban poverty and its implication for housing inequality , this paper contributes empirical evidence about the utility of image feature derived from high-resolution satellite imagery and machine learning approach for identifying urban poverty in China at the community level .

for the case of the Jiangxia District and Huangpi District of Wuhan , image feature , including perimeter , line segment detector ( LSD ) , Hough transform , gray-level cooccurrence matrix ( GLCM ) , histogram of oriented gradient ( HoG ) , and local binary pattern ( LBP ) , are calculated , and four machine learning approach and 25 variable are applied to identify urban poverty and relatively important variable .

the result show that image feature and machine learning approach can be used to identify urban poverty with the best model performance with a coefficient of determination , R2 , of 0.5341 and 0.5324 for Jiangxia and Huangpi , respectively , although some difference exist among the approach and study area .
the importance of each variable differ for each approach and study area ; however , the relatively important variable are similar .
in particular , four variable achieved relatively satisfactory prediction result for all model and presented obvious difference in varying community with different poverty level .
housing inequality within low-income neighborhood , which is a response to gap in wealth , income , and housing affordability among social group , is an important manifestation of urban poverty .

policy maker can implement these finding to rapidly identify urban poverty , and the finding have potential application for addressing housing inequality and proving the rationality of urban planning for building a sustainable society .
mapping essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) using geospatial big data : Progress , challenge , and opportunity .

urban land use information that reflects socio-economic function and human activity is critically essential for urban planning , landscape design , environmental management , health promotion , and biodiversity conservation .

land-use map outlining the distribution , pattern , and composition of essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) have facilitated a wide spectrum of application and further triggered new opportunity in urban study .

new and improved Earth observation , algorithms , and advanced product for extracting thematic urban information , in association with emerging social sensing big data and auxiliary crowdsourcing dataset , all together offer great potential to mapping fine-resolution EULUC from regional to global scale .
here we review the advance of EULUC mapping research and practice in term of their data , method , and application .

based on the historical retrospect , we summarize the challenge and limitation of current EULUC study regarding sample collection , mixed land use problem , data and model generalization , and large-scale mapping effort .

finally , we propose and discuss future opportunity , including cross-scale mapping , optimal integration of multi-source feature , global sample library from crowdsourcing approach , advanced machine learning and ensembled classification strategy , open portal for data visualization and sharing , multi-temporal mapping of EULUC change , and implication in urban environmental study , to facilitate multi-scale fine-resolution EULUC mapping research .
published by Taylor & Francis Group and Science Press on behalf of the International Society for Digital Earth , supported by the CASEarth Strategic Priority Research Programme .
virtual design of urban planning based on GIS big data and machine learning .

in order to build a virtual urban planning model and improve the effect of urban planning , this paper builds a virtual urban planning design model based on GIS big data technology and machine learning algorithms , and proposes a solution that combines multiple feature .

with the development of polarized SAR in the direction of high resolution , a single feature often can not fully express the detailed information of ground object , resulting in poor classification result and low accuracy .
the combination of multiple feature can express feature information well .

in addition , this paper uses the ELM method to plan SAR ground object classification , uses an extreme learning machine classification algorithm with fast learning speed and good classification effect , and uses ELM as a classifier .
finally , this paper designs experiment to explore the performance of the model constructed in this paper from two aspect : detection accuracy and planning score .
the research result show that the model constructed in this paper meets the expected goal .
estimating Socio-Economic Parameter via Machine Learning Methods Using Luojia1-01 Nighttime Light Remotely Sensed Image at Multiple Scales of China in 2018 .
mapping socio-economic indicator with a raster format is still a great challenge .
the nighttime light ( NTL ) dataset have been widely utilized to estimate the socio-economic parameter .
however , the precision of the published dataset was too coarse to meet related issue such as flood loss assessment , urban planning , and epidemiological study .

the present study calibrated gross domestic product ( GDP ) , population ( POP ) , electric consumption ( EC ) , and urban build-up area ( B-A ) at 100 m resolution for 45 city of China in 2018 using Luojia1-01 NTL datasets via random forest ( RF ) as well as geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) model .
the linear regression ( LR ) , back propagation neural network ( BPNN ) , and support vector machine ( SVM ) method were selected for comparison with GWR and RF model .
besides , the Suomi National Polar-Orbiting Partnership-Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite ( NPP-VIIRS ) was chosen for comparison with Luojia1-01 .
the ten-folded cross-validation ( CV ) has been used for evaluating accuracy at county and city scale .
finally , the distribution map of socio-economic parameter were illustrated and some finding were obtained .
first , the validation result revealed that the calibration at the city-scale outperformed the county or district scale .
second , the precision of the Luojia1-01 NTL dataset surpassed the NPP-VIIRS NTL dataset on the same administrative scale except for some specific situation .

third , the precision of the simulation for the gross domestic product ( GDP ) is the highest than the other , followed by electric consumption ( EC ) , build-up area ( B-A ) , and population ( POP ) .
fourth , the optimum model varied according to the socio-economic parameter .
fifth , the distribution of socio-economic parameter exhibited obvious spatial heterogeneity .
this paper can supply scientific support for calibrating socio-economic parameter in other region .
mapping Urban Slum Settlements Using Very High-Resolution Imagery and Land Boundary Data .
accurate mapping of slum is crucial for urban planning and management .
this article proposes a machine learning , hierarchical object-based method to map slum settlement using very high-resolution ( VHR ) imagery and land boundary data to support slum upgrading .
the proposed method is tested in Kingston Metropolitan Area , Jamaica .
first , the VHR imagery is classified into major land cover class ( i.e.
, the initial land cover map ) .
second , the VHR imagery and land boundary layer are used to obtain homogenous neighborhood ( HNs ) .
third , the initial land cover map is used to derive multiple context , spectral , and texture image features according to the local physical characteristic of slum settlement .
fourth , a machine-learning classifier , classification and regression tree , is used to classify HNs into slum and nonslum settlement using only the effective image feature .
finally , reference data collected manually are used to assess the accuracy of the classification .
in the training site , an overall accuracy of 0.935 is achieved .
the effective image indicator for slum mapping include the building layout , building density , building roof characteristic , and distance from building to gully .
the classifier and those feature selected from the training site are further used to map slum in two validating site to assess the transferability of our approach .

overall accuracy of the two validating site reached 0.928 and 0.929 , respectively , suggesting that the feature and classification model obtained from one site has the potential to be transferred to other area in Jamaica and possibly other developing Caribbean countrie with similar situation and data availability .
comparison of performance of artificial neural network ( ANN ) and random forest ( RF ) in the classification of land cover zone of urban slum region .
india is one of the world ’ s largest economy and economic growth has remained continuous .
this has led to accelerating urbanization which requires proper planning and monitoring .
as the urban area are expanding , urban slum area are also increasing along with it .
these growing urban slum area require proper observation so that existing resource can be employed to provide these region with the best possible livelihood condition .

for this purpose , urban slum area as well as surrounding land resource should be well identified and classified so that the existing land resource can be appropriately utilized for future implementation of development activity .
machine learning classification algorithm are found to be very suitable for the identification and classification of remotely sensed image .
their efficiency in feature identification and extraction has established these algorithm as important tool in decision making .
in this study , our major objective is to identify and classify different land cover zone in the urban slum area of Chingrajpara area of Chhattisgarh using remotely-sensed image .

for this purpose , high-resolution image , collected using unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) , are used and these image are classified into different land cover features using two different machine learning algorithms Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) and Random Forest ( RF ) .
the result obtained show that the overall accuracy achieved by ANN and RF are 72.6 % and 84.35 % respectively .
the study highlights the role and importance of landcover classification for future planning and management .
integrating activity-based geographic information and long-term remote sensing to characterize urban land use change .
the land use structure is a key component to understand the complexity of urban system because it provides a snapshot of urban dynamic and how people use space .
this paper integrates socially sensed activity data with a remotely sensed land cover product in order to infer urban land use and its change over time .

we conducted a case study in theWashington D.C.-Baltimore metropolitan area to identify the pattern of land use change from undeveloped to developed land , including residential and non-residential use for a period covering 1986-2008 .
the proposed approach modeled physical and behavioral feature of land parcel from a satellite-based impervious surface cover change product and georeferenced Tweet , respectively .

a model assessment with random forest classifier showed that the proposed classification workflow could classify residential and non-residential land uses at an accuracy of 81 % , 4 % better than modeling the same land use from physical feature alone .
using the timestamp of the impervious surface cover change product , the study also reconstructed the timeline of the identified land use .

the result indicated that the proposed approach was capable of mapping detailed land use and change in an urban region , and represents a new and viable way forward for urban land use surveying that could be especially useful for surveying and tracking change in city where traditional approach and mapping product ( i.e.
, from remote sensing product ) may have a limited capacity to capture change .
evaluation of ADVANCED DATA MINING ALGORITHMS in LAND USE/LAND COVER MAPPING .
for environmental monitoring , land-cover mapping , and urban planning , remote sensing is an effective method .

in this paper , firstly , for land use land cover mapping , Landsat 8 OLI image classification based on six advanced mathematical algorithms of machine learning including Random Forest , Decision Table , DTNB , Multilayer Perceptron , Non-Nested Generalized Exemplars ( NN ge ) and Simple Logistic is used .
then , result are compared in the term of Overall Accuracy ( OA ) , Mean Absolute Error ( MAE ) and Root Mean Squared Error ( RMSE ) for land use land cover ( LULC ) mapping .

based on the training and test dataset , Simple Logistic had the best performance in term of OA , MAE and RMSE value of 99.9293 , 0.0006 and 0.016 for training dataset and value of 99.9467 , 0.0005 and 0.0153 for the test dataset .
machine Learning for Strategic Urban Planning .
data mining is an important part of strategic planning for the development of modern urban settlement with capacity to accommodate population explosion .
developing countrie are fast becoming urbanized giving the development and opportunity that are lacking in rural area .
data regarding urban development such as satellite image need to be analysed to ascertain the possibility for further development or opening up of new settlement .
this work presents a binary sub-pixel and feature based method of classification to detect water bodie and vegetation in earth observatory image .

in this work , the image were subjected data pre-processing , feature extraction , and analysed the data using machine learning classification method to detection region that support urban expansion or development of new settlement .
the proposed method achieved 88.93 % accuracy and 0.06 % RMSE .
land cover classification and change detection analysis of multispectral satellite image using machine learning .

land cover classification and change detection analysis based on remote sensing image using machine learning algorithm has become one of the important factor for environmental management and urban planning .
we select Yangon as the study area because the government faces many problem in urban planning sector due to the population growth and urban sprawl .

therefore , the proposed method aims to perform the land cover classification in Yangon using Random Forest ( RF ) classifier in Google Earth Engine ( GEE ) and post-classification change detection between 1987 and 2017 with 5 year interval period are evaluated .

despite land cover classification using satellite imagery have been executed in the past decade , the classification of remotely sensed data integrating with multiple spectral , temporal and textural feature and processing time for classification using time series data still have limitation .

to overcome these limitation , feature extracted from Sentinel-2 , Landsat-8 , Landsat-7 , Landsat-5 and Open Street Map ( OSM ) are executed for classification and cloud-based GEE platform is used to reduce the processing time .
some spectral indexe such as NDVI , NDBI and slope from SRTM are calculated to achieve better classification .
land cover classification is performed by using the RF classifier with the different band ' combination .

land cover classification map with 7 class ( Shrub Land , Bare Land , Forest , Vegetation , Urban Area , Lake and River ) is obtained with the overall accuracy of 96.73 % and kappa statistic of 0.95 for 2017 .
finally , change detection analysis over 30 year is performed and the significant change in build-up , bare land , and agriculture have been resulted .
the technical and commercial increment of the fusion of big data analysis , artificial intelligence and earth observation .
earth observation is one of the most important application in downstream space activity .
it is widely used in environmental monitoring , urban planning , topographic mapping , agricultural census and disaster prevention .
however , traditional satellite remote sensing is subject to high cost and long data acquisition cycle , and it is difficult for user to get the data in time .

these problem result in insufficient data supply capacity of remote sensing satellite , which leads to difficulty in supporting daily business application and establishing a fast-growing business model business model .
the small satellite segment has seen rapid market growth and technological advancement since 2013 following the multiple successful launch , most notably the Planet , Spire and other .
economy of scale during production are one of the core advantage of the small satellite segment , thus allowing for significant cost reduction throughout their development and production cycle .
at the same time , big data analysis and the artificial intelligence ( AI ) industry are booming .
periodically full coverage data from small satellite provides a data source for data mining and periodic statistic for a wide range of target .
it provides huge opportunity and extension channel for the application of big data analysis and artificial intelligence ( AI ) in Earth observation ( EO ) .
the present paper describes research on the technical and commercial increment of the fusion of big data analysis , AI and EO .

in the first section of the paper , a literature review of the common downstream space activity along with identifying the limitation of Earth Observation in term of high cost and long data acquisition cycle is presented .
in the second section , the paper outlines a 4G case study to show that how the improvement of infrastructure brings new application scenario , vertical and consumer .
in the third section , the paper considers the possible new market opportunity of the 5G technology in the fusion of big data analysis , AI and EO .

finally , it concludes by proposing two prototype model in agriculture monitoring and disaster and emergency response , assesses the technical and commercial increment relative to the current business .
air-to-air Path Loss Prediction Based on Machine Learning Methods in Urban Environments .
recently , unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAV ) plays an important role in many application because of its high flexibility and low cost .
to realize reliable UAV communication , a fundamental work is to investigate the propagation characteristic of the channel .
in this paper , we propose path loss model for the UAV air-to-air ( AA ) scenario based on machine learning .
a ray-tracing software is employed to generate sample for multiple route in a typical urban environment , and different altitude of Tx and Rx UAVs are taken into consideration .
two machine-learning algorithm , Random Forest and KNN , are exploited to build prediction model on the basis of the training data .
the prediction performance of trained model is assessed on the test set according to the metric including the mean absolute error ( MAE ) and root mean square error ( RMSE ) .
meanwhile , two empirical model are presented for comparison .
it is shown that the machine-learning-based model are able to provide high prediction accuracy and acceptable computational efficiency in the AA scenario .
moreover , Random Forest outperforms other model and has the smallest prediction error .
further investigation is made to evaluate the impact of five different parameter on the path loss .
it is demonstrated that the path visibility is crucial for the path loss .
intelligent GPS L1 LOS/multipath/NLOS classifier based on correlator- , RINEX- and NMEA-level measurement .

this paper proposes to use a correlator-level global positioning system ( GPS ) line-of-sight/multipath/non-line-of-sight ( LOS/MP/NLOS ) signal reception classifier to improve positioning performance in an urban environment .

conventional LOS/MP/NLOS classifier , referred to as national marine electronic association ( NMEA ) -level and receiver independent exchange format ( RINEX ) -level classifier , are usually performed using attribute extracted from basic observable or measurement such as received signal strength , satellite elevation angle , code pseudorange , etc .
the NMEA/RINEX-level classification rate is limited because the complex signal propagation in urban environment is not fully manifested in these end attributes .
in this paper , LOS/MP/NLOS feature were extracted at the baseband signal processing stage .
multicorrelator is implemented in a GPS software-defined receiver ( SDR ) and exploited to generate feature from the autocorrelation function ( ACF ) .
a robust LOS/MP/NLOS classifier using a supervised machine learning algorithm , support vector machine ( SVM ) , is then trained .
it is also proposed that the Skymask and code pseudorange double difference observable are used to label the real signal type .
raw GPS intermediate frequency data were collected in urban area in Hong Kong and were postprocessed using a self-developed SDR , which can easily output correlator-level LOS/MP/NLOS feature .
the SDR measurement were saved in the file with the format of NMEA and RINEX .
a fair comparison among NMEA- , RINEX- , and correlator-level classifier was then carried out on a common ground .

result show that the correlator-level classifier improves the metric of F1 score by about 25 % over the conventional NMEA- and RINEX-level classifier for testing data collected at different Place to that of training data .

in addition to this finding , correlator-level classifier is found to be more feasible in practical application due to its less dependency on surrounding scenario compared with theNMEA/RINEX-level classifier .
nlos multipath detection by using machine learning in urban environment .

in global navigation satellite system ( GNSS ) positioning , GNSS satellite are often obstructed by building , leading to reflected and diffracted signal , which are known as non-line-of-sight ( NLOS ) signal .
these cause major positioning ( also known as `` NLOS multipath '' ) error in GNSS positioning .
this paper proposes a novel NLOS multipath detection technique that uses a machine-learning technique to improve positioning accuracy in urban environment .
the key idea behind this technique is to construct a classifier that discriminates NLOS multipath signal from the output of the multiple GNSS signal correlator of a software GNSS receiver .
in the code-tracking process within GNSS receiver , the code correlation peak is determined and tracked using the output of the signal correlator .
in the case of an NLOS signal , there are no direct signal ; the first reflected signal has low power compared to the direct signal .
hence , the correlation function is expected to be more distorted in the case of NLOS signal correlation .
we use this phenomenon to detect NLOS signal .
for realizing machine learning , we extract the feature of the NLOS signal from the shape of the NLOS correlation function , using an actual dataset , to construct an NLOS classifier .
to evaluate the proposed technique , we conduct NLOS classification experiment using signal correlation data acquired at different location in the Shinjuku area of Japan .
we propose to construct an NLOS classifier based on a support vector machine .
from the experiment , 87 % of the LOS signal and 99 % of the NLOS signal are correctly discriminated .
a machine learning approach for localization in cellular environment .
a machine learning approach is developed for localization based on received signal strength ( RSS ) from cellular tower .

the proposed approach only assumes knowledge of RSS fingerprint of the environment , and does not require knowledge of the cellular base transceiver station ( BTS ) location , nor uses any RSS mathematical model .
the proposed localization scheme integrates a weighted K-nearest neighbor ( WKNN ) and a multilayer neural network .
the integration takes advantage of the robust clustering ability of WKNN and implements a neural network that could estimate the position within each cluster .

experimental result are presented to demonstrate the proposed approach in two urban environment and one rural environment , achieving a mean distance localization error of 5.9 m and 5.1 m in the urban environment and 8.7 m in the rural environment .
this constitutes an improvement of 41 % , 45 % , and 16 % , respectively , over the WKNN-only algorithm .
detecting Transportation Modes Based on LightGBM Classifier from GPS Trajectory Data .

human travel behavior can be obtained from the trajectory data generated by GPS device , which can be reflected in different transportation mode and provide useful information for trajectory prediction , urban planning and traffic monitoring .

in this article , we proposed transportation mode classification method based on Light Gradient Boosting Machine ( LightGBM ) to discover seven kind of transportation mode from GPS trajectory data , including walking , cycling , taking a bus , taking a taxi , driving a car , taking the subway and taking a train .
first , the original trajectory must be divided into some sub trajectory .
there is only one transportation mode label in each sub trajectory .
second , the feature vector of sub trajectory is computed including eight basic and three advanced feature .
these basic feature are distance feature , five velocity-related feature and two acceleration-related feature .
three advanced feature are heading change rate ( hcr ) , stop rate ( sr ) and velocity change rate ( vcr ) , Final , the LightGBM classifier is used to detect the transportation modes automatically .
the eXtreme Gradient Boosting ( XGBoost ) and decision tree are also used to verify the efficiency of our method .
the experiment data are Geolife provided by Microsoft Research Asia .
the result show that the LightGBM and XGBoost method are more accurate than decision tree method and the LightGBM is better than XGBoost at the classification of car , subway and train .
a fuzzy logic based transport mode detection framework in urban environment .
transport mode detection is an emerging research area in different domain such as urban planning , context-aware mobile computing , and intelligent transportation system .
current approach are mostly data-driven , based on machine learning approach .
however , machine learning model require substantial training data and can not explain the reasoning procedure .
data-driven approach also fall short while interpreting trajectory where ground truth information is limited .
therefore , this paper develops a novel knowledge-based approach for interpreting smartphone global positioning system trajectory by detecting various transport mode used during travel .
the proposed model is based on an expert system that can work without any training , based solely on expert knowledge .
core is a fuzzy multiple-input multiple-output expert system using kinematic and spatial information with a well explained fuzzy reasoning scheme through a fuzzy rule base .
the model can provide alternate prediction with varied certainty factor .

different membership function combination have been evaluated in term of accuracy and ambiguity , and the result demonstrates that the model performs best using a Gaussian–Gaussian combination , comparable to the existing machine learning approach .
machine learning for source localization in urban environment .
this paper investigates source localization in urban environment using machine learning method .
both classification and regression scheme are examined using the random forest algorithm .
in both approach , the localization performance depends mostly on arrival time information of received signal .
it is shown that the use of a relative arrival time difference rather than the direct time of arrival ( TOA ) also provide good performance , which is beneficial for practical application .
it is found that with enough number of receiver , the signal power parameter can be omitted , which eliminates frequency dependency of developed model .
it is also found that at least three receiver should be used to achieve acceptable prediction performance .
additionally , the number of training example needed depends on the approach used as well as the desired level of accuracy .
this factor is more important in the classification approach , as the amount of training data required closely relates to the number of sector created by the localization problem .
a regression scheme is more natural for predicting spatial coordinate value , and achieved higher localization accuracy with fewer training example as compared to classification .
ultimately , the regression based localization scheme using the time difference of arrival ( TDOA ) parameter at three receiver location achieved an average localization accuracy of 2.8m .
field Experiment of Localization Based on Machine Learning in LTE Network .
in mobile communication network , if we can estimate the location of each user equipment ( UE ) with high accuracy , efficient cell planning and network optimization become possible .

however , it is difficult for operator to estimate the location of most commercial UEs because they can not feedback their location information directly to their serving base station with the exception of UEs with Minimization of Drive Test ( MDT ) function specified in LTE Release 10 .
radio Frequency ( RF ) fingerprint method is known as an effective localization method , with which we can estimate the location of UEs with only RF signature and location information beforehand .
in LTE , RF fingerprint database can be collected by conducting drive test or using measurement data from UEs compatible with MDT .

although the estimation accuracy can be better with more RF signature , the increase in the amount of RF signatures causes the increase in the feedback , which consumes the uplink capacity and UE battery .
furthermore , keeping all RF signature in database is inefficient because some RF signature do not have effect on improving estimation accuracy .
hence , it is important to clarify the effect of each RF signature and use only effective one in the localization .

in this paper , we conducted a field experiment to create an RF fingerprint database in dense urban area , and evaluated the effectiveness of each RF signature by making several localization model based on machine learning .
eventually , we clarified minimum RF signature required to operate RF fingerprint localization in LTE network .
improving GPS Code Phase Positioning Accuracy in Urban Environment Using Machine Learning .
the accuracy of location information , mainly provided by the global positioning system ( GPS ) sensor , is critical for Internet-of-Things application in smart city .
however , built environment attenuate GPS signal by reflecting or blocking them resulting in some case multipath and non-line-of-sight ( NLOS ) reception .
these effect cause range error that degrade GPS positioning accuracy .
enhancement in the design of antennae and receiver deliver a level of reduction of multipath .
however , NLOS signal reception and residual effect of multipath are still to be mitigated sufficiently for improvement in range error and positioning accuracy .
recent machine learning-based method have shown promise in improving pseudorange-based position solution by considering multiple variable from raw GPS measurement .
however , positioning accuracy is limited by low accuracy signal reception classification .

unlike the existing method , which use machine learning to directly predict the signal reception classification , we use a gradient boosting decision tree ( GBDT ) -based method to predict the pseudorange error by considering the signal strength , satellite elevation angle and pseudorange residual .
with the predicted pseudorange error , two variation of the algorithm are proposed to improve positioning accuracy .
the first correct pseudorange error and the other either correct or excludes the signal determined to contain the effect of multipath and NLOS signal .

the result for a challenging urban environment characterized by high-rise building on one side , show that the 3-D positioning accuracy of the pseudorange error correction-based positioning measured in term of the root mean square error is 23.3 m , an improvement of more than 70 % over the conventional method .
machine learning-based method for path loss prediction in urban environment for LTE network .
this paper presents prediction path loss model in an urban environment for cellular network with the help of machine learning method .
for this goal , Support Vector Regression ( SVR ) , Random Forest ( RF ) and K-Nearest Neighbor ( KNN ) algorithms are exploited and assessed .

the training and testing procedure is carried out with the help of a path loss dataset generated by simulated result considering a Long Term Evolution ( LTE ) network utilizing a digital terrain model .
the simulation takes into account an urban environment for both line-of-sight ( LOS ) and non-LOS ( NLOS ) propagation condition .
the result reveal that all the evaluated algorithms forecast path loss with a remarkable accuracy , providing root-mean-square error on the order of 2 .
1-2.2db for LOS and 3 .
4-4.1db for NLOS location , respectively .
among the examined algorithms , KNN shows the best performance , thus being an appealing option to predict path loss in urban area .

for comparison purpose , the COST231 Walfisch-Ikegami empirical model was applied , which presents the worst performance , providing the highest error under-predicting path loss , especially in NLOS location .
nlos multipath detection using convolutional neural network .

in global navigation satellite system ( GNSS ) positioning , GNSS satellite are often obstructed by building , leading to reflected and diffracted signal , which are known as non-line-of-sight ( NLOS ) signal .
such signal cause major GNSS positioning ( also known as “ NLOS multipath ” ) error .
in this paper , a novel NLOS multipath detection technique using a machine-learning approach to improve the positioning accuracy in urban environment is proposed .
the key idea behind this technique is to construct a classifier that discriminates NLOS multipath signal from the output of the multiple GNSS signal correlator of a software GNSS receiver .
in the case of an NLOS signal , there are no direct signal ; the first reflected signal has low power compared to a direct signal .
hence , the correlation function is expected to be more distorted in the case of an NLOS signal correlation .
we use this phenomenon to detect NLOS signal .

to consider the change in shape of the correlation value of NLOS signal and their temporal variation , we propose a method for constructing a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) -based NLOS discriminator .
furthermore , we propose a method for applying the NLOS probability , which is the output of the CNN , to the positioning calculation .
to evaluate the proposed technique , we conducted NLOS classification experiment using signal correlation data acquired at different location in the Shinjuku area of Japan .
we compared the proposed method with a method using a simple NN .

as the experiment result indicate , the proposed method can correctly discriminate approximately 98 % of NLOS multipath signal , and the discrimination rate of the proposed CNN-based method is higher than that of the simple NN-based approach .
furthermore , we improved the positioning accuracy from 34.1 to 1.6 m using the proposed method and concluded that the proposed approach can increase the positioning accuracy in urban environment .
a new method for non-line-of-sight GNSS signal detection for positioning accuracy improvement in urban environment .
the classification of the line-of-sight ( LOS ) and non-line-of-sight ( NLOS ) signal is one of the major problem for robust GNSS positioning and the shadow matching in urban environment .
the existing technique include the multi-sensor integration , 3D map aid , using a dual-polarized antenna , an omnidirectional camera aid are proposed to solve the classification problem .
however , they all require external hardware or up-to-date map , which is expensive or impractical for mass-market application .

consistency checking with the receiver autonomous integrity monitoring ( RAIM ) is widely used for the detection of NLOS signal , but it is efficient only when the majority of the received signal are LOS signal .
machine learning method , including the decision tree , the support vector machine ( SVM ) have been explored to classify LOS and NLOS with good accuracy .

however , all current machine learning based method only utilize information within one epoch , all the inter-epoch information and data feature in time series are lost , and the information of signal propagation in the complex urban environment is not fully manifested in the Rinex level observation and NMEA level observation in one single epoch .
in this paper , a multivariate Long Short Term Memory Fully Convolutional Network ( MLSTM-FCN ) based signal classification method is proposed .
with the aid of the convolution layer and long short term memory block , this method handles the data feature in both time domain and value domain .

six time series feature of GNSS signal , including differenced C/N0 , time differenced ambiguity , double difference phase and pseudorange , phase and pseudorange consistency are analyzed and used as the input of the MLSTM-FCN .
dataset from two location in the urban Calgary are collected , each of which is used for training and testing purpose respectively .

the result reveal that , compared to the SVM classification method , the overall testing accuracy of the newly proposed classifier is improved from 93.00 % to 95.97 % for the Rinex level observation , and from 92.99 % to 93.83 for the NMEA level observation .

this improved classification accuracy brought by the proposed classifier is encouraging since it will enhance the robustness of the conventional GNSS positioning and the shadow matching based navigation system by reducing unbounded NLOS signal error in urban environment and result in significant improvement in positioning accuracy .

compared to the SVM classifier aided single point positioning ( SPP ) test , the accuracy in the form of RMS of the MLSTM-FCN aided SPP test can be improved by 24.3 % , 17.8 % and 24.4 % in the East , North and Up direction respectively , and the rate of the valid solution can be increased from 99.02 % to 99.94 % .
the new method has the potential to be widely applied by various receiver type with the output of the raw observation or only with the NMEA observation output .
support Vector Machine for Path Loss Predictions in Urban Environment .
path Loss ( PL ) propagation model are important for accurate radio network design and planning .
in this paper , we propose a new radio propagation model for PL prediction in urban environment using Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) .
field measurement campaign are conducted in urban environment to obtain mobile network and path loss information of radio signal transmitted at 900 , 1800 and 2100 MHz frequency .
svm model is trained with field measurement data to predict path loss in urban propagation environment .
performance of SVM model is evaluated using Mean Absolute Error ( MAE ) , Mean Square Error ( MSE ) , Root Mean Square Error ( RMSE ) and Standard Error Deviation ( SED ) .
result show that SVM achieve MAE , MSE , RMSE and SED of 7.953 dB , 99.966 dB , 9.998 dB and 9.940 dB respectively .
svm model outperform existing empirical model ( Okumura-Hata , COST 231 , ECC-33 and Egli ) with relatively low prediction error .
a comparison among various classification algorithms for travel mode detection using sensor ' data collected by smartphone .
nowaday , machine learning is used widely for the purpose of detecting the mode of transportation from data collected by sensor embedded in smartphone like GPS , accelerometer and gyroscope .
a lot of different classification algorithm are applied for this purpose .
this study provides a comprehensive comparison among various classification algorithms on the basis of accuracy of result and computational time .
the data used was collected in Kobe city , Japan using smartphone and cover seven transport mode .
after feature extraction , the data was applied to algo-rithms namely Support Vector Ma-chine , Neural Network , Decision Tree , Boosted Decision Tree , Random Forest and Naïve Bayes .
result indicat-ed that boosted decision tree gives highest accuracy but random forest is much quicker with accuracy slightly lower than that of boosted decision tree .
therefore , for the purpose of travel mode detection , random forest is most suitable .
analysis of BeiDou/Galileo combined pseudo-range positioning performance in urban environment .
the observation condition have a significant influence on the positioning performance .
gnss signal are easily blocked in urban environment , which leads to discontinuity and instability of position solution .
with the construction of BeiDou and Galileo satellite navigation system in the final stage , multi-satellite fusion will be the future development trend of GNSSs .

this paper introduces the mathematical fusion model of Galileo and BeiDou satellite navigation system , typical urban coverage condition are simulated , and a detailed in the aspect of number of visible satellite , positioning error and PDOP value are analysed .

the result show that the positioning accuracy of the integrated navigation system in the horizontal is within 3 m , the elevation is within 5 m , and the PDOP value are less than 1.5 in the open sky condition .

in any coverage condition , Galileo stand-alone system can not guarantee the positioning continuity in the whole day , and positioning performance is the worst in the north coverage condition , unable to obtain the position solution for more than 40 % time in the whole day .
in the north coverage condition , BeiDou has the best positioning performance , with a minimum of 4 visible satellite and 99 % of PDOP value are less than 10 .
artificial intelligence solution for urban land dynamic : A review .
artificial intelligence ( AI ) system are widely accepted as a technology offering an alternative way to tackle complex and dynamic problem in urban study .
the goal of this article is a review of current literature in the field of planning and AI .

the aim of this review is to increase the understanding of how AI approaches urban and land dynamic modeling process and how , as a result , researcher can structure that knowledge and choose the correct approaches to embed in their model .
for this purpose , the author review the application of AI technique in urban land dynamic domain as well as the emerging challenge they face .
the author discuss hybrid AI system as a need resulting from the trend in planning policy to develop more holistic approach .
the author conclude that , although challenge exist , AI-based approach offer promising solution for urban and land dynamic .
can expert system help with planning ?
the study of urban information system has focused primarily on devising an effective way to integrate data from various source to provide the necessary information for decision making .
recent advance in artificial intelligence ( AI ) technology have raised interest in how existing urban information system might benefit from AI .
artificial intelligence does not solve urban planning problem by itself .
rather , it is a newly emerging and promising technology that can be integrated into existing information system to provide more intelligent and effective solution to urban problem .
we conclude that application of expert system to urban planning are not only desirable but also a means of overcoming the limitation found in current computer-based approach to problem solving .
by integrating the technique of expert system into existing computer-based system , planner will be able to develop more intelligent information system for supporting their various task .
the promise of expert system for urban planning .

in this Guest Editorial , we present a brief history of Expert Systems ( ES ) , showing how they have emerged from work in Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) which has paralleled the availability of massive computer memory made possible by the development of the microprocessor .

our main concern here , however , is to present a context for the paper which follow , and we attempt this by identifying the sort of planning problem to which expert system can be applied , emphasising characteristic such as the balance between qualitative and quantitative representation , the degree to which such problem are well- or ill-defined and the extent to which their structure can be modelled using the logic of relation and search which lie at the heart of all expert system .
we also point out certain key feature of the paper which comprise this special issue .
in particular , we examine the way in which some of the author use expert system to interface existing computer model , thus developing Decision Support Systems ( DSS ) .

and we also note the concern in these application for developing appropriate characterisation of the `` knowledge base '' and the `` inference engine '' through the generation of appropriate rule-based logic which suitably define the problem in question .
finally , we draw out some of the implication of this stream of research for more effective urban planning .
concept of interactive machine learning in urban design problem .
this work presents a concept of interactive machine learning in a human design process .
an urban design problem is viewed as a multiple-criteria optimization problem .
the outlined feature of an urban design problem is the dependence of a design goal on a context of the problem .
we model the design goal as a randomized fitness measure that depends on the context .
in term of multiple-criteria decision analysis ( MCDA ) , the defined measure corresponds to a subjective expected utility of a user .
in the first stage of the proposed approach we let the algorithm explore a design space using clustering technique .
the second stage is an interactive design loop ; the user makes a proposal , then the program optimizes it , gets the user 's feedback and return back the control over the application interface .
the cooperative conceptualization of urban space in ai-assisted environmental planning .
the literature on spatial environment concern many discipline , and the present study aim at broadly contributing from an urban-planning view .
indoor and outdoor townscape , because of their dynamic complexity , seem to offer ill-structured holds to the typical spatial behaviour of an agent .
therefore , a question arises about the 'fundamental ' of spacescape from the point of view of the need of living and moving agent .
following this thread , the paper deal with the diagnosis and the control of a structured simple space , a minimum arc of a graph .

condition , situation , element , behaviour are explored in their spatial-temporal dimension , subsequently aiming at setting up a system architecture to let spatial agent control their de-structuring impact .

text analysis and interpretation are applied to a questionnaire survey , exploring low level ( movement orientation ) and high level ( memory and fantasy ) behaviours in human interaction with a space .
the experiment is developed in a large class of student from the Technical University of Bari , daily using a long and apparently amorphous corridor to reach Professor ' office for explanation .
an AI application to integrated tourism planning .

integrated Tourism can be defined as the kind of tourism which is explicitly linked to the locality in which it takes place and , in practical term , has clear connection with local resource , activity , product , production and service industry , and a participatory local community .
in this paper we report our experience in applying Artificial Intelligence technique to Integrated Tourism planning in urban area .
in particular , we have modeled a domain ontology for Integrated Tourism and developed an Information Extraction tool for populating the ontology with data automatically retrieved from the Web .
also , we have defined several Semantic Web Services on top of the ontology and applied a Machine Learning tool to better adapt the automated composition of these service to user demand .
use case of the resulting service infrastructure are illustrated for the Apulia Region , Italy .
procedural lot generation for evolutionary urban layout optimization in urban regeneration decision support .
decision support in urban regeneration planning involve fulfilment of complex design objective that require a close collaboration between stakeholder , designer and planner .
the objective are to achieve computationally optimized design plan that are environmentally robust and sustainable .
for the purpose of pre-planning analysis and optimization of such design model , the construction framework of the whole system development life cycle is simulated using specialist analysis tool .
in the analysis and design phase of such a construction process , location allocation of built environment structure integrated with AI based urban assessment model remain a cumbersome task .
with the advent of sophisticated computing hardware and 3D modelling technique , it has become viable to visualize and develop simulation outcome with ease over standard computer .
however , creation of simulated outcome with huge urban detail still remains a daunting task .

with the advent of knowledge-based data standard and mining technique , possibility have arisen to integrate procedural urban modelling framework with socio-economic deprivation assessment system to create massive city model in order to improve sustainability and smart growth .

the implementation of a procedural modelling framework offers a promising area of research in location allocation optimization of residential and public service structure for urban regeneration planning and collaboration purpose but is still largely stochastic in nature until now .

the work presented in this article proposes an L-system-based automated urban layout generation module in addition to an evolutionary building placement optimization system for the purpose of urban regeneration decision support .
