the location allocation optimization of a highly accessible pedestrian and street network grid still remains a complex process especially with neighbourhood suffering from severe socio-economic deprivation .

using an extension to ' L-systems ' , the module utilizes an 'mBPMOL ' system to recursively subdivide an urban regeneration layout and later encode the layout to a genetic chromosome to iteratively place a range of urban structure to the lot .

moving further , the system implements a distance-based socio-economic deprivation minimization fitness function and assesses subsequent individual genetic solution to search for an optimized layout .

the development of such an online procedural framework is a very first attempt to employ the capability of procedural automation with evolutionary computation to automatically generate and optimize the placement of a large number of building model .
the outcome achieved a set of relatively optimal solution with evaluation based upon a distance-based fitness objective function of various public service structure .
the solution ( layout plan ) thus obtained offered a number of moderate to highly accessible alternative .
development of such a system is meant to facilitate decision support and improve time efficiency among urban designer and planner .
an information system for judicial and public administration using artificial intelligence and geospatial data .
the adoption of information technology in judicial and public administration has become a major need nowaday with the rapid growth of information regarding managerial issue .

this paper presents an advanced methodology developed by using Information and Communication Technologies ( ICT ) and artificial intelligence to support decision making in public and judicial administration .

a prototype Management Information System for public administration ( MISPA ) was developed to provide a computerized way of managing geospatial urban , environmental and crime data of an urban area .
this system was developed by using several programming language , a Database Management System ( DBMS ) and other technology and programming tool .

the proposed system was developed aiming at the systemization and modernization of public , judicial and police authority that are associated with issue that have to be dealt by studying urban data regarding crime and environmental data and support decision making based on crime forecasting .
human as avatar in smart and playable city .
we compare the behavior of avatar in videogame with the expected behavior of human in smart environment , particularly smart urban environment .
as a result of this comparison we conclude that many aspect of controlling an avatar in a game environment will also be seen in controlling human behavior in smart urban environment .

we predict a convergence of videogame environment with smart urban environment where the Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) of the game environment can be compared with the AI of the smart urban environment that is responsible for the functioning of the smart city .
game characteristic such as immediate reward for good behavior can also be foreseen .
modelling space perception in urban planning : A cognitive Ai-based approach .
the study deal with cooperative space conceptualization by human according to the AI-based cognitive approach and the urban-planning approach of architect and planner .
it carries out the diagnosis and the control of example space in known urban environment .
the paper is oriented toward suggesting system architecture to let spatial agent add structuring degree to navigated urban space and challenge relevant disorientation condition .
the methodology draws on ontology-based text-mining analysis and statistical interpretation applied to university-class questionnaire survey , exploring behaviour in human interaction with a space .
after an introduction , a case-based discussion of the cooperative conceptualization and representation of space is carried out .
the third section shows the ontological result of the case-study , with general result and follow-up discussed in the concluding section .
towards the collaborative development of machine learning technique in planning support system – a Sydney example .

the rise of the term ‘ big data ’ has contributed to recent advance in computational analysis technique , such as machine learning and more broadly , artificial intelligence , which can extract pattern from large , multi-dimensional dataset .

in the field of urban planning , it is pertinent to understand both how such technique can advance our understanding of city , and how they can be embedded within transparent and effective digital planning tool , known as planning support system .
this research specifically focuses on two related contribution .

first , it investigates the role of planning support system in supporting a participatory data analytic approach through an iterative process of developing and evaluating a planning support system environment .

second , it investigates how specifically machine learning planning support system can be co-designed by built environment practitioner and stakeholder in this environment to solve a real planning issue in Sydney , Australia .
this paper presents the result of applied research undertaken through the design and implementation of four workshop , involving 57 participant who were involved in a co-design process .
the research follows a mixed-methods approach , studying a wide array of measure related to participatory analytic , task load , perceived added value , recording and observation .
the result highlight recommendation regarding the design and evaluation of planning support system environment for co-design and their coupling with machine learning technique .
it was found that consistency and transparency are highly valued and central to the design of a planning support system in this context .

general attitude towards machine learning and artificial intelligence as technique for planner and developer were positive , as they were seen as both potentially transformative but also as simply another technique to assist with workflow .

some conceptual challenge were encountered driven by practitioner ' simultaneous need for concrete scenario for accurate prediction , paired with a desire for prediction to drive the development of these scenario .

insight from this work can inform future planning support system evaluation and co-design study , in particular those aiming to support democracy enhancement , greater inclusion and more efficient resource allocation through a participatory analytic approach .
systematizing heterogeneous expert knowledge , scenario and goal via a goal-reasoning artificial intelligence agent for democratic urban land use planning .

the task of democratic urban land use planning , as subjective-objective combined decision-making effort that require considerable time and energy , have heretofore been accomplished mainly through deep human thought or by voting .

in this paper , we introduce a goal-reasoning artificial intelligence ( AI ) agent that can assist with these task by combining traditional scenario planning , multicriteria decision analysis ( MCDA ) with a novel goal-oriented Monte Carlo tree search ( G-MCTS ) method .
g-mct conduct goal-oriented search to meet the need of heterogeneous goal and provide the best land use solution .

we evaluated this method on a real-world planning case , and the result show that 1 ) the goal-reasoning AI agent is good at performing complex goal reasoning task with many heterogeneous expert knowledge ; 2 ) different human planning manuscript could be integrated into a better solution via a goal-reasoning AI agent ; and 3 ) the goal-reasoning AI agent has the potential to make comprehensive decision during a democratic political agenda .

we conclude that the goal-reasoning AI agent , via an improved reinforcement learning ( RL ) method of G-MCTS , provides vast potential for assisting in subjective-objective combined urban land use planning and many other similar Field by weighing heterogeneous goal , reproducing human inspiration , and acting as a reflexive sociotechnical system .
automating layout synthesis with constructive preference elicitation .
layout synthesis refer to the problem of arranging object subject to design preference and structural constraint .
application include furniture arrangement , space partitioning ( e.g .
subdividing a house into room ) , urban planning , and other design task .
computer-aided support system are essential tool for architect and designer to produce custom , functional layout .
existing system , however , do not learn the designer ’ s preference , and therefore fail to generalize across session or instance .
we propose addressing layout synthesis by casting it as a constructive preference elicitation task .
our solution employs a coactive interaction protocol , whereby the system and the designer interact by mutually improving each other ’ s proposal .
the system iteratively recommends layout to the user , and learns the user ’ s preference by observing her improvement to the recommendation .
we apply our system to two design task , furniture arrangement and space partitioning , and report promising quantitative and qualitative result on both .
code related to this paper is available at : https : //github.com/unitn-sml/constructive-layout-synthesis/tree/master/ecml18 .
toward typogenetic tool for generative urban aesthetic .
purpose : Urban typogenetic investigates the use of machine intelligence for the evaluation of performance measure as a decision support system ( DSS ) with a focus on urban aesthetic evaluation .
this framework allows designer to address performance measure , urban measure and aesthetic criterion in an adaptive , interactive generative design approach .
the purpose of this paper is to provide an understanding of the structure and the nature of the framework and the application of human-in-the-loop design system to urban design .
design/methodology/approach : Significant literature reviewed lead to the identification of an application potential in the decision-making process .
this potential is situated around the use of AI for the evaluation of subjective performance criterion in a DSS .

recognising that the key decision about urban aesthetic are based on the individual evaluation of the designer , an HITL approach for computational design software to support creative decision is presented in this paper .
finding : Urban typogenetic for interactive generative urban design allows the exploration of complex design space by using a human-in-the-loop design system in the context of urban aesthetic .

hybrid aesthetic evaluation allows the designer to analyse morphological feature and urban aesthetic during exploratory search and reveal hidden aspect of the urban context by visualisation of the result of the aesthetic evaluation .
integrating performance measure and urban aesthetic in urban typogenetic address major criterion of urban design at the beginning of the creative process .
originality/value : The use of a broad interactive approach to typogenetic design in an application to urban scenario is a novel conceptual approach to the design of urban configuration .

the suggested adaptive mechanism would allow the user of a typogenetic tool to subjectively evaluate solution by sight and reason about aesthetic , social and cultural implication of the reviewed design solution .
knowledge and reasoning in development control and urban design : an expert system approach .
expert system are computer program that use knowledge and expertise in a particular field to solve complex problem .
as such , they are a way of organising , formalising , and disseminating context-specific knowledge and problem-solving technique .

attempt to formalise planning and design method are reviewed and some parallel are proposed in the development of thought between one area of artificial intelligence ( AI ) research and planning theory .

in the final part of the paper there is a discussion of how an expert system approach , based on technique developed in the field of artificial intelligence , can be used to investigate the nature of knowledge and expertise in urban design and development control .
-from Author
enabling digital co-creation in urban planning and development .
co-creation is essential for urban planning .
online citizen participation is an established method to obtain feedback from citizen on a wide variety of plan .
but tool and method for digitized workshop are rare .
the City of Hamburg and the HafenCity University develop a system , which integrates digital online and on-site participation .
this paper reports on experience and finding made during the development and testing of digital touch table , peripheral and software .

while touch table proved to be powerful workshop tool for the visualization of map , plan , urban data and 3D model , it also showed that the design of interface for the citizen ’ input is a challenge .
of high importance and high potential is the development of AI-based functionality to support user input and feedback evaluation .
urban Experiment : Taking Off on the Wind of Al .
abstract .
what will be the impact of Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) on our urban future ?
it is clear is that a symbiosis between human designer and AI assistant is swiftly evolving .
wanyu He , CEO of XKool Technology and co-founder of Future Architecture Lab , leads us through some of the advantage of this new alliance , featuring some example of XKool 's AI- empowered insight .
viewpoint : City Information Modelling ( CIM ) and Digitizing Urban Design Practices .
new development in Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) and digital ubiquity bring revelation of emerging smart city .
however , urban designer are particularly reluctant to become digital and use software that automatically generates city .
instead , they return to traditional design skill such as creating scale model , sketching , notation and drafting .
there is an increasing advocacy for design to a human scale , placemaking and liveable city .
this viewpoint asks question about the application of AI and generative algorithms in digitizing urban design practice .

it reflects on the possibility of conjoining urban morphology and design theory into City Information Modelling ( CIM ) as a new digital tool for urban designer and reveal challenge in the ongoing development of new CIM software .
urban designer work within intricate design world with toolbox that consist of customized design element and symbologie .
the design worlds consist of element , rule and patern and they act as holding environment for their unique diagrammatic design knowledge .
cim and AI should understand design world with customized toolbox and provide help to automate repetitive behaviour patern while designing .
accessibility : Operationalizing a concept with relevance for planner .
earlier chapter in this book have shown that whilst accessibility is a well-studied concept in the scientific literature its use in practice is still limited .

in this chapter , we examine 24 of the latest wave of Accessibility Instruments ( AIs ) represented in COST Action TU1002 to assess their potential usability as planning support tool for transport and land use practitioner .

we here describe their key feature ( background , conceptual framework , and theoretical underpinning , operational aspect , relevance for planning practice , strength and limitation , and visualization ) in some detail and we reflect in a more nuanced way , as urban planner , on the data collected thought a survey , on how these instrument can most usefully be deployed to address land use and transport planning issue .
we also describe the developer ’ s perception of usability collected through the same survey used for collecting the key feature .
we identify , per item , significant similarity and difference and reflect on potential implication for their usability in planning practice .

besides the Accessibility Instruments Survey , this chapter also uses data also from the AIs summary report , which provide much richer information and explanation than the developer ’ s survey of how they anticipate their instrument could have a role in urban planning .
the chapter is structured into six section .
the first section provides an overview of the background of the 24 AIs involved in this research , followed by a description of the role in urban and transport planning of the AIs .

the third section concludes the debate around the key feature of the 24 AIs going into detail on conceptual and operational issue , such as the conceptual framework and theoretical underpinning , the operational characteristic , and the visualization of output .
the fourth section provides a specific analysis of the developer ’ s perception of usability of their AIs .
this is followed by a more general debate on the relevance of AIs for planning practice .
finally some general conclusion are drawn .
artificial Neural Networks as an Architectural Design Tool-Generating New Detail Forms Based on the Roman Corinthian Order Capital .

the following paper presents the result of the research in the field of the machine learning , investigating the scope of application of the artificial neural network algorithms as a tool in architectural design .

the computational experiment was held using the backward propagation of error method of training the artificial neural network , which was trained based on the geometry of the detail of the Roman Corinthian order capital .

during the experiment , as an input training data set , five local geometry parameter combined has given the best result : Theta , Pi , Rho in spherical coordinate system based on the capital volume centroid , followed by Z value of the Cartesian coordinate system and a distance from vertical plane created based on the capital symmetry .
additionally during the experiment , artificial neural network hidden layer optimal count and structure was found , giving result of the error below 0.2 % for the mentioned before input parameter .
once successfully trained artificial network , was able to mimic the detail composition on any other geometry type given .
despite of calculating the transformed geometry locally and separately for each of the thousand of surface point , system could create visually attractive and diverse , complex pattern .
designed tool , based on the supervised learning method of machine learning , gives possibility of generating new architectural forms- free of the designer 's imagination bound .

implementing the infinitely broad computational method of machine learning , or Artificial Intelligence in general , not only could accelerate and simplify the design process , but give an opportunity to explore never seen before , unpredictable form or everyday architectural practice solution .
the Cognitive Visualization of Space in City Walking : Spacescape Experimentation in Italy .
spacescape are often shaped by spatial behaviour .
however , their dynamic complexity makes it difficult for them to be simulated in AI-based environment .
as a result , degree of uncertainty often arise when one describes space , trying to give shared importance to structural , fundamental , peculiar spacescape quality .
this paper explores space ontologie built by human agent .
with the use of app feature of personal smartphone , student of the Technical University of Bari have explored an urban commercial street .
the result they obtained in the context of spatial cognition have been analysed and discussed for environment planning and management .
will AI ever support design thinking ?

this paper addresses the question of whether AI will ever support Design Thinking , with a focus on Architecture and Urban Planning , by analyzing the current trend of research in AI and related Field .
metroped : A tool for supporting crowds of pedestrian AI 's in urban environment .
metroped is a tool for supporting AI behaviour in real-time virtual city environment .

given information about the basic geometry of the environment being modelled , it allows a designer to annotate and mark-up element of relevance to AI character , providing support for appropriate autonomous AI behaviour in a manner consistent with the visual representation of the environment .

we describe the tool and mark-up process , providing insight into the importance of AI tool and principled approach when attempting to create large number of AI controlled character for use in real-time application situated in urban environment .
we also describe how we have been using the tool in novel way to research viewer perception of crowd behaviour .
a generative architectural and urban design method through artificial neural network .
machine learning , as a computational tool for finding mapping between the input and output data , has been widely used in engineering Field .
researcher have applied machine learning model to generate 2D drawing with pixel or 3D model with voxel , but the pixelization reduces the precision of the geometry .

therefore , in order to learn and generate 3D geometry as vectorized model with higher precision and faster computation speed , we develop a specific artificial neural network , learning and generating design feature for the form of building .

a customized data structure with feature parameter is constructed , meeting the requirement of the neural network by rebuilding surface with controlling point and appending additional input neuron as quantified vector to describe the property of the design .
the neural network is first trained with generated design data and then tested by adjusting the feature parameter .
the prediction of the generated data shows the basic generative ability of the neural network .

furthermore , trained with design data collected from existing building , the neural network learn and infer the geometric design feature of architectural design with different feature parameter , providing a data-driven method for designer to generate and analyze architectural form .
visual Analytics of Urban Informality and Infrastructure Planning with Tableau for Sustainable Urban Design Research Strategies in Lagos Metropolis .
urban informality and infrastructure planning ( UIIP ) are global phenomena .
study in urban informality are nearing 50 year with diverse research strategy to resolve the threat of infrastructure availability and quality to urban development .

information technology and artificial intelligence in humanitie , social science and environmental science research are described as the current paradigm shift for contextualising and resolving complex urban challenge such as UIIP .
this study assessed urban development factor with visual analytic technique to understand the issue of UIIP for sustainable urban design research strategy in Lagos metropolis .
it adopts case study method with triangulation technique , mixed method of data collection with SPSS and Tableau software for visual presentation analysis .

the finding revealed the descriptive statistical relationship between socioeconomic , environmental , and infrastructural factor of sustainable urban development toward UIIP in Lagos metropolis and suggests an inclusive research design strategy with integrated urban design research strategy .
measuring sustainability and urban data operationalization : An integrated computational framework to evaluate and interpret the performance of the urban form .
with rapid urbanization , the necessity for sustainable development has skyrocketed , and sustainable urban development is a must .
recent advance in computing performance of urban layout in real-time allow for new paradigms of performance-driven design .
as beneficial as utilizing multiple layer of urban data may be , it can also create a challenge in interpreting and operationalizing data .

this paper presents an integrated computational framework to measure sustainability , operationalize and interpret the urban form 's performance data using generative design method , novel performance simulation , and machine learning prediction .

the performance data is clustered into three pillar of sustainability : social , environmental , and economical , and it is followed with the performance space exploration , which assists in extracting knowledge and actionable rule of thumb .
a significant advantage of the framework is that it can be used as a discussion table in participatory planning processes since it could be easily adapted to interactive environment .
ai urbanism : a design framework for governance , program , and platform cognition .

historically , the dynamic between philosophy of artificial intelligence and its practical application has been essential for the development of both , and thus the encounter between theory of AI and architectural/urban theory should be a site of considerable productivity .
however , in many way , it is not .
this is due to two primary factor , one arising from each side of this encounter .

first , legacy of overly-anthropomorphic model of AI permeate design discourse , where issue of how well AI can be constrained to social issue of philosophy of mind exclude more foundational and cross-cultural question about artificial intelligence as material process in the physical world that could inform new philosophical insight .

concurrently , the mobilization of investment in “ Smart Cities ” discourses dominates the space of application of AI at urban scale in way that prematurely fixes solution in the skeuomorphic image of architectural and urban convention .

to break this impasse , we held a series of think-tank , workshop , and design charette that brought together leading figure in philosophy of artificial intelligence , urban design , and commercial AI platform .

the goal was to re-think from first principle how alternative philosophical model of AI as a distributed , discontinuous , landscape-scale technology in a direct encounter with the application in contexts of ecological sensing , automation ’ s impact on urban form , and issue of algorithmic governance .

the design brief for this research establishes a generative framework for conceiving how embedded machine sensing and intelligence is already changing urban form ( but unrecognized ) and could change it in the future ( based on more appropriate design projection ) .

the framework focuses on issue of urban zoning and architectural programming , data modeling and governance , platform cognition and design , and how these inform shift in dynamic of public and private institution .
the art of learnin .

david Wasserman states that with the help of artificial intelligence ( AI ) , planner can now evaluate the potential impact of a safety project in one week rather than having to wait for five year , or develop a sidewalk inventory across an entire county in a short period of time .

he describes how recent advance in AI and particularly its computer-vision subfield , promise to refocus planner ' effort on the work only professional can do and revolutionize the way we understand our community .
ai is the study of algorithm that can sense , reason , adapt , or otherwise simulate human intelligence .
it has had stop and start since the late 1950 , but everything changed in the early 2010s .
the field has experienced a transformation driven by improved hardware , the emergence of big data , and the widespread use of deep learning .

these advance enabled computer to learn by example , which has allowed them to do all sort of new task , from translating speech and increasing the pace of industrial automation to identifying cat picture on the internet .
urban Planning Reform Trend Based on Artificial Intelligence .
artificial intelligence ( AI ) will offer opportunity for comprehensive reform in the urban planning field , including thought , technology , method , and management .
it is inevitable that the urban planning reform throughout the urban planning management process will be optimized by the development and application of AI .
firstly , the development and evolution of AI and its stage feature are consolidated , and several technological breakthrough direction of AI are expounded .
subsequently , the interaction between AI and urban planning are analyzed .

meanwhile , based on the clarification of four basic feature ( uncertain , scientific , democratic and dynamic ) of urban planning reform , the problem of China 's urban planning reform in four aspect of information , technology , subject , and feedback are reviewed .

finally , from the four technical breakthrough direction , that is , big data intelligence , human-computer hybrid enhanced intelligence , Internet group intelligence , and cross-media intelligence , in the AI technology closely related to the above urban planning reform problem , optimization strategy are prosed for the urban planning reform in China .
comparative Study on Urban Virtual Modeling Platforms for Urban Planning and Design Practice .

this paper examines urban virtual modelling platform ( UVMPs ) to be used for urban planning and design practice , thus following point are revealed ; firstly , comparing existing platform in the case study , capability of each platform is pointed out .
secondly , potential of UVMPs for urban planning and design process , including A ) Collaborative Design , B ) Simulation-based Design and C ) AI-involved Design are also tested in the case study .
consequently , a possible system with above potential is tested and the workflow for urban planning and design practice using UVMPs is suggested .
algorithms , AI and architecture .
this paper reports on ongoing research investigating application and methodology for algorithms and artificial intelligence within urban design .
although the research recognises not all design is numerically quantifiable , it posits that certain aspect are .
it provides evidence of algorithmically derived solutions-in many cases-being as good as those developed by a design professional .
i situate the research within a series of example of design quantification and description .
before discussing practical implementation of algorithmic spatial planning by the co-work start-up WeWork .
these project demonstrate an ongoing narrative to establish spatial syntactical rule for building and urban design .
finally , the paper report on original research that aims to apply algorithmic space planning to urban design .
a work-in-progress , at this stage the finding report on our methodology , preliminary implementation of an algorithmic strategy .
it finally presents emerging data pointing to what might happen if the sector does not embrace algorithms and AI .

application of AI in urban design .
due to the complexity of the urban environment , urban planner and designer need to simplify this complex system for the better understanding of the urban change .
the aim of this book is centralized on the use of novel method in recognizing urban phenomenon and the way to deal with them .
nowaday thank to the appearance of the AI technique this aim becomes feasible , up-to-date , and immediate .
therefore we try to introduce AI technique and their application on the process of urban planning and design by the aim of improving the quality of life within city .
designing with citizen : Challenge and evaluation method for crowd-sourced urban layout .
this paper presents analysis tool for evaluating crowdsourced geometry-based design proposal for urban planning .
with the Quick Urban Analysis Kit , an online platform , citizen are able to manipulate object and create a preferred layout over a case study area .
given that our case study is on a meso-cale , our analysis is focused on the layout and plot configuration .
the proposed analysis tool range from simple counting of object type and a buffer analysis to clustering and spatial autocorrelation tool .
besides these form-based criterion , perception-based criterion are also proposed to link the participating subject 's assessment of the design with the layout .
technique deployed include supervised machine learning method , statistical spatial test , and simple calculation of the area size and frequency of object .
procedural urban environment for FPS game .
this paper presents a novel approach to procedural generation of urban map for First Person Shooter ( FPS ) game .
a multi-agent evolutionary system is employed to place Street , building and other item inside the Unity3D game engine , resulting in playable video game level .

a computational agent is trained using machine learning technique to capture the intent of the game designer as part of the multi-agent system , and to enable a semi-automated aesthetic selection for the underlying genetic algorithm .
international series on information system and management in creative eMedia .
the proceeding contain 4 paper .

the topic discussed include : concept of interactive machine learning in urban design problem ; tackling challenge in the engagement of citizen with smart city initiative ; squat & grow : designing smart human-food interaction in Singapore ; and Artur Lugmayr 's white paper collection and online resource .
online cooperative design for the proposal of layout of street furniture in a street park .
in the last decade of the twenty-first century , the rapid development of Internet and computer technology has enabled conduct cooperative design through the Internet .

al-douri ( 2010 ) argued that conventional urban planning may lack adequate coverage of the essential design aspect of the built environment , which can be corrected by digital model and information technology tool that may help designer to visualize and interact with design alternative and correct this problem .

following the work of Carmona and Punter ( 2002 ) , Ai-Douri classified urban design aspect , such as urban form , townscape , public realm , conservation area , land use , and landscape architecture .

under the multi-user architecture for team environment , the technical condition for the implementation of cooperative design comprises both a visual representation and a semantic representation , as well as a shared workspace for shared understanding ( Saad and Maher 1996 ) .

meanwhile , research on online design tool has recently appeared in literature regarding coordination , collaboration , and communication in cooperative design ( Klein 1995 ; Nurcan 1998 ; Okukuni et al .
2000 ; Wang et al .
2009 ) using virtual reality ( VR ) .
it is worthwhile to explore the prospect of online cooperative design as an application and extension of VR technology .

in this chapter , we focus on a shared visual representation and computer-mediated communication ( Miller and Brunner 2008 ) between participant for reaching a consensus on the design of a street park .
understanding townscape through AI approach to the study of human living in space .
spatial environment have been studied by many scholar in different discipline , and the present study aim at contributing to the broader discussion from an urban-planning view .

indoor and outdoor townscape , because of their dynamic complexity , seem to offer ill-structured holds to the typical spatial behaviour of an agent , particularly when spatial behaviours is analyzed in mainstream AI robotic .
therefore , a question arises about the 'fundamental ' of spacescape from the point of view of the need of living agent , having to live in and move through them in resilient and intelligent way .
in this context , the subject of the present paper is the diagnosis and the control of a structured simple space , geometrically intended as the minimum arc of a graph .

condition , situation , element , behaviour are explored and partially analyzed in their spatial-temporal dimension , subsequently aiming at setting up a system architecture to let spatial agent control their de-structuring impact .

the research makes use of text analysis and interpretation , both applied to an in-class questionnaire survey , exploring low level ( movement orientation ) and high level ( memory and fantasy ) behaviours in human interaction with a space .

the experiment is developed by relying on a large class of student from the Technical University of Bari , daily using a long and apparently amorphous corridor to reach lecturer ' office for advice , exam and explanation .
the construction game .
technology for video game have advanced dramatically over the past decade , revolutionising the motion picture , game and multimedia industry .
similar technology , such as virtual reality and digital modelling , have been used in the construction domain ; example can be found in urban planning and city modelling .
the nD game project , by the University of Salford , developed a computer game to inspire younger generation into the construction industry .

with modern game technology becoming more and more sophisticated , and the vast amount of technology that have been developed during the game development , this chapter explores the opportunity to apply gaming technology in the construction arena .

technology such as game artificial intelligence ( AI ) and behavioural modelling for construction simulation , massively multiplayer online game ( MMOG ) for the virtual construction site , and interactive game for construction training are discussed .
a knowledge-based creation of mathematical programming for GIS problem solving .
nowadays the biggest challenge to GIS is the model design of theme analyzing .
many GIS application need more function in analysis and decision-making than in data organization or visualization .

while confronted with an application like planning a new metro line in a city , the typical GIS can not accomplish it by itself , unless some human expert or artificial intelligence technology are involved .
number of GIS application essentially are model of theme analyzing , and they are also example of problem solving in AI .
therefore many theory and technology from AI can be embedded in GIS to strengthen its ability of automatic analysis .
fortunately mathematical programming is a kind of powerful tool to settle problem with a demand of optimization under some constraint condition .
many GIS application happen to be this type , and some mathematical model can usually approximate them accurately .
two new question aroused .
the first is what objective function and constraint condition that constitute a mathematical programming should be , and the second is how to acquire those mathematical expression .
due to the establishment of a mathematical programming is highly knowledge-based , so an AI subsystem is designed to autonomously create a mathematical programming .

this problem has a typical characteristic of multiple domain crossing from perspective of Knowledge Engineering , so some novel knowledge-processing method , like knowledge dependence , knowledge transition and knowledge reference , are studied .
and a knowledge system represented by frame and a reference-based knowledge-using method are presented here .

measuring visual enclosure for street walkability : Using machine learning algorithm and Google Street View imagery .

one major limitation currently with studying street level urban design quality for walkability is the often inconsistent and unreliable measure of streetscape feature across different field surveyor even with costly training due to lack of more objective process , which also make large scale study difficult .
the recent advance in sensor technology and digitization have produced a wealth of data to help research activity by facilitating improved measurement and conducting large scale analysis .
this paper explores the potential of big data and big data analytic in the light of current approach to measuring streetscape feature .
by applying machine learning algorithm on Google Street View imagery , we generated objectively three measure on visual enclosure .
the result showed that sky area were identified fairly well for the calculation of proportion of sky .
the three visual enclosure measure were found to be correlated with pedestrian volume and Walk Score .

this method allows large scale and consistent objective measure of visual enclosure that can be done reproducibly and universally applicable with readily available Google Street View imagery in many countrie around the world to help test their association with walking behavior .
measuring daily accessed street greenery : A human-scale approach for informing better urban planning practice .
the public benefit of visible street greenery have been well recognised in a growing literature .
nevertheless , this issue was rare to be included into urban greenery and planning practice .

as a response to this situation , we proposed an actionable approach for quantifying the daily exposure of urban resident to eye-level street greenery by integrating high resolution measurement on both greenery and accessibility .
google Street View ( GSV ) images in Singapore were collected and extracted through machine learning algorithm to achieve an accurate measurement on visible greenery .
street network collected from Open Street Map ( OSM ) were analysed through spatial design network analysis ( sDNA ) to quantify the accessibility value of each street .

the integration of street greenery and accessibility helps to measure greenery from a human-centred perspective , and it provides a decision-support tool for urban planner to highlight area with prioritisation for planning intervention .
moreover , the performance between GSV-based street greenery and the urban green cover mapped by remote sensing was compared to justify the contribution of this new measurement .
it suggested there was a mismatch between these two measurement , i.e.
, existing top-down viewpoint through satellite might not be equivalent to the benefit enjoyed by city resident .

in short , this analytical approach contributes to a growing trend in integrating large , freely-available dataset with machine learning to inform planner , and it makes a step forward for urban planning practice through focusing on the human-scale measurement of accessed street greenery .
mapping urban form and function at city block level using spatial metric .

this paper focuses on the potential of urban metric describing the presence and the configuration of built-up and open space area for mapping distinct type of urban form and function at city block level .

next to traditional , patch-based metric used in landscape ecology , alternative metric are proposed , measuring the presence and the spatial arrangement of built-up and open space area along a set of radial transect , along contour parallel to the urban block boundary and along the block 's perimeter , as well as metric describing the internal composition of the built-up area .
use of the proposed metric for identifying different type of urban form and function was tested on the Brussels Capital Region .
large-scale vector data was used to define built-up structure and to analyse the morphological property of the built-up area at block level .

decision tree classification was applied in conjunction with bootstrap aggregation to gain insight in the distinctive character of the defined metric , and the robustness of land use and urban form classification based on these metric .

our study point out the shortcoming of traditional landscape ecological metric for mapping urban form and emphasizes the need for alternative approach for analysing urban landscape , more explicitly describing the morphological characteristic of the urban fabric .
streetvizor : Visual Exploration of Human-Scale Urban Forms Based on Street Views .
urban form at human-scale , i.e.
, urban environment that individual can sense ( e.g.
, sight , smell , and touch ) in their daily live , can provide unprecedented insight on a variety of application , such as urban planning and environment auditing .
the analysis of urban form can help planner develop high-quality urban space through evidence-based design .
however , such analysis is complex because of the involvement of spatial , multi-scale ( i.e.
, city , region , and street ) , and multivariate ( e.g.
, greenery and sky ratio ) nature of urban form .
in addition , current method either lack quantitative measurement or are limited to a small area .

the primary contribution of this work is the design of StreetVizor , an interactive visual analytic system that helps planner leverage their domain knowledge in exploring human-scale urban form based on street view image .

our system presents two-stage visual exploration : 1 ) an AOI Explorer for the visual comparison of spatial distribution and quantitative measurement in two areas-of-interest ( AOIs ) at city- and region-scale ; 2 ) and a Street Explorer with a novel parallel coordinate plot for the exploration of the fine-grained detail of the urban form at the street-scale .
we integrate visualization technique with machine learning model to facilitate the detection of street view pattern .
we illustrate the applicability of our approach with case study on the real-world dataset of four city , i.e.
, Hong Kong , Singapore , Greater London and New York City .
interview with domain expert demonstrate the effectiveness of our system in facilitating various analytical task .
microsite condition dominate habitat selection of the red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis , Hymenoptera : Megachilidae ) in an urban environment : A case study from Leipzig , Germany .
the red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis L. ) is a common wild bee in urban environment which contributes to early-season pollination .
we know only little about how any specie of wild bee in city respond to resource distribution or landscape structure and the urban habitat ( s ) that they prefer .
we employed a citizen science approach to investigate driver behind the spatial distribution of this solitary bee in the urban region of Leipzig ( Germany ) .
volunteer hung trap nest at different location and collected information on eight local , microsite condition ( such as sun exposure , attachment position , local flower availability ) .
we derived 14 landscape factor from a digital GIS biotope data map ( e.g .
distance to flower site and urban matrix property such as size and edge length of patch ) .
both occurrence and abundance of O. bicornis were then analyzed using a combination of machine learning and multiple ( logistic ) regression .
the result indicate that the red mason bee is ubiquitous in urban area but clearly profit from nearby floral resource .
although we expected a balanced influence of landscape factor and microsite condition , we found that hang location of the trap nest was most important , followed by sun exposure .

city with many fine-scaled floral resource ( such as private garden but not park ) and an open housing structure with higher sun exposure between building provide a good environment for cavity-nesting bee such as O. bicornis .
in Place without suitable nesting opportunity , artificial nest can support the bee .
a tool for urban soundscape evaluation applying Support Vector Machines for developing a soundscape classification model .
to ensure appropriate soundscape management in urban environment , the urban-planning authority need a range of tool that enable such a task to be performed .
an essential step during the management of urban area from a sound standpoint should be the evaluation of the soundscape in such an area .

in this sense , it has been widely acknowledged that a subjective and acoustical categorization of a soundscape is the first step to evaluate it , providing a basis for designing or adapting it to match people 's expectation as well .
in this sense , this work proposes a model for automatic classification of urban soundscape .
this model is intended for the automatic classification of urban soundscape based on underlying acoustical and perceptual criterion .
thus , this classification model is proposed to be used as a tool for a comprehensive urban soundscape evaluation .

because of the great complexity associated with the problem , two machine learning technique , Support Vector Machines ( SVM ) and Support Vector Machines trained with Sequential Minimal Optimization ( SMO ) , are implemented in developing model classification .
the result indicate that the SMO model outperforms the SVM model in the specific task of soundscape classification .
with the implementation of the SMO algorithm , the classification model achieves an outstanding performance ( 91.3 % of instance correctly classified ) .
machine learning approach to understand the influence of urban environment on human 's physiological response .

this research proposes a framework for signal processing and information fusion of spatial-temporal multi-sensor data pertaining to understanding pattern of human physiological change in an urban environment .
the framework includes signal frequency unification , signal pairing , signal filtering , signal quantification , and data labeling .

furthermore , this paper contributes to human-environment interaction research , where a field study to understand the influence of environmental feature such as varying sound level , illuminance , field-of-view , or environmental condition on human ’ perception was proposed .
in the study , participant of various demographic background walked through an urban environment in Zürich , Switzerland while wearing physiological and environmental sensor .

apart from signal processing , four machine learning technique , classification , fuzzy rule-based inference , feature selection , and clustering , were applied to discover relevant pattern and relationship between the participant ’ physiological response and environmental condition .
the predictive model with high accuracy indicate that the change in the field-of-view correspond to increased participant arousal .
among all feature , the participant ’ physiological response were primarily affected by the change in environmental condition and field-of-view .
daily accessed street greenery and housing price : Measuring economic performance of human-scale streetscape via new urban data .
the protective effect of street greenery on ecological , psychological , and behavioral phenomenon have been well recognized .
nevertheless , the potential economic effect of daily accessed street greenery , i.e.

, a human-scale and perceptual-oriented quality focusing on exposure to street greenery in people 's daily live , has not been fully studied because a quantitative measuring of this human-scale indicator is hard to achieve .
this study was an attempt in this direction with the help of new urban data and new analytical tool .
shanghai , which has a mature real estate market , was selected for study , and the housing price of 1395 private neighborhood in its city center were collected .

we selected more than forty variable that were classified under five categories-location feature , distance to the closest facility , density of facility within a certain radius , housing and neighborhood feature , and daily accessed street greenery-in a hedonic pricing model .
the distance and density of facility were computed through a massive number of points-of-interest and a geographical information system .
the visible street greenery was collected from Baidu street view image and then measured via a machine-learning algorithm , while accessibility was measured through space syntax .

in addition to the well-recognized effect previously discovered , the result show that visible street greenery and street accessibility at global scale hold significant positive coefficient for housing price .
visible street greenery even obtains the second-highest regression coefficient in the model .
moreover , the combined assessment , the co-presence of local-scale accessibility and eye-level greenery , is significant for housing price as well .

this study provides a scientific and quantitative support for the significance of human-scale street greenery , making it an important issue in urban greening policy for urban planner and decision maker .
explaining subjective perception of public space as a function of the built environment : A massive data approach .
people 's perception of the built environment influence the way they use and navigate it .
understanding these perception may be useful to inform the design , management and planning process of public space .
recently , several study have used data collected at a massive scale and machine learning method to quantify these perception , showing promising result in term of predictive performance .
nevertheless , most of these model can be of little help in understanding user ’ perception due to the difficulty associated with identifying the importance of each attribute of landscape .

in this work , we propose a novel approach to quantify perception of landscape through discrete choice model , using semantic segmentation of image of public space , generated through machine learning algorithms , as explanatory variable .

the proposed model are estimated using the Place Pulse dataset , with over 1.2 million perceptual indicator , and are able to provide useful insight into how user perceive the built environment as a function of its feature .
the model obtained are used to infer perceptual variable in the city of Santiago , Chile , and show they have a significant correlation with socioeconomic indicator .
capturing impression of pedestrian landscape used for healing purpose with decision tree learning .
in 2002 , Medicare health insurance recognized the relationship between pedestrian environment and public health by providing co-pay for health care delivered in residential land use .

in this multi-disciplinary experiment , artificial intelligence ( AI ) and landscape architecture ( LA ) bridge their respective domain to measure and model the pedestrian reaction to walking environment in small town residential community in Central Texas .
in the process , we gained a deeper understanding of the health motivation of walker and their empirical relationship to various street environment that they used for health purpose .

the analytical model we ultimately developed is a flexible tool that facilitates exploration of people 's perception of the landscape , how the pedestrian landscape are functioning in the opinion of its user , and how change to the design of the walking domain may predictably affect physical activity level with the associated health benefit .
a pilot study involving fifty-four participant and six walking environment were used in the development of an analytical model that is significantly site-specific and grass root oriented .
participant perception were measured querying each participant 's rating of fifty discrete environmental variable taken .
this data was then analyzed using the decision tree algorithm .

our primary objective was to capture the decision-making pattern walker engage in when deciding to walk in a particular environment specifically for health purpose and to make this available to the designer of pedestrian environment in transportation corridor .
the approach gave the designer new insight into the critical variable and the not so critical variable that affected people 's decision to walk for health purpose .
the result from the analysis defined measurable environmental variable that form the design for pedestrian activity in the six walking environment in the study area .
a customized version of decision tree machine learning algorithm rule for designing good pedestrian landscape for health purpose were extracted from the grass root survey .
the data indicated that variable influencing the decision to walk for health purpose in the study area included weather , sound , water , light and edge of space .

the analytical model derived from the discipline of artificial intelligence facilitated examining a subset of variable and manipulating of individual or group of these variable to better understand how the built environment affected decision to walk for different purpose .
this collaboration was our first phase in developing intelligent tool for designer that provided site-specific user-specific data to the planner or designer of pedestrian space .
a systematic measurement of street quality through multi-sourced Urban data : A human-oriented analysis .
many study have been made on street quality , physical activity and public health .
however , most study so far have focused on only few feature , such as street greenery or accessibility .
these feature fail to capture people ’ s holistic perception .
the potential of fine grained , multi-sourced urban data creates new research Avenue for addressing multi-feature , intangible , human-oriented issue related to the built environment .
this study proposes a systematic , multi-factor quantitative approach for measuring street quality with the support of multi-sourced urban data taking Yangpu District in Shanghai as case study .
this holistic approach combine typical and new urban data in order to measure street quality with a human-oriented perspective .
this composite measure of street quality is based on the well-established 5Ds dimension : Density , Diversity , Design , Destination accessibility and Distance to transit .

they are combined as a collection of new urban data and research technique , including location-based service ( LBS ) positioning data , point of interest ( PoIs ) , element and visual quality of street-view image extraction with supervised machine learning , and accessibility metric using network science .

according to these quantitative measurement from the five aspect , Street were classified into eight feature cluster and three type reflecting the value of street quality using a hierarchical clustering method .
the classification was tested with expert .
the analytical framework developed through this study contributes to human-oriented urban planning practice to further encourage physical activity and public health .
structure and information in spatial segregation .
ethnoracial residential segregation is a complex , multiscalar phenomenon with immense moral and economic cost .
modeling the structure and dynamic of segregation is a pressing problem for sociology and urban planning , but existing method have limitation .
in this paper , we develop a suite of method , grounded in information theory , for studying the spatial structure of segregation .

we first advance existing profile and decomposition method by posing two related regionalization method , which allow for profile curve with nonconstant spatial scale and decomposition analysis with nonarbitrary areal unit .
we then formulate a measure of local spatial scale , which may be used for both detailed , within-city analysis and intercity comparison .
these method highlight detailed insight in the structure and dynamic of urban segregation that would be otherwise easy to miss or difficult to quantify .
they are computationally efficient , applicable to a broad range of study question , and freely available in open source software .
the conceptual basis of water-energy-food nexus governance : systematic literature review using network and discourse analysis .
in the last decade , the debate on the governance of water , energy , and food ( WEF ) has intensified , spurring the emergence of the term “ nexus governance.
” In general , the reduction of trade-off and construction of synergy between WEF have been placed on the scientific , political , and economic agenda .
however , although increasingly used , it is difficult to find a clear meaning and definition of what the term represents .

based on a systematic literature review ( SLR ) , using text-mining and machine learning algorithms , this article investigates what are the conceptual basis of the nexus governance debate , and attempt to clarify the main theme , network , and gap within this literature .
the analysis is based on quantitative and qualitative method , combining social network analysis ( SNA ) and discourse analysis ( DA ) .

the result highlighted that twenty-four governance-related concept support this literature , breaking down into eight group : water and basin governance ; environmental and system governance ; risk and resource security governance ; economic governance ; global governance ; urban governance ; integrative and cooperative governance ; and “ epistemic ” and transdisciplinary governance .
published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .
feature extraction and k-mean clustering approach to explore important feature of urban identity .
public space play an important role in the process of formation , generation and change of urban identity .
under present day condition , the identity of city are rapidly deteriorating and vanishing .
therefore , the importance of urban design , which is a means of designing urban space and their physical and social aspect , is ever growing .
this paper proposes a novel methodology by using Principle Component Analysis ( PCA ) and K-means clustering approach to find important feature of the urban identity from public space .
k. Lynch 's work and Space Syntax theory are reconstructed and integrated with POI ( Point of Interest ) to quantify the quality of the public space .
a case study of Zürich city is used to test of these redefinition and feature of urban identity .
the result show that PCA and K-means clustering approach can identify the urban identity and explore important feature .
this strategy could help to improve planning and design process and generation of new urban pattern with more appropriate feature and quality .
on urban soundscape mapping : A computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment .
the purpose of this study was to investigate whether or not a computer may predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , based on acoustic data only .
it may be argued that this is impossible , because a computer lack life experience .
moreover , if the computer was able to make an accurate prediction , we also wanted to know what information it needed to make this prediction .
we recruited 33 student ( 18 female ; Mage = 25.4 yrs.
, SDage = 3.6 ) out of which 30 assessed how pleasant and eventful 102 unique soundscape excerpt ( 30 s ) from Stockholm were .

based on the Bag of Frames approach , a Support Vector Regression learning algorithm was used to identify relationship between various acoustic feature of the acoustic signal and perceived affective quality .
we found that the Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients provided strong prediction for both Pleasantness ( R2 = 0.74 ) and Eventfulness ( R2 = 0.83 ) .
this model performed better than the average individual in the experiment in term of internal consistency of individual assessment .
taken together , the result show that a computer can predict the outcome of soundscape assessment , which is promising for future soundscape mapping .
impact of community deprivation on urban park access over time : Understanding the relative role of contributor for urban planning .
as an important element of urban landscape , park plays an important role in building environmentally sustainable city .
thus , it is important to examine park accessibility and how it changes over time in relation to community deprivation so as to provide all resident with equitable service .

using the Gaussian-based 2SFCA ( two-step floating catchment area ) method , this paper analyzes dynamic park accessibility from 2016 to 2018 for community within the Hangzhou metropolitan area in China and then quantifies the relative role of local contributor to park accessibility change ( population , park and transport network ) .

a machine learning algorithm , which handles the interdependence of deprivation dimension , is further employed to determine the relationship between community deprivation and park accessibility change .
result show that park accessibility continued to grow during the study period , and most community achieved excellent park accessibility by 2018 .
population decrease and park increase contribute positively to improved park accessibility , while transport network change have had less of an impact .
deprived community have observed a rising trend of park accessibility , while the elderly concentrated community are more likely to experience declined park accessibility .

our study provides a new methodological framework , which integrates the geographical accessibility model , economic chain substitution model and machine learning algorithm , for understanding the dynamic park access and associated social inequality in rapidly urbanizing region .
the lesson learned from this study should be insightful for urban planning .
urban Data Mining using emergent SOM .
the term of Urban Data-Mining is defined to describe a methodological approach that discovers logical or mathematical and partly complex description of urban pattern and regularity inside the data .
the concept of data mining in connection with knowledge discovery technique plays an important role for the empirical examination of high dimensional data in the field of urban research .
the procedure on the basis of knowledge discovery system are currently not exactly scrutinised for a meaningful integration into the regional and urban planning and development process .
in this study ESOM is used to examine community in Germany .
the data deal with the question of dynamic process ( e.g .
shrinking and growing of city ) .
in the future it might be possible to establish an instrument that defines objective criterion for the benchmark process about urban phenomenon .
the use of GIS supplements the process of knowledge conversion and communication .
automatic sound recognition of urban environment event .
the audio analysis of speaker ’ s surrounding has been a first step for several processing system that enable speaker ’ s mobility though his daily life .
these algorithm usually operate in a short-time analysis decomposing the incoming event in time and frequency domain .
in this paper , an automatic sound recognizer is studied , which investigates audio event of interest from urban environment .

our experiment were conducted using a close set of audio event from which well known and commonly used audio descriptor were extracted and model were training using powerful machine learning algorithm .
the best urban sound recognition performance was achieved by SVMs with accuracy equal to approximately 93 % .
multiple image of the city : Unveiling group-specific urban perception through a crowdsourcing game .
our perception of public space are central for our experience in the city .
understanding which factor shape this perception informs both urban planner , that aim at improving city life , as well as computational model that help us navigate in urban space .
to understand city at scale , crowdsourcing game have been employed successfully to evaluate citizen ' opinion about city and urban scene .
by analyzing human perception from resident of a mid-sized Brazilian city , this work brings three novel contribution .
first , we consider theory from urban design to explore through crowdsourcing which high and low level feature in an urban space are linked to perception of safety and pleasantness .

secondly , this paper leverages theory from urban sociology and anthropology to show how the sociodemographic pro.le of the citizen signi.cantly mediate their perception of safeness and pleasantness of Place .

finally , we show that feature of the urban form proposed by urbanist can be combined with sociodemographic to improve the accuracy of machine learning model that predict which scene a person will .nd more safe or pleasant .
.is last result paves the road for more personalized recommendation in cold-start scenario .
comparison of machine learning technique for the automatic recognition of soundscape .
rather than recognising single environmental sound source , research on soundscape recognition aims at identifying general unstructured auditory scene composed of multiple simultaneous sound source .

nowaday , soundscape recognition has multiple application , such as : i ) contextawareness for mobile robot and portable device , so as to provide information about the surrounding acoustic environment , enabling the automatic reaction of the device without human intervention ; ii ) background noise identification for speech recognition system , so as to improve the robustness of such system by facilitating their adaptability to any indoor or outdoor environment ; iii ) support tool in urban planning and noise annoyance assessment .
in this paper , pattern recognition technique specially designed to automatically recognise soundscape are implemented .
specifically , the study focuses on finding the most appropriated learning paradigm .

a set of machine learning technique , commonly employed in similar sound recognition task , are considered : decision tree , K-Nearest Neighbours algorithm , Gaussian Mixture Models and Neural Networks .
extensive experiment are carried out so as to empirically test and compare the performance attained by the different learning technique .
the experiment are performed employing an audio data corpus composed of 15 different soundscene , such as park , traffic street , restaurant or stadium .
a data-informed analytical approach to human-scale greenway planning : Integrating multi-sourced urban data with machine learning algorithm .
urban greenway have been recognized as an important strategy to improve human-scale quality in high-density built environment .
nevertheless , current greenway suitability analysis mainly focuses on geographical and natural issue , failing to account for human-scale urban design factor .

accordingly , this study proposes a data-informed approach to planning urban greenway network using a combination of classical urban design theory , multi-sourced urban data , and machine learning algorithms .
maoming City in China was used as a case study .

per classical urban design theory , specifically , Cervero and Ewing 's 5D variable , density , diversity , design , dimension of destination accessibility , and distance-to-transit , were selected as key factor .

a series of new urban data , including point of interest ( PoIs ) , location-based service ( LBS ) positioning data , and street view image , were applied in conjunction with machine learning algorithm and geographical information system ( GIS ) tools to measure these key factor at a human-scale resolution and generate an optimized greenway suitability analysis .
this analytical approach is an attempt to take human-scale concern into account on a city-wide scale regarding greenway network generation .
it also pushes the methodological boundary of greenway planning by combining classical urban design thinking with new urban data and new technique .
urban multisensory laboratory , an approach to model urban space human perception .
an urban sensory lab ( USL or LUS an acronym in Spanish ) is a new and avant-garde approach for studying and analyzing a city .
the construction of this approach allows the development of new methodology to identify the emotional response of public space user .
the laboratory combine qualitative analysis proposed by urbanist and quantitative measure managed by data analysis application .
usl is a new approach to go beyond the border of urban knowledge .
the design thinking strategy allows us to implement method to understand the result provided by our technique .
in this first approach , the interpretation is made by hand .
however , our goal is to combine design thinking and machine learning in order to analyze the qualitative and quantitative data automatically .
now , the result are being used by student from the Urbanism and Architecture course in order to get a better understanding of public space in Puebla , Mexico and its interaction with people .

the shape of segregation : The role of urban form in immigrant assimilation .
the built environment can mediate or constrain the opportunity for social interaction , essential to the formation of social tie .

this study uses the large inflow of immigrant in Barcelona between 1998 and 2008 to study whether the configuration of building and open urban area in a block is associated with the residential segregation of immigrants—a proxy for social interaction .
based on a rich set of shape metric , I use machine learning technique to classify each block in Barcelona into one of eight typology , which provide a summary measure of their built environment .
i then combine these data with measure of residential segregation constructed at the building level using data on the exact address of each resident of Barcelona .

the finding show that some feature of the built environment of a block—as measured by the typologies—are systematically associated with reduced residential segregation of Spaniards and newly arrived immigrant in that block .
a multiscale clustering of the urban morphology for use in quantitative model .

geo-spatial data available to researcher and practitioner has increased substantially over the last decade , offering new opportunity for analyzing and characterizing location and their spatial environment in an objective way .

various study in the field of urban planning and design have given recommendation on “ good urban form ” , suggesting that especially characteristic of the urban morphology inform the quality of location and additionally influence spatial behavior .

while we find a growing number of quantitative spatial model such as hedonic price model , location choice model , or applied machine learning algorithm , characteristic describing the urban morphology are still rarely reported in these .
one reason can be found in the limited knowledge on how to characterize the urban morphology best .
in this chapter , we address this deficit and define attribute that are suitable to characterize the urban morphology in quantitative mean at different scale .
we show how these can be processed from a data model that is simple enough to allow for reproducibility in most study area and process them for the case study of Switzerland .
finally , we use the attribute to define urban typology through clustering method .
these are compared on their outcome , their consistency , and interpretation .
measuring heterogeneous perception of urban space with massive data and machine learning : An application to safety .

in the last decade , large street imagery data set and machine learning development have allowed increasing scalability of methodology to understand the effect of landscape attribute on the way they are perceived .

however , these new methodology have not incorporated individual heterogeneity in their analysis , even though difference by gender and other sociodemographic characteristic in the perception of safety and other aspect of landscape and public space have been widely studied in social science and urban planning in lower scale study .

in the present study , we combine computational and statistical tool to develop a methodological proposal with high scalability and low implementation cost , which helps to identify and measure heterogeneous perception and its correlation to the presence of element in the landscape .
to achieve this , we implement a survey of perception of public space , collecting sociodemographic information of respondent .
then , we fit a discrete choice model to quantify perception of these space using a parametrization of image that jointly considers semantic segmentation and object detection as input .
our result show heterogeneity in the perception of safety in public space according to gender and the observer 's habitual mobility choice .
the model is then applied to the city of Santiago , Chile .
this produces a map of safety perception for different type of user .
the proposed method and the obtained result can be a relevant input for the design of public space and decision making in the urban planning process .
water Distribution-Transportation Interface Connectivity Responding to Urban Geospatial Morphology .
water distribution and transportation system are geospatially colocated , forming a network of connection .
this network of connection is referred to as an interface network .
investigation of interface network connectivity can help understand and minimize failure propagation from water to transportation system .
water distribution-transportation interface network consist of node , which can be either pipes or roads , and edge , which represent the geospatial colocation of a pipe and road .

the purpose of this study is twofold : to topologically represent geospatial colocation by characterizing the connectivity of water distribution-transportation interface network for multiple city , and to identify the nodal attributes that are most predictive of a given connectivity profile .
a total of forty interface network from eight city of varying geospatial morphology are extracted and analyzed using network analysis and machine learning .
using network analysis , we investigate whether the topological connectivity between water and transportation is consistent across different city .
then we use a random forest model to ascertain which nodal attribute may have predictive power to identify the connectivity cluster of the city to which a node belongs .

the result indicate that city of different geospatial morphology may vary in their interface network connectivity , and the average shortest path length of a given node is the major nodal feature contributing to a given city 's interface network connectivity .
these finding hold implication for urban planning and water distribution design to mitigate potential cascading failure .
access and form of urbanity in public space : Transit urban design beyond the global north .
there has been an emerging interest in the study of urban design dimension associated with Transit-Oriented Development ( TODs ) .
however , addressing the question of how TOD principles laid out in the international literature can be explored in the context of the global South remains in an incipient stage .

in this paper , we investigate the nexus between station walkable catchment and form of urbanity around transit node by adopting an assemblage approach to cut across any separation of sociality and spatiality .

drawing on empirical research from two case study in Tehran , this paper contributes to study on transit urban design by developing two measure of accessibility-the Catchment of Accessible Public Spaces ( CAPS ) and Accessible Interface ( AI ) .

we found that the combination of high CAPS and high AI within a given time can enable streetlife intensity , which is also linked to a synergistic effect of a larger assemblage , including the number of entry and diversity of function .
we argue that a focus on both measure is critical to understand the performance and potential transformation of street network in a TOD .
predicting the environment of a neighborhood : A use case for France .
notion of neighbourhood is critical in many application such as social study , cultural heritage management , urban planning or environment impact on health .
