two main challenge deal with the definition and representation of this spatial concept and with the gathering of descriptive data on a large area ( country ) .
in this paper , we present a use case in the context of real estate search for representing French neighbourhood in a uniform manner , using a few environment variable ( e.g.
, building type , social class ) .
since it is not possible to manually classify all neighbourhood , our objective is to automatically predict this new information .
city safety perception model based on visual content of street image .
safety perception measurement has been a subject of interest in many city of the world .
this is due to its social relevance , and to its effect on some local economic activity .
even though people safety perception is a subjective topic , sometimes it is possible to find out common belief given a restricted sociocultural context .
this paper presents an approach that makes use of image processing and machine learning technique to model citizen 's safety perception using visual information of city image .
the proposed method predicts how safe a given street of Bogotá City can be .
this is done based on people judgment of the visual appearance of a street image .

result suggest that the obtained model is able to detect city Street , where a visual feature is linked to an activity or street condition that has a significant influence on their associated safety perception .

this feature makes the proposed model an alternative tool for decision maker with regard to urban planning , safety and health public policy , as well as a collective memory associated to a particular urban environment .
can we predict the scenic beauty of location from geo-tagged Flickr image ?
in this work , we propose a novel technique to determine the aesthetic score of a location from social metadata of Flickr photo .
in particular , we built machine learning classifier to predict the class of a location where each class corresponds to a set of location having equal aesthetic rating .
these model are trained on two empirically build dataset containing location in two different city ( Rome and Paris ) where aesthetic rating of location were gathered from TripAdvisor.com .
in this work we exploit the idea that in a location with higher aesthetic rating , it is more likely for an user to capture a photo and other user are more likely to interact with that photo .
our model achieved as high as 79.48 % accuracy ( 78.60 % precision and 79.27 % recall ) on Rome dataset and 73.78 % accuracy ( 75.62 % precision and 78.07 % recall ) on Paris dataset .
the proposed technique can facilitate urban planning , tour planning and recommending aesthetically pleasing path .
machine learning for real-time urban metric and design recommendation .
city are growing , becoming more complex , and changing rapidly .
currently , community engagement for urban decision-making is often ineffective , uninformed , and only occurs in project ’ later stage .
to facilitate a more collaborative and evidence-based urban decision-making process for both expert and non-expert , real-time feedback and optimized suggestion are essential .
however , most of the current tool for urban planning are neither capable of performing complex simulation in real-time nor of providing guidance for better urban performance .
citymatrix was introduced to address these challenge .
machine learning technique were applied to achieve real-time prediction of multiple urban simulation , and thousand of city configuration were simulated .
the simulation result were used to train a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to predict the traffic and solar performance of unseen city configuration .
the prediction with the CNN is thousand of time faster than the original simulation and maintains a high-quality representation of the result .
this machine learning approach was applied as a versatile , quick , accurate , and computationally efficient method not only for real-time feedback , but also for optimized design recommendation .
user involved in the evaluation of this project had a better understanding of the embodied trade-off of the city and achieved their goal in an efficient manner .
geospatial simulation of urban neighbourhood densification potential .

although densification of urban area is being proposed as a sustainable urbanisation strategy , framework for detailed large-scale analysis of densification potential and their evaluation are lacking .
a geospatial simulation framework is presented to assess and evaluate densification potential at the neighbourhood level of already built-up residential area .
the focus is on post-war neighbourhood , which are particularly promising for sustainable densification .
neighbourhood are localised using geospatial analysis and based on literature and architectural design , potential are estimated for different neighbourhood archetype and densification strategy .
potential are simulated at a national scale using supervised archetype classification .
the embeddedness into current mobility infrastructure is used as a proxy for evaluating the sustainability of neighbourhood densification .
the developed framework is tested for Switzerland .
depending on the densification strategy , the simulated additional inhabitant for populating post-war urban neighbourhood range between 4–15 % of the current population .
more than half of this potential is located in central area and is well connected by public transportation .
the presented approach is suitable for assessing spatially explicit densification potential and for prioritising densification location .
we show that in countrie with a high number of post-war neighbourhood in well-connected location , considerable densification opportunity could be realised in already built-up residential area .
local and application-specific geodemographic for data-led urban decision making .
this work seeks to introduce improvement to the traditional variable selection procedure employed in the development of geodemographic classification .
it presents a proposal for shifting from a traditional approach for generating general-purpose one-size-fits-all geodemographic classification to application-specific classification .

this proposal addresses the recent scepticism towards the utility of general-purpose application by employing supervised machine learning technique in order to identify contextually relevant input variable from which to develop geodemographic classification with increased discriminatory power .

a framework introducing such technique in the variable selection phase of geodemographic classification development is presented via a practical use-case that is focused on generating a geodemographic classification with an increased capacity for discriminating the propensity for Library use in the UK city of Leeds .

two local classification are generated for the city , one a general-purpose classification , and the other , an application-specific classification incorporating supervised Feature Selection method in the selection of input variable .

the discriminatory power of each classification is evaluated and compared , with the result successfully demonstrating the capacity for the application-specific approach to generate a more contextually relevant result , and thus underpin increasingly targeted public policy decision making , particularly in the context of urban planning .
evolution of historical urban landscape with computer vision and machine learning : A case study of Berlin .

previous study of historical urban landscape usually focused on the qualitative analysis of city planning and development with the social , economic , and political context , but overlooked quantitative analysis from human perception .
in this study , we objectively measured the seemingly subjective quality of the eye-level urban landscape perception with computer vision and machine learning technology .
we then explored correlation between the measured perceptual quality and characteristic from the historical context .
we chose Berlin as a research object because it is a capital city that owns a rich history of division and reunification , as well as a variety of residential zone built at different period .

we extracted 30 street feature from the 150,000 Google Street View Imagery ( SVI ) dataset with a computer vision algorithm and evaluated eight perceptual quality including typology , order , ecology , enclosure , aesthetic , richness , accessibility and scale with a machine learning method .
then we defined seven residential district in Berlin , according to their spatial distribution and construction period .
through a systematic comparison of perceptual quality of the seven residential district , we find perceptual quality of ecology and enclosure have been improved a lot over a hundred year in Berlin .

the housing policy and design code in different social , economic and political contexts evolved to end overcrowding living condition , create more open space , and develop a better ecological environment .
this study enriches our understanding and application of subjective measure of human-centred built environment perception to the evolution of the historical urban landscape .
the proposed quantitative framework of subjective human perception measure provides great testimony to evaluate the effect of the implementation of housing and other urban planning policy .

such an automated , multisource , high-throughput and scalable framework can be applied to other city to determine the personality of the city and assess the impact of urban design and planning policy in streetscape improvement .
frontier topic in italian regional science in its fortie : The increasing role of heterogeneity in theory , policy and planning .
this paper introduces the second volume of the special issue edited to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of AISRe .

it presents different contribution ranging from the analysis of knowledge spillover , the use of microdata in the spatial context , the application of machine learning tool for regional policy evaluation study , the assessment of smart specialization and inner area strategy , the role of the evolutionary approach in regional planning and that of urban planning instrument in land rent measurement .
the common denominator of the different essay may be found in the increasing diffusion of approach dealing with heterogeneity of firm , geographical space and territory in modern regional science .
toward Participatory Design of City Soundscapes .
sonic environment of fast-growing urban area are an integral part of the quality of our everyday living in city .
due to the individual nature of the sonic experience , collecting and analyzing such experience need method for gathering accurate and useful data about them .
this paper describes how to incorporate the concept of soundscape into city planning process .
to achieve this , we propose creating participatory method for gathering data from the citizen so that the data would be useful and relevant for the city planning professional .

since the participatory planning process aim at in evolving the citizen , we suggest method that utilize crowdsourcing , mobile technology and machine learning for presenting , workshopping , and designing soundscape in the city context .
investigating sense of place of the Las Vegas Strip using online review and machine learning approach .
public space is essential to urban public life , activity , and event , and has become a key component of design and regeneration scheme .

however , visitor ’ experience of public space and the subsequent perception and sense of place are often difficult to measure because of its intangible nature and the expensive data collection process .
this study collected 20,476 online review from 18,387 Tripadvisor user from 2008 to 2019 to understand how visitor experience and react to the public space on the Las Vegas Strip .

we effectively elicited sense of place on the Las Vegas Strip and quantified the popularity and sentiment of each sense of place facet with Latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) and logistic regression machine learning method .
the result specified 30 distinct topic related to the Strip , among which the most important one were exploring different hotel , night scene , people watching , and walking long distance .

the visitor experience explored within this study uncovered multiple facet of sense of place on the Strip and suggested urban design strategy and public space management policy related to the programmatic and physical element of the Strip sidewalk .
the study shows how online review can provide strong empirical evidence for visitor experience in built environment project .
this approach can be used by landscape architect , urban planner , and policy maker on post-occupancy evaluation and guide redevelopment effort to provide a full feedback loop .
data-driven historical preservation : a case study in Shanghai .
historical preservation is becoming ever important in globalizing Shanghai city .
however , traditional survey-based way of policy making are not efficient .

this work introduces the data-driven technique with machine learning algorithm to find the relationship between the feature of the historical site and the popularity , which relates to the economy such as tourism and the associated GDP contribution .
the method is automatic , which relieves the work load from statistical survey and other inefficient traditional approach .

moreover , while the survey can only reflect the current condition , the machine learning approach has the ability of predicting the possible outcome based on existing data , which is helpful when decision on protection and development are to be made .
we collect data from selected historical site in Shanghai to illustrate the procedure of the proposed data-driven approach .
the case study demonstrates the capability of prediction and shows its promising future in guiding policy making , resource allocation and scientific research .
modeling and evaluating the residential urban environment perception .
this article discusses the use of machine learning method for assessing and predicting the perception of urban environment by citizen .
the research is based on the analysis of the data collected from social survey and characteristic of the environment from open source .
the urban environment is seen as a complex system that can be analyzed though the point of view of the urban context .
the urban context is formed by the geophisical and social feature that forms citizen habitat .
at the same time , the perception of the urban environment by citizen depend both on the parameter of the urban environment and on the socio-demographic feature of the studied group .
the article discusses model for predicting the citizen ' perception of the urban environment and evaluation method of such model .
the author propose the application of the model on the case of St. Petersburg , Russia .
a LARGE SCALE CLASSIFICATION of PUBLIC SPACES USING A STUDY of PERCEPTION and PUBLIC DATA from INEGI of the CITY of PUEBLA , SAN PEDRO CHOLULA and SAN ANDRES CHOLULA .

this work aims to create a methodology to automatize the classification of public space using a perception test and data obtained from city census information , in our case , from the Mexican National Institute of Statistics and Geography ( INEGI ) .
nowaday there is no well defined process in decision making when planning the creation or development of public space .

for this reason , a study to measure the human perception was made in order to gather data about what people perceived about five variable : architectural beauty , pollution , fun , wealth and safety .
the information obtained was used to create a Machine learning model that could find a relation between the perception obtained and the census dataset .

this first attempt aim to find key insight needed to develop a more complex methodology to classify , at a greater scale , public Place in term of their safety or architectural value and which socio-demographic data define this perception .
new Impression of Beijing Hutong : A Microscale Urban Emotion Measurement Method .
urban emotion is a critical aspect for the human-centered city in the Smart City context .
as a general approach of public emotion , measuring happiness has is an active focus with great marketing potential since actually , it concerned prominently by the government in recent year .
different author have measured urban emotion in a variety of way .
prior spatial-oriented urban emotion measurement tool practice on the macroscale level for the nation and mesoscale level for community result in a lack of microscale level for the street .

this paper presents a spatial-oriented microscale measurement approach of urban emotion based on the Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technology , which enables a data collection and visualization from human emotion recognition and object recognition technology .
by comparing the data visualization map , the gradual improvement of urban facility is one of the manifestation element of urban development , but emotion of citizen is mostly neutral .
these result attempt to reveal the structure and interpret a particular connection between urban emotion and facility .
in the sensor-rich future city , various data can be accumulated from the recognized data proposal and then transferred to contribute in a reference or feedback for the process of urban planning .
multi-criteria Evaluation vs Perceived Urban Quality : An Exploratory Comparison .
this study compares a service-based and environmental evaluation of an urban area with that of its perceived walkability .

the Pampulha region in Belo Horizonte , Brazil was first put through a multi-criteria spatial evaluation with respect to a set of spatial data considered relevant for liveability and quality of life in city , and was subsequently assessed in term of perceived walkability ( using a machine learning procedure of a training set provided by local auditor ) .
the two type of analysis were compared and qualitatively aggregated to obtain a joint spatial score of the urban environment .
the finding provide useful insight for planning and urban policy .
the Social Life of Small Urban Spaces 2.0 : Three Experiment in Computational Urban Studies .
this paper introduces a novel framework for urban analysis that leverages computational technique , along with established urban research method , to study how people use urban public space .

through three case study in different urban location in Europe and the US , it demonstrates how recent machine learning and computer vision technique may assist us in producing unprecedently detailed portrait of the relative influence of urban and environmental variable on people ’ s use of public space .
the paper further discusses the potential of this framework to enable empirically-enriched form of urban and social analysis with application in urban planning , design , research , and policy .
public transportation accessibility : Toward sustainable transit oriented development ( Case study : Depok Baru Station - Jakarta , Indonesia ) .
pedestrian accessibility considered as an important factor in developing a Transit Oriented Development ( TOD ) concept to improve peri-urban development .
depok Baru Station is having a potential value to be expanded as a TOD area in order to support Jabodetabek urban planning .
this paper aims to figure up the pedestrian accessibility level in Depok Baru Station based on time by calculating the pedestrian walking time during transfer mode .

adopting Public Transportation Accessibility Levels ( PTAL ) method , this paper will measure accessibility index ( AI ) using the primary data from direct observation and secondary data from related data document .
research finding deliver accessibility index ( AI ) value from two mode namely commuter line and local public transport as the basic knowledge to be considered as a TOD component .
study on traditional architectural feature of JIN-ai under the influence of silk road commerce .
the Silk Road is the green commercial thoroughfare between Europe and Asia , and also a cultural front for confrontation as well as coordination between the western and eastern civilization .
the ancient business Town along the Silk Road are like star shining in the great universe .
yuzhong County of Lanzhou City is a market town .
since Han , it began to undertake commercial supply , cargo transit , postal transfer and many other important role in history .
rich in cultural heritage , Jin-ai has formed its traditional architecture and its culture of distinct regional characteristic .

this article is based on field research and concerned with how Jin-ai 's traditional building , adapting farming , commerce , patriarchal relation , reflect its morphology , external space , layout and spatial scale , as well as its traditional cultural characteristic .
a data-driven predictive model of city-scale energy use in building .

many city across the United States have turned to building energy disclosure ( or benchmarking ) law to encourage transparency in energy efficiency market and to support sustainability and carbon reduction plan .

in addition to direct peer-to-peer comparison , the benchmarking data published under these law have been used as a tool by researcher and policy-maker to study the distribution and determinant of energy use in large building .
however , these policy only cover a small subset of the building stock in a given city , and thus capture only a fraction of energy use at the urban scale .

to overcome this limitation , we develop a predictive model of energy use at the building , district , and city scale using training data from energy disclosure policy and predictor from widely-available property and zoning information .

we use statistical model to predict the energy use of 1.1 million building in New York City using the physical , spatial , and energy use attribute of a subset derived from 23,000 building required to report energy use data each year .

linear regression ( OLS ) , random forest , and support vector regression ( SVM ) algorithms are fit to the city 's energy benchmarking data and then used to predict electricity and natural gas use for every property in the city .
model accuracy is assessed and validated at the building level and zip code level using actual consumption data from calendar year 2014 .
we find the OLS model perform best when generalizing to the City as a whole , and SVM result in the lowest mean absolute error for predicting energy use within the LL84 sample .
our median predicted electric energy use intensity for office building is 71.2 kbtu/sf and for residential building is 31.2 kbtu/sf with mean absolute log accuracy ratio of 0.17 .

building age is found to be a significant predictor of energy use , with newer building ( particularly those built since 1991 ) found to have higher consumption level than those constructed before 1930 .
we also find higher electric consumption in office and retail building , although the sign is reversed for natural gas .
in general , larger building use less energy per square foot , while taller building with more story , controlling for floor area , use more energy per square foot .
attached building – those with adjacent building and a shared party wall – are found to have lower natural gas use intensity .

the result demonstrate that electricity consumption can be reliably predicted using actual data from a relatively small subset of building , while natural gas use presents a more complicated problem given the bimodal distribution of consumption and infrastructure availability .
data-driven Urban Energy Simulation ( DUE-S ) : A framework for integrating engineering simulation and machine learning method in a multi-scale urban energy modeling workflow .
the world is rapidly urbanizing , and the energy intensive built environment is becoming increasingly responsible for the world 's energy consumption and associated environmental emission .
as a result , significant effort have been put forth to develop method that can accurately model and characterize building energy consumption in city .

these model aim to utilize physics-based building energy simulation , reduced-order calculation and statistical learning method to assess the energy performance of building within a dense urban area .

however , current urban building energy model are limited in their ability to account for the inter-building energy dynamic and urban microclimate factor that can have a substantial impact on building energy use .

to overcome these limitation , this paper proposes a novel Data-driven Urban Energy Simulation ( DUE-S ) framework that integrates a network-based machine learning algorithm ( ResNet ) with engineering simulation to better understand how building consume energy on multiple temporal ( hourly , daily , monthly ) and spatial scale in a city ( single building , block , urban ) .
we validate the proposed DUE-S framework on a proof of concept case study of 22 densely located university building in California , USA .
our result indicate that the DUE-S framework is able to accurately predict urban scale energy consumption at hourly , daily and monthly interval .

moreover , our result also demonstrate that the integration of data-driven and engineering simulation approach can partially capture the inter-building energy dynamic and impact of the urban context and merit future work to explore how they can be improved to predict sub-urban scale energy prediction ( single building , block ) .

in the end , successfully predicting and modeling the energy performance of urban building has the potential to inform the decision-making of a wide variety of urban sustainability stakeholder including architect , engineer and policymaker .
contribution of dust storm to PM10 level in an urban arid environment .

quantitative information on the contribution of dust storm to atmospheric PM10 ( particulate matter with an aerodynamic diameter ≤10 μm ) level is still lacking , especially in urban environment with close proximity to dust source .

the main objective of this study was to quantify the contribution of dust storm to PM10 concentration in a desert urban center , the city of Beer-Sheva , Negev , Israel , during the period of 2001-2012 .
toward this end , a background value based on the `` dust-free '' season was used as a threshold value to identify potentially `` dust day . ''
subsequently , the net contribution of dust storm to PM10 was assessed .
during the study period , daily PM10 concentration ranged from 6 to over 2000 μg/m3 .
in each year , over 10 % of the daily concentration exceeded the calculated threshold ( BVt ) of 71 μg/m3 .
an average daily net contribution of dust to PM10 of 122 μg/m3 was calculated for the entire study period based on this background value .
furthermore , a dust storm intensity parameter ( Ai ) was used to analyze several storm with very high PM10 contribution ( hourly average of 1000-5197 μg/m3 ) .
this analysis revealed that the strongest storm occurred mainly in the last 3 yr of the study .
finally , these finding indicate that this arid urban environment experience high PM10 level whose origin lies in both local and regional dust event .
implication : The finding indicate that over time , the urban arid environment experience high PM10 level whose origin lies in local and regional dust event .
it was noticed that the strongest storm have occurred mainly in the last 3 yr .
it is believed that environmental change such as global warming and desertification may lead to an increased air pollution and risk exposure to human health .
estimation of daily maximum and minimum air temperature in urban landscape using MODIS time series satellite data .
urban air temperature is considered a significant variable for a variety of urban issue , and analyzing the spatial pattern of air temperature is important for urban planning and management .
however , insufficient weather station limit accurate spatial representation of temperature within a heterogeneous city .

this study used a random forest machine learning approach to estimate daily maximum and minimum air temperature ( Tmax and Tmin ) for two megacitie with different climate characteristic : Los Angeles , USA , and Seoul , South Korea .

this study used eight time-serie land surface temperature ( LST ) data from Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer ( MODIS ) , with seven auxiliary variable : elevation , solar radiation , normalized difference vegetation index , latitude , longitude , aspect , and the percentage of impervious area .
we found different relationship between the eight time-serie LSTs with Tmax/Tmin for the two city , and designed eight scheme with different input LST variable .
the scheme were evaluated using the coefficient of determination ( R2 ) and Root Mean Square Error ( RMSE ) from 10-fold cross-validation .

the best scheme produced R2 of 0.850 and 0.777 and RMSE of 1.7 °C and 1.2 °C for Tmax and Tmin in Los Angeles , and R2 of 0.728 and 0.767 and RMSE of 1.1 °C and 1.2 °C for Tmax and Tmin in Seoul , respectively .
lst obtained the day before were crucial for estimating daily urban air temperature .
estimated air temperature patterns showed that Tmax was highly dependent on the geographic factor ( e.g.
, sea breeze , mountain ) of the two city , while Tmin showed marginally distinct temperature difference between built-up and vegetated area in the two city .
turning down the heat : An enhanced understanding of the relationship between urban vegetation and surface temperature at the city scale .
guiding urban planner on the cooling return of different configuration of urban vegetation is important to protect urban dweller from adverse heat impact .

to this end , we estimated statistical model that fused multi-temporal very fine spatial ( 20 cm ) and vertical ( 1 mm ) resolution imagery , that captures the complexity of urban vegetation , with remotely sensed temperature data to assess how urban vegetation configuration influence urban temperature .
perth , Western Australia , was used as a case-study for this analysis .
panel regression model showed that within a location an increase in tree and shrub cover has a larger cooling effect than grass coverage .
on average , holding all else equal , an approximate 1 km 2 increase in shrub ( tree ) cover within a location reduces surface temperature by 12 °C ( 5 °C ) .
we included a range of robustness check for the observed relationship between urban vegetation type and temperature .

geographically weighted regression model showed spatial variation in the cooling effect of different vegetation type ; this indicates that i ) unobserved factor moderate temperature-vegetation relationship across urban landscape , and ii ) that urban vegetation type and temperature relationship are complex .
machine learning model ( Random Forest ) were used to further explore complex and non-linear relationship between different urban vegetation configuration and temperature .

the Random Forests showed that vegetation type explained 31.84 % of the out-of-bag variance in summer surface temperature , that increased cover of large vegetation within a location increases cooling , and that different configuration of urban vegetation structure can lead to cooling gain .
the model in this study were trained with vegetation data capturing local detail , multiple time-period , and entire city coverage .
thus , these model illustrate the potential to develop locally-detailed and spatially explicit tool to guide planning of vegetation configuration to optimise cooling at local- and city-scale .
the effect of multi-dimensional indicator on urban thermal condition .
urban heat island ( UHI ) study have recognized ten factor as increasing the inner-city temperature compared with that of the surrounding suburbs .
the UHI effect is a leading cause of heat-related disease and mortality in many nation .
however , there are still two main shortcoming .
first , the effect of UHI is not well recognized in arid and semi-arid region .
second , the association of multi-dimensional information with surface temperature in urban area must be examined .
this study focuses on the height-related aspect of urban geometry in an arid region .
a range of multispectral and spatial vector data were used to derive the surface temperature and two-dimensional ( 2D ) and three-dimensional ( 3D ) information of the study area .
all information was aggregated into a grid with common spatial resolution to create a homogeneous dataset .
the machine learning statistical model of a boosted regression tree ( BRT ) was used to reflect the relative influence of 2D and 3D indicator with land surface temperature .
our result showed a cooler surface temperature in the city than in the surrounding area , leading to the question of whether the established UHI definition encompasses all type of city .
in addition , the thermal band was able to distinguish different spatial structure in the study area .
the BRT analysis demonstrated that both multi-dimensional 2D and 3D indicator affect the surface temperature .
in particular , the 3D indicator play a more important role than 2D indicator in shaping the surface temperature at different urban geometry of the study area .
this new method can help urban planner identify the most influential 2D and 3D indicator that affect the surface temperature in different district of a city .
examining threshold effect of built environment element on travel-related carbon-dioxide emission .

understanding how built environment feature are associated with travel-related carbon-dioxide ( CO2 ) emission is essential for planner to encourage environmentally sustainable travel through transportation and land use policy .

applying gradient boosting decision tree to the data from the Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area , this study addresses two gap in the literature by identifying critical built environment determinant of CO2 emission , and more importantly , illustrating threshold effect of built environment element .
the result show that three neighborhood-level built environment factor have the strongest influence on CO2 emission : distance to the nearest transit stop , job density , and land use diversity .
the distance to downtown also has a substantial impact .
this study further confirms that built environment variable are effective only within a certain range .
these threshold effect offer valuable implication for planner to achieve desirable environmental benefit efficiently .
using a gradient boosting model to improve the performance of low-cost aerosol monitor in a dense , heterogeneous urban environment .

the increased availability and improved quality of new sensing technology have catalyzed a growing body of research to evaluate and leverage these tool in order to quantify and describe urban environment .

air quality , in particular , has received greater attention because of the well-established link to serious respiratory illness and the unprecedented level of air pollution in developed and developing countrie and city around the world .

though numerous laboratory and field evaluation study have begun to explore the use and potential of low-cost air quality monitoring device , the performance and stability of these tool has not been adequately evaluated in complex urban environment , and further research is needed .

in this study , we present the design of a low-cost air quality monitoring platform based on the Shinyei PPD42 aerosol monitor and examine the suitability of the sensor for deployment in a dense heterogeneous urban environment .

we assess the sensor 's performance during a field calibration campaign from February 7th to March 25th 2017 with a reference instrument in New York City , and present a novel calibration approach using a machine learning method that incorporates publicly available meteorological data in order to improve overall sensor performance .

we find that while the PPD42 perform well in relation to the reference instrument using linear regression ( R2 = 0.36–0.51 ) , a gradient boosting regression tree model can significantly improve device calibration ( R2 = 0.68–0.76 ) .

we discuss the sensor 's performance and reliability when deployed in a dense , heterogeneous urban environment during a period of significant variation in weather condition , and important consideration when using machine learning technique to improve the performance of low-cost air quality monitor .
a reduced order model for turbulent flow in the urban environment using machine learning .
to help create a comfortable and healthy indoor and outdoor environment in which to live , there is a need to understand turbulent air flows within the urban environment .

to this end , building on a previously reported method [ 1 ] , we develop a fast-running Non-Intrusive Reduced Order Model ( NIROM ) for predicting the turbulent air flows found within an urban environment .
to resolve larger scale turbulent fluctuation , we employ a Large Eddy Simulation ( LES ) model and solve the resulting computational model on unstructured mesh .
the objective is to construct a rapid-running NIROM from these result that will have ‘ similar ’ dynamic to the original LES model .

based on Proper Orthogonal Decomposition ( POD ) and machine learning technique , this Reduced Order Model ( ROM ) is six order of magnitude faster than the high-fidelity LES model and we demonstrate how ‘ similar ’ it can be to the high-fidelity model by comparing statistical quantity such as the mean flows , Reynolds stress and probability density of the velocity .
we also include validation of the high-fidelity model against data from wind tunnel experiment .

this paper represents a key step towards the use of reduced order modelling for operational purpose with the tantalising possibility of it being used in place of Gaussian plume model , and the potential for greatly improved model fidelity and confidence .
quantifying the effect of urban form on land surface temperature in subtropical high-density urban area using machine learning .
it is widely acknowledged that urban form significantly affects urban thermal environment , which is a key element to adapt and mitigate extreme high temperature weather in high-density urban area .
however , few study have discussed the impact of physical urban form feature on the land surface temperature ( LST ) from a perspective of comprehensive urban spatial structure .
this study used the ordinary least-square regression ( OLS ) and random forest regression ( RF ) to distinguish the relative contribution of urban form metric on LST at three observation scale .
result of this study indicate that more than 90 % of the LST variation were explained by selected urban form metric using RF .
effect of the magnitude and direction of urban form metric on LST varied with the change of season and observation scale .
overall , building morphology and urban ecological infrastructure had dominant effect on LST variation in high-density urban center .
urban green space and water bodie demonstrated stronger cooling effect , especially in summer .
building density ( BD ) exhibited significant positive effect on LST , whereas the floor area ratio ( FAR ) showed a negative influence on LST .
the result can be applied to investigate and implement urban thermal environment mitigation planning for city manager and planner .
the effect of 3D architectural pattern on the urban surface temperature at a neighborhood scale : Relative contribution and marginal effect .
urban architecture is an important contributor to urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .
yet thorough investigation into how three-dimensional ( 3D ) architectural pattern influence urban thermal condition collectively and individually are limited .

this study bridges this gap by adopting a machine learning method , boosted regression tree ( BRT ) , to analyze the relative influence and marginal effect of 3D urban architecture on land surface temperature ( LST ) .
ten architectural metric are incorporated to describe the composition and configuration of 3D architectural pattern at a neighborhood scale in the typical megacity of Shanghai .

the result show that in summer , the building coverage ratio ( BCR ) , mean architecture height ( MAH ) , mean architecture height standard deviation ( AHSD ) and mean architecture projection area ( MAPA ) are the most influential factor , with relative contribution of 39.3 % , 16.5 % , 12.3 % and 10.4 % , respectively .
the regulation amplitude ( ΔT ) of the dominant metric for the neighborhood average LST temperature are 2.7 °C , 0.9 °C , 0.6 °C , and 0.6 °C , respectively .

moreover , with the LST , the BCR exhibits a monotonic positive correlation , the MAH and AHSD show a stepwise negative correlation , and the MAPA shows a combination of positive and negative correlation .

it is generally recommended to decrease the development intensity and architectural base area , while increase the building height and roughness to improve the urban thermal condition at the neighborhood scale .
the dominant contributor and related marginal effect are generally consistent across different season .
these finding can provide quantitative insight for mitigating the LST effect via rational design and management of 3D architectural pattern .
given the distinctive insight provided , the BRT method is recommended for disentangling the relationship between LST and environmental variable in upcoming study .
analysis on spatiotemporal change of urban thermal landscape pattern in the context of urbanisation : A case study of Xiamen City .
city are center of political , economic , cultural and social life .
it is a symbol of human civilization and development , and urbanization is a common trend in many countrie .
nowaday , world urbanization accelerates greatly , especially in developing countrie .
while providing great economic and social benefit , urbanization has also created some environmental problem , including the Urban Heat Island ( UHI ) effect .
uhi has deep impact on material cycle and energy transfer within urban ecosystem , and has become an important issue in urban climate and environmental research .
xiamen is one of the special economic zone , and its rapid urbanization induced the UHI becoming much more intense and extensive .
to study UHI from a viewpoint of landscape is a new method in urban thermal environment research .
analyzing the dynamic of the urban thermal landscape in the context of urbanization will provide support for environmental protection , energy use policy making , and urban planning and management .
this study analyzed the spatiotemporal change of urban thermal landscape pattern in the main area of Xiamen City .

firstly , Landsat Thematic Mapper ( TM ) and Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus ( ETM+ ) thermal image , which were acquired on similar date in the winter of 1987 , 1992 , 1997 , 2002 and 2007 , were used to retrieve brightness temperature .
then a relative brightness temperature ( R ) was calculated and the thermal patch were classified into 6 grade by temperature difference .
landscape metric were used here at both landscape and class level to quantify change in the urban thermal landscape pattern .
and they can describe the change of thermal landscape pattern in 3 aspect , including quantity , shape and structure .
finally , we investigated the distribution of thermal pollution source in Xiamen .

the result showed that : 1 ) In term of quantity , with the rapid urbanization of Xiamen City between 1987 and 2007 , the thermal landscape became more fragmented , and was more and more dominated by high-grade thermal landscape patch .
2 ) The shape of high-grade thermal patch even the whole landscape tends to complex .
3 ) For structure , each grade of thermal landscape became well-distributed and even .

the new high-grade thermal patch were found close to the old one that induced the proximity index ( PROX_MN ) of high-grade thermal patch increased ; the aggregation index ( AI ) of the whole landscape decreased while the high-grade thermal patch increased ; the contagion index ( CONTAG ) of the whole landscape also decreased so that dominance of high-grade thermal patch gradually increased .
4 ) The area of thermal patch which converted from low-grade to high-grade is bigger than the area converted from high-grade to low- grade .
according to statistical analysis , we found that it is much easier that the high-grade thermal landscape patch converted into the middle-grade thermal landscape than converted among high grade .
5 ) The high-grade thermal patch mainly distributed in the industry area , and they were increased remarkably .

all the high-grade thermal patch experienced three kind of change ( increasing number , expanding area and increasing grade ) , and grouped into five high temperature zone ( Haicang , Xinyang , Xinglin , seaport of Xiamen island and airport ) , especially in the industrial district of Xinyang and Xinglin .
identifying urban geometric type as energy performance pattern .
this paper aims to find the impact of geometric parameter on the energy performance of building , to using them to identify type regarding major geometric characteristic of a target area .
conventional approach to control energy efficiency of building mainly focus on material and capacity of insulation , but rarely consider urban and building geometry .
by examining energy impact on urban block by urban geometric form , this paper seeks to identify urban geometric type and energy pattern on urban block .

to achieve the aim of this study , this paper follows two step : First , significant indicator for analyzing energy performance are identified in urban geometry ; second , the type that capture urban geometry of a real city are categorized .
as a result , as a reference for urban planning and design , the paper identifies 13 type that represent the characteristic of urban geometry regarding energy performance .
the geometric indicator are carefully measured and their significance to energy performance of building is examined through regression analysis .
according to these indicator , the 13 type are categorized using a hierarchical clustering algorithm , a machine learning method .
additionally , the 13 type are discussed for implementation as reference in urban planning and design , particularly in block planning for a city .
data-driven model for cross ventilation potential in high-density city based on coupled CFD simulation and machine learning .
effective urban ventilation through decent urban planning and building design can alleviate the deterioration of the urban built environment .

however , natural ventilation requirement and guideline in current building code and standard are either qualitative or quantitative but subject to an absolute indoor airspeed threshold without considering the outdoor wind environment .

to fill this gap , this paper develops an urban-scale coupled indoor and outdoor computational fluid dynamic ( CFD ) model and defines a novel ventilation index to assess natural ventilation potential .
the index consider wind environment of both indoor and outdoor space .
first , the coupled CFD model is developed to study wind-driven cross ventilation in high-density city .
a 3D isothermal CFD simulation is solved using the RNG k-ε turbulent model .
the simulation result are compared with wind tunnel experiment data from literature .
second , six key design variable are used to generate 3840 parametric design variation for natural ventilation assessment .
third , a novel integrated index CIOIv ( coupled indoor and outdoor interaction ) is proposed to evaluate the wind speed ratio between the indoor area and outdoor reference area .
for demonstration , CIOIv , F1 is used to represent CIOIv on the ground level .
data-driven CIOIv , F1 model are developed to predict indoor building ventilation potential for quick early design support .
compared with multivariate linear regression model , the Gradient Boosting non-linear model display much higher prediction accuracy ( mean absolute percentage error = 0.16 with R2 = 0.8 ) .

in early design stage , designer and engineer can skip the computational expensive CFD simulation and use this data-drive model to quickly check the building natural ventilation potential of different design option in an urban environment .
a data-driven approach for multi-scale GIS-based building energy modeling for analysis , planning and support decision making .
urban planner , local authority , and energy policymaker often develop strategic sustainable energy plan for the urban building stock in order to minimize overall energy consumption and emission .
planning at such scale could be informed by building stock modeling using existing building data and Geographic Information System-based mapping .
however , implementing these process involves several issue , namely , data availability , data inconsistency , data scalability , data integration , geocoding , and data privacy .

this research addresses the aforementioned information challenge by proposing a generalized integrated methodology that implements bottom-up , data-driven , and spatial modeling approach for multi-scale Geographic Information System mapping of building energy modeling .
this study uses the Irish building stock to map building energy performance at multiple scale .
the generalized data-driven methodology uses approximately 650,000 Irish Energy Performance Certificates building data to predict more than 2 million building ’ energy performance .
in this case , the approach delivers a prediction accuracy of 88 % using deep learning algorithms .
these prediction result are then used for spatial modeling at multiple scale from the individual building level to a national level .
furthermore , these map are coupled with available spatial resource ( social , economic , or environmental data ) for energy planning , analysis , and support decision-making .
the modeling result identify cluster of building that have a significant potential for energy saving within any specific region .
geographic Information System-based modeling aid stakeholder in identifying priority area for implementing energy efficiency measure .
furthermore , the stakeholder could target local community for retrofit campaign , which would enhance the implementation of sustainable energy policy decision .
development of an urban high-resolution air temperature forecast system for localweather information service based on statistical downscaling .
the Korean peninsula has complex and diverse weather phenomena , and the Korea Meteorological Administration has been working on various numerical model to produce better forecasting data .

the Unified Model Local Data Assimilation and Prediction System is a limited-area working model with a horizontal resolution of 1.5 km for estimating local-scale weather forecast on the Korean peninsula .

however , in order to numerically predict the detailed temperature characteristic of the urban space , in which surface characteristic change rapidly in a small spatial area , a city temperature prediction model with higher resolution spatial decomposition capability is required .
as an alternative to this , a building-scale temperature model was developed , and a 25 m air temperature resolution was determined for the Seoul area .
the spatial information was processed using statistical method , such as linear regression model and machine learning .
by comparing the accuracy of the estimated air temperature with observational data during the summer , the machine learning was improved .
in addition , horizontal and vertical characteristic of the urban space were better represented , and the air temperature was better resolved spatially .
air temperature information can be used to manage the response to heat-wave and tropical night in administrative district of urban area .
thermal sensation prediction by soft computing methodology .
thermal comfort in open urban area is very factor based on environmental point of view .
therefore it is need to fulfill demand for suitable thermal comfort during urban planning and design .
thermal comfort can be modeled based on climatic parameter and other factor .
the factor are variable and they are changed throughout the year and day .
therefore there is need to establish an algorithm for thermal comfort prediction according to the input variable .
the prediction result could be used for planning of time of usage of urban area .
since it is very nonlinear task , in this investigation was applied soft computing methodology in order to predict the thermal comfort .
the main goal was to apply extreme leaning machine ( ELM ) for forecasting of physiological equivalent temperature ( PET ) value .
temperature , pressure , wind speed and irradiance were used as input .
the prediction result are compared with some benchmark model .
based on the result ELM can be used effectively in forecasting of PET .
building Energy Information : Demand and Consumption Prediction with Machine Learning Models for Sustainable and Smart Cities .
building energy consumption plays an essential role in urban sustainability .
the prediction of the energy demand is also of particular importance for developing smart city and urban planning .
machine learning has recently contributed to the advancement of method and technology to predict demand and consumption for building energy system .
this paper presents a state of the art of machine learning model and evaluates the performance of these model .
through a systematic review and a comprehensive taxonomy , the advance of machine learning are carefully investigated and promising model are introduced .
urban ambient air temperature estimation using hyperlocal data from smart vehicle-borne sensor .
high-quality temperature data at a finer spatio-temporal scale is critical for analyzing the risk of heat exposure and hazard in urban environment .
the variability of urban landscape makes city a challenging environment for quantifying heat exposure .

most of the existing heat hazard study have inherent limitation on two front ; first , the spatio-temporal granularitie are too coarse , and second , the inability to track the ambient air temperature ( AAT ) instead of land surface temperature ( LST ) .
overcoming these limitation requires developing model for mapping the variability in heat exposure in urban environment .
we investigated an integrated approach for mapping urban heat hazard by harnessing a diverse set of high-resolution measurement , including both ground-based and satellite-based temperature data .
we mounted vehicle-borne mobile sensor on city bus to collect high-frequency temperature data throughout 2018 and 2019 .

our research also incorporated key biophysical parameter and Landsat 8 LST data into Random Forest regression modeling to map the hyperlocal variability of heat hazard over area not covered by the bus .

the vehicle-borne temperature sensor data showed large temperature difference within the city , with the largest variation of up to 10 °C and morning-afternoon diurnal change at a magnitude around 20 °C .

random Forest modeling on noontime ( 11:30 am – 12:30 pm ) data to predict AAT produced accurate result with a mean absolute error of 0.29 °C and successfully showcased the enhanced granularity in urban heat hazard mapping .
these map revealed well-defined hyperlocal variability in AAT , which were not evident with other research approach .
urban core and dense residential area revealed larger than 5 °C AAT difference from their nearby green space .

the sensing framework developed in this study can be easily implemented in other urban area , and finding from this study will be beneficial in understanding the heat vulnerability of individual community .
it can be used by the local government to devise targeted hazard mitigation effort such as increasing green space , developing better heat-safety policy , and exposure warning for worker .
high-resolution spatiotemporal measurement of air and environmental noise pollution in Sub-Saharan African city : Pathway to Equitable Health Cities Study protocol for Accra , Ghana .
introduction Air and noise pollution are emerging environmental health hazard in African city , with potentially complex spatial and temporal pattern .
limited local data are a barrier to the formulation and evaluation of policy to reduce air and noise pollution .

method and analysis We designed a year-long measurement campaign to characterise air and noise pollution and their source at high-resolution within the Greater Accra Metropolitan Area ( GAMA ) , Ghana .

our design uses a combination of fixed ( year-long , n=10 ) and rotating ( week-long , n =∼130 ) sites , selected to represent a range of land use and source influence ( eg , background , road traffic , commercial , industrial and residential area , and various neighbourhood socioeconomic class ) .
we will collect data on fine particulate matter ( PM 2.5 ) , nitrogen oxide ( NO x ) , weather variable , sound ( noise level and audio ) along with street-level time-lapse image .
we deploy low-cost , low-power , lightweight monitoring device that are robust , socially unobtrusive , and able to function in Sub-Saharan African ( SSA ) climate .

we will use state-of-the-art method , including spatial statistic , deep/machine learning , and processed-based emission modelling , to capture highly resolved temporal and spatial variation in pollution level across the GAMA and to identify their potential source .
this protocol can serve as a prototype for other SSA city .

ethic and dissemination This environmental study was deemed exempt from full ethic review at Imperial College London and the University of Massachusetts Amherst ; it was approved by the University of Ghana Ethics Committee ( ECH 149/18-19 ) .
this protocol is designed to be implementable in SSA city to map environmental pollution to inform urban planning decision to reduce health harming exposure to air and noise pollution .
it will be disseminated through local stakeholder engagement ( public and private sector ) , peer-reviewed publication , contribution to policy document , media , and conference presentation .
investigating important urban characteristic in the formation of urban heat island : a machine learning approach .

despite the urban heat island phenomenon has long been recognized as a major urban environmental problem , it was not until recently that this urban phenomenon gained attention from the discipline of urban planning .

to integrate the finding of the urban heat island research into the planning practice , the relationship between land surface temperature and urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic should be addressed at the planning relevant spatial scale , a land parcel .
using a parcel as a unit of analysis , this study proposed to use a machine learning approach to identify important variable in the formation of urban heat island in Indianapolis , Indiana .

applying random forest method to planning zone , this study identified planning zone specific urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic that are important for the interpretation of urban heat island phenomenon of Indianapolis , Indiana .

the main contribution of this study is twofold : to integrate urban physical and socioeconomic characteristic into a land parcel for the better interpretation of the result of urban heat island study into planning practice and to apply machine learning approach to identify highly determinant variable in the formation of urban heat island .
comparison of Regression Tools for Regional Electric Load Forecasting .
urban area electrical load forecasting is important for power generation capacity planning and also to integrate environment friendly energy source at district level .
load prediction will help in developing demand side management in coordination with renewable power generation .
urban area load is influenced by meteorological condition therefore it is important to include weather parameter for load prediction .
machine Learning algorithm can effectively contribute for electrical load prediction .
the most commonly used algorithm for load prediction is Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) , which is a complex predictor that utilizes a big amount of training data .

k-nearest Neighbour ( kNN ) has proven to be efficient by the introduction of binary dummy variable for categorisation and it can be used for short term ( 30 min ) and long term ( 24 hour ) load forecasting .
this paper explores the use of regression tool for regional electric load forecasting by correlating lower distinctive categorical level ( season and day of the week ) and weather parameter .
the historical electrical load dataset with meteorological parameter are available for the Sydney region and they have been used to test the regression tool .
data correlation over seasonal change have been argued by mean of improving Mean Absolute Percentage Error ( MAPE ) .
by examining the structure of various regressor they are compared for the lowest MAPE .
the regressor show good MAPE for short term ( 30 min ) prediction and Random Forest Regressor scores best in the range of 1-2 % MAPE .
an Evaluation Index for Cross Ventilation Based on CFD Simulations and Ventilation Prediction Model Using Machine Learning algorithms .
high-density city usually surfer deterioration of the urban built environment due to slow or stagnant air movement .
this deterioration could be mitigated by improved urban natural ventilation through good urban planning and building design .
however , indoor natural ventilation requirement in current building standard only define absolute indoor air speed without considering outdoor condition .

to fill this gap , this paper developed generic urban-scale coupled indoor and outdoor CFD model and proposes a new integrated index ( CIOI index ) to evaluate indoor natural ventilation potential , which couples both indoor and outdoor wind environment .
cioiv regression model are developed by applying machine learning algorithm based on 3,840 CFD simulation result .
the Gradient Boosting ( GB ) model shows an improved performance in term of higher correlation ( R2=0.8 ) and lower error ( MAPE=16 % ) compared with the multivariate linear regression model .
building designer and urban planner can use this CIOI prediction model to quickly check , in the early design stage , the influence of their design variation on indoor ventilation potential .
published by Elsevier Ltd .
predicting urban cold-air path using boosted regression tree .

ensuring the transport of colder air mass from rural surrounding or inner urban open space into the dense urban center is a vital approach for reducing nocturnal warming of urban area in summer , i.e .
the urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .
hence , cold-air path are an important mitigation aspect in urban planning .
the identification of cold-air path by field measurement , however , is time-consuming and it is difficult to cover larger spatial domain ( e.g .
entire city ) .

therefore , we used a machine learning technique , boosted regression tree ( BRT ) , for estimating the spatial distribution of cold-air path in three German city ( Braunschweig , Freiburg , Stuttgart ) .
we identified the most important predictor variable for cold-air path occurrence and tested the spatial transferability of BRT model from one training city to the other study city .

three variable explaining difference in surface elevation indicated strongest influence on spatial distribution of cold-air path : relative surface elevation , topographic position index , and topographic wind index .

we achieved prediction for the spatial distribution of cold-air path for city the model was trained on , resulting in model performance of 0.85 < AUC < 0.96 ( AUC : area under the receiver operating characteristic curve ) .
model transfer to other city , however , achieved only poor to moderate result ( 0.5 < AUC < 0.8 ) .
the city of Freiburg tended to be the most suitable basis for a general model , since it covers the largest range of condition .
transfer works best for ‘ similar ’ city , i.e .
city with a comparable range of predictor variable and morphological structure .
cold-air path identification via BRT modelling appeared to be a promising method delivering helpful information for urban planning .
thermal comfort prediction by applying supervised machine learning in green sidewalk of Tehran .

purpose : This research aims to introduce a new methodology for integration between urban design strategy and supervised machine learning ( SML ) method – by applying both energy engineering modeling ( evaluating phase ) for the existing green sidewalk and statistical energy modeling ( predicting phase ) for the new one – to offer algorithms that help to catch the optimum morphology of green sidewalk , in case of high quality of the outdoor thermal comfort and less error in result .
design/methodology/approach : The tool of the study are the way of processing by SML , predicting the future based on the past .
machine learning is benefited from Python advantage .
the structure of the study consisted of two main part , as the majority of the similar study follow : engineering energy modeling and statistical energy modeling .
according to the concept of the study , at first , from 2268 model , some are randomly selected , simulated and sensitively analyzed by ENVI-met .
furthermore , the Envi-met output as the quantity of thermal comfort – predicted mean vote ( PMV ) and weather item are input of Python .
then , the formed data set is processed by SML , to reach the final reliable predicted output .
finding : The process of SML leads the study to find thermal comfort of current model and other similar sidewalk .
the result are evaluated by both PMV mathematical model and SML error evaluation function .
the result confirm that the average of the occurred error is about 1 % .
then the method of study is reliable to apply in the variety of similar Field .

finding of this study can be helpful in perspective of the sustainable architecture strategy in the building and urban scale , to determine , monitor and control energy-based behavior ( thermal comfort , heating , cooling , lighting and ventilation ) in operational phase of the system ( existed element in building , and construction ) and the planning and designing phase of the future built case – all over their life span .
research limitations/implication : Limitation of the study are related to the study variable and alternative that are notable impact on the finding .
furthermore , the most trustable input data will result in the more accuracy in output .
then modeling and simulation process are most significant part of the research to reach the exact result in the final step .
practical implication : Finding of the study can be helpful in urban design strategy .

by finding outdoor thermal comfort that resulted from machine learning method , urban and landscape designer , policymaker and architect are able to estimate the feature of their design in air quality and urban health and can be sure in catching design goal in case of thermal comfort in urban atmosphere .
social implication : By 2030 , city are delved as living space for about three out of five people .
as green infrastructure influence in moderating the city ’ climate , the relationship between green space and habitant ’ thermal comfort is deduced .

although the strategy to outside thermal comfort improvement , by design method and applicant , are not new subject to discuss , applying machine that may be common in predicting result can be called as a new insight in applying more effective design strategy and in urban environment ’ s comfort preparation .

then study ’ s footprint in social implication stems in learning from the previous project and developing more efficient strategy to prepare city as the more comfortable and healthy Place to live , with the more efficient model and consuming money and time .
originality/value : The study achievement are expected to be applied not only in Tehran but also in other climate zone as the pattern in more eco-city design strategy .
although some similar study are done in different Major , the concept of study is new vision in urban study .
an ensemble energy consumption forecasting model based on spatial-temporal clustering analysis in residential building .

due to the availability of smart metering infrastructure , high-resolution electric consumption data is readily available to study the dynamic of residential electric consumption at finely resolved spatial and temporal scale .
analyzing the electric consumption data enables the policymak-er and building owner to understand consumer ’ s demand-consumption behavior .

furthermore , analysis and accurate forecasting of electric consumption are substantial for consumer involvement in time-of-use tariff , critical peak pricing , and consumer-specific demand response initiative .

along-side its vast economic and sustainability implication , such as energy wastage and decarbonization of the energy sector , accurate consumption forecasting facilitates power system planning and stable grid operation .

energy consumption forecasting is an active research area ; despite the abundance of devised model , electric consumption forecasting in residential building remains challenging due to high occupant energy use behavior variability .
hence the search for an appropriate model for accurate electric consumption forecasting is ever continuing .
to this aim , this paper presents a spatial and temporal ensemble forecasting model for short-term electric consumption forecasting .
the proposed work involves exploring electric consumption profile at the apartment level through cluster analysis based on the k-mean algorithm .
the ensemble forecasting model consists of two deep learning model ; Long Short-Term Memory Unit ( LSTM ) and Gated Recurrent Unit ( GRU ) .
first , the apartment-level historical electric consumption data is clustered .
later the cluster are aggregated based on consumption profile of consumer .
at the building and floor level , the ensemble model are trained using aggregated electric consumption data .
the proposed ensemble model forecasts the electric consumption at three spatial scale apartment , building , and floor level for hourly , daily , and weekly forecasting horizon .
furthermore , the impact of spatial-temporal granularity and cluster analysis on the prediction accuracy is analyzed .
the dataset used in this study comprises high-resolution electric consumption data acquired through smart meter recorded on an hourly basis over the period of one year .
the consumption data belong to four multifamily residential building situated in an urban area of South Korea .
to prove the effectiveness of our proposed forecasting model , we compared our model with widely known machine learning model and deep learning variant .

the result achieved by our proposed ensemble scheme verify that model has learned the sequential behavior of electric consumption by producing superior performance with the lowest MAPE of 4.182 and 4.54 at building and floor level prediction , respectively .
the experimental finding suggest that the model has efficiently captured the dynamic electric consumption characteristic to exploit ensemble model diversity and achieved lower forecasting error .
the proposed ensemble forecasting scheme is well suited for predictive modeling and short-term load forecasting .
proposing an effective and inexpensive tool to detect urban surface temperature change associated with urbanization process in small city .
a consequence of urbanization is the loss of vegetation cover , replaced by urban area .

this study investigates the evolution of the built-up area and its influence on increasing the surface temperature through methodology applicable to small and medium-sized municipality where urbanization process monitoring is limited .
for the case study , the municipality of Penedo , located in the State of Alagoas , was selected .

landsat-5 and Landsat-8 image were used to evaluate urban landscape through normalized difference vegetation index ( NDVI ) , normalized difference built-up index ( NDBI ) , and the land surface temperature ( LST ) .
a simple tool that summarizes NDBI and LST change was proposed - the Change Detection Index ( CDI ) .
it was possible to highlight area where the increase in temperature is associated with the built area 's intensification .

furthermore , the machine learning k-mean clustering tool was applied to create group and analyze the relationship between urbanization and temperature increase , confirming the CDI value and validating this tool .
an evident increase in the built area was highlighted by CDI and cluster analysis , indicating a heat island 's potential formation at the implantation area of a housing complex in the municipality .

the spatial analysis indicates priority area for intervention by a simple methodology that facilitated dialogue and understanding between stakeholder , associated with a low-cost tool with the potential for reproduction and adaptation , providing indicator to urban study and decision-maker and handle the lack of monitoring data in small and medium-sized municipality .
a hybrid air pollutant concentration prediction model combining secondary decomposition and sequence reconstruction .
acid rain is a serious threat to terrestrial ecosystem .

to provide more accurate early warning information for acid rain prevention , urban planning , and travel planning , a novel air pollutant prediction model was proposed in this paper to predict NO2 and SO2 .
first , the data were decomposed into several sub-sequence by a complete ensemble empirical mode decomposition with adaptive noise .
second , the subsequence are reconstructed by variational mode decomposition and sample entropy .
then , the new subsequence are predicted by the extreme learning machine combined with the whale optimization algorithm .
the empirical analysis was carried out through 8 data set .
according to the experimental result , three main conclusion can be drawn .
first , the proposed model in this paper has excellent prediction performance and robustness .
in all the comparison experiment , the R2 and RMSE of the proposed model are the best among all the model .
second , data preprocessing is very necessary .
after adding the decomposition algorithm , the average improvement level of R2 and RMSE were 897.57 % and 50.78 % , respectively .
third , the re-decomposition of IMF1 is an effective method to improve prediction accuracy .
after the re-decomposition of IMF1 , R2 can be improved by 13.64 % on average on the original basis , and RMSE can be reduced by 31.99 % on average .
the result of this study can provide a valuable reference for the research of air pollutant prediction .
in future work , the application of the proposed model in other air pollutant or other region can be explored .
identifying tree trait for cooling urban heat islands—a cross-city empirical analysis .

research Highlight : This paper presents a cross-city empirical study on micro-climatic thermal benefit of urban tree , using machine-learning analysis to identify the importance of several in situ measured tree physiognomy trait for cooling .
background and Objective : Green infrastructure and tree in particular play a key role in mitigating the urban heat island ( UHI ) effect .
a more detailed understanding of the cooling potential of urban tree and specific tree trait is necessary to support tree management decision for cooling our progressively hot city .
the goal of this study was to identify the influence and importance of various tree trait and site condition .

material and Method : Surface temperature , air temperature at 1.1 m and at tree crown height , as well as wet bulb globe-temperature of shaded and fully sun-exposed reference area , were used to study the cooling effect of seven different urban tree specie .
for all 100 individual , tree height , crown base , trunk circumference , crown volume , crown area , leaf area index ( LAI ) and leaf area density ( LAD ) were measured .
measurement were conducted in the city of Dresden , Salzburg , Szeged , and Vienna as representative for middle European city in different climate zone .
result : Beside site condition , tree specie , height , height of crown base , as well as trunk circumference , have a great influence on the cooling effect for city dweller .

the trunk circumference is a very valuable indicator for estimating climate regulating ecosystem service and therefore a highly robust estimator for policy maker and tree management practitioner when planning and managing urban green area for improving the availability and provision of ecosystem service .
evaluating multivariable statistical method for downscaling nighttime land surface temperature in urban area .
for research and practice in Field such as the environment and meteorology , nighttime land surface temperature ( LST ) images at fine resolution provide important basic data .
since only a few satellite sensor can take fine-resolution thermal infrared image at night , such image are rather scarce .
downscaling of coarse-resolution LST images is a potential method for obtaining high-resolution LST image .
however , downscaling method have been mostly proposed for daytime LST image .
this study aimed to evaluate the performance of method that combine multiple explanatory variable and machine learning algorithms for downscaling coarse-resolution nighttime LST image in urban area .
verification showed that the error in the downscaling result were acceptable ( mean absolute error within 2 K ) .
the resulting image could depict the spatial pattern of night LST in the study area in great detail .
it was demonstrated that visible-near infrared image taken in the daytime could be used for downscaling of nighttime LST image , the rationality of which was deduced .
it was also demonstrated that the performance of the spectral explanatory variable in nighttime LST downscalingwas not lower than that of the mechanism explanatory variable .

this method has high application value in many academic and practical effort , such as land-atmosphere interface radiation budget study , suitability assessment of human settlement , and urban environmental planning .
evaluating the role of urban fabric on surface urban heat island : The case of Istanbul .
urban heat island , one of the fundamental anthropogenic impact on local climate , have been a growing concern especially for high-density urban area such as Istanbul .

this paper outlines the use of a supervised machine learning technique to understand the effect of the urban fabric on surface urban heat island ( SUHI ) formation in Istanbul , and identify effective variable to provide a basis for research and practice focusing on SUHI mitigation .
