an analysis using the Ridge Regression Model found that 71 % of land surface temperature anomaly in Istanbul are linked to building coverage ratio ( BCR ) , surface/volume ratio ( SVR ) , sky-view factor ( SVF ) , canyon geometry factor ( CGF ) , and vegetation index ( NDVI ) .
ndvi and BCR were the urban fabric component with the highest contribution to SUHI formation , while the effect of SVF and CGF remained relatively low .

this research can help planner and designer gauge the contribution of the urban fabric to micro-climate issue and adapt SUHI mitigation strategy for project aiming to build climate-sensitive urban environment .
it also provides insight into and improves knowledge of supervised machine learning approach to the urban planning and design discipline .
smart environment design planning for smart city based on deep learning .

machine Learning ( ML ) and Deep Learning ( DL ) method have contributed to the progression of model in the different aspect of planning , prediction , and uncertainty analysis of urban and smart city development in the current scenario .
most developed city have suffered from severe air quality as population growth and industrialization grow rapidly .
government agency and citizen are increasingly concerned about air quality , which has an impact on various area of the human environment and human advancement .

conventional method of air pollution forecasting primarily use low-level simulation , and these model generate disappointing result that have led us to factor that influence air pollution measurement based on a thorough design of the structure .

furthermore , in this paper , Long Short- Term Memory ( LSTM ) assisted Staked Auto-Encoder ( SAE ) ( LSTM-SAE ) model has been proposed for predicting the air quality in smart environment design planning in the smart city .
long Short- Term Memory is used to evaluate air pollution quality prediction in smart city .
staked Auto-Encoder ( SAE ) is modeled and prepared gently to extract the intrinsic component that occur due to air pollution .

furthermore , the finding indicate that classification accuracy of 91.22 % and the overall Error rate of 0.46 has been validated , and LSTM-SAE addresses the different aspect of smart city and effective method when compared to other existing method .
meta-regression framework for energy consumption prediction in a smart city : A case study of Songdo in South Korea .
nowadays the concept of smart city has gained in popularity in urban study .
a smart city collects diverse information to monitor and analyze urban system , such as energy management .
it is crucial for smart city to monitor energy efficiency to be sustainable .
in this study , we search to expose the possibility offered by the energy data of Songdo , a South Korean smart city .
first , we have highlighted the ability of Songdo to generate energy data .
second , we used those data to predict its evolution .
as a result , we develop a short-term stacking ensemble model for energy consumption in Songdo , focusing on a three-months-ahead prediction problem .

to obtain this result , first we design a baseline regressor for the prediction , second , we apply a three-combination of each best model of the base regressor , and finally , a weighted meta-regression model was applied using meta-XGBoost .
we call the resulting model stacking ensemble model .
the proposed stacking ensemble model combines the best ensemble network to improve performance prediction , yielding an R2 value of 97.89 % .
the result support the effectiveness of the ensemble network , which use Artificial Neural Networks ( ANN ) , CatBoost and Gradient Boosting .
this study also shows that the weighted meta model outperforms several machine learning model in term of R2 , MAE and RSME .
evaluation of the environmental impact of urbanization from the viewpoint of increased skin temperature : a case study from Istanbul , Turkey .
urbanization is an inevitable process all around the world especially in developing countrie like Turkey .
istanbul has been experiencing rapid urban expansion for the past 60 year .
this urban expansion is leading to the replacement of forest by various artificial surface .
this situation has a critical impact on the natural surface due to the alteration of heat energy balance .

in this study , the author tried to investigate the extent of urbanization of Istanbul within the past decade to unearth its impact on the urban heat island ( UHI ) severity and the level of its ecological consequence in term of decreased thermal comfort .

to this end , land use/cover ( LULC ) and land surface temperature ( LST ) map were generated using Landsat imagerie based on random forest ( RF ) classifier ( as a machine learning tool ) and radiometric image processing algorithms , respectively , for four different date from 1989 to 2019 .
the statistical and spectral indicator were calculated for the study area to evaluate the association between urban development and UHI .

result indicate that Istanbul has suffered a continuous land transformation from forest to urban and cropland so that the area of forest has diminished by 373.3 km2 , and the artificial surface have increased by 260 km2 .
skin temperature over all the LULC classes show an increase during the study period with the highest value estimated over artificial surface .

the statistical analysis of urbanization indicator ( ULI , PD , UGSI , NDVI , and NDBI ) and UHI indicator ( UTFVI ) resulted in good correlation coefficient with the best agreement found between NDBI and UTFVI which stresses the strong link between the expansion of built-up area as a result of urbanization and the severity of UHI and its ecological impact in Istanbul .

thus , it is a must for policy-maker and official of the city to take accurate measure regarding the urban planning to mitigate the harsh environmental impact of growing urbanization of Istanbul in upcoming year .
assessing the cooling efficiency of urban park using data envelopment analysis and remote sensing data .
urban park can contribute to significant cooling effect for the city microclimate and , therefore , promote urban resident ’ outdoor thermal comfort .

as the enhancement of the urban heat island effect , understanding the cooling efficiency of urban park and associated determinant has become critical for maximizing the ecological benefit of urban ecological infrastructure .

in this paper , we measured holistically the cooling efficiency of urban park from a relative and absolute perspective by using the data envelopment analysis ( DEA ) model and Landsat 8 OLI/TIRS satellite imagerie .

we adopted two novel cooling effect indice to rank and identify the inefficient park : DEA-based cooling efficiency index for relative efficiency and park cooling intensity index ( PCII ) for absolute efficiency .
a total of 146 urban park within the Shanghai metropolitan city was selected to conduct the empirical research .
the correlation analysis and machine learning technique ( XGBoost ) were also used to examine the relationship between the characteristic of park and two cooling effect indice .
the finding revealed that the average cooling efficiency of urban park in summer was approximately 2.7 time higher than that in winter .
park size and vegetation greenness ( NDVI ) were identified as the dominant factor for park cooling efficiency .
moreover , larger park with area > 5 ha showed better cooling performance on average .
in the current study area , increasing the water body coverage ratio also played an important role on the improvement of cooling effect in both summer and winter .
the research finding could provide valuable reference for designing urban park and for urban planning to maximize the cooling benefit and mitigate the UHI effect .
designing roadside green infrastructure to mitigate traffic-related air pollution using machine learning .
community located in near-road environment are exposed to traffic-related air pollution ( TRAP ) , causing adverse health effect .
while roadside vegetation barrier can help mitigate TRAP , their effectiveness to reduce TRAP is influenced by site-specific condition .

to test vegetation design using direct field measurement or high-fidelity numerical simulation is often infeasible since urban planner and local community often lack the access and expertise to use those tool .
there is a need for a fast , reliable , and easy-to-use method to evaluate vegetation barrier design based on their capacity to mitigate TRAP .

in this paper , we investigated five machine learning ( ML ) method , including linear regression ( LR ) , support vector machine ( SVM ) , random forest ( RF ) , XGBoost ( XGB ) , and neural network ( NN ) , to predict size-resolved and locationally dependent particle concentration downwind of various vegetation barrier design .
data from 83 computational fluid dynamic ( CFD ) simulation was used to train and test the ML model .
we developed downwind region-specific model to capture the complexity of this problem and enhance the overall accuracy .

our feature space was composed of variable that can be feasibly obtained such as vegetation width , height , leaf area index ( LAI ) , particle size , leaf area density ( LAD ) and wind speed at different height .

rf , NN , and XGB performed well with a normalized root mean square error ( NRMSE ) of 6–7 % and an average test R2 value & gt ; 0.91 , while SVM and LR had an NRMSE of approximately 13 % and an average test R2 value of 0.56 .
using feature selection , vegetation dimension and particle size had the highest influence in predicting pollutant concentration .
the ML model developed can help create tool to aid local community in developing mitigation strategy to address TRAP problem .
toward low carbon city : A machine learning method for predicting urban block carbon emission ( UBCE ) based on built environment factor ( BEF ) in Changxing City , China .

predicting urban block carbon emission ( UBCE ) accurately based on built environment factor ( BEF ) is an effective way to reduce UBCE and alleviate urban heat island ( UHI ) from the perspective of urban planning .

at an urban level , this study collected various source of data and proposed a machine learning method ( Back Propagation Neural Network - BPNN ) to predict different function of UBCE by BEF in Changxing , a representative small city in China .
the study found that UBCE can be significantly affected by BEF such as density , function , and morphology .
the BPNN has a good prediction performance on different function of UBCE , and the mean absolute percentage error ( MAPE ) is stable within 10 % –20 % .
the prediction result showed that the average value of different function of UBCE presented an obvious variation .
the carbon emission map showed that the high UBCE are mainly clustered in the middle-east and south of the central city of Changxing .
by comparison with other study , the accuracy of this method was proved .
this method could be applied to predict carbon emission of the urban planning scheme .
optimizing the BEF of urban block can play key role in the reduction of carbon emission and then alleviation of the UHI .
investigation of urban climate and built environment relation by using machine learning .
climate change can cause a cascade of effect from the individual organism to ecosystem-scale where in nature , all specie are element of complex network of interaction .
hence , every impact on every scale has a significant role .
those property of the network are decisive on the global ecosystem , so how they will be modified by climate change needs serious study .

the vast population of the urban area exerts significant effect on climate change even though they cover a small proportion of the surface of the Earth ; however , impact of urbanization on climate and ecosystems remain inadequately understood .
in the meantime , urbanization continues to increase and in 2030 , two-third of the population is expected to be living in urban area with an increasing rate in time .
it is of great importance to elaborate on the relation between urbanization and climate .
in this respect , the use of information technology with an extensive computational capacity is one of the cornerstone of climate and urban study .
machine learning is a branch of computer science that deal with the automated recognition of pattern from data .
the use of machine learning algorithm can bring significant advantage to both understanding and predicting the climate .

the computational power with big data , their ability to capture nonlinear behavior , and learn as new data arrive make machine learning a useful tool for understanding climate and developing urban planning .

in this sense , the purpose of this study is to show the advantage of machine learning algorithm by developing a recurrent neural network algorithm to make climate prediction and stating possible effect of machine learning on design and its contribution to understanding the climate .
estimating the influence of building and urban form on the thermal load of urban dwelling in the Mediterranean climate using machine learning .
the paper presents a novel method of generating metamodel that can quantify the influence of urban form on the heating and cooling load of dwelling for the Mediterranean climate .
the goal of the metamodel is to inform the early urban design process with quick and accurate feedback on the energy demand of a given urban configuration .
the proposed method generates training dataset through Monte Carlo dynamic energy simulation of a single thermal zone .

the study focuses on the geometrical parameter that affect building energy balance at the urban scale , such as dwelling shape , compactness , adjacencie and shading , utilizing a set of morphological indicator to relate these parameter to heating and cooling load .
the study focuses on the Mediterranean climate of Thessaloniki , Greece and utilizes several open-source tool ( Ladybug Tools , EnergyPlus and Scikit-learn ) under a streamlined workflow .

the metamodel , which are trained using the Random Forest algorithm are then validated on 12 real-world urban site of Thessaloniki with a reported Mean Average Percentage Error ( MAPE ) of 12 % and 15 % for heating and cooling load , respectively .
fine scale surface climate in complex terrain using machine learning .

accurate and high spatial resolution ( < 100 m ) surface climate information is crucial for process-based modelling in hydrology , ecology , agriculture , urban study etc , especially in complex terrain landscape where coarse grid resolution information ( ∼10 km ) is inadequate to represent pronounced local variability .
we used a machine learning-based workflow to predict high resolution ( 30 m ) and sub-daily atmospheric variable Field of near-surface air temperature and humidity , and wind speed .

the method used the Principal Component Analysis ( PCA ) decomposition applied on ground station observation or Global Climate Model ( GCM ) residual error , in a sequence with bias correction and statistical model ( Linear Regression-LR , Artificial Neural Network model-ANN and Empirical Quantile Mapping-EQM ) to provide downscaling from large scale atmospheric condition to complex terrain variability .

the prediction described relationship of Principal Component ( PC ) scores dependent on GCM temporal variability on 6-hourly basis ( with LR or ANN or EQM ) , and PC loadings dependent on topographic indexe to help providing horizontal sub-grid extrapolation .
the method were validated with a 1-year dataset from a dense weather station network deployed in a complex terrain basin in tropical climate of Southeast Brazil .
we present an exhaustive description of the PC modes daily/seasonal variability for each variable , and their spatial variability associated to the topography and thermal driven circulation .
the prediction in general substantially improved accuracy when compared to GCM output , especially near the valley and in sheltered area where local effect are mandatorie .
specially , ANN and EQM significantly improved the prediction at the variability of extreme event , such as the formation of strong cold air pooling or wetting in the valley .
combining CityGML file and data-driven model for microclimate simulation in a tropical city .
this research first developed a solution to convert LOD 2 CityGML file to LOD 1 file .

then , by using LOD 1 file as geometric input , this study developed a python-based microclimate simulation program based on a customized machine learning algorithm to better understand the relationship between urban morphology and outdoor temperature .
the integration with the 3D geometry makes this prediction model not only useful to the scientific research , but also as an urban planning tool for environmentally sustainable design .

for model development , meteorological data and urban morphology feature were used to predict the daily maximum temperature , daily minimum temperature , daily daytime average temperature and daily night-time average temperature .
voting regression ( VOT ) based on ordinary least square and random forest was used as the regression model .
the average CV-R2 and the CV-RMSE predicted by VOT for the outdoor air temperature were 0.84 and 0.52°C .
compared with ordinary least Square , VOT improved R2 by an average of 18 % and RMSE by an average of 24 % .
sensitivity analysis indicated the daytime temperature was inversely proportional to the aspect ratio of urban canyon Street .
in tropical climate , greenery can be used as a cooling measure .
a negative logarithmic relationship was found between the daily maximum temperature , daily minimum temperature and green plot ratio .
this shows that as the green coverage increase , the cooling effect of greenery increase , and it is more effective to adopt greenery early in area with less vegetation .
characterizing air quality in urban area with mobile measurement and high resolution open spatial data : Comparison of different machine-learning approach using a visual interface .
air quality is one of the most important topic in our urban life , as it is of great significance for human health and urban planning .
however , accurate assessment and prediction of air quality in urban area are difficult .
in major city , typically only a limited number of air quality monitoring station are available , and inferring air quality in the un-sampled area throughout the city is challenging .

on the other hand , air quality varie in the urban area non-linearly ; it is highly spatially dependent and considerably influenced by multiple factor , such as building distribution , traffic situation and land use .
in this research , we model air quality in the city of Augsburg using spatial feature and high quality sensor data .
we identify spatial feature such as type and area of different land use , road network with high resolution .
we integrate open available data to the air quality prediction .

in this regard , we compare a simple baseline model with linear regression model ( Ordinary Least-Square and Ridge Regression ) and tree-based machine-learning model ( Gradient Boosting and Random Forest ) .
in our evaluation , given the non-linearity of the data , tree-based model outperform all linear model , which are commonly used in literature .
in addition , we created an interactive and visual dashboard .
this dashboard demonstrates the analytical workflow , gives insight into model performance and uncertainty and visualizes the result .
combined gis , cfd and neural network multi-zone model for urban planning and building simulation .
this study developed a methodology using Geographic Information System ( GIS ) , Computational Fluid Dynamics ( CFD ) and neural network to help predict the microclimate of the building .
the geographic representation of an urban area in Syracuse generated in GIS was converted to the computational domain used in CFD simulation .
the flow field around the building was simulated using the CFD model under different wind speed and direction .
result from CFD simulation could be well presented in GIS using anchored coordinate system .
the flow pattern were very similar when the wind speed was varied , while they were highly dependent on the wind direction .
however , predicting the flow Field of different wind direction requires running the CFD simulation for each case .
a neural network for machine learning was adopted to help predict the microclimate around the building so that much time can be saved .
the result show that the proposed neural network has the potential to help predict the microclimate .
the predicted microclimate could be used for further study of the building performance .
exploiting foursquare and cellular data to infer user activity in urban environment .

inferring the type of activity in neighborhood of urban center may be helpful in a number of contexts including urban planning , content delivery and activity recommendation for mobile web user or may even yield to a deeper understanding of the geographical evolution of social life in the city .

during the past few year , the analysis of mobile phone usage pattern , or of social media with longitudinal attribute , have aided the automatic characterization of the dynamic of the urban environment .

in this work , we combine a dataset sourced from a telecommunication provider in Spain with a database of million of geo-tagged venue from Foursquare and we formulate the problem of urban activity inference in a supervised learning framework .
in particular , we exploit user communication pattern observed at the base station level in order to predict the activity of Foursquare user who checkin-in at nearby venue .
first , we mine a set of machine learning feature that allow us to encode the input telecommunication signal of a tower .
subsequently , we evaluate a diverse set of supervised learning algorithms using label extracted from Foursquare place category and we consider two application scenario .

initially , we assess how hard it is to predict specific urban activity of an area , showing that Nightlife and Entertainment spot are those easier to infer , whereas College and Shopping area are those featuring the lowest accuracy rate .
then , considering a candidate set of activity type in a geographic area , we aim to elect the most prominent one .

we demonstrate how the difficulty of the problem increases with the number of class incorporated in the prediction task , yet the classifier achieve a considerably better performance compared to a random guess even when the set of candidate class increases .
urban human mobility data mining : An overview .
understanding urban human mobility is crucial for epidemic control , urban planning , traffic forecasting system and , more recently , various mobile and network application .
nowaday , a variety of urban human mobility data have been gathered and published .
pervasive GPS data can be collected by mobile phone .
a mobile operator can track people 's movement in city based on their cellular network location .
this urban human mobility data contain rich knowledge about location and can help in addressing many urban challenge such as traffic congestion or air pollution problem .
in this article , we survey recent literature on urban human mobility from a data mining view : from the data collection and cleaning , to the mobility model and the application .
first , we summarize recent public urban human mobility data set and how to clean and preprocess such data .
second , we describe recent urban human mobility model and predictor , e.g.
, the deep learning predictor , for predicting urban human mobility .
third , we describe how to evaluate the model and predictor .
we conclude by considering how application can utilize the mobility model and predictive tool for addressing city challenge .
analyzing large-scale human mobility data : a survey of machine learning method and application .
human mobility pattern reflect many aspect of life , from the global spread of infectious disease to urban planning and daily commute pattern .

in recent year , the prevalence of positioning method and technology , such as the global positioning system , cellular radio tower geo-positioning , and WiFi positioning system , has driven effort to collect human mobility data and to mine pattern of interest within these data in order to promote the development of location-based service and application .

the effort to mine significant pattern within large-scale , high-dimensional mobility data have solicited use of advanced analysis technique , usually based on machine learning method , and therefore , in this paper , we survey and assess different approach and model that analyze and learn human mobility pattern using mainly machine learning method .

we categorize these approach and model in a taxonomy based on their positioning characteristic , the scale of analysis , the property of the modeling approach , and the class of application they can serve .
we find that these application can be categorized into three class : user modeling , place modeling , and trajectory modeling , each class with its characteristic .
finally , we analyze the short-term trend and future challenge of human mobility analysis .
impact of land use and amenity on public transport use , urban planning and design .
various land-use configuration are known to have wide-ranging effect on the dynamic of and within other city component including the transportation system .

in this work , we particularly focus on the complex relationship between land-use and transport offering an innovative approach to the problem by using land-use feature at two differing level of granularity ( the more general land-use sector type and the more granular amenity structure ) to evaluate their impact on public transit ridership in both time and space .

to quantify the interdependency , we explored three machine learning model and demonstrate that the decision tree model perform best in term of overall performance-good predictive accuracy , generality , computational efficiency , and `` interpretability '' .

result also reveal that amenity-related feature are better predictor than the more general one , which suggests that high-resolution geo-information can provide more insight into the dependence of transit ridership on land-use .

we then demonstrate how the developed framework can be applied to urban planning for transit-oriented development by exploring practicable scenario based on Singapore 's urban plan toward 2030 , which includes the development of `` regional center '' ( RCs ) across the city-state .
result show an initial increase in transit ridership as the amount of amenity is increased .

this trend , on the other hand , eventually reverses ( particularly during peak hour ) with continued strategic increase in amenity ; a tipping point at 55 % increase is identified where ridership begins to decline and at 110 % , the predicted ridership begins to fall below current level .
our in-silico experiment support one of the medium-term land-use transport goal of stakeholders-to alleviate future strain in the transportation system of Singapore through the development of RCs .

the model put forward can serve as a good foundation in building decision-support tool that can assist planner in better strategizing and planning land-use configuration , in particular the amenity resource distribution , to influence and shape public transportation demand .
temporal decomposition and semantic enrichment of mobility flow .
mobility data has increasingly grown in volume over the past decade as localisation technology for capturing mobility flow have become ubiquitous .
novel analytical approach for understanding and structuring mobility data are now required to support the backend of a new generation of space-time GIS system .
it is increasingly important as GIS is becoming a decision support platform for operation in fleet management , urban data analysis and related application .
this paper applies the machine learning method of probabilistic topic modelling for semantic enrichment of mobility data recorded in term of trip Count by using geo-referenced social media data .
it further explores the question of causality and correlation , as well as predictability of the obtained semantic decomposition of mobility flow on a real dataset from a bike sharing network .
mining large-scale human mobility data for long-term crime prediction .
traditional crime prediction model based on census data are limited , as they fail to capture the complexity and dynamic of human activity .
with the rise of ubiquitous computing , there is the opportunity to improve such model with data that make for better proxy of human presence in city .
in this paper , we leverage large human mobility data to craft an extensive set of feature for crime prediction , as informed by theory in criminology and urban study .

we employ averaging and boosting ensemble technique from machine learning , to investigate their power in predicting yearly Count for different type of crime occurring in New York City at census tract level .
our study shows that spatial and spatio-temporal feature derived from Foursquare venue and checkin , subway ride , and taxi ride , improve the baseline model relying on census and POI data .
the proposed model achieve absolute R2 metric of up to 65 % ( on a geographical out-of-sample test set ) and up to 89 % ( on a temporal out-of-sample test set ) .
this proves that , next to the residential population of an area , the ambient population there is strongly predictive of the area ’ s crime level .

we deep-dive into the main crime category , and find that the predictive gain of the human dynamic feature varie across crime type : such feature bring the biggest boost in case of grand larceny , wherea assault are already well predicted by the census feature .
furthermore , we identify and discuss top predictive feature for the main crime category .
these result offer valuable insight for those responsible for urban policy or law enforcement .
iviztran : Interactive visual learning for home and work place detection from massive public transportation data .

using transport smart card transaction data to understand the homework dynamic of a city for urban planning is emerging as an alternative to traditional survey which may be conducted every few year are no longer effective and efficient for the rapidly transforming modern city .
as commuter travel pattern are highly diverse , existing rule-based method are not fully adequate .

in this paper , we present iVizTRANS - a tool which combines an interactive visual analytic ( VA ) component to aid urban planner to analyse complex travel pattern and decipher activity location for single public transport commuter .
it is coupled with a machine learning component that iteratively learns from the planner classification to train a classifier .
the classifier is then applied to the city-wide smart card data to derive the dynamic for all public transport commuter .
our evaluation shows it outperforms the rule-based method in previous work .
strategway : Web solution for building public transportation route using big geodata analysis .
we propose Strategway , a group of web solution for public transportation route planning based on real geo-data obtained from city resident .
the idea behind the solution is to use collected data about city resident ' transportation need ( resident ' preference ) and to build an optimal route network minimizing total cost of ownership .
as transportation preference of people are represented as a large set of geoobject , machine learning algorithm were modified to take geodata specific into account .
strategway includes the analytic core for data gathering , clustering and route design based on machine learning technique .
these feature can be considered as contribution in smart algorithms for urban planning system .
pseudocode of main algorithms with novel addition are represented in the paper as the result of some case study .
future work is declared in the end to highlight the way of contribution to the domain of analytic as a web service .
automated urban travel interpretation : A bottom-up approach for trajectory segmentation .
understanding travel behavior is critical for an effective urban planning as well as for enabling various context-aware service provision to support mobility as a service ( MaaS ) .
both application rely on the sensor trace generated by traveller ’ smartphone .
these trace can be used to interpret travel mode , both for generating automated travel diary as well as for real-time travel mode detection .
current approach segment a trajectory by certain criterion , e.g.
, drop in speed .
however , these criterion are heuristic , and , thus , existing approach are subjective and involve significant vagueness and uncertainty in activity transition in space and time .
also , segmentation approach are not suited for real time interpretation of open-ended segment , and can not cope with the frequent gap in the location trace .
in order to address all these challenges a novel , state based bottom-up approach is proposed .
this approach assumes a fixed atomic segment of a homogeneous state , instead of an event-based segment , and a progressive iteration until a new state is found .

the research investigates how an atomic state-based approach can be developed in such a way that can work in real time , near-real time and offline mode and in different environmental condition with their varying quality of sensor trace .

the result show the proposed bottom-up model outperforms the existing event-based segmentation model in term of adaptivity , flexibility , accuracy and richness in information delivery pertinent to automated travel behavior interpretation .
multi-gcn : Graph convolutional network for multi-view network , with application to global poverty .
with the rapid expansion of mobile phone network in developing countrie , large-scale graph machine learning has gained sudden relevance in the study of global poverty .
recent application range from humanitarian response and poverty estimation to urban planning and epidemic containment .

yet the vast majority of computational tool and algorithm used in these application do not account for the multi-view nature of social network : people are related in myriad way , but most graph learning model treat relation as binary .
in this paper , we develop a graph-based convolutional network for learning on multi-view network .
we show that this method outperforms state-of-the-art semi-supervised learning algorithms on three different prediction task using mobile phone dataset from three different developing countrie .

we also show that , while designed specifically for use in poverty research , the algorithm also outperforms existing benchmark on a broader set of learning task on multi-view network , including node labelling in citation network .
characterization of behavioral pattern exploiting description of geographical area .
the enormous amount of recently available mobile phone data is providing unprecedented direct measurement of human behavior .
early recognition and prediction of behavioral pattern are of great importance in many societal application like urban planning , transportation optimization , and health-care .
understanding the relationship between human behavior and location ’ s context is an emerging interest for understanding human-environmental dynamic .
growing availability of Web 2.0 , i.e .
the increasing amount of website with mainly user created content and social platform opens up an opportunity to study such location ’ s contexts .
this paper investigates relationship existing between human behavior and location context , by analyzing log mobile phone data record .
first an advanced approach to categorize area in a city based on the presence and distribution of category of human activity ( e.g.
, eating , working , and shopping ) found across the area , is proposed .

the proposed classification is then evaluated through its comparison with the pattern of temporal variation of mobile phone activity and applying machine learning technique to predict a timeline type of communication activity in a given location based on the knowledge of the obtained category vs. land-use type of the location area .

the proposed classification turns out to be more consistent with the temporal variation of human communication activity , being a better predictor for those compared to the official land use classification .
integrating geovisual analytic with machine learning for human mobility pattern discovery .
understanding human movement pattern is of fundamental importance in transportation planning and management .

we propose to examine complex public transit travel pattern over a large-scale transit network , which is challenging since it involves thousand of transit passenger and massive data from heterogeneous source .
additionally , efficient representation and visualization of discovered travel pattern is difficult given a large number of transit trip .
to address these challenge , this study leverages advanced machine learning method to identify time-varying mobility pattern based on smart card data and other urban data .
the proposed approach delivers a comprehensive solution to pre-process , analyze , and visualize complex public transit travel pattern .

this approach first fuses smart card data with other urban data to reconstruct original transit trips.We use two machine learning method , including a clustering algorithm to extract transit corridor to represent primarymobility connection between different region and a graph-embedding algorithmto discover hierarchical mobility community structures.We also devise compact and effective multi-scale visualization form to represent the discovered travel behavior dynamic .

an interactive web-based mapping prototype is developed to integrate advanced machine learning method with specific visualization to characterize transit travel behavior pattern and to enable visual exploration of transit mobility pattern at different scale and resolution over space and time .
the proposed approach is evaluated using multi-source big transit data ( e.g.
, smart card data , transit network data , and bus trajectory data ) collected in Shenzhen City , China .
evaluation of our prototype demonstrates that the proposed visual analytic approach offers a scalable and effective solution for discovering meaningful travel pattern across large metropolitan area .
unveiling Topic from Scientific Literature on the Subject of Self-driving Cars using Latent Dirichlet Allocation .
self-driving car are becoming popular topic in academia .
consumer of self-driving car and vehicle have different concern , for example , safety and security , to name a few .
also , the public sector has interest in self-driving car such as amending policy to enable the management of self-driving vehicle in city , urban planning , traffic management and , etc .
in this paper , more than 2700 corpus are extracted from literature from several subject area to identify latent ( hidden ) topic of self-driving car .
latent Dirichlet Allocation ( LDA ) is used for topic identification .

the result of this study shows that topic identified are valid research area such as urban planning , driver car ( computer ) interaction , self-driving control and system design , ethic in self-driving car , safety and risk assessment , training dataset quality and machine learning in self-driving car are among the topic identified .

furthermore , the network visualization of association graph of term show that the most frequently discussed concept reveal that control of self-driving car is based on algorithms , data , design , method , and model .
the method used in this study and the result can be used as decision tool , if carefully applied , in diverse discipline that are disrupted by the introduction of self-driving car .
for future study , we plan to extend this study with a larger dataset and other data mining technique .
nonnegative coupled matrix tensor factorization for smart city spatiotemporal pattern mining .
with the advancement in smartphone and inbuilt sensor , the day-to-day spatiotemporal activity of people can be recorded .
with this available information , the automated extraction of spatiotemporal pattern is crucial to understand the people ’ s mobility .
these pattern can assist in improving the smart city environment like traffic control , urban planning , and transportation facility .
the smartphone generated spatiotemporal data is enriched with multiple contexts and efficiently utilizing them in a Machine Learning process is still a challenging task .
in this paper , we propose a Nonnegative Coupled Matrix Tensor Factorization ( CMTF ) model to integrate and analyze additional contexts with spatiotemporal data to generate meaningful pattern .
we also propose an efficient factorization algorithm based on variable selection to solve the Nonnegative CMTF model that yields accurate spatiotemporal pattern .
our empirical analysis highlight the efficiency of the proposed CMTF model in term of accuracy and factor goodness .
cell-to-cell activity prediction for smart city .

in this paper , we analyze data from a large mobile phone provider in Europe , pertaining to time series of aggregate communication volume Ai , j ( t ) & gt ; 0 between cell i and j , for all pair of cell in a city over a month .
we develop a methodology for predicting the future ( in particular whether two cell will talk to each other Ai , j ( t ) & gt ; 0 ) based on past activity .
our data set is sparse , with 80 % of the value being zero , which makes prediction challenging .
we formulate the problem as binary classification and , using decision tree and random forest , we are able to achieve 85 % accuracy .
by giving higher weight to false positive , which cost more to network operator , than false negative , we improved recall from 40 % to 94 % .

we briefly outline potential application of this prediction capability to improve network planning , green small cell , and understanding urban ecology , all of which can inform policy and urban planning .
crosstown traffic - supervised prediction of impact of planned special event on urban traffic .
large-scale planned special event in city including concert , football game and fair can significantly impact urban mobility .
the lack of reliable model for understanding and predicting mobility need during urban event causes issue for mobility service user , provider as well as urban planner .
in this article , we tackle the problem of building reliable supervised model for predicting the spatial and temporal impact of planned special event with respect to road traffic .

we adopt a supervised machine learning approach to predict event impact from historical data and analyse effectiveness of a variety of feature , covering , for instance , feature of the event as well as mobility- and infrastructure-related feature .

our evaluation result on real-world event data containing event from several venue in the Hannover region in Germany demonstrate that the proposed combination of event- , mobility- and infrastructure-related feature show the best performance and are able to accurately predict spatial and temporal impact on road traffic in the event context in this region .
in particular , a comparison with both event-based and event-agnostic baseline shows superior capacity of our model to predict impact of planned special event on urban traffic .
learning geo-contextual embedding for commuting flow prediction .
predicting commuting flow based on infrastructure and land-use information is critical for urban planning and public policy development .
however , it is a challenging task given the complex pattern of commuting flow .
conventional model , such as gravity model , are mainly derived from physic principle and limited by their predictive power in real-world scenario where many factor need to be considered .
meanwhile , most existing machine learning-based method ignore the spatial correlation and fail to model the influence of nearby region .

to address these issue , we propose Geocontextual Multitask Embedding Learner ( GMEL ) , a model that captures the spatial correlation from geographic contextual information for commuting flow prediction .
specifically , we first construct a geo-adjacency network containing the geographic contextual information .

then , an attention mechanism is proposed based on the framework of graph attention network ( GAT ) to capture the spatial correlation and encode geographic contextual information to embedding space .
two separate GATs are used to model supply and demand characteristic .

to enhance the effectiveness of the embedding representation , a multitask learning framework is used to introduce stronger restriction , forcing the embedding to encapsulate effective representation for flow prediction .
finally , a gradient boosting machine is trained based on the learned embedding to predict commuting flow .
we evaluate our model using real-world dataset from New York City and the experimental result demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method against the state of the art .
a generic paradigm for mining human mobility pattern based on the GPS trajectory data using complex network analysis .
the mining of human mobility can be exploited to support the design of traffic planning , route recommendation , urban planning , emergency management , and land use .
currently , various method such as the machine learning algorithm , statistical method , and semantic analysis are widely applied to identify and extract human mobility pattern .
in this paper , we propose a simple and generic paradigm for mining human mobility pattern based on the GPS trajectory data using complex network analysis .

the essential idea behind the proposed paradigm mainly include ( 1 ) creating weighted complex network of GPS trajectory and ( 2 ) extracting the human mobility pattern by analyzing the structure and metric of the created complex network of GPS trajectory .

to evaluate the performance of the proposed paradigm , we design five group of experiment and identify the mobility pattern of the selected five person based on the selected five network analysis metric .
experimental result indicate that ( 1 ) the proposed paradigm is effective and ( 2 ) the quite interesting potential information about the human mobility can be mined easily .
the proposed paradigm is simple and generic , which can be employed to rapidly identify the human mobility pattern based on the GPS trajectory data .
exploring the relationship between ride-sourcing service and vehicle ownership , using both inferential and machine learning approach .
ride-sourcing service are getting more popular each year , and their market are growing .
much has been speculated , but not much has been tested regarding the impact of ride-sourcing service on the transportation system .
in this study , we examine the relationship between ride-sourcing service and vehicle ownership of household , by using the most up-to-date ( 2017 ) national household travel survey data .
to better capture the effect of ride-sourcing service on vehicle ownership , we controlled for the effect of socioeconomic characteristic of household and built environment variable , i.e.
, density , diversity , design , and distance to transit .
two approach were used to model vehicle ownership : a probabilistic or inferential model ( i.e.
, multilevel Poisson ) , and a machine learning method ( i.e.
, random forest ) .

this is the first study to utilize such advanced method to model vehicle ownership and capture non-linear relationship , using the largest sample of household travel record ever assembled for such a study .
the result suggest that there is a negative correlation between using ride-sourcing service and vehicle ownership .
vehicle ownership is also negatively associated with the number of year Uber , as the biggest ride-sourcing service , has operated in a county .
the relative contribution of ride-sourcing variable , however , are very limited compared to other variable controlled in this study which makes intuitive sense .

for urban planning and design practice , this study suggests that the probability of car shedding will increase if the usage of ride-sourcing service becomes a habit , these service become more available , and built environment become more dense , connected , and transit-served .
fine-grained dynamic population mapping method based on large-scale sparse mobile phone data .
the dynamic nature of urban population distribution plays a key role in urban planning , emergency management and public travel information service .
currently , the widespread use of mobile phone data provides the opportunity to support fine-scale population study .
however , the data sparsity problem of mobile phone data has been a huge handicap .
to overcome this , we proposed a comprehensive approach to achieve fine-grained dynamic population distribution and high-resolution population map based on large-scale sparse mobile phone data .
first , we developed an anchor-point-based trajectory reconstruction method to improve the spatiotemporal granularity of mobile phone trajectory .
then , a rapid and efficient automation population mapping method was proposed with the support of reconstructed high spatiotemporal resolution of human movement .
finally , we analyze spatiotemporal characteristic of population distribution and spatial-Temporal interaction of human movement .
using a real mobile phone dataset in the city of Shanghai as a case study , we evaluated the performance of our method .

result indicated that our method improved the precision and reliability of population distribution estimation and could be utilized for quantitatively analyzing the spatiotemporal characteristic of population distribution and migration .
we argue that this study is useful for understanding the highly dynamic human movement state and supporting advanced urban application .
dimensionality Reduction to Reveal Urban Truck Driver Activity Patterns .
this paper study the activity profile of truck driver in urban area .
finding repeating dynamical pattern is important in understanding freight behavior , and aid freight-friendly planning .
in the digital age , data on truck driver is becoming more available with heterogeneous demographic and work profile .
by synthesizing such pervasive data and applying machine learning concept , this paper proposes to identify signature travel activity patterns via dimensionality reduction .
based on driver survey data , truck driver ’ behavior are represented as longitudinal activity sequence .

dimensionality reduction and activity reconstruction via principal component analysis ( PCA ) , logistic PCA , and autoencoder were conducted to reveal fundamental activity feature and approximate the underlying data-generating function .
in the driver survey dataset , 243 truck driver in Singapore reported their daily activity for 1,099 weekday .
this study found that PCA produced the most faithful reconstruction of driver ’ activity .
when projecting the input data down from 2,592 to 82 dimension , PCA explained 77 % of variance with a reconstruction error of 0.99 % .
logistic PCA is a useful extension of PCA to study the pattern of a single activity .
it captures the variation of infrequent activity such as truck queuing , which PCA fails to reconstruct .
autoencoder was found to be more powerful than PCA in reconstructing activity – with 1 % of original dimension , it reconstructed the activity with an error rate of 1.24 % .
moreover , when implemented as a variational autoencoder , autoencoder generated realistic-looking sample of driver activity .
the top three most distinctive activity pattern of Singapore truck driver are reported using PCA .
data mining tourism pattern .
in this study we show how Call Detail Record ( CDR ) can be used to better understand the travel pattern of visitor .
we show how Origin-Destination ( OD ) Interactive Maps can provide transportation information through CDR .
we then use aggregation of CDR to show the difference between the travel pattern of visitor from different countrie and of different length of stay .
we also show that visitor move differently during event period and non-event period , reflecting the importance of real-time data available by CDR .

from CDR , we can gain more detailed and complete information about how tourist move compared to traditional survey , which can be used to aid smarter transportation system and urban resource planning .
a note on the square root law for urban police travel time .

the classical Square Root Law formula for emergency travel time consists of one observable component , the density of patrol coverage , and one unknown component that must be estimated empirically , the effective travel speed .
the effective travel speed is typically assumed to be an empirical constant .
we test whether this simplifying assumption is justified empirically .

we propose a modern machine-learning approach and a Least Absolute Shrinkage and Selection Operator regression to incorporate into a travel speed model various exogenous factor such as call type , incident location , weather condition and traffic congestion .
the value of the proposed analytical approach and some practical implication are demonstrated using operational data from a large urban police jurisdiction based in British Columbia , Canada .

although the analysis is framed within the context of urban emergency police operation , the proposed approach has the potential to be useful for other emergency service or roving business unit that deal with unscheduled service call .
automated urban location annotation on mobile record .
location information is becoming much more important than ever before , especially in mobile service .
being widespread , less cost of energy and almost free for collecting data make mobile phone a perfect location sensor probe .
meaningful location name rather than digital coordinate could provide much more valuable information .

in this paper , we develop a location semantic predicting method referred to Location Annotation ( LA ) which can automatically annotate meaningful base station of phone user with semantic tag such as 'home ' , 'work place ' and 'club ' .
we extract several explicit feature from phone record and spatial-temporal pattern of mobile phone user to build an annotation model based on Maximum Entropy Model .
then a machine learning method is presented to estimate the best configuration of parameter in the model .
finally , comprehensive experiment demonstrate good performance of our method .
overall accuracy is about 90 % which outperforms simple and traditional classification method by 10+ % .
semantic location name are valuable to urban planning and optimization , transportation management and land use planning .
a data-driven agent-based simulation to predict crime pattern in an urban environment .
spatial crime simulation contribute to our understanding of the mechanism that drive crime and can support decision-maker in developing effective crime reduction strategy .
agent-based model that integrate geographical environment to generate crime pattern have emerged in recent year , although data-driven crime simulation are scarce .

this article ( 1 ) identifie numerous important driver of crime pattern , ( 2 ) collect relevant , openly available data source to build a GIS-layer with static and dynamic geographical , as well as temporal feature relevant to crime , ( 3 ) builds a virtual urban environment with these layer , in which individual offender agent navigate , ( 4 ) proposes a data-driven decision-making process using machine-learning for the agent to decide whether to engage in criminal activity based on their perception of the environment and , finally , ( 5 ) generates fine-grained crime pattern in a simulated urban environment .

the novelty of this work lies in the various large-scale data layer , the integration of machine learning at individual agent level to process the data layer , and the high resolution of the resulting prediction .
the result show that the spatial , temporal , and interaction layer are all required to predict the top street segment with the highest number of crime .
in addition , the spatial layer is the most informative , which means that spatial data contributes most to predictive performance .
thus , these finding highlight the importance of the inclusion of various open data source and the potential of theory-informed , data-driven simulation for the purpose of crime prediction .
the resulting model is applicable as a predictive tool and as a test platform to support crime reduction .
unveiling transit mobility structure toward sustainable city : An integrated graph embedding approach .
detecting urban mobility structure , i.e.

, segmenting urban area into disjoint cluster with similar mobility pattern , can facilitate our understanding of how a city is organized and how different part of a city interact with each other , which underpin informed decision-making in achieving sustainable urban transportation development and resilient society .

in this study , we propose to tackle a novel transit mobility structure detection problem , which hinges on high-level mobility pattern that characterize collective movement dynamic across the study region .
to this end , we propose a machine learning-based approach to discover meaningful urban mobility structure using big transit data .
we contend that both transit mobility pattern and local urban function information should be considered during the detection of transit mobility structure .

by integrating different source of urban data , we model the network of transit mobility as an attributed graph : local static urban function are described by attributed feature for graph node whereas travel dynamic are captured via a transit mobility pattern matrix .
similarity of both attributed feature and transit mobility pattern are jointly embedded to derive compact low-dimensional vector representation via graph auto-encoder .
mobility structure is then extracted using unsupervised clustering and gap statistic .
the proposed approach is capable of synthesizing both mobility and static information in a data-driven manner , preserving original urban topological structure and resident movement dynamic .
the proposed approach was evaluated using real-world transit data collected in Shenzhen City , China .
experimental result and analyses demonstrate that the proposed approach has the applicability of unveiling meaningful transit mobility structure in large metropolitan area .

the detected mobility community maps present a holistic overview of public transit movement structure , enabling decision maker to make informed decision on sustainable urban development and transit management .
interpretation of contextual influence with explanatory tool : Travel mode likelihood mapping using GPS trajectory .
past study have failed to address the spatially and temporally varying impact of environmental factor regarding the uncertain geographic context problem .

this study seeks to provide an innovative framework to facilitate the understanding of spatially and temporally varying impact of multiple contexts on individual ' travel mode using GIS and machine learning technique .

it adopts machine learning technique to create likelihood map to predict the spatiotemporal pattern of individual travel behavior and uses explanatory tool to explore the spatially and temporally varying impact .
the most notable change at a local level in the spatial dimension was that assault and offenses involving children turned out to be important in two selected community in Chicago .

regarding the temporally varying impact , battery , other offense , and robbery showed negative association with the walking prediction to some extent at the afternoon peak ( 5–7:59 p.m. ) during weekday .

the proposed approach will enable meaningful interpretation of complex interaction between multiple environmental factor and individual travel behavior to suggest policy in urban planning and design .
a machine learning approach to the simulation of intercity corporate network in mainland China .
this paper explores the potential of machine learning algorithms ( MLAs ) for the simulation of intercity network .
to this end , we implement the random forest MLA to simulate the intercity corporate network created by Fortune China 500 firm in mainland China .
the random forest MLA does not require a predefined model but detect patterns directly from the data to automatically build model .
the city-dyad connectivitie were computed using an interlocking network model and treated as target variable .
city factor and geographical factor were treated as feature .
the model was trained using a 2010 training set and subsequently validated using 2010 and 2017 test set .
the result are promising , with the pseudo R2 of the model coupled with different test data ranging from 0.861 to 0.940 .
nonetheless , the random forest MLA also faces some challenge in the context of the simulation of intercity network .

we conclude that MLAs are potentially useful for specific application such as the analysis of network big data , scenario simulation in regional planning , and the detection of driving force in exploratory research .
graph input representation for machine learning application in urban network analysis .
understanding and learning the characteristic of network path has been of particular interest for decade and has led to several successful application .
such analysis become challenging for urban network as their size and complexity are significantly higher compared to other network .
the state-of-the-art machine learning technique allow us to detect hidden pattern and , thus , infer the feature associated with them .
however , very little is known about the impact on the performance of such predictive model by the use of different input representation .
in this paper , we design and evaluate six different graph input representation ( i.e .

representation of the network path ) , by considering the network ’ s topological and temporal characteristic , for being used as input for machine learning model to learn the behavior of urban network path .
the representation are validated and then tested with a real-world taxi journey dataset predicting the tip of using a road network of New York .
our result demonstrate that the input representation that use temporal information help the model to achieve the highest accuracy ( root mean-squared error of 1.42 $ ) .
using Social Media to Understand City-wide Movement Patterns and Behaviours .
geospatially located social media data is increasingly used to understand human behaviour .
this flow of social activity can offer a real time understanding of city and provide insight into many issue such as estimation of crowd size , urban planning or even criminal activity .

in this paper we combine a multitude of social media data from diverse social media platform to explore population movement pattern and activity in two major city in Australia ( Melbourne and Sydney ) .
we provide a framework for the identification of cluster of activity and explore different temporal pattern and compare them with historical average in order to distinguish anomalous activity .
we also utilize natural language processing of the geo-textual data as well as supervised machine learning to classify the use of location based on cluster of activity .
collectively these analysis offer insight into urban human activity to provide a city pulse .
learning Semantic Relationships of Geographical Areas based on Trajectorie .

mining trajectory data to find interesting pattern is of increasing research interest due to a broad range of useful application , including analysis of transportation system , location-based social network , and crowd behavior .
the primary focus of this research is to leverage the abundance of trajectory data to automatically and accurately learn latent semantic relationship between different geographical area ( e.g.
, semantically correlated neighborhood of a city ) as revealed by pattern of moving object over time .

while previous study have utilized trajectory for this type of analysis at the level of a single geographical area , the result can not be easily generalized to inform comparative analysis of different geographical area .
in this paper , we study this problem systematically .
first , we present a method that utilizes trajectory to learn low-dimensional representation of geographical area in an embedded space .
then , we develop a statistical method that allows to quantify the degree to which real trajectory deviate from a theoretical null model .

the method allows to ( a ) distinguish geographical proximity to semantic proximity , and ( b ) inform a comparative analysis of two ( or more ) model obtained by trajectory defined on different geographical area .
this deep analysis can improve our understanding of how space is perceived by individual and inform better decision of urban planning .

our experimental evaluation aim to demonstrate the effectiveness and usefulness of the proposed statistical method in two large-scale real-world data set coming from the New York City and the city of Porto , Portugal , respectively .

the method we present are generic and can be utilized to inform a number of useful application , ranging from location-based service , such as point-of-interest recommendation , to finding semantic relationship between different city .
recognition of implicit geographic movement in text .
analyzing the geographic movement of human , animal , and other phenomena is a growing field of research .
this research has benefited urban planning , logistic , animal migration understanding , and much more .
typically , the movement is captured as precise geographic coordinate and time stamp with Global Positioning Systems ( GPS ) .

although some research uses computational technique to take advantage of implicit movement in description of route direction , hiking path , and historical exploration route , innovation would accelerate with a large and diverse corpus .
we created a corpus of sentence labeled as describing geographic movement or not and including the type of entity moving .
creating this corpus proved difficult without any comparable corpora to start with , high human labeling cost , and since movement can at time be interpreted differently .
to overcome these challenge , we developed an iterative process employing hand labeling , crowd voting for confirmation , and machine learning to predict more label .

by merging advance in word embedding with traditional machine learning model and model ensembling , prediction accuracy is at an acceptable level to produce a large silver-standard corpus despite the small gold-standard corpus training set .
our corpus will likely benefit computational processing of geography in text and spatial cognition , in addition to detection of movement .
harnessing Social Interactions on Twitter for Smart Transportation Using Machine Learning .
twitter is generating a large amount of real-time data in the form of microblog that has potential knowledge for various application like traffic incident analysis and urban planning .
social media data represents the unbiased actual insight of citizen ’ concern that may be mined in making city smarter .
in this study , a computational framework has been proposed using word embedding and machine learning model to detect traffic incident using social media data .

the study includes the feasibility of using machine learning algorithms with different feature extraction and representation model for the identification of traffic incident from the Twitter interaction .
the comprehensive proposed approach is the combination of following four step .
in the first phase , a dictionary of traffic-related keyword is formed .
secondly , real-time Twitter data has been collected using the dictionary of identified traffic related keyword .
in the third step , collected tweet have been pre-processed , and the feature generation model is applied to convert the dataset eligible for a machine learning classifier .
further , a machine learning model is trained and tested to identify the tweet containing traffic incident .
the result of the study show that machine learning model built on top of right feature extraction strategy is very promising to identify the tweet containing traffic incident from micro-blog .
transaction-driven Mobility Analysis for Travel Mode Choices .
urban planning can benefit tremendously from a better understanding of where , when , why , how people travel .
through advance in technology , detailed data on the travel behavior of individual has become available .
this data can be leveraged to understand why one prefers one mode of transportation over another one .
in this paper , we analyze a unique dataset through which we can address this question .
we show that the travel behavior in our dataset is highly predictable , with an accuracy of 97 % .
the main predictor are reachability feature , more so than specific travel time .
moreover , the travel type ( commute or personal ) has a considerable influence on travel mode choice .
quantitative relationship model of express service network and service facility in Beijing .
this paper intends to propose a quantitative relationship model in the layout between express service network and other life service facility .
through big data mining technology , we collected GPS location of express service point , residential area , grocery store and transportation station in Beijing .

then , using Multiple linear regression , SVM and random forest machine learning model the quantitative relationship between the number of express service point and other data in urban area , as well as the approach of model stacking get an integration machine learning model .
finally , the model and research idea of this paper provide decision-making basis for the rational construction and planning of logistic service network in first-tier city in China .
latent Flow Patterns Discovery by Dockless Bike Trajectory Data for Demand Analysis .
the dockless shared bike flourish as a new concept in recent year .
it allows user to find bike anywhere via a GPS-based mobile application , and flexible cycling and parking the bike in the same way .
from the bike trajectory data produced by User , we can extract bike flow pattern for better urban planning and Point-of-Interest ( POI ) recommendation .

in this paper , through conducting the spatio-temporal representation of bike activity acquired from bike trajectory log , we first design a graph clustering model With sparsity constraint that combine time information to explore potential pattern of bike flow .

next , by comparing historical trajectory log and POI information with the flow pattern , we dig out several typical category of bike flow pattern , which can give suggestion for further urban planning and POI recommendation .
further , our experiment via Mobike trajectory data demonstrate the effectiveness of bike flow pattern discovery .

1st Asia-Pacific Web and Web-Age Information Management Joint Conference on Web and Big Data , APWeb-WAIM 2017 held in Conjuction with the International Workshop on Mobile Web Data Analytics , MWDA 2017 , International Workshop on Hot Topics in Big Spatial Data and Urban Computing , HotSpatial 2017 , International Workshop on Graph Data Management and Analysis , GDMA 2017 , 2nd International Workshop on Data Driven Crowdsourcing , DDC 2017 , 2nd International Workshop on Spatio-temporal Data Management and Analytics , SDMA 2017 and International Workshop on Mobility Analytics from Spatial and Social Data , MASS 2017 .
the proceeding contain 25 paper .
the special focus in this conference is on Web and Web-Age Information Management .

the topic include : Smooth representation clustering based on kernelized random walk ; a joint model for water scarcity evaluation ; efficient stance detection with latent feature ; an adversarial machine learning model against android malware evasion attack ; word similarity computation with extreme-similar method ; using jaccard distance measure for unsupervised activity recognition with Smartphone accelerometer ; speech emotion recognition using multiple classifier ; intelligent taxi dispatching based on improved artificial fish swarm algorithm ; correction of telecom localization error by context knowledge ; inferring unmet human mobility demand with multi-source urban data ; graph summarization based on attribute-connected network ; timely detection of temporal relation in RDF stream processing scenario ; taxi call prediction for online taxicab platform ; automatic text generation via text extraction based on submodular ; collaborative heterogeneous information embedding for recommender system and comparative research for social recommendation on VK .
partial least-square regression for linking land-cover pattern to soil erosion and sediment yield in watershed .
there are strong tie between land cover pattern and soil erosion and sediment yield in watershed .
the spatial configuration of land cover has recently become an important aspect of the study of geomorphological process related to erosion within watershed .
many study have used multivariate regression technique to explore the response of soil erosion and sediment yield to land cover pattern in watershed .

however , many landscape metric are highly correlated and may result in redundancy , which violates the assumption of a traditional least-squares approach , thus leading to singular solution or otherwise biased parameter estimate and confidence interval .

here , we investigated the landscape pattern within watershed in the Upper Du River watershed ( 8973km2 ) in China and examined how the spatial pattern of land cover are related to the soil erosion and sediment yield of watershed using hydrological modeling and partial least-square regression ( PLSR ) .
the result indicate that the watershed soil erosion and sediment yield are closely associated with the land cover pattern .

at the landscape level , landscape characteristic , such as Shannon 's diversity index ( SHDI ) , aggregation index ( AI ) , largest patch index ( LPI ) , contagion ( CONTAG ) , and patch cohesion index ( COHESION ) , were identified as the primary metric controlling the watershed soil erosion and sediment yield .
the landscape characteristic in watershed could account for as much as 65 % and 74 % of the variation in soil erosion and sediment yield , respectively .
greater interspersion and an increased number of patch land cover type may significantly accelerate soilerosion and increase sediment export .

plsr can be used to simply determine the relationship between land-cover pattern and watershed soil erosion and sediment yield , providing quantitative information to allow decision maker to make better choice regarding landscape planning .

with readily available remote sensing data and rapid development in geographic information system ( GIS ) technology , this practical and simple PLSR approach could be applied to a variety of other watershed .
urban flood risk mapping using the GARP and QUEST model : A comparative study of machine learning technique .
flood risk mapping and modeling is important to prevent urban flood damage .

in this study , a flood risk map was produced with limited hydrological and hydraulic data using two state-of-the-art machine learning model : Genetic Algorithm Rule-Set Production ( GARP ) and Quick Unbiased Efficient Statistical Tree ( QUEST ) .
the flood conditioning factor used in modeling were : precipitation , slope , curve number , distance to river , distance to channel , depth to groundwater , land use , and elevation .
based on available report and field survey for Sari city ( Iran ) , 113 point were identified as flooded area ( with each flooded zone assigned a value of 1 ) .

different conditioning factor , including urban density , quality of building , age of building , population density , and socio-economic condition , were taken into account to analyze flood vulnerability .
in addition , the weight of these conditioning factor was determined based on expert knowledge and Fuzzy Analytical Network Process ( FANP ) .
an urban flood risk map was then produced using flood hazard and flood vulnerability map .
the area under the receiver-operator characteristic curve ( AUC-ROC ) and Kappa statistic were applied to evaluate model performance .
the result demonstrated that the GARP model ( AUC-ROC = 93.5 % , Kappa = 0.86 ) had higher performance accuracy than the QUEST model ( AUC-ROC = 89.2 % , Kappa = 0.79 ) .

the result also indicated that distance to channel , land use , and elevation played major role in flood hazard determination , whereas population density , quality of building , and urban density were the most important factor in term of vulnerability .
these finding demonstrate that machine learning model can help in flood risk mapping , especially in area where detailed hydraulic and hydrological data are not available .
urbanization impact on landscape pattern in Beijing City , China : A spatial heterogeneity perspective .
the temporal and spatial characteristic of landscape pattern change can reflect the spatial impact of urbanization on the ecological environment .
studying the relationship between urbanization and landscape pattern can provide support for urban ecological management .

previous study have examined the quantitative relationship between the social economy and landscape pattern of an entire region , but have not considered the spatial non-stability of this relationship .
in this study , we characterized the landscape pattern in Beijing City , China during 2000 and 2010 using four landscape metric , i.e .
patch density ( PD ) , edge density ( ED ) , Shannon 's diversity index ( SHDI ) and the aggregation index ( AI ) .

geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) was employed to identify the spatial heterogeneity and evolution characteristic of the relationship between the urbanization of population density ( POP ) , gross domestic production ( GDP ) and nighttime lighting ( NTL ) , and landscape pattern .
the evolution of urban landscape pattern indicated a decentralized , aggregated , and fragmented change from the downtown to the suburb and outer suburb .
during the 10-year period , the average PD in the downtown increased by 100.6 % , and the increase of AI in the suburb was the largest .
the PD , ED and SHDI increased by different degree in the outer suburb .
the influence of different urbanization mode on landscape pattern were also different .
infilling mode made the landscape patterns more regular and integrated .
the landscape was more broken and complicated under the edge-expanding mode , and the leapfrog mode made PD and SHDI increase slightly .
