the framework consists of three layer : 1 ) A data-merging layer , which builds a citizen-centered panoramic data set for each citizen by merging citizen-related big data from multiple source in collaborative urban governance via similarity calculation and conflict resolution ; 2 ) a knowledge-discovery layer , which plots the citizen profile and citizen persona at both individual and group level in term of urban public service delivery and citizen participation via simple statistical analysis technique , machine learning , and econometric method ; and 3 ) a decision-making layer , which uses ontology model to standardize urban governance-related attribute , persona , and association to support governance decision-making via data mining and Bayesian Net technique .
finally , the proposed framework is validated in a case study on blood donation governance in China .

this research highlights the value of citizen-centered big data , push data-to-decision research from conceptual to operational , synthesizes previously published framework for citizen-centered big data analysis in smart city , and enhances the mutual supplement cross multiple disciplinarie .
semantic framework of internet of thing for smart city : Case study .
in recent year , the advancement of sensor technology has led to the generation of heterogeneous Internet-of-Thing ( IoT ) data by smart city .
thus , the development and deployment of various aspect of IoT-based application are necessary to mine the potential value of data to the benefit of people and their live .
however , the variety , volume , heterogeneity , and real-time nature of data obtained from smart city pose considerable challenge .
in this paper , we propose a semantic framework that integrates the IoT with machine learning for smart city .
the proposed framework retrieve and model urban data for certain kind of IoT application based on semantic and machine-learning technology .
moreover , we propose two case study : pollution detection from vehicle and traffic pattern detection .
the experimental result show that our system is scalable and capable of accommodating a large number of urban region with different type of IoT application .
smart city and a data-driven response to COVID-19 .
this commentary describes the rapid development of a COVID-19 data dashboard utilising existing Urban Observatory Internet of Things ( IoT ) data and analytic infrastructure .
existing data capture system were rapidly repurposed to provide real-time insight into the impact of lockdown policy on urban governance .
artificial intelligence technology and related urban planning and development concept : How are they perceived and utilized in Australia ?

artificial intelligence ( AI ) is a powerful technology with an increasing popularity and application in area ranging from marketing to banking and finance , from agriculture to healthcare and security , from space exploration to robotic and transport , and from chatbot to artificial creativity and manufacturing .

although many of these area closely relate to the urban context , there is limited understanding of the trending AI technology and their application areas—or concepts—in the urban planning and development Field .
similarly , there is a knowledge gap in how the public perceive AI technology , their application area , and the AI-related policy and practice of our city .
this study aims to advance our understanding of the relationship between the key AI technology ( n = 15 ) and their key application area ( n = 16 ) in urban planning and development .

to this end , this study examines public perception of how AI technology and their application area in urban planning and development are perceived and utilized in the testbed case study of Australian state and territory .
the methodological approach of this study employs the social media analytic method , and conducts sentiment and content analysis of location-based Twitter message ( n = 11,236 ) from Australia .

the result disclose that : ( a ) digital transformation , innovation , and sustainability are the most popular AI application area in urban planning and development ; ( b ) drone , automation , robotic , and big data are the most popular AI technology utilized in urban planning and development , and ; ( c ) achieving the digital transformation and sustainability of city through the use of AI technologies—such as big data , automation and robotics—is the central community discussion topic .
kadaster knowledge graph : Beyond the fifth star of open data .
after more than a decade , the supply-driven approach to publishing public ( open ) data has resulted in an ever-growing number of data silo .
hundred of thousand of dataset have been catalogued and can be accessed at data portal at different administrative level .
however , usually , user do not think in term of dataset when they search for information .
instead , they are interested in information that is most likely scattered across several dataset .

in the world of proprietary incompany data , organization invest heavily in connecting data in knowledge graphs and/or store data in data lake with the intention of having an integrated view of the data for analysis .

with the rise of machine learning , it is a common belief that government can improve their service , for example , by allowing citizen to get answer related to government information from virtual assistant like Alexa or Siri .
to provide high-quality answer , these system need to be fed with knowledge graphs .
in this paper , we share our experience of constructing and using the first open government knowledge graph in the Netherlands .

based on the developed demonstrator , we elaborate on the value of having such a graph and demonstrate its use in the context of improved data browsing , multicriteria analysis for urban planning , and the development of location-aware chat bot .
generative growth with ‘ thin ’ globalization : Cambridge ’ s crossover model of innovation .
change in leading-edge urban and regional development process and policy signify the rise of the ‘ Quaternary ’ or 4.0 Era of economic growth .
few such space exist yet , but they have prodigious global reach from location like Cambridge ( as the exemplar here ) , Israel and Silicon Valley .
their surface spread has led to the designation ‘ thin globalization ’ compared with ‘ thick ’ antecedent based on manufacturing and routine service .
each display ‘ post-cluster ’ or ‘ platform ’ inter-connectivity and even early sign of ‘ de-globalization ’ via on-shoring of supplier .
pioneer in ‘ crossover ’ innovation 4.0 platform evolution include ‘ flagship ’ corporation like FAGAMi ( Facebook , Apple , Google , Amazon and Microsoft ) .
these and other flagship acquire and site lab in proximity to Cambridge ’ s and other university research institutes and talent .
they work to what seems like a neoliberal ‘ Plan for the Future ’ in at least three case embedded in futuristic urban design utopias .

this further advantages innovation ‘ microsystems ’ like Cambridge and innovation ‘ macrosystems ’ like Silicon Valley that evolve diversified ‘ platform-cluster ’ of ‘ crossover ’ innovation flowing from interaction among microelectronic system , advanced mobility , machine learning , AI , robotic be mitigated healthcare .
the research problem is how can such extreme uneven growth polarization and .
effective task scheduling algorithm with deep learning for Internet of Health Things ( IoHT ) in sustainable smart city .
in the recent year , important key factor for urban planning is to analyze the sustainability and its functionality towards smart city .

presently , many researcher employ the conservative machine learning based analysis but those are not appropriate for IoT based health data analysis because of their physical feature extraction and low accuracy .
in this paper , we propose remote health monitoring and data analysis by integrating IoT and deep learning concept .

we proposed novel IoT based FoG assisted cloud network architecture that accumulates real-time health care data from patient via several medical IoT sensor network , these data are analyzed using a deep learning algorithm deployed at Fog based Healthcare Platform .
furthermore , the proposed methodology is applied to the sustainable smart city to evaluate the process for real-time .
the proposed framework not only analyses the healthcare data but also provides immediate relief measure to the patient facing critical condition and need immediate consultancy of doctor .
performance is measure in term of accuracy , precision and sensitivity of the proposed DHNN with task scheduling algorithm and it is obtained 97.6 % , 97.9 % , and 94.9 % .
while accuracy , precision and sensitivity for deep CNN is 96.5 % , 97.5 % and 94 % and for Deep auto-encoder is 92 % , 91 % , and 82.5 % .
drone Future : UAS in landscape and urban design .
drone Futures explores new paradigms in Unmanned Aircraft Systems ( UAS ) in landscape and urban design .

uas or drone can be deployed with direct application to the built environment ; this book explores the myriad of contemporary and future possibility of the design medium , its aesthetic , mapping agency , AI , mobility and contribution to smart city .
drone present innovative possibility , operating in a ‘ hover space ’ between human scale of landscape observation and light aircraft providing a unique resolution of space .
this book shows how UAS can be utilised to provide new perspective on spatial layout , landscape and urban condition , data capture for construction monitoring and simulation of design proposal .
author Paul Cureton examines both the philosophical use of these tool and practical step for implementation by designer .

illustrated in full colour throughout , Drone Futures discusses UAS and their connectivity to other design technology and process , including mapping and photogrammetry , AR/VR , drone AI and drone for construction and fabrication , new mobility , smart city and city information model ( CIMs ) .

it is specifically geared toward professional seeking to understand UAS application and future development and student seeking an understanding of the role of drone and airspace in the built environment and its powerful geographic imaginary .

with international contribution , multidisciplinary source and case study , Drone Futures examines new power of flight for visualising , interpreting and presenting landscape and urban space of tomorrow .
city brain and smart urbanization : regulating ‘ sharing economy ’ innovation in China .

starting from the officially proclaimed readjustment of the People ’ s Republic of China ’ s national development road map , this article engages in a theory-guided evaluation of the country ’ s artificial intelligence ( AI ) strategy in connection with its smart city initiative .

the government ’ s official quest to steer China toward a ‘ new mode of urbanization ’ has , as this article argues , facilitated the rise of the country ’ s ‘ sharing economy ’ / ’ platform economy ’ , with the mushrooming of a private AI economy offering ‘ smart ’ algorithm-optimized solution to complex urban governance dilemmas .

to ( re ) strengthen control and to cement central authority , the Chinese government has set out to regulate and standardize this emerging private platform economy sector—while also attempting not to interrupt the innovation drive of the Chinese AI landscape as such .

this article argues that these regulation effort , contrary to conventional top-down steering approach , rely on central-local collaboration and network coordination that involves a number of multiple actor operating under the ‘ shadow of hierarchy ’ of the central party-state .
structural health monitoring installation scheme using utility computing model .

in view of intensified disaster and fatality caused by natural phenomenon , there is a pressing need for an efficient environment logging that provides structural information to administrator for a better management and urban planning .
this paper proposes a novel utility model for structural health monitoring that would enable early detection of risk factor and mitigation of loss .
the proposed utility computing model takes the input data in term of 'number of occupant ' in a building ( i.e .
mac , International Mobile Equipment Identifier address and biometric attendance system installed ) and SHM system data ( i.e .
sensor reading ) .

it give visual representation of all the data for utility manager and expert to decide better location of SHM and number of SHM needed per zone depending on high disturbance created due to higher occupancy and number of structure per zone .
denser area with higher structure and higher population will require more precise and accurate SHM system compared to rural area .
it also analyzes the data from SHM system and using simple machine learning algorithm give expert ' suggestion for type of SHM needed at an area .
it make it possible for the data of each and every device of SHM system over several zone to be accessible by specific authority that can be used to predict as well as forecast any natural disaster .
the Structural Health Monitoring utility model is unique in term of its heterogeneity of resource management in realizing the utility processes .
finally , a case study of Qatar University is looked at where node are distributed in zone along with occupant measuring is used over each building .
the data was taken over simulated occupation model and mathematical model from literature for occupation and zone calculation using ideal SHM system data .

it can be inferred from the data that real-time analysis data will act similar to simulated and proposed Utility Computing System will give visual data and analyze the zone as can be seen in the result .

therefore , SHM Utility Computing model is efficient and most effective system that save cost as well as prepare authority for maintenance of a structure or crisis management due to external surrounding .
the automated vacuum waste collection optimization problem .
one of the most challenging problem on modern urban planning and one of the goal to be solved for smart city design is that of urban waste disposal .

given urban population growth , and that the amount of waste generated by each of us citizen is also growing , the total amount of waste to be collected and treated is growing dramatically ( EPA 2011 ) , becoming one sensitive issue for local government .
a modern technique for waste collection that is steadily being adopted is automated vacuum waste collection .

this technology uses air suction on a closed network of underground pipe to move waste from the collection point to the processing station , reducing greenhouse gas emission as well as inconvenience to citizen ( odor , noise , ... ) and allowing better waste reuse and recycling .
this technique is open to optimize energy consumption because moving huge amount of waste by air impulsion requires a lot of electric power .

the described problem challenge here is , precisely , that of organizing and scheduling waste collection to minimize the amount of energy per ton of collected waste in such a system via the use of Artificial Intelligence technique .
this kind of problem are an inviting opportunity to showcase the possibility that AI for Computational Sustainability offers .
framework for smart city model composition : Choice of component design model and risk .
this paper is a reflective overview of the knowledge on online conversion of service in the perspective of urban planning .
it points that traditional planning aimed at building optimal spatial relationship between particular function in urban environment .
appropriate decision-making rule had been introduced , contributing to a hierarchical land-use structure .
this conventional approach has been recently challenged by the rapid ICT development which added a lively , virtual , non-spatial dimension of urban economy .
the well-established foundation of urban planning started to shake , calling for a new paradigm .
this paper looks for an alternative to traditional planning which would be able to develop policy for omnichannel service ( i.e.
, enterprises that use both online and offline channel for communicating and distributing their product ) .

the advantage of ' e-planning ' in managing omnichannel service are outlined and a conclusion is drawn that only a multi-channel approach can bring appropriate answer to contemporary development in service sector .
research on urban anti-terrorism intelligence perception system from the perspective of Internet of thing application .

objective/significance : Based on the urgent need of the status quo of urban anti-terrorism , combining the present situation of intelligent city construction , we carry out the research on the key problem such as the collection and analysis of counter-terrorism information for urban environment .

this paper puts forward a kind of city anti-terrorism information perception system based on the Internet of thing , and realizes to improve the level of surveillance and early warning of terrorist activity facing the urban environment .

method/process : The system collect and merges the heterogeneous information of terrorism , which is based on the information perception layer , the intelligence identification layer and the intelligence inference layer , which is based on the city 's focal area .

to filter suspicious information by constructing a semantic database of terrorist action signal Combined with complex event processing and machine learning technology , real-time monitoring and mining prediction of mass event flow , using the comparison between historical data of terrorist attack and real-time data , increased the area of counter-terrorism intelligence .
results/conclusion : We hope to provide a better model and an exploratory study on the construction of the counter-terrorism early warning for the urban environment .
planning the Future of Smart Cities with Swarms of Fully Autonomous Unmanned Aerial Vehicles Using a Novel Framework .

the autonomy of unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) - self-governing in the aerospace discipline has been a remarkable research area with the development of the advanced bespoke microcontroller embedded with advanced AI technique for the last several decade .
the road forward about the operational environment is certain about the swarm of fully automated UAVs ( FAUAVs ) , that is , urban area .

fauavs with self-learning and self-decision-making ability by executing non-trivial sequence of event with decimetre-level accuracy based on a set of rule , control loop and constraint using dynamic flight plan and trajectory are taking their indispensable part within smart city ( SCs ) .
therefore , their integration with the SC component using real-time data analytic is urgent .

this is mainly required to establish a better swarm intelligence along with a safer and optimised harmonious smart ecosystem that enables cooperative FAUAV-SC automation system with collaborative automated intelligence engaging in the concept of Internet of Everything ( IoE ) and Automation of Everything ( AoE ) .

planning the future of city with swarm of FAUAVs is explored in this paper to optimise the use of FAUAVs with a diverse range of application and a contemporary methodology is proposed using a holistic framework - FAUAVinSCF equipped with various effective and efficient technique along with a novel FAUAV routing technique customisable to the constraint of FAUAVs and urban area .

with the methodology , the component of SC and FAUAVs involving recent and impending technological advancement are moulded together to make this inevitable transformation a harmonious part of the inhabitant contributing to the city ' liveability and sustainability .

the framework consists of a decentralized agent-based control architecture that monitor and controls the swarm of resource-constraint FAUAVs for their real-time requirement in optimising their urban use .

the outcome of the methodology suggest that the constraint of FAUAVs can be mitigated significantly in urban area and consequently , their efficacy can be increased in realising their diverse range of mission .
machine learning technology for sustainability in smart city in the post-covid era .
the unprecedented urban growth of recent year requires improved urban planning and management to make urban space more inclusive , safe , resilient and sustainable .
additionally , humanity faces the COVID pandemic , which especially complicates the management of Smart Cities .
a possible solution to address these two problem ( environmental and health ) in Smart Cities may be the use of Machine Learning technique .
one of the objective of our work is to thoroughly analyze the link between the concept of Smart Cities , Machine Learning technique and their applicability .
in this work , an exhaustive study of the relationship between Smart Cities and the applicability of Machine Learning ( ML ) technique is carried out with the aim of optimizing sustainability .
for this , the ML model , analyzed from the point of view of the model , technique and application , are studied .
the area and dimension of sustainability addressed are analyzed , and the Sustainable Development Goals ( SDGs ) are discussed .
the main objective is to propose a model ( EARLY ) that allows us to tackle these problem in the future .
an inclusive perspective on applicability , sustainability scope and dimension , SDGs , tool , data type and Machine Learning technique is provided .
finally , a case study applied to an Andalusian city is presented .
participatory AI : Reducing AI bias and developing socially responsible AI in smart city .
as smart city evolve , artificial intelligence ( AI ) will increasingly be used to manage decision for how city operate .
for everything from incarceration sentencing , city pension appropriation , surveillance and infrastructure management , AI will play a role .
the author argues that implementing AI for a smart city should be decided similarly to how city decide on major infrastructural planning project .
for both , there are social and ethical implication of deployment .
a protocol is proposed for smart city AI so that AI can be seen as an ethical and trustworthy city asset rather than an adversary fraught with controversy and bias .
this is achieved through participatory AI - the marriage of a fully transparent data architecture , such as the blockchain , and the urban planning practice of participatory planning .
the diversity of opinion that participatory AI afford enables city to facilitate socially responsible AI outcome .
risk management system must provide automatic decision according to crisis computable algebra .

is is nowadays our responsibility to convince our contemporary citizen that AI device as UGVs ( Unmanned Ground Vehicles ) and UAVs ( Unmanned Aerial Vehicles ) are crucial actor of today 's life in a dual domain , both civilian and military .

in particular , the decision process is the main component of every military operation and is of high interest because of two main reason : it is necessary designed to cope with conflict issue and it requires a very complex planning process to be successful .

the difficulty to find a good plan is worse in urban area because of the high uncertainty due to the topology of these area , the presence of civilian , who can be hostile or friendly , and the unpredictable nature of enemy .
the idea in that paper is to qualify what can be a valid computed plan in that context , i.e .
well-designed for recovering of peace , rescue operation after a bombing event , hostage salvage , non-combatant evacuation operation , civil-military co-operation , .
, in urban area .

this planning process leads to associate actually four component , the representation of the tactical scheme , the implementation of the tactical scheme as the behaviour of special force , military unit or emergency squad , the proof process or the explanation process , and finally the handling of external factor depending on the current environment or the current context in which the operation takes place .

this paper uses a quaternary representation called the epistemological quadriptych , in order to highlight that the integration of UGVs or UAVs device requires actually to understand the role of knowledge and behaviour and to provide secure and valid action plan , i.e .
which can be explained and justified .
big data analytic for identifying electricity theft using machine learning approach in microgrid for smart community .
electricity theft ( ET ) causes major revenue loss in power utility .
it reduces the quality of supply , raises production cost , causes legal consumer to pay the higher cost , and impacts the economy as a whole .
in this article , we use the State Grid Corporation of China ( SGCC ) dataset , which contains electricity consumption data of 1035 day for two class : normal and fraudulent .
in this work , ET detection model is proposed that consists of four step : interpolation , data balancing , feature extraction , and classification .
first , missing value of the dataset are recovered using the interpolation method .
second , resampling technique is implemented .
et consumer are 9 % in the SGCC dataset that make the model inefficient to correctly classify both class ( normal and theft ) .
a hybrid resampling technique is proposed , named synthetic minority oversampling technique with near miss .
third , residual network extracts the latent features from the SGCC dataset .
fourth , three tree based classifier , such as decision tree ( DT ) , random forest ( RF ) , and adaptive boosting ( AdaBoost ) are applied to train the encoded feature vector for classification .
besides , search for good hyperparameter is a challenging task , which is usually done manually and takes a considerable amount of time .
to resolve this problem , Bayesian optimizer is used to simplify the tuning process of DT , RF , and AdaBoost .
finally , the result indicate that RF outperforms DT and AdaBoost .
a Review of AI for Urban Planning : Toward Building Sustainable Smart Cities .
urban planning , in short , deal with solving the problem of the modern society .
the problem are complementary to the growing population in today 's society .
the problem in society range from mundane task like ensuring sanitization in society to more technical task like managing infrastructure .
the concept of smart city , lately , has been a topic of great interest for social scientist , engineer , and everyone who wants to integrate technology into their daily live .
ai and IoT have become an important part of our live .
data has become ubiquitous with such smart device that are connected to the internet .
such data can be used to make intelligent system for smart city .
ai and loT have promising effect on urban life .
artificial Intelligence is often considered to be the fourth industrial revolution because of its unprecedented potential to change everything .
as AI progresses to improve day by day , it has blessed human with everything from smart healthcare to secured smart city .
everything has been changed by AI and IoT in smart city .

in this paper , the various use case of AI and IoT for urban planning in order to build smart and sustainable city are discussed The proposed research work has reviewed various paper that could potentially be used in the development of smart city .
intrusion Detection System as Audit in IoT Infrastructure using Ensemble Learning and SMOTE Method .
with the industrial revolution 4.0 , the use of IoT-based system is increasing , both in the field of health manufacturing , urban planning , housing , and even automotive .
therefore , the security of the IoT system needs to be considered , this is related to data integrity , privacy , service stability .
through intrusion detection , activity on the IoT system will be able to be analyzed whether there are suspicious activity that can interfere with or threaten IoT service .
in several previous study in the literature , the approach used to detect intrusion in the IoT system has a high false alarm rate .

this research proposes an approach through machine learning , specifically the ensemble learning approach and the synthetic minority over-sampling technique ( SMOTE ) method as a method of detecting intrusion in the IoT system which is expected to produce better performance .
the result of this study indicate that the proposed approach is able to detect intrusion and classify into five type of intrusion including normal intrusion , probe , dos , r2l , u2r .

based on the evaluation result , the proposed approach can improve the performance of intrusion detection in term of accuracy to 97.02 % , detection rate of 97 % , false alarm rate 0.16 % , compared to base learning and approach in previous study used as intrusion detection method , but in processing time performance have not shown satisfying result .
the future city ecosystem .

as the population increase , megacitie rise , and the urban landscape evolves ever more vertically , the traditional stratification of city function will be replaced by technology , and new living pattern will form a pixelated mosaic .
the layering of the city will be interconnected by axon of multilevel transportation .
virtual and spatial connectivity will enhance civic cohesion , returning a sense of community .

we can not predict with certainty the future of the city and the role of the skyscraper , however , there are emerging theme that point the way to the probable : The future will be more collaborative , innovative , virtual , flexible , and connected .
technology will be the ultimate enabler , responsive to changing pattern of living .
city will react to climate change , be resilient to material scarcity , be smarter and more flexible , embrace autonomous energy generation , and be adaptable to the changing world .

the electric city , artificial intelligence ( AI ) , big data , material engineering through synthetic biology , additive manufacturing and circular economy , biomimicry , and computational design will lead the way .
data mining technique for smart mobility—a survey .
with the rapid increase in urbanization , there is essence for making urban area smart .
there are assorted Field of computer science liable for development of a city to make it smart and intelligent .
some of these Field include data mining , sensor network , Internet of thing , web of thing , cloud computing technique and machine learning .
smart city is an umbrella term that encompasses smart mobility , smart governance , smart planning , smart environment and other .
smart mobility is one of the crucial aspect of smart city addressing efficient movement of people and good from one place to another .
this work is an extensive survey of research work related to application of data mining technique for smart mobility .
a comparative study of major work done in the aforementioned field is outlined in this paper .
a reasoning approach for modelling and predicting terroristic attack in urban environment .
during the last decade the world has witnessed a number of terroristic attack and security incident exposing numerous vulnerability of the urban environment .

hence the ability to proactively detect and even predict potential threat related to terrorist attack is crucial for supporting government agency in order to timely react ( pro-act ) to potentially alarming terrorist attack .

the work described in this paper is part of an overall larger effort in developing a framework for early identification and prediction of terrorist action ( the PROACTIVE project-http : //www.fp7-proactive.eu/ ) .
the paper focuses on a near real-time reasoning layer designed around a number of reasoning capability for transforming raw and symbolic event into meaningful alert .
the reasoning layer was designed to process information source at different abstraction level ( e.g .
sensor information , police patrol input , external semantic crafted data source ) and simulates various expert user role indicated as crucial in the intelligence analyst work flow ( i.e .
operational , tactical and strategic user role ) .

additionally a special focus was given to support functional requirement of the overall terrorist attack prediction system , as producing near real-time detection of threat event by relying on reliable model regarding terrorist action and predicting sensitive threat event .
hence the overall designed build on top of approach as event driven architecture , complex event processing system , and machine learning technique .
a prototype implementation of layer is presented in a simulated validation scenario .

the prototype allows an expert user to monitor threat probability for different physical environment , and influence the sensitivity of these environment in real-time as well as and provide feedback for adapting the machine learning model .
urban computing and smart city : Opportunitie and challenge in modelling large-scale aggregated human behavior .
city-wide urban infrastructure are increasingly reliant on networked technology to improve and expand their service .

as a side effect of this digitalization , large amount of data -digital footprints- can be sensed and analyzed to uncover pattern of human urban behavior and to augment the city experience of its citizen .

in my talk , I will introduce the main concept , opportunity and challenge in the emerging area of urban computing/smart city , which focuses on improving the quality of life of an urban environment by understanding the city dynamic through the data provided by ubiquitous technology .
this is a human-centric , data-rich area that spans multiple discipline , including sociology , computer science and urban planning .

from a computer science perspective , there are challenge in a variety of domain , including data visualization , storage , security , privacy , machine learning , data mining and pattern recognition .
some of the application of smart city include traffic forecasting , modeling of the spread of biological virus , urban and transportation design and location-based service .
nordic Cities Meet Artificial Intelligence .
in this paper , we explore Finnish city official ' attitude , knowledge and relationship towards the use of artificial intelligence ( AI ) in their city through topical expert interview .
our interviewee came from two metropolitan area city , Helsinki and Espoo , which have taken an active role in attempting to utilize various novel technology .
through these interview , we identify and discuss key issue in the infusion of AI into city .
these interviewee were key player in their respective city ' response to the challenge and opportunity of novel technology , including AI .

as such , while our sampling is small , these interviewee are a good representation of the relevant individual who hold sway over the thought , vision , idea and challenge that are recognized in their respective organization .

we ask , how do these individual understand AI and gauged through their view , how are these city prepared for the increasing and continuous infusion of artificial intelligence technology in these city ' agenda , practice and project ?
neural Network Based Algorithm for Multi-UAV Coverage Path Planning .
this paper proposes a method to tackle the Coverage Path Planning ( CPP ) problem for a fleet of AI-driven UAVs while accounting for congestion , collision avoidance , and efficiency of the path .
the algorithm relie on a mixed-use of decentralized Artificial Neural Networks ( ANN ) and the A pathfinder .
each UAV has elementary cognitive skill to sense information about the nearby environment which are then fed as an input to the network .
the neural network creates a correlation between the current state of a UAV and the best action to take at each time step .

the exploration strategy is stored in a labeled database for the single-UAV case ; the neural network learn and replicates it in the multi-UAV case , being able to generalize the acquired skill over new map not contained in the database .
the training session imitates human prior in a multi-class classification , which completely bypasses common drawback such as the need for large database or high computational resource .
the case study focuses on complex urban area , for which the grid resolution of the traditional approach ca n't model the problem with sufficient accuracy .
method and Guideline for Incorporating Human Factors Requirements in Automated Vehicles Development .
automated vehicle ( AV ) are transforming the future of the transportation and improving the quality of life .
however , due to their societal impact in urban environment , AV development challenges the current development process .
particularly , it is unclear how human factor requirement can be communicated to developer of AI-based AV .
it is quite challenging especially in agile development , where the focus is on continuous deployment and rapid release cycle with short lead-Time .

due to the importance of human factor and its impact on trust , acceptance , and safety of AV in urban environment , my work aim at providing a suitable requirement engineering perspective and method .
introduction to Urban Computing .
this chapter overviews Part V of this book themed urban computing .

this part of the book covers the topic of visual analytic , cloud , edge , and mobile computing , data mining and knowledge discovery , AI and deep learning for urban computing , and a range of mainstream urban model and simulation method .
it provides a systematic review of computing technology for urban governance and urban service , together with the example of their usage , in the context of urban computing .
ai and Deep Learning for Urban Computing .

in the big data era , with the large volume of available data collected by various sensor deployed in urban area and the recent advance in AI technique , urban computing has become increasingly important to facilitate the improvement of people ’ s live , city operation system , and the environment .
in this chapter , we introduce the challenge , methodology , and application of AI technique for urban computing .
we first introduce the background , followed by listing key challenge from the perspective of computer science when AI technique are applied .

then we briefly introduce the AI technique that are widely used in urban computing , including supervised learning , semi-supervised learning , unsupervised learning , matrix factorization , graphic model , deep learning , and reinforcement learning .
with the recent advance of deep-learning technique , model such as CNN and RNN have shown significant performance gain in many application .
thus , we briefly introduce the deep-learning model that are widely used in various urban-computing task .

finally , we discuss the application of urban computing including urban planning , urban transportation , location-based social network ( LBSNs ) , urban safety and security , and urban-environment monitoring .
for each application , we summarize major research challenge and review previous work that uses AI technique to address them .
the City of the Future : The Urban ( Un ) Seen Connecting Citizens and Spaces via Community Sensing .
maximizing the potential of digitalization , technology of the virtual realm present an opportunity to rethink the experience of space , society , and culture .
city designed with integrated smart technology and sustainable energy source can improve urban life .
given the impact of these technology , this paper examines the connection between data , infrastructure , and the public realm .
artificial intelligence ( AI ) can transform the environment we live in , and city are facing the rise of urban intelligence ( UI ) .

mobile sensor and handheld device , referred to as `` urban tech , '' allow car , bus , bicycle , and citizen to collect data about air quality , noise pollution , and the urban environment at large .
smart urban infrastructure can address issue such as crime , environmental pollution , and public health and help improve quality of life .
how will our live change intellectually , physically , and emotionally as the Internet of thing ( IoT ) migrates into urban environment ?
twenty-first-century architecture can find new purpose by adopting a coherent vision for the future .
virtual space can function as a mediating layer between the real and the yet to come , between cultural identity and a truly global technological existence .
evaluation of Smart Infrastructure Systems and Novel UV-Oriented Solution for Integration , Resilience , Inclusiveness , and Sustainability .

rapid urbanization nowaday demands the stable functioning of a city 's infrastructure , but the traditional infrastructure system faces numerous challenge : unpreparedness for extreme situation , aging and deterioration of existing facility , costly maintenance , and lack of coordination .

moreover , the transformation from traditional infrastructure into smart infrastructure introduces new challenge both from the underdevelopment of information network and the limitation of AI technology .

in this paper , we evaluate , from the UV perspective , the challenge of the infrastructure system and the current status of the smart infrastructure system based on the framework of closed feedback control loops : data acquisition , communication , decision making , and action .

we propose that an effective smart infrastructure system should take into consideration the interaction between the smart infrastructure system and other seven smart city subsystem : smart home , smart medicine and healthcare , intelligent transportation , urban planning and crowd management , smart energy management , smart response for city emergency , smart environmental protection , and smart humanity , and also study how the smart infrastructure system would be affected by four major impacting factor of smart city : information flow , material cycle , lifestyle , and community .

this systematic study will help us explore in-depth the complicated dynamic relationship between multiple impacting factor and propose a UV-oriented , integrated , resilient , inclusive , and sustainable development framework design to address current imminent challenge and to improve the efficiency and safety of city infrastructure through vulnerability-oriented sensing and active monitoring ; defining shared responsibility ; communication reinforcement ; data visualization ; static and dynamic data integration ; hierarchical decision making ; and optimized and coordinated demand response management .
5g boosting smart city development .
the construction of smart city promotes the development of modern city , which shows a complex and dynamic process .

in addition to cultural factor , it is more involved in the formulation and evolution of specific urban planning , adjustment and transformation of urban space , industry , and population structure , etc .

however , the fifth-generation mobile communication technology ( 5G ) , as one of the biggest tuyere of the future information technology revolution , has the ultra-bandwidth , high reliability , low latency , big connection characteristic , the reasonable use of which will undoubtedly provide a new significant auxiliary mean for the urban comprehensive treatment .
meanwhile , 5G integrate artificial intelligence ( AI ) , big data , blockchain , Internet of Thins , Industrial Internet and other technology , to usher in a new era of smart city construction .
algorithmic Urban IoT Context and Convergence of Services Sensing and Planning Units ( PUs ) .
urban planning is a domain of visualizing various aspect of social and physical matter concerning the habitat .

these are centered toward better living of social group in a physical infrastructure momentum that is always dynamic with reference to delivering the betterment ever , thus requiring a well synchronized synergy between planning and delivery through plan management .
the context of an urban scenario is always around supply dynamic of service infrastructure to the urban density .
the situation of balanced supply of these service to spatial status of demand needing an efficient delivery system that can manage the service guarantee .

well-orchestrated service infrastructure enabled by IoT as a delivery mechanism with synchronized functioning for the planned and occasional dynamic of citizen support system must evolve through bidirectional data sharing between the delivery system and urban planning , thus opening a new domain of math programming and algorithms to solve some of the pertinent issue concerning the synthesis .
smart urban future : Outlining the smart city planning project .
city are constantly evolving complex system , and ongoing digitalization is making them even more complex .
the toolkit for urban scientist is expanding with computational method from AI to machine learning , data mining and advanced spatial analysis .

together with vast amount of data of urban phenomenon and new lifestyle emerging from virtuality and cybernetic system , this ‘ smartification ’ makes the planning and analyses more challenging while providing new tool to respond to them .

in this article I propose a project for better understanding and guiding the future smart city based on dynamic urban theory such as those studying complex adaptive system , urban morphology , urban economy and mobility system .

i argue that we need to carry out empirical research on ongoing change to learn about novel , becoming spatial and functional pattern in the city , and apply both theory and imaginary vision to be able to grasp the likely qualitative transition in human ’ life following the ubiquitous use of technology .
the project is built around three coupled module , urban space , mobility and urban economic , and it will be carried out in the city of Tallinn , Estonia .

the expected result would help planner , decision maker , urban scientist and developer to better understand the transition we are facing , to be able to support the change and steer it towards better social and economic outcome .
intelligent Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Technology in Urban Environments .
sustainable development of megacitie requires a transition to the new management method and technology , based on the wide use of a large amount of heterogeneous data .
managing the urban economy needs to consider environmental restriction , environmental monitoring task , engineering facility , and transport .

operational control over the urban environment and the surrounding area can be produced using unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) , and the collected data can be processed using a wide range of software and hardware technology related to the field of artificial intelligence .
however , along with any fairly new technology , intelligent unmanned technology have both advantage and disadvantage .

strength are mobility and efficiency , relative cheapness , the possibility of a high degree of automation , whereas weakness are short flight time , dependence on weather condition , the certain outstanding task of data management and processing .
this paper considers the possibility of using intelligent unmanned technology based on UAVs for solving the problem of monitoring the urban environment of the Kazakhstan megalopolise .

consideration is also being given to the scope for extending possibility of applying these technology to the field of environmental monitoring , monitoring of hazardous geological process , technical construction and vehicle .
furthermore , technological and economic issue , as well as necessary data processing technology , are discussed .
the economic effect of the use of IUVAT is estimated at $ 70-200 million , but it requires solving a set of data processing , control and technical problem .

theoretical design and experimental study for urban data management using energy-saved IoT big data .
in this study , an experimental study ( ESIF ) is presented for urban data management and smart city application using energy-saved IoT big data analytic .
this study is also used to manage the energy consumption in urban planning and smart city application .
the previous researcher demonstrate that the big data analysis process is more complex .
we use different kind of sensor such as traffic congestion , weather , smart home , water , and vehicular sensor to collect the resource data .
the framework is divided into three phase .
the first phase is responsible for collecting the data using IoT device and interconnect with elasticity ( energy-saving ) manager .
the second phase is data handling operation using MapReduce framework .
third phase deal with decision-making which is an important step to classify the event and produce the decision accurately .
to do this , machine learning concept of deep learning algorithms is used and it produces the decision more effectively .
the Hadoop is to provide offline service as well as online service with the help of spark .
therefore , the effectiveness of the model is illustrated in the case of processing time and throughput .

internet of thing and statistical analysis .
internet of Things ( IoT ) creates a world where physical object are integrated into information network .
iot refer to the connection of device that transforms a wide range of Field .
in medicine , for instance , connected device can assist medical professional in monitoring patient inside and outside of hospital .
practitioner adjust treatment and improve patient outcome using the produced data .
another field in which a transformation occurs is urban planning .
sensor with an IP address are placed under a busy street , so driver can be alerted about upcoming delay or accident .

the explosive growth in the number of device connected to the IoT and the exponential increase in data consumption only reflect how the growth of large data set is perfectly overlapping with that of IoT .
in addition to increased volume , the IoT-generated large data set exhibit a mixture of multiple modality and varying data quality .
intelligent processing and analysis of these data set is the key to developing smart IoT application .
since IoT will be among the greatest source of new data , data science is used to make IoT application more intelligent .
analysis of these data set , in practice , is done using various data science technique .
data science is the compounding of different discipline of science that uses data mining , machine learning , and other technique to get form and fresh insight from data .
the different algorithm are applied to the information in order to draw out higher-level information from IoT data set .
these technique include a wide scope of algorithms applied in different domain and comprise both unsupervised and supervised method .

the procedure of applying data analytic method to particular area involves data model such as neural network , classification , clustering method , and applying efficient algorithms that fit with the data characteristic .
in this article , we focus on statistical analysis of the collected data set and look at the similarity and difference of data mining and statistical method for IoT system .
by explaining the need for both descriptive and inferential statistical method , we show the inadequacy of using only unsupervised data mining technique for IoT data set .

we then concentrate on statistical inference approach , such as the design-based and model-based inference , and discuss the role of explanatory versus forecasting statistical model in an IoT environment .
lastly , we demonstrate the danger of making forecast using only unsupervised technique by revealing open challenge as future research direction .
space for urban innovation : A global approach to downstream sector .
space vertical have a key role to play in the smart city ecosystem as a technological enabler , at the core of cost-efficient business model .
sensor use and satellite connectivity are the pillar of the smart city grid market ( e.g .
smart transport , energy grid , waste management , connected vehicles… ) .
modern navigation system have a key role in the transport and mobility sector ( e.g .
real time transport information , urban traffic modelling , autonomous and intelligent vehicles… ) .
earth observation data open to a huge portfolio of business opportunity in several sector ( e.g .
urban planning , climate change challenge , sustainable urban agriculture , infrastructure and building business as well as disaster and security issue ) .
the European Space Agency ( ESA ) has already a relevant position in the smart city ecosystem with a portfolio of activity ongoing or planned in support .
considering the constant market growth both from a geographical and economic point of view ESA further reinforced its positioning in this sector through its Downstream Gateway .

intelligence augmentation for urban warfare operation planning using deep reinforcement learning .
the density , diversity , connectedness and scale of urban environment make military operation challenging .
this paper shows that different artificial intelligence technique can be combined to provide the commander with various form of intelligence augmentation and to support the decision making process .

a warfare model has been developed where an AI system , representing a red unit , learns how to select the position for a target and for several improvised explosive device ( IEDs ) in order to prevent the blue unit to locate the target .
the blue unit is trained to reach the target by using deep reinforcement learning , while an evolutionary algorithm is used to train the red unit .
these technique do not rely on large amount of historical data .
different approach have been used and discussed to optimise the co-learning of the two agent , showing that optimal behaviour can be learned in an urban environment .

information about the most likely position of the target and the IEDs can be extracted from the policy learned by the system , and used by the commander to provide intelligence augmentation while planning an operation and evaluating different possible course of action .
the reliability of this information depends on the realism of the AI system simulating the red unit , that is strictly dependent on the model used for the blue unit during the training .
